title: Avatar
dialogue: They can fix a spinal, if you've got the money. But not on vet benefits, not in this economy.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I became a Marine for the hardship. To be hammered on the anvil of life. I told myself I could pass any test a man can pass.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Let's get it straight up front. I don't want your pity. I know the world's a cold-ass bitch.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You want a fair deal, you're on the wrong planet. The strong prey on the weak.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's just the way things are. And nobody does a damn thing.

title: Avatar
dialogue: All I ever wanted in my sorry-ass life was a single thing worth fighting for. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: I hope you realize you've just lost a customer!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Candy ass bitch.

title: Avatar
dialogue: If it ain't rainin' we ain't trainin'!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Step off. You're ruinin' my good mood.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The strong prey on the weak. A guy with a knife took all Tommy would ever be, for the paper in his wallet.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jesus, Tommy.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The Suits' concern was touching.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The egghead and the jarhead. Tommy was the scientist, not me. He was the one who wanted to get shot light years out into space to find the answers.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Me -- I was just another dumb grunt gettin' sent someplace I was gonna regret.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Are we there?

title: Avatar
dialogue: What're you two limpdicks starin' at?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Nothing like an old-school safety brief to put your mind at ease. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's why I'm here.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Damn. They got big.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It looks like him.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The idea is -- every driver is matched to his own avatar --

title: Avatar
dialogue: -- so their nervous systems are in tune. Or something. Which is why they offered me this gig, because I can link with Tommy's avatar, which was insanely expensive. Is this right? I just say whatever in these videologs?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Right. So, whatever. Here I am. Doing science. Never been in a lab before.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Who's got my goddamn cigarette?!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Norm. I hear good things about you. How's your Na'vi?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Not bad. You sound a little formal.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, I know who you are, and I don't need you. I need your brother. You know -- the PhD who trained three years for this mission.

title: Avatar
dialogue: He's dead. I know it's a big inconvenience to everyone.

title: Avatar
dialogue: How much lab training have you had? Ever run a gas chromatograph?

title: Avatar
dialogue: No.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Any actual lab work at all?

title: Avatar
dialogue: High school chemistry. But I ditched.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You see? You see? They're pissing on us without even the courtesy of calling it rain. I'm going to Selfridge.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Parker, I used to think it was benign neglect, but now I see you're intentionally screwing us.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I need a research assistant, not some jarhead dropout.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Lucky? How is this in any way lucky?

title: Avatar
dialogue: The last thing I need is another trigger happy asshole out there!

title: Avatar
dialogue: That tends to happen when you use machine guns on them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: How much link time have you logged?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Like -- an hour.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Tell me you're joking.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Don't! I got this.

title: Avatar
dialogue: So you just figured you'd come out here to the most hostile environment known to man, with no training of any kind, and see how it went? What was going through your head?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Maybe I was just tired of doctors telling me what I couldn't do.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Relax and let your mind go blank. That shouldn't be hard for you.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Kiss the darkest part of my lily white --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Go figure. Alright, I'm going in.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hey Marine!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Grace?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Well who'd you expect, numbnuts? Think fast!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Motor control is looking good.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's kinda freaky.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Lights out amigos. See ya' at dinner.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Damn. Same old sack a' bones.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You guys're packing some heavy ordinance.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah, no problem.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I figured -- just another hellhole.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That sounds real good, Colonel. So -- am I still with Augustine?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Start calibrating. We're on the flight line in ten minutes.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What did Atilla want?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Just Marines comparin' tattoos.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah. Well, listen to me, Marine --

title: Avatar
dialogue: -- you're driving an avatar, now. That means you're in my world, got it?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Got it.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That son of a bitch has screwed up this program enough. All this -- -- exists so we can go out there and build a bridge of trust to these people, who could teach us so much. But thanks to Quaritch and his thugs the Na'vi won't even talk to us anymore.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Then how's this supposed to work?

title: Avatar
dialogue: We have a new face. You're fluent, you've studied the culture. You're non-threatening. The ones we know best -- the Omaticaya clan -- may give you a chance. Maybe you can get them back to the table before things go tits-up for good.

title: Avatar
dialogue: How do we contact them?

title: Avatar
dialogue: We don't. They contact us. If they see us taking our samples, treating the forest with respect -- Not trampling everything in sight -- they may reach out to us.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Or they may skin us and make a drum.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Just keep your mouth shut and let Norm do the talking.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Looks like a bull, six cows and some juveniles.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Stay with the ship. One idiot with a gun's enough.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Relax, Marine. You're making me nervous.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm sure they're watching us right now.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The kids were so bright, so eager to learn... they picked up English faster than I could teach it to them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Bring the soil probe -- right there, yellow case.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The stingbats knock them off. I guess I always hope somebody will come back and read them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The Na'vi learned as much about us as they needed to know.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What happened here?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Are you going to help with this gear? We've got a lot to do.

title: Avatar
dialogue: See, right here where the roots of the two trees interact.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Don't shoot. You'll piss it off.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's already pissed off!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake, that armor's too thick. Trust me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's a territorial threat display. Do not run, or he'll charge.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What do I do?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hold your ground!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Oh yeah! Who's bad?! That's right.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's what I'm talkin' about, bitch!

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's right motherf--

title: Avatar
dialogue: What about this one? Run, don't run? What?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Run. Definitely RUN!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Shit.

title: Avatar
dialogue: He's not going to make it till morning.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I don't have all goddamn night! Come on! Come on!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Wait, don't --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Look, um, I know you probably don't understand this. But -- thanks. Thank you. I owe you.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I would have been screwed if you hadn't come along --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hey, wait. Wait! Where you goin'?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Slow down a second will you. I just want to thank you for killing those --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Okay, I'm sorry. Whatever I did -- I'm sorry.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They attacked me. How'm I the bad guy HERE--

title: Avatar
dialogue: Okay, fine, you love your little forest friends. So why not just let them kill my ass? What's the thinking?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yes, why save me?

title: Avatar
dialogue: If I'm so ignorant, maybe you should teach me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Whooaa.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Then teach me to "see."

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hey, slow down. Look, I think we just got off on the wrong foot and --

title: Avatar
dialogue: --you just have to get to know me. I'm Jake. Jake Sull--

title: Avatar
dialogue: Whooaaa -- shit!

title: Avatar
dialogue: I need your help.

title: Avatar
dialogue: So take me with you.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What?

title: Avatar
dialogue: What are they?

title: Avatar
dialogue: What was that all about?

title: Avatar
dialogue: What's your name?

title: Avatar
dialogue: What's going on?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Your father!? Uh, good to meet you, sir.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Who's Eywa?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake Sully.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I came to learn.

title: Avatar
dialogue: My cup is empty, trust me. Just ask Doctor Augustine. I'm no scientist.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I don't know. I was a Marine -- uh, a warrior. Of the Jarhead clan.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What's going on? What are they saying?

title: Avatar
dialogue: So it's all good, right? You and me --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Don't get up.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You never told me your name.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Okay, again, a whole lot slower.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Nay-TEE-ree. That's nice. Nay-TEE-ree.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Your mom likes me. I can tell.

title: Avatar
dialogue: These rock. What are they?

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's some damn fine teylu. That's like grandma's teylu.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Come on back, kid, that's it.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Wha --? Oh.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Damn, you were dug in like a tick. Is the avatar safe?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah, Doc -- and you are not going to believe where I am. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: -- so the kid's out there one night and he's got the Queen Bitch herself offering him the spare room and the car keys. Unbelievable.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's not something you can teach.

title: Avatar
dialogue: For reasons I cannot fathom, the Omaticaya have chosen you. God help us all. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah. They want to study me. See if I can learn to be one of them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Does Augustine know about this?

title: Avatar
dialogue: So -- who talks them into moving?

title: Avatar
dialogue: What if they won't go?

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm on it. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Tsu'tey. Mo'at. Eytukan.

title: Avatar
dialogue: He's the clan leader -- -- but she's the spiritual leader. Like a shaman.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Got it. So who's this Eywa?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Who's got a date with the chief's daughter?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Knock it off. Jesus, it's like kindergarten around here.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Neytiri was my best student. She and her sister Silwanin. Just amazing girls.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I didn't meet the sister.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No, she's dead. Okay, let's go -- village life starts early.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Don't do anything unusually stupid.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Forward.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I knew this guy could speak English.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You've got outer columns, then a secondary ring here, and an inner ring. Then a core structure, it's like a spiral, that's how they move up and down.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Roger that.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm not about to let Quaritch and Selfridge micro-manage this thing. We're going up into the mountains.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's right.

title: Avatar
dialogue: See these magnetic formations. We're getting close.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yup. We're in the flux vortex.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah, so what does hold them up? Grace explained it to me -- some kind of maglev effect because unobtanium is a superconductor, or something. At least somebody understands it. Just not me. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake, take number two, it's the least glitchy. Norm, I need you to operate Jake's link.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hey. You got a problem?

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's not our choice, Norm.

title: Avatar
dialogue: He can't go far.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Let's get you in. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Holy shit.

title: Avatar
dialogue: When?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Do I have to do this? I need some rack.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No -- now, when it's fresh.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah, yeah. The days are starting to blur together. The language is a bitch, but I figure it's like field-stripping a weapon. Repetition.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Seyri.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Ontu, mikyun, nari.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Neytiri thinks I'm some kind of retard.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Norm's attitude has improved lately.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Ireiyo.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's good he's back on board, but he thinks I'm a retard too.

title: Avatar
dialogue: My feet are getting tougher. I can run farther every day.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I have to trust my body to know what to do. With Neytiri it's learn fast or die.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I sweet-talked Mo'at into giving Norm and Grace a hall pass. Now Grace even makes me coffee before link every morning.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I See you, Neytiri Mo'at'ite.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm learning to read the trails, the tracks at the water-hole, the tiniest scents and sounds.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Sometimes I have no idea what she's talking about.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's been a month and I'm still not allowed to make a kill. She says the forest hasn't given permission.

title: Avatar
dialogue: There's a lot of crap like that. She's always going on about the flow of energy-- the spirits of the animals and what not --

title: Avatar
dialogue: I just hope this treehugger shit isn't on the final.

title: Avatar
dialogue: This isn't just about eye-hand coordination out there. You need to listen to what she says. Try to see the forest through their eyes.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Excuse me -- this is my video-log here, okay?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Everything is backwards now. Like out there is the true world, and in here is the dream.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I See you Brother, and thank you. Your spirit goes with Eywa, your body stays behind to become part of the People.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You're still losing weight. Here --

title: Avatar
dialogue: I made a kill today. We ate it. I know where that meal came from.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Other body. You need to take care of this body.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah yeah.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake, I'm serious -- you look like crap. You're burning too hard.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Get rid of this shit, then you can lecture me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm telling you, as your boss and someone who might even consider being a friend someday, to take some down time.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Not now. Tomorrow we leave for Iknimaya.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah -- you're gonna go ride a banshee. Or die trying.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's right, Grace. This is what I've been working for.

title: Avatar
dialogue: And this is your check up from the neck up, Marine. You're getting in way too deep. Trust me, I learned the hard way.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What did happen at the school?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Neytiri's sister -- Sylwanin -- stopped coming to school. She was angry about the clear-cutting.

title: Avatar
dialogue: One day, she and a couple of other young hunters came running in, all painted up -- they'd set a bulldozer on fire -- I guess they thought I could protect them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The troopers pursued them to the schoolhouse.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They killed Sylwanin in the doorway. Right in front of Neytiri. Then shot the others. I got most of the kids out, before they shot me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jesus.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Avatar
dialogue: A scientist stays objective -- we can not be ruled by emotion. But I poured ten years of my life into that school. They called me sa'atenuk. Mother. That kind of pain reaches back through the link.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's a job. Learn what you can -- but don't get attached.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's not our world, Jake. And we can't stop what's coming. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Iknimaya translates roughly as stairway to heaven. It's the test every young hunter has to pass.

title: Avatar
dialogue: We doin' this?

title: Avatar
dialogue: How will I know if he chooses me?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Outstanding.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Let's dance.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's right! You're mine.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Heeeyyyaaaah!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Shut the hell up!!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Level out! Fly straight!

title: Avatar
dialogue: I may not be much of a horse guy. But I was born to do this.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The Great Leonopteryx is the apex aerial predator. Not only rare, but the sightings tend not to get reported.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The People call it Toruk.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Last one you ever see.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's it.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Vitraya Ramunong -- The Well of Souls. It's their most sacred place.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Something big is going on in there, biologically. I'd die to get samples, but outsiders are strictly forbidden.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hey, guys. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's a long time.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Watch that stuff. It'll knock you into next week.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Sorry.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's hard to put in words the deep connection the People have to the forest.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They see a network of energy that flows through all living things. They know that all energy is only borrowed--

title: Avatar
dialogue: -- and one day you have to give it back.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hard to believe it's only been three months.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I can barely remember my old life. I'm not sure who I am anymore. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: You called us back to report -- you want to hear it or not?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake is making incredible progress, years worth in just a few months. But -- we need more time.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Parker, it's their ancestral home. They've lived there since before human history began. You can spare them a few more weeks.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No. I can do this.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I've gotta finish this thing. There's one more test -- the Dream Hunt. It's the final stage of becoming a man. Then I'm one of them. They'll trust what I say...

title: Avatar
dialogue: ... and I can negotiate the terms of their relocation.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake, I can't allow this. You're just not strong enough.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's the last door -- I'm going through it. You can help me or get out of the way.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Will you listen to me? Sometimes the Na'vi themselves die in these vision quests. The venom takes you to the edge of death.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No matter what you prove out there-- you are still in here. Right here.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I have to go all the way -- become one of THEM--

title: Avatar
dialogue: Goddammit, Jake, you can never be one of them!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Our life out there takes millions of dollars of machinery to sustain. You visit -- and you leave.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You can never truly be with her.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You know why I'm here? Because Quaritch sent me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's right -- to embed with the Omaticaya. To find out how to screw them out of their home. By deceit or by force, he didn't care. And if it turned out to be force, then how best to do it.

title: Avatar
dialogue: And what about now, Jake?

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm not that guy any more.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I know.

title: Avatar
dialogue: But if I tell Quaritch the truth, he yanks me out -- I never see her again. And if I tell her the truth, the clan throws me out -- that's if they don't cut my heart out and show it to me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They don't even have a word for "lie" -- they had to learn it from us.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I know. I taught it to them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Grace. I've gotta go. They're waiting.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake. You can't carry this burden much longer.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's okay. Mo'at says an alien mind probably can't survive the Dream Hunt anyway.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Prep my link. I'm going in. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's like -- a sound you feel.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I don't want Ninat.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I've already chosen. But this woman must also choose me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Neytiri, you know my real body is far away, sleeping.

title: Avatar
dialogue: We are?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Really, we are?

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's cool. I'm there.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Here -- eat this. I'd hate to have to force-feed a cripple.

title: Avatar
dialogue: She's not going anywhere.

title: Avatar
dialogue: And when was the last time you took a shower? Jesus, Marine.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hey! Heeeey! Stop! Stop!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Please -- this will only make it worse --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Okay, listen. There's something I have to tell you. It's gonna be hard. I just need you to --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Oh shit.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Jake, don't --

title: Avatar
dialogue: I accept. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: What the hell are you doing?

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's the only way to get him to goddamn listen.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Are you out of your goddamn mind?!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Parker, listen, there may still be time to --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Or what, Ranger Rick? You gonna shoot me? You need to muzzle your dog!

title: Avatar
dialogue: You say you want to keep your people alive. Start by listening to her.

title: Avatar
dialogue: This is bad, Parker. Those trees were sacred to the Omaticaya in a way you can't imagine.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm not talking about pagan voodoo here -- I'm talking about something real and measurable in the biology of the forest.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I can't do this. How am I supposed to reduce years of work to a sound bite for the illiterate?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Just tell him what you know in your heart.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Alright, look -- I don't have the answers yet, I'm just now starting to even frame the questions. What we think we know -- is that there's some kind of electrochemical communication between the roots of the trees. Like the synapses between neurons. Each tree has ten to the fourth connections to the trees around it, and there are ten to the twelfth trees on Pandora --

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's more connections than the human brain. You get it? It's a network -- a global network. And the Na'vi can access it -- they can upload and download data -- memories -- at sites like the one you destroyed.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You need to wake up, Parker. The wealth of this world isn't in the ground -- it's all around us. The Na'vi know that, and they're fighting to defend it. If you want to share this world with them, you need to understand them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They're not going to give up their home -- they're not gonna make a deal. For what? Lite beer and shopping channel? There's nothing we have that they want. We're a horror to them. We're the monsters from space.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They're never going to leave Hometree.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Parker, we have to talk, like rational people.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They bulldozed a sacred site on purpose, to trigger a response. They're fabricating this war to get what they want.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yup. That's how it's done. When people are sitting on shit you want, you make them your enemy. Then you're justified in taking it.

title: Avatar
dialogue: When?

title: Avatar
dialogue: My God.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Parker, wait. Stop! These are people you're about to --

title: Avatar
dialogue: For God's sake, there are children in there. Babies!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Look Selfridge, you don't want this kind of blood on your hands. Let me try to talk them out. They trust me.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Eytukan, I have something to say, to everyone.

title: Avatar
dialogue: A great evil is upon us. The Sky People are coming to destroy Hometree. They will be here soon.

title: Avatar
dialogue: You have to leave, or you will die.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They sent me here to learn your ways. So one day I could bring this message, and you would believe it.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yes. At first it was just orders. Then everything changed. I fell in love-- with the forest, with the Omaticaya People -- -- with you. And by then, how could I tell you?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Neytiri. Please, I only wanted to --

title: Avatar
dialogue: You have to get out of Hometree! Run to the forest! Please, I'm begging you!

title: Avatar
dialogue: We've gotta move! He's gonna blow the columns.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Neytiri! Neytiri!

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm sorry --

title: Avatar
dialogue: I was a warrior who dreamed he could bring peace. Sooner or later though, you always have to wake up...

title: Avatar
dialogue: They never wanted us to succeed.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Thanks.

title: Avatar
dialogue: So what do you say? Time for a revolution?

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm free.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Come on. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: Get your ship fired up.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Stay here. I need somebody on the inside I can trust.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Take it nice and easy, troop.

title: Avatar
dialogue: On the ground, face down. Hands behind your head.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Do what he goddamn says!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Go! Go! Go!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Oh yeah, baby!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Aaahh, crap. Not again.

title: Avatar
dialogue: This is gonna ruin my whole day.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hang on, Grace. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's strongest at the Well of Souls, right?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Good, `cause that's where we're going.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm gonna get you some help, Grace.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Forget it, it doesn't matter.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No! The People can help you. I know it. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: The Well of Souls. The heart of the forest. I knew the People would go there.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I've gotta try, Norm.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Outcast. Betrayer. Alien. To ever face them again, I was gonna have to change the rules.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Sometimes your whole life boils down to one insane move.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Come on, boy. Time to fly.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The way I had it figured, Toruk is the baddest cat in the sky. Nothing attacks him. So why would he ever look up?

title: Avatar
dialogue: But that was just a theory.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I See you.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Tsu'tey of the Rongloa, son of Ateyo. I stand before you, ready to serve the People. You are Olo'eyctan, and you are the best warrior. I can't do this without you.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Ireiyo.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Grace is dying. I beg the help of the Great Mother.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Look where we are, Grace.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I need to take some samples.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Is that possible?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Hang on, they're gonna fix you up.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I -- always held back. But you gave them your heart. I'm proud of you, Jake.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Help them. You do whatever it takes. You hear me?

title: Avatar
dialogue: I will.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm with her Jake -- -- she's real --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Grace!

title: Avatar
dialogue: With your permission, I will Speak now. You would honor me by translating.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The Sky People have sent a message that they can take whatever they want, and no one can stop them. But we will send them a message. Ride out, as fast as the wind can carry you, tell the other clans to come. Tell them Toruk Macto calls to them. Fly now with me brothers and sisters! Fly! And we will show the Sky People that this is our land!

title: Avatar
dialogue: We rode out to the four winds. To the horse clans of the plain, to the ikran people of the mountains. When Toruk Macto called them, they came.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Talk fast.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Can you talk to Selfridge? Maybe we can cut some kinda deal before this thing goes all the way.

title: Avatar
dialogue: When?

title: Avatar
dialogue: Thanks.

title: Avatar
dialogue: That's right. Because I gave it to him on a plate.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Then I guess we better stop him.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Gonna have to settle for coffee. CUT TO:

title: Avatar
dialogue: I was a warrior who dreamed he could bring peace. But there was only one thing I was ever really good at. Ooh-rah.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Strike here and here.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What's your point?

title: Avatar
dialogue: I've never done this in my life.

title: Avatar
dialogue: And I'm probably just talking to a tree right now. But if you're there -- I need to give you a heads up.

title: Avatar
dialogue: If Grace is there with you -- look in her memories -- she can show you the world we come from. There's no green there. They killed their Mother, and they're gonna do the same thing here.

title: Avatar
dialogue: More Sky People are gonna come. They're gonna come like a rain that never ends --

title: Avatar
dialogue: -- until they've covered the world. Unless we stop them.

title: Avatar
dialogue: It was worth a try.

title: Avatar
dialogue: We have to stop the shuttles, no matter what it takes.

title: Avatar
dialogue: What the hell -- ?

title: Avatar
dialogue: WHOO-HOOOO!

title: Avatar
dialogue: Quaritch is gonna take out the Well of Souls! He's got a clear shot. Hit him, anybody that can! Do it now!

title: Avatar
dialogue: It's all over Quaritch --

title: Avatar
dialogue: Kinda hoped you'd say that.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I See you, Tsu'tey te Rongloa Ateyitan.

title: Avatar
dialogue: They're safe.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No. I'm not officer material.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I'm not killing you.

title: Avatar
dialogue: No.

title: Avatar
dialogue: Forgive me, my Brother. Go now to the Mother Spirit.

title: Avatar
dialogue: A few chose to stay. Fewer were chosen.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The forest will heal, and so will the hearts of the People. New life keeps the energy flowing, like the breath of the world.

title: Avatar
dialogue: This is my last videolog.

title: Avatar
dialogue: The science guys will keep the lights on, here. But I won't miss this place.

title: Avatar
dialogue: I better wrap this up. There's a funeral tonight, and I don't want to be late. It was someone very close to me.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How bad is it?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: NASA didn't authorize Selvig to test phase.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What are the energy levels now?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How long to get everyone out?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Do better.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We should tell them to go back to sleep?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I need you to make sure that PHASE 2 prototypes are shipped out.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Until such time as the world ends, we will act as though it intends to spin on. Clear out the tech below. Every piece of PHASE 2 on a truck and gone.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Talk to me, doctor. DR. ERIK SELVIG emerges from behind the CMS machine, concerned. The Tesseract is glowing unusually brighter and flare rings shoot out at random.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Is there anything we know for certain?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Is that supposed to be funny?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How soon until you pull the plug?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We've prepared for this, doctor. Harnessing energy from space.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: That can be harmful. Where's Barton?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Agent Barton, report. BARTON rappels down from the catwalk. Walks up to Fury. They both walk around the facility in a discreet manner.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I gave you this detail so you could keep a close eye on things.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Are you seeing anything that might set this thing off?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: At this end?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Sir, please put down the spear! Loki looks at his spear then suddenly points it at where Fury and Barton are standing and SHOOTS OUT A BLUE EXPLODING LIGHT TOWARDS THEM. BARTON TACKLES Fury and they both barely miss Loki's fired shot. ALL HELL BREAKS. Machine gun fire is shot at Loki, but the bullets bounce off him like a boss. Loki jumps high from the platform and ATTACKS those firing at him. In the blink of an eye, Loki takes down several guards with his KNIVES and ENERGY BLASTS from the scepter. He stops and waits to see who will attack him next. Honestly, the whole lab has almost gone to shit. Barton tries to stand up. Loki quickly walks towards him. Barton raises his gun, but Loki grabs Barton's hand.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You have heart. Loki points the head of his spear at Barton's head. Barton's eyes suddenly glow BLACK. The ability to control Barton's mind is now in Loki's hand. Barton puts his piece away and stands straight. As Loki is busy using his abilities to control the minds of several S.H.I.E.L.D. personnel, Fury takes the Tesseract, placing it back into its case and tries to leave the lab.Then...

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Please don't. I still need that.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Of course it does. I've come too far for anything else. I am Loki of Asgard, and I am burdened with glorious purpose.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We have no quarrel with your people.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: An ant has no quarrel with a boot.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You planning to step on us?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I come with glad tidings, of a world made free.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Free from what?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Freedom. Freedom is life's great lie. Once you accept that, in your heart... Like a gunslinger, Loki turns to face Selvig who's standingbehind him and places his spear against Selvig's heart. Selvig's eyes glow BLACK.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You will know peace.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Yeah, you say peace, I kind of think you mean the other thing. From the vacuum chamber ceiling, Tesseract's energy cloud RAPIDLY builds into what may be an implosion.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Like The Pharaohs of Odin.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, then... Loki, looking at Barton, who doesn't even hesitate, SHOOTS FURY WHO FALLS TO THE GROUND. Barton grabs the case containing the Tesseract and leaves the lab with Loki, Selvig and the other S.H.I.E.L.D personnel Loki is controlling.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Hill, do you copy?! Loki and Barton SHARPLY look at Agent Hill.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Barton is...

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: He's got the Tesseract! Track it down! The energy is really brewing a fucking shit storm from the vacuum chamber ceiling.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: The Tesseract is with the hostile force. I have men down. Hill?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Sound the general call. I want every living soul not working rescue looking for that brief case.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Coulson, get back to base. This is a LEVEL SEVEN. As of right now, we are at war. A beat.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You ever been in a war, Councilman? In a firefight? Did you feel an overabundance of control?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Not Asgard. Loki.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Our intelligence says, Thor is not a hostile. But he's worlds away, we can't depend on him to help. It's up to us.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: PHASE 2 isn't ready, our enemy is. We need a response team.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: This isn't about The Avengers.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm not leaving anything to anyone. We need a response team. These people maybe isolated, unbalanced even, but I believe with the right push they can be exactly what we need.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: No, it's won by soldiers.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: There's not enough time! I gotta put her in the water!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Trouble sleeping?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I slept for seventy years, sir. I think I've had my fill.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Then you should be out, celebrating, seeing the world. Steve stops punching and walks over to the bench, unraveling the tape off his hands. He sits down.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I went under, the world was at war, I wake up, they say we won. They didn't say what we lost.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We've made some mistakes along the way. Some very recently.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You here with a mission, sir?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I am.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Trying to get me back in the world?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Trying to save it. Fury hands Steve a file on the Tesseract, along with other files on HYDRA'S projects.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Hydra's secret weapon.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Howard Stark fished that out of the ocean when he was looking for you. He thought what we think, the Tesseract could be the key to unlimited sustainable energy. That's something the world sorely needs.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Who took it from you?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: He's called Loki. He's not from around here. There's a lot we'll have to bring you up to speed on if you're in. The world has gotten even stranger than you already know.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: At this point, I doubt anything would surprise me.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Ten bucks says you're wrong. There's a debriefing package waiting for you back at your apartment. Steve turns and picks up a punching bag. Starts walking out of the gym.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Is there anything you can tell us about the Tesseract that we ought to know now?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You should have left it in the ocean.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You're good on this end. The rest is up to you.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark Tower is about to become a beacon of self-sustaining clean energy.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I assume. Light her up. As IRON MAN flies to the STARK TOWER BUILDING, the power is switched on and the STARK sign LIGHTS UP.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Like Christmas, but with more... me.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Pepper, you're killing me. Remember? Enjoy the moment.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm not in. I'm actually out.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Close the line Jarvis. I got a date.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Of course they are, I was directly involved. Which brings me to my next question: how does it feel to be a genius?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What do you mean? All this came from you.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Give yourself some credit, please. Stark Tower is your baby. Give yourself... twelve percent of the credit.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: An argument can be made for fifteen.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, I did do all the heavy lifting. Literally, I lifted the heavy things. And sorry, but the security snafu? That was on you.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: My private elevator...

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: ...was teeming with sweaty workmen. I'm going to pay for that comment about percentages in some subtle way later, aren't I? Pepper pours herself and Tony a glass of champagne.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'll tell you what. Next building's gonna say 'Potts' on the tower.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: ...Call your mom, can you bunk over?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You have reached the life model decoy of Tony Stark, please leave a message.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Then leave it urgently. At that moment the elevator door opens and Coulson appears.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Security breach.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Phil? Uh, his first name is Agent.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Which is why he can't stay.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I don't like being handed things.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Official consulting hours are between eight and five every other Thursday.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: The Avengers Initiative was scrapped, I thought. And I didn't even qualify.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Yeah, apparently I'm volatile, self- obsessed, don't play well with others.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Whatever. Miss Potts, got a minute? Pepper walks over to Tony who places the files into his own databases.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You know, I thought we were having a moment.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How did you notice? Why is he Phil?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: This is, uh... Tony EXPANDS his arms and different profiles appear in holographic form floating in the air in front of Tony and Pepper.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: This. Screens appear of CAPTAIN AMERICA IN ACTION, the HULK ROARING AS

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Tomorrow.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, what if I didn't?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Square deal. It's the last date. Pepper kisses him.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: So, this Doctor Banner was trying to replicate the serum that was used on me?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Didn't really go his way, did it?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, I hope I'm the man for the job.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: The uniform? Aren't the stars and stripes a little... old fashioned?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Let them go at themselves. I will lead them into glorious battle.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Glorious, not lengthy. If your force is as formidable as you claim.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I was a king! The rightful king of Asgard! Betrayed!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You don't have the Tesseract yet. THE OTHER runs over to attack him, but stops as Loki points his scepter.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I don't threaten, but until I open the doors, until your force is mine to command, you are but words.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Ma'am?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Trading cards?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Dr. Banner. Steve walks up to Banner and shakes his hands.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Word is you can find the cube.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Only word I care about.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, this is actually kind of familiar.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Is this is a submarine?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Good. Let's vanish.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Gentlemen. Steve gives Fury 10 bucks, referring to his earlier statement about never being surprised again. Fury walks over Banner and extends his hand. Banner, reluctantly shakes it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Doctor, thank you for coming.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Once we get our hands on the Tesseract, you're in the clear.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How many are there?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Agent Romanoff, would you show Dr.Banner to his laboratory, please. Natasha nods and walks off, leading Banner down the hall.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I know. What did it show you, Agent Barton?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Tell me what you need.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: No, no. It's fine.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Captain, you're up. Steve nods. Leaves.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Kneel before me. The crowd ignores him. Another LOKI appears, blocking the crowd. Loki after Loki appears, they all grin as they raise their spears, encircling the crowd.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I said. KNEEL!!! Everyone becomes quiet and kneels in front him. Loki embracing his arms out, smiling.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Is not this simpler? Is this not your natural state? It's the unspoken truth of humanity, that you crave subjugation. The bright lure of freedom diminishes your life's joy in a mad scramble for power, for identity. You were made to be ruled. In the end, you will always kneel. As the words resonate to the kneeling crowd, an ELDER GERMAN MAN refuses to kneel and stands, heroic.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: There are no men like me.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Look to your elder, people. Let him be an example. Loki is about to execute him with his scepter as the light GLOWS blue. Just as the ENERGY BEAM shoots out, FUCKING CAPTAIN AMERICA arrives! He dives in just in time and BLOCKS the blast with his SHIELD, knocking down Loki on his ass.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You know, the last time I was in Germany and saw a man standing above everybody else, we ended up disagreeing.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm not the one who's out of time. From above Cap, the QUINJET arrives. A machine gun is pointed towards Loki.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Kneel.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Not today! Cap FLIPS and KNOCKS him out with his leg. Loki grabs him and FLIPS him over.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Agent Romanoff, did you miss me? Both Cap and Loki look up at the sky. Tony flies over in his IRON MAN suit and blasts Loki right back to the ground. IRON MAN touches down. He stands up and pulls out every piece of weaponry the suit has.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Make your move, Reindeer Games. Loki puts up his hands and surrenders. His armor materializes away.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Good move.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Mr. Stark.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Captain.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Said anything?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Just get him here. We're low on time. With Loki tied up and cuffed to his seat, Tony and Steve watch from a distance, whispering.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I don't like it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What? Rock of Ages giving up so easily?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I don't remember it being ever that easy. This guy packs a wallop.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Still, you are pretty spry, for an older fellow. What's your thing? Pilates?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: It's like calisthenics. You might have missed a couple things, you know, doing time as a Capsicle. Steve looks at Tony, finally meeting his ego match.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Fury didn't tell me he was calling you in.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Yeah, there's a lot of things Fury doesn't tell you. THUNDER and LIGHTNING nearly hit the jet, making it shake violently.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What's the matter? Scared of a little lightning?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm not overly fond of what follows. What the fuck? OUTSIDE THE JET A BLINDING LIGHT hits the jet. Not a light. A King. THE MIGHTY THOR. Thor OPENS the ramp and grabs Loki by the throat and flies out. Steve and Tony are left dumbstruck. Tony puts the IRON MAN helmet on.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Now there's that guy.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Think the guy's a friendly?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Doesn't matter. If he frees Loki or kills him, the Tesseract's lost. Tony turns and gets ready to jump off the jet to chase after Thor.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark, we need a plan of attack!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I have a plan. Attack. IRON MAN jumps out of the jet and chases after Thor. Cap grabs a parachute to follow.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I don't see how I can.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: There's only one God, ma'am. And I'm pretty sure he doesn't dress like that. Cap JUMPS OUT of the jet.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Where is the Tesseract?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Do I look to be in a gaming mood?!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Oh, you should thank me. With the Bifrost gone how much dark energy did the Allfather have to muster to conjure you here? Your precious Earth. Thor drops MJÖLNIR, causing the mountain to quake. He picks up Loki. His brother. Although Thor is pissed for what he has done, a family is everything to a man or god.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I thought you dead.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Did you mourn?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We all did. Our father...

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Your father. He did tell you my true parentage, did he not? Thor lets go Loki, who walks away from Thor, causing an even bigger wedge between them.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We were raised together, we played together, we fought together. Do you remember none of that?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: So you take the world I love as recompense for your imagined slights. No, the Earth is under my protection, Loki.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You think yourself above them.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, yes.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Then you miss the truth of ruling, brother. Throne would suit you ill. Angrily, Loki shoves his brother to the side. He walks back up to the ledge. Turns around.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I've seen worlds you've never known about! I have grown, Odinson, in my exile! I have seen the true power of the Tesseract, and when I wield it...

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Who showed you this power? Who controls the would-be-king?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I am a king!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Not here! You give up the Tesseract! You give up this poisonous dream! You come home.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I don't have it. You need the cube to bring me home, but I've sent it off I know not where. Mjölnir flies back to his grasp.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You listen well, brother. I...

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm listening.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Do not touch me again!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Then don't take my stuff.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You have no idea what you're dealing with.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Shakespeare in the park? Doth mother know you weareth her drapes?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: This is beyond you, metal man. Loki will face Asgardian justice!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: He gives up the Cube, he's all yours. Until then, stay out of my way... tourist. The IRON MAN helmet clamps up and he walks away. In one quick move, Thor pulls Mjölnir, throws it, and KNOCKS IRON MAN clear across into a tree.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)

dialogue: I thought the beast had wandered off.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You're missing the point. There's no throne, there is no version of this, where you come out on top. Maybe your army comes and maybe it's too much for us, but it's all on you. Because if we can't protect the Earth, you can be damned well sure we'll avenge it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How will your friends have time for me,when they're so busy fighting you? Loki TAPS Tony on the chest with his scepter. PING! Nothing. Confused, Loki tires again. PING! NOTHING.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: It should work.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Well, performance issues. You know? In anger, Loki GRABS Tony by the throat and FLINGS him across the room.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Jarvis. Anytime now. Loki grabs Tony by the throat again.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You will all fall before me. LOKI THROWS TONY OUT THE WINDOW. Tony FREEFALLS down the tower. From behind Loki, an elevator opens and a RED POD SHOOTS out. The pod LASER SIGNALS the COLANTOTTE BRACELETS on Tony. The POD begins to TRANSFORM into the MARK VII suit. It LATCHES onto Tony. IRON MAN. The suit FLIES up before he hits the ground or the gazing people. Loki looks up, angry.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: And there's one other person you pissed off! His name was Phil. Loki raises the scepter. IRON MAN FIRES at Loki, sending him on his ass.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Right. Army. IRON MAN flies up towards the portal. From his shoulders, a miniature multiple rocket launcher, pops out and FIRES. Like the JERICHO MISSILE, several targets are taken down unlike no missile. It's useless. THOUSANDS OF CHITAURI FLY OUT. IRON MAN flies towards the city.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Loki! Turn off the Tesseract or I'll destroy it!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You can't. There is no stopping it. There is only the war!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: So be it. Loki and Thor rush at each other. They and their weapons collide. The two battle -- Loki unleashing another pent-up rage and jealousy, Thor having no choice but to defend himself.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What, did you stop for drive-thru? Swing up PARK, I'm gonna lay 'em out for you.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Fine. Let's keep them occupied. IRON MAN heads back to the portal.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark, are you seeing this?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm seeing, still working on believing. Where's Banner? Has he shown up yet?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Banner?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Just keep me posted. Jarvis, find me a soft spot. IRON MAN quietly flies behind and parallel with the CHITAURI

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Look at this! Look around you! You think this madness will end with your rule?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: It's too late. It's too late to stopit.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: No. We can. Together. Loki looks at his brother, showing a sign of hope. Then... Loki stabs Thor with a small knife. Thor keels over.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Sentiment. Thor gets up, KICKS Loki and lifts him into the air. Thor then SLAMS him down, hard. Loki, bleeding, rolls over the edge. Thor looks down. LOKI IS RIDING ON A FLYING CHARIOT. DOZENS of CHITAURI follow his lead.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Those people need assistance down there. CHITAURI SOLDIERS that have landed near them and begin FIRING at them. BLACK WIDOW pulls both pistols and FIRES. Turns to Cap.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I need men in these buildings. There are people inside that can run into the line of fire. You take them through the basement or through the subway. You keep them off the streets. I need a perimeter as far back as 39th.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What's the story upstairs?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: The powers surrounding the cube is impenetrable.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Thor is right. We gotta deal with these guys.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: As a team.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I have unfinished business with Loki.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Save it. Loki's gonna keep this fight focused on us and that's what we need. Without him these things could run wild. We got Stark up top, he's gonna need us... Just then, BANNER ARRIVES ON A SMALL MOTORBIKE. Getting off, he looks around the city.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark? We got him.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Banner?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Just like you said.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Then tell him to suit up. I'm bringing the party to you. IRON MAN comes out from behind a building. The CHITAURI LEVIATHAN follows, impatiently.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Dr. Banner. Now might be a really good time for you to get angry.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Send the rest.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Call it, Cap.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Alright, listen up. Until we can close that portal up there, we're gonna use containment. Barton, I want you on that roof, eyes on everything. Call out patterns and strays. Stark, you got the perimeter. Anything gets more than three blocks out, you turn it back or your turn it to ash.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Right. Better clench up, LEGOLAS. IRON MAN lifts HAWKEYE up to the building.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Thor, you've gotta try and bottleneck that portal. Slow them down. You've got the lightning. Light the bastards up. You and me, we stay here on the ground, keep the fighting here. And Hulk.SMASH.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Just try and keep them off the streets.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I will roger that. IRON MAN does so and leads towards TIGHT CORNERS and in HAWKEYE'S view, who fires arrow upon and arrow, EXPLODING the CHITAURI RIDERS. IRON MAN keeps leading CHITAURI RIDERS UNDER TUNNELS, THROUGH OPEN PARKING GARAGES. He looks back. None left.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Nice call. What else you got?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: And he didn't invite me?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Our biggest guns couldn't touch it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You wanna get up there, you're gonna need a ride.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Are you sure about this?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm on it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Everyone! Clear out! CAPTAIN AMERICA flips over the SOLDIER, grabs his SHIELD and just as the BOMB is about to GO OFF, CHITAURI BOMBER dives for, trying to stop it, but it GOES OFF, sending CAPTAIN AMERICA through the window, landing very hard on a car. The civilians look up from below. They're okay.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I recognize the council has made a decision, but given that it's a stupid ass decision, I've elected to ignore it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: That is the island of Manhattan, Councilman. Until I'm certain my team can't hold it, I will not order a nuclear strike against a civilian population.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I send that bird out, we already have. Fury shuts off his viewscreen.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: JARVIS. You ever hear the tale of Jonah?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark, you hearing me? We have a missile headed straight for the city.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: How long?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Three minutes, at best. Stay low and wipe out the missile.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Jarvis, put everything we got into the thrusters!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You ready for another bout?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What? You gettin' sleepy?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Do it!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: No, wait!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark, these things are still coming!

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I got a nuke coming in, it's gonna blow in less than a minute. And I know just where to put it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Stark, you know that's a one-way trip?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: You might as well.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Close it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: He's not slowing down. Thor swings Mjölnir around. Just as Thor flies up, THE HULK

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: What the hell? What just happened? Please tell me nobody kissed me?

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Alright. Hey. Alright. Good job, guys. Let's just not come in tomorrow. Let's just take a day. Have you ever tried shawarma? There's a shawarma joint about two blocks from here. I don't know what it is, but I wanna try it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: We're not finished yet. A beat.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: And then shawarma after.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: If it's all the same to you. I'll have that drink.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I'm not currently tracking their whereabouts. I'd say they've earned a leave of absence.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: The Tesseract is where it belongs: out of our reach.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I didn't make it. I just didn't argue with the god that did.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Oh, I think he will be.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: They surely are. And the whole world knows it. Every world knows it.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: A promise.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: They'll come back.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: I am.

title: Avengers-The-(2012)
dialogue: Because we'll need them to.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Little town, it's a quiet village Every day like the one before Little town full of little people Waking up to say...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: There goes the baker with his tray like always The same old bread and rolls to sell

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Every morning just the same Since the morning that we came To this poor provincial town

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Good morning, Monsieur Jean. Have you lost something again?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: To return this book to Pere Robert. It's about two lovers in fair Verona.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: There must be more than this provincial life

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Two cities in Northern Italy. I didn't want to come back.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Have you got any new places to go?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Thank you, Pere Robert. Your library almost makes our small corner of the world feel big.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oh... isn't this amazing? It's my favorite part because you'll see Here's where she meets Prince Charming But she won't discover that it's him `Til chapter three

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You've read it?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Sorry, not tonight.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: No.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Papa, do you think I'm odd?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I don't know. People talk.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Just tell me one more thing about her.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: A rose like the one in the painting.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: And every year, you bring it.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I'll see you tomorrow!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Stay safe...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: The laundry.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Come!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: ...over the dark wood.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: All I wanted was to teach a child to read.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I'm not ready to have children.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: It's a small village, Gaston. I've met them all.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Gaston, we could never make each other happy. No one can change that much.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I might be a farm girl, but I'm not simple. I'm sorry, but I will never marry you, Gaston.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Can you imagine? Me, the wife of that boorish, brainless...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Madame Gaston, can't you just see it Madame Gaston, his little wife No sir, not me, I guarantee it

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I want much more than this Provincial life...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I want adventure in the great wide somewhere I want it more than I can tell And for once it might be grand To have someone understand I want so much more than They've got planned

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Must have lost his way in the woods...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: A man of taste.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Philippe?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: What happened? Where is Papa?!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Take me to him!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Look, Cogsworth. A beautiful girl.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: But what if she is the one? The one who will break the spell?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Who said that? Who's there?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Papa!? Is that you?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oh, your hands are ice. We need to get you home.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Who?!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Who's there? Who are you?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I've come for my father.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Liar!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I asked for the rose. Punish me, not him!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: A life sentence for a rose?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Come into the light.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Alright, Papa. I will leave. I need a minute alone with him.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Are you so cold-hearted that you won't allow a daughter to kiss her father goodbye? Forever can spare a minute!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I should have been with you.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Forget you? Everything I am is because of you.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I love you too, Papa...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I'm not afraid. And I will escape, I promise.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: He is my father.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Don't hurt him!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Forgive my intrusion, mademoiselle, but I have been sent to escort you to your room.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: My room? But I thought --

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: What? That once this door closes it will not open again, RARRR? I know, he gets so dramatic.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: `Allo.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: AHHH!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oh, you are very strong. That's a great quality!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: What are you?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I am Lumière.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: And you can talk.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: What do you want to be for the rest of your life, Cogsworth: a man or a mantle clock?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Ready, miss? Trust me.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You must forgive first impressions, I hope you are not too startled.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Why would I be startled? I'm talking to a candle.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Candelabra, please. Enormous difference. But consider me at your service. The castle is your home now, so feel free to go anywhere you like --

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Why, what's in the west wing?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Uh... nothing. Storage space. That's it.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: This way, please!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Or as I like to call it, the only wing! Watch your step s'il vous plait.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Welcome to your new home. It's modest, but comfortable...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: It's... beautiful.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Of course. Master wanted you to have the finest room in the castle.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oh dear! We were not expecting guests.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I would risk anything to kiss you again, Plumette.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: How can I be strong when you make me so weak?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Is everything here alive? Hello, what's your name?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Do not be alarmed, mademoiselle. This is just your wardrobe. Meet Madame De Garderobe. A great singer.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Ah, stay with us, Madame! We have someone for you to dress!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: But I'm not a princess.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Mm. Subtle. Understated. I love it!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Be calm, let me do the talking.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: We thought you might appreciate the company.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: That is true. But if the girl is the one who can break the spell, maybe you can start by using dinner to charm her. Good thinking, Cogsworth!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You must try, master. With every passing day, we become less human.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Yes. The poor thing is probably in there, scared to death.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Just a minute.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You see, there she is. Now, master, remember. Be gentle.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: And when she opens the door, give her a dashing debonair smile. Come come -- show me the smile.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oh mon dieu.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You've taken me prisoner and now you want to have dinner with me? Are you insane?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: And I told you no!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I'd starve before I ever ate with you!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oh master, you've returned!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Eh, I got you there!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Another petal fell...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I know, darling -- Ow! I'm getting more metallic every day.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I told you to go away.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I'm so worried about him. He's never been on his own.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: But he said, "If she doesn't eat with me, she doesn't eat at all."

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: They're coming! Final checks, everyone, tout de suite!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Yes, I will make sure of it. But did you see her stand up to him? I am telling you, this girl is the one. They must fall in love if we are to be human again, and they can't fall in love if she stays in her room. Eh, Chapeau, you missed a spot!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: A broken clock is right two times a day, mon ami, and this is not one of those times.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Stand up straight! It's time to sparkle!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I have no taste buds, but I can tell this is exquisite.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Of course, of course. But what is dinner without a little... music?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Maestro Cadenza, are you ready?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Maestro, your wife is upstairs, finding it harder and harder to stay awake. She's counting on you to help us break this curse.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Ma chere, mademoiselle. It is with deepest pride and greatest pleasure that we welcome you tonight. And now, we invite you to relax.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Let us pull up a chair... as the dining room proudly presents...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: ... your dinner. Be our guest, be our guest

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Put our service to the test Tie your napkin `round your neck, cherie And we provide the rest!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Soup du jour, hot hors d'oeuvres Why we only live to serve Try the grey stuff, it's delicious

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Don't believe me? Ask the dishes!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: They can sing, they can dance After all, miss, this is France!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: And a dinner here is never second best Go on unfold your menu

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Beef ragout, cheese souffle, Pie and pudding en flambé!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: We'll prepare and serve with flair A culinary cabaret!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You're alone and you're scared But the banquet's all prepared!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: No one's gloomy or complaining While the flatware's entertaining!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: We tell jokes, I do tricks With my fellow candlesticks

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Come on and lift your glass You've won your own free pass To be our guest If you're stressed, it's fine dining we suggest.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Oui our guest Be our guest, be our guest!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Life is so unnerving For a servant who's not serving

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: He's not whole Without a soul to wait upon

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Ah, those good old days when we were useful Suddenly, those good old days are gone

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Too long we've been rusting Needing so much more than dusting Needing exercise A chance to use our skills

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Most days we just lay around the castle Flabby, fat and lazy

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You walked in, and oops-a-daisie!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: She's our guest!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Pudding?!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Surely you're as trapped here as I am. Don't you ever want to escape?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Lumiere mentioned something about the West Wing...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Good night.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Nothing.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Checkmate. Again.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Mademoiselle... what are you doing?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Getting out of here!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Go go, Froufrou!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Please, don't go! It's dangerous!

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: You have to help me... you have to stand...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: If you held still, it wouldn't hurt as much.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Well if you hadn't frightened me, I wouldn't have run away.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Well you should learn to control your temper.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Try to get some rest.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: We are eternally grateful.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Why do you care so much about him?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: But he has cursed you somehow. Why? You did nothing.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Let him sleep.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: How in the midst of all this sorrow Can so much hope and love endure? I was innocent and certain Now I'm wiser but unsure

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: What happens when the last petal falls?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: The master remains a beast forever. And the rest of us become...

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Knickknacks.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: I want to help you. There must be some way to lift the curse.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Love can transpose to form and dignity. Love looks not with the eyes but with the mind. And therefore --

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: So you know Shakespeare?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Actually, "Romeo and Juliet" is my favorite play.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Sorry?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Like what?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: It's wonderful.

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Have you really read every one of these books?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Was that a joke? Are you making jokes now?

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: The air is blue and keen and cold And in a frozen sheath enrolled

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: Each branch, each twig, each blade of grass Seems clad miraculously with glass

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: But in that solemn silence Is heard the whisper Of every sleeping thing: "Look, look at me Come wake me up For still here I be."

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: There's something sweet and almost kind But he was mean and he was coarse and unrefined

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: And now he's dear and so unsure I wonder why I didn't see it there before

title: Beauty-and-the-Beast
dialogue: New and a bit alarming Who'd have ever thought that this could be?

title: Black-Panther
dialogue: Nakia will oversee the social outreach ... And you will spearhead the science and information exchange . Shuri turns to T'Challa in shock at what this means.

title: Black-Panther
dialogue: My name is King T'Challa , son of King T'Chaka . I am the sovereign ruler of the Nation of Wakanda and for the first time in our history we will be sharing our knowledge and resources with the outside world. Wakanda will no longer watch from the shadows . We cannot , we must not. We will work to be an example of how we as brothers and sisters on this Earth should treat each other . Now more than ever , illusions of division threaten our very e x istence. We all know the truth : more connects us than separates us . In times of crisis , the wise build bridges , while the foolish build barriers . We must find a way to look after one another, as if we were one single tribe . The audience of WORLD LEADERS look around , bemused, wondering what Wakanda could possibly have to offer .

dialogue: Leland Turbo, this is Finn McMissile. I'm at the rally point. Over.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Leland, it's Finn. Please respond. Over.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Professor Zundapp?

title: Cars-2
dialogue: What are you up to now, Professor?

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Mater. Tow Mater, that's who... is here to help you!

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Hey, Otis!

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Well dadgum, you're leaking oil again. Must be your gaskets. Hey, look on the bright side: This is your tenth tow this month, so that means it's on the house.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Don't sweat it. These things happen to everybody, Otis.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Yeah, but I ain't perfect. Don't tell nobody, but I think my rust is starting to show through.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Not yet.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: Yeah, we're so dadgum proud of him. But I sure wish he'd hurry up and get back `cause we got a whole summer's worth of best friend fun to make up for. Just me and --

title: Cars-2
dialogue: --- McQueen!

title: Cars-2
dialogue: It's good to be home, everybody.

title: Cars-2
dialogue: McQueen!
