dialogue: Our family thinks music is a curse. None of them understand, but I know you would have. You would've told me to follow my heart. To seize my moment!

title: Coco
dialogue: So if it's all right with you, I'm gonna play in the plaza, just like you did!

title: Coco
dialogue: I... I'm sorry! It's not what it looks like! De la Cruz is my...

title: Coco
dialogue: Mamá!

title: Coco
dialogue: Thanks, I--

title: Coco
dialogue: Ahhh!

title: Coco
dialogue: AHHH!

title: Coco
dialogue: Dante?! You can see me? W-wait! What's going on?!

title: Coco
dialogue: Dante! Dante!

title: Coco
dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm sorry...

title: Coco
dialogue: Remind me how I know you?

title: Coco
dialogue: Tía... Rosita?

title: Coco
dialogue: Papá Julio?

title: Coco
dialogue: Tía Victoria?

title: Coco
dialogue: Tío Oscar? Tío Felipe?

title: Coco
dialogue: Whoa...

title: Coco
dialogue: Dante! Dante! Dante, wait up!

title: Coco
dialogue: You gotta stay with me, boy. We don't know... where...

title: Coco
dialogue: This isn't a dream, then. You're all really out there...

title: Coco
dialogue: Well I don't know, I thought it might've been one of those made up things that adults tell kids... like... vitamins.

title: Coco
dialogue: Well, now I'm thinking maybe they could be...

title: Coco
dialogue: Are those...? Alebrijes! But those are--

title: Coco
dialogue: Yes, it is I. Frida Kahlo. Shall we skip the scanner? I'm on so many ofrendas, it'll just overwhelm your blinky thingie...

title: Coco
dialogue: Okay, when I said I was Frida... just now? That... that was a lie. And I apologize for doing that.

title: Coco
dialogue: You know what, I'm just gonna zip right over, you won't even know I'm gone.

title: Coco
dialogue: Ha HA!

title: Coco
dialogue: Almost there, just a little further...!

title: Coco
dialogue: Fine, okay. Fine, who cares... Dumb flower bridge!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hola.

title: Coco
dialogue: Whoa...

title: Coco
dialogue: Mamá Imelda...

title: Coco
dialogue: What?!

title: Coco
dialogue: But I wasn't stealing the guitar!

title: Coco
dialogue: It was my great-great grandfather's, he would have wanted me to have it--

title: Coco
dialogue: Uh, you're all dead.

title: Coco
dialogue: That's just Dante.

title: Coco
dialogue: But Dante doesn't have any hair.

title: Coco
dialogue: Oh...

title: Coco
dialogue: It was an accident!

title: Coco
dialogue: That's it?

title: Coco
dialogue: What happens at sunrise?

title: Coco
dialogue: What? She can't do that!

title: Coco
dialogue: Fine.

title: Coco
dialogue: No skeletons!

title: Coco
dialogue: Mariachi Plaza, here I come--

title: Coco
dialogue: This isn't fair, it's my life! You already had yours!

title: Coco
dialogue: Papá Julio, I ask for your blessing.

title: Coco
dialogue: Tía Rosita? Oscar? Felipe? Tía Victoria?

title: Coco
dialogue: You really hate music that much?

title: Coco
dialogue: The same path he did.

title: Coco
dialogue: He's family...

title: Coco
dialogue: Con permiso, I... need to visit the restroom. Be right back!

title: Coco
dialogue: Vámonos.

title: Coco
dialogue: If I wanna be a musician, I need a MUSICIAN'S blessing. We gotta find my great-great grandpa.

title: Coco
dialogue: No, no -- Dante!

title: Coco
dialogue: That's illegal?

title: Coco
dialogue: Amigo? Oh, that's so nice, to hear you say that, because... I've just had a really hard Día de Muertos, and I could really use an amigo right now.

title: Coco
dialogue: And amigos, they help their amigos. Listen, you get me across that bridge tonight and I'll make it worth your while.

title: Coco
dialogue: Oh, you like de la Cruz? He and I go way back! I can get you front row seats to his Sunrise Spectacular Show!

title: Coco
dialogue: I'll -- I'll get you backstage, you can meet him! You just gotta let me cross that bridge!

title: Coco
dialogue: Can I at least get my costume back?

title: Coco
dialogue: Some amigo...

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey. Hey! You really know de la Cruz?

title: Coco
dialogue: Who wants to-- Ah! You're alive!

title: Coco
dialogue: Shhh!

title: Coco
dialogue: Yeah I'm alive. And if I wanna get back to the Land of the Living, I need de la Cruz's blessing.

title: Coco
dialogue: That's weirdly specific.

title: Coco
dialogue: He's my great-great-grandfather.

title: Coco
dialogue: He's your wha-whaat...?

title: Coco
dialogue: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. Wait, wait... Wait, no, wait, wait, wait. Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait? Yes! You're going back to the Land of the Living?!

title: Coco
dialogue: D'ya know what, maybe this isn't such a g--

title: Coco
dialogue: No, niño, niño, niño, I can help you! You can help me. We can help each other! But most importantly, you can help ME.

title: Coco
dialogue: AH!

title: Coco
dialogue: I'm Héctor.

title: Coco
dialogue: That's nice!

title: Coco
dialogue: Espérame chamaco!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey, hey, hold still. Look up. Look up. A ver, a ver... look up. Up, UP!... Ta-da!

title: Coco
dialogue: Dead as a doorknob. So listen, Miguel: this place runs on memories. When you're well- remembered, people put up your photo and you get to cross the bridge and visit the living on Día de Muertos. Unless you're me.

title: Coco
dialogue: You don't get to cross over.

title: Coco
dialogue: No one's ever put up my picture... But you can change that!

title: Coco
dialogue: This is you?

title: Coco
dialogue: Muy guapo, eh?

title: Coco
dialogue: So you get me to my great-great grandpa, then I put up your photo when I get home?

title: Coco
dialogue: Such a smart boy! Yes! Great idea, yes! One hiccup: de la Cruz is a tough guy to get to. And I need to cross that bridge soon. Like TONIGHT. So, you got any other family here, you know? Someone a bit more... accessible?

title: Coco
dialogue: Mmm, nope.

title: Coco
dialogue: Don't yank my chain, chamaco. You gotta have SOME other family.

title: Coco
dialogue: ONLY de la Cruz. If you can't help me, I'll find him myself.

title: Coco
dialogue: Okay, okay, kid, fine -- fine! I'll get you to your great-great grandpa...!

title: Coco
dialogue: ...It's not gonna be easy, you know? He's a busy man. What are you doing?

title: Coco
dialogue: I'm walking like a skeleton. Blending in.

title: Coco
dialogue: No, skeletons don't walk like that.

title: Coco
dialogue: It's how you walk.

title: Coco
dialogue: No, I don't.

title: Coco
dialogue: Stop it!

title: Coco
dialogue: Whoa..."Ernesto de la Cruz's Sunrise Spectacular...!" Qué padre!

title: Coco
dialogue: Blech. Every year, your great- great grandpa puts on that dumb show to mark the end of Día de Muertos.

title: Coco
dialogue: And you can get us in!

title: Coco
dialogue: Ahhhh--

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey, you said you had front row tickets!

title: Coco
dialogue: That... that was a lie. I apologize for that.

title: Coco
dialogue: Cool off, chamaco, come on... I'll get you to him.

title: Coco
dialogue: How?

title: Coco
dialogue: 'Cause I happen to know where he's rehearsing!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hola, Ceci!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hola.

title: Coco
dialogue: Ceci, I lost the dress--

title: Coco
dialogue: Ceci -- I know, Ceci. I know, I know. Ceci -- Ceci... Ceci. Ceci...

title: Coco
dialogue: Dante... Dante!

title: Coco
dialogue: We shouldn't be in here...

title: Coco
dialogue: No, no, Dante! Ven acá!

title: Coco
dialogue: I just followed my--

title: Coco
dialogue: I don't think he's a spirit guide.

title: Coco
dialogue: I think it's just the right amount of obvious? It could use some music... Oh! What if you did, like, doonk-doonk- doonk-doonk...

title: Coco
dialogue: Oh! And then it could go dittle- ittle-dittle-ittle-dittle-ittle- dittle-ittle -- WHAAA!

title: Coco
dialogue: Huh?

title: Coco
dialogue: Excuse me, where's the real de la Cruz?

title: Coco
dialogue: Chamaco! You can't run off on me like that! C'mon, stop pestering the celebrities...

title: Coco
dialogue: You said my great-great grandpa would be here! He's halfway across town, throwing some big party.

title: Coco
dialogue: That bum! Who doesn't show up to his own rehearsal?

title: Coco
dialogue: If you're such good friends, how come he didn't invite you?

title: Coco
dialogue: He's YOUR great-great grandpa. How come he didn't invite YOU?

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey Gustavo! You know anything about this party?

title: Coco
dialogue: Ha ha, very funny guys. Very funny.

title: Coco
dialogue: Chorizo?

title: Coco
dialogue: I don't want to talk about it.

title: Coco
dialogue: I didn't choke, okay -- I got food poisoning, which is a big difference!

title: Coco
dialogue: This is why I don't like musicians... bunch of self- important jerks!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey, I'm a musician.

title: Coco
dialogue: You are?

title: Coco
dialogue: No, no, no, chamaco, you are loco if you think--

title: Coco
dialogue: I need to get my great-great grandfather's blessing.

title: Coco
dialogue: You know where I can get a guitar?

title: Coco
dialogue: I know a guy...

title: Coco
dialogue: Why the heck would you wanna be a musician?

title: Coco
dialogue: My great-great grandpa was a musician.

title: Coco
dialogue: ...Who spent his life performing like a monkey for complete strangers. Blech, no, no thank you, guácala, no...

title: Coco
dialogue: Whadda you know?

title: Coco
dialogue: So, how far is this guitar anyway?

title: Coco
dialogue: We're almost there...

title: Coco
dialogue: Keep up, chamaco, come on!

title: Coco
dialogue: Eh! These guys!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey Tío! Qué onda!

title: Coco
dialogue: These people are all your family?

title: Coco
dialogue: Eh, in a way... We're all the ones with no photos or ofrendas, no family to go home to. Nearly forgotten, you know? So, we all call each other cousin, or tío, or whatever.

title: Coco
dialogue: Tía Chelo! He-hey!

title: Coco
dialogue: Hey, hey! Save some for me! Is Chicharrón around?

title: Coco
dialogue: Who doesn't like a visit from Cousin Héctor?

title: Coco

dialogue: I'm afraid I can't let you take those.

dialogue: Examining print dust. We've been robbed.

dialogue: Just trying to find out more about our jewel thief. I ran her prints from the photos she handled - Wayne pulls up a mug shot - a fat, male armed-robbery suspect. - but she was wearing someone else's fingerprints. She's good.

dialogue: My fingerprints. There was printer toner mixed with graphite on the safe. Gives you a good pull, and it's untraceable.

dialogue: Now you're trying to set me up with a jewel thief?

dialogue: There's nothing out there for me.

dialogue: And I need an appointment at the hospital. About my leg.

dialogue: I'll pass along your request. Next time I see him. Miranda catches something in this.

dialogue: I was not. But it wouldn't do him any good - Mr. Wayne still retains a clear majority. Miranda leaves. Fox moves into his office - stops.

dialogue: Even with -
