dialogue: No, why?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: These conversations always used to end with some...unusual requests.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I retired.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Let me show you some stuff, anyway. Fox hits a button - the bookcase opens into a hidden elevator.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I figured you'd have shut this place down.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It was always shut down, officially.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: But all this new stuff?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: After your father died, Wayne Enterprises set up fourteen different defense subsidiaries. I've spent years shuttering them and consolidating all the prototypes under one roof. My roof.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Why?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Stop them falling into the wrong hands. Besides, I thought someone might get some use out of them... Wayne shakes his head.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Sure I can't tempt you to something? Pneumatic crampons? Infrared lenses? Least let me get you something for that leg.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It's fine the use it gets these days.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Well, then I have just the thing for an eccentric billionaire who doesn't like to walk... Fox opens a door - we glimpse a sleek vehicle. Wayne's eyes light up.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Now you're just showing off.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Defense Department project for tight-geometry urban pacification. Rotors configured for maneuvering between buildings without recirculation.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What's it called?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It has a long and uninteresting Wayne Enterprises designation. So I took to calling it the Bat. And yes, Mr. Wayne, it does come in black. Wayne touches its sleek side. Marveling.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Works great except for the autopilot.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What's wrong with that?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Software-based instability. Take a better mind than mine to fix it.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Better mind?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I was trying to be modest. A less busy mind. Yours, perhaps. Wayne looks wistfully at the machine. Turns away.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I told you. I retired, Lucius.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: That's good -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: The Batman wasn't needed anymore. We won.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What if he doesn't exist anymore?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm not sure if my assistant put me on the guest list -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Miss Tate, isn't it?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: True. Proceeds go to the big fat spread, not the cause. It's not about charity, it's about feeding the ego of whichever society hag laid it on.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Oh.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: That's very generous of you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Sometimes the investment doesn't pay off. Sorry.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Mind if I cut in? Rich Twit turns, annoyed - Wayne hands him his cane. Takes Selina by the waist. She glares at him.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You don't seem very happy to see me.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Felt like some fresh air.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I have a powerful friend who deals with this kind of thing. Brazen costume for a cat burglar.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Bruce Wayne, eccentric billionaire. Who's your date?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It's pronounced 'Ibeetha'. You wouldn't want these folks realizing you're a crook not a social climber.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I doubt you care what anyone in this room thinks about you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Well, Selina Kyle, I know you came here from your walk-up in Old Town - modest place for a master jewel thief. Which means either you're saving for your retirement - or you're in deep with the wrong people.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Actually, I was born in the Regency Room.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Start fresh.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Or our achievements.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You think that justifies stealing?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Robin Hood?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Maybe you're assuming too much.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Ouch.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Sounds like you're looking forward to it.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: These pearls do look better on you then they did in my safe...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Not likely.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I must have lost my ticket -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: My wife?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: This is Fox.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Remember those 'unusual requests' I used to make?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I knew it! Up front, Alfred listens. Concerned.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You start with the good limb so it learns your optimum muscle patterns. Wayne swaps the brace to his bad knee. Puts his weight on it - the knee bends, kicks. He sits again. Cautious. Now we tighten it up.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Not bad - Wayne executes a perfect roundhouse, knocking out a brick. Not bad at all.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm all ears.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Bane.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Born in a prison?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Bane was a member of the League of Shadows.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I didn't realize I was known for trifling with criminals.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Which was?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: If this man is all the things you say he is, then this city needs me. The Batsuit emerges from the cube.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I tried helping as Bruce Wayne, Alfred. And I failed.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: That's what you're afraid of - that if I go back out there I'll fail.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: They just don't care.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No guns. No killing.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Come on! Catwoman follows, confused, as Batman leaps off the roof. She gets to the edge, pauses to look down into the alley - sees the black angular roof of the Bat, cockpit open. Shots impact around her - she leaps, landing hard, but gracefully on the back of the vehicle, slides into the cockpit. As the engines thunder into life, and the canopy hisses shut, taking bullets from above.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: This isn't a car. Catwoman flinches as the Bat thunders into the sky, downdraft forcing the Mercenaries down onto the roof, all but one, who walks slowly across the roof, strong against the wind...Bane. He watches the Bat roar off into the night.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You're welcome.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Those weren't street thugs - they were trained killers. I saved your life. In return I need to know what you did with Bruce Wayne's fingerprints. Catwoman looks at him. Considering.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I doubt many people get the better of you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What were they going to do with them?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Miss Kyle -? But she is gone. So that's what that feels like.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: We bought all the neighbors. Alfred takes the cowl from him, then the cape, as they walk.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I retrieved this.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: They don't have the tools to analyze it.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: One man's tool is another man's weapon.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Alfred. Enough. The police weren't getting it done -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Perhaps you're upset you were wrong.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You thought I didn't have it in me. Alfred looks at him. Puts down the cape and cowl.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'll fight harder, I always have.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You said he was excommunicated.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: R¯'s al Gh¯l was the League of

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Trades of some kind. Coded... The screen blanks, a thumb print appears.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Mine. Courtesy of Selina Kyle.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You'd abandon me?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Rachel died knowing we'd decided to be together. That was my life beyond this cave and I can't just move on. She didn't. She couldn't.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: She was, I can't change that -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Why would you say such a thing?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You're lying.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You're lying!

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: How dare you use Rachel to stop me!

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Sorry?! You expect to destroy my world, then shake hands?!

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What does it mean, Alfred?!

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Goodbye, Alfred.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Alfred? But Alfred is gone.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Answering your own door?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Yes. Could you decode the trades on that drive?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I didn't need to. Page three. Wayne turns the page:

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It seems you made a series of large put options on the futures exchange. Verified by thumb print. The options expired at midnight last night. Wayne looks up from the newspaper, reeling.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Long term we may be able to prove fraud, but for now...you're completely broke. And Wayne Enterprises is about to fall into the hands of John Daggett.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: The weapons - we can't let Daggett get his hands on Applied Sciences -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Applied Sciences is shut up tight, and off the books. The energy project is a different story.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Miranda Tate. We need to convince the board to get behind her. Let's show her the reactor -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: We're meeting her there in thirty-five minutes. You better get dressed.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Bear with me, Miss Tate. They arrive at a Portakabin and enter.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Keep your hands and feet inside the car at all times. He hits a button and the floor descends, Miranda is shocked as the office becomes an elevator into -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: The reactor is beneath the river so that it could be instantly flooded in an event of a security breach.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm gonna plead the fifth on that one. Miranda marvels as they step off the elevator. She spots a figure deep within: Bruce Wayne.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I thought you might like to see what your investment built.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: If it worked. It doesn't. Wayne leads Miranda to the core. Two perpendicular rings of electromagnets suspend a bowling-ball-sized mass of metal. Wayne hits buttons - the ball glows, then dies to cold.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Ignition, yes. But no chain reaction.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Miranda, if it were operational, the danger to Gotham would be too great.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Someone else will work out what Dr. Pavel did. Someone else will figure out how to turn this power source into a nuclear weapon. I need you to take control of Wayne Enterprises and this reactor.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Nothing. Until we can find a way to guarantee its safety.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Decommission it. Flood it.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: If the world's not ready. Yes.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm trusting you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I could've flooded this chamber any time in the last three years. I'm choosing to trust you, Miranda, and that's not the easiest thing for me. Please. His eyes are genuine. Pleading. Miranda nods.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: We have a board meeting to get to.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm afraid he has a point, Mr. Wayne.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I understand. Ladies and gentlemen.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Right away.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: To protect the people closest to me.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: There are always people you care about. You just don't realize how much until they're gone. The idea was to be a symbol. Batman could be anybody, that was the point.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Not everybody agrees.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Got anything on Bane's whereabouts?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Don't wait. I'll get a cab.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Actually, no. Blake hands him some bills, watches him cross the street. The radio squawks. Blake reacts - drives off.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I don't think so.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Actually, they're letting me keep the house.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Vacation?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: My powerful friend hopes to change your mind about leaving.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: By giving you what you want.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: He says it does. He wants to meet. Tonight.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: He needs to find Bane. He thinks you'd know how.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No, you're not.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No. I'm on my own now.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Never needed them... She takes his hand.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Hope you don't like me for your money. Miranda kicks off her shoes. Glances at the paper.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: He left. Taking everything. Miranda puts the photo down. Kisses him. Passionately. Then again. He kisses back. Suddenly the lights go out.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You're pretty good at that.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I assumed your family was wealthy.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I've made a few myself. She turns to him, tracing the scars across his chest.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Someday perhaps. Not tonight. She pulls him close. He kisses her. They fold into each other, the warm heart at the center of a vast, cold room.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: That depends.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: On what you want it for. I acquired it to keep it out of the wrong hands.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Start by taking me to Bane.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Neither am I. Catwoman swings into a -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Me. Darkness smashes onto the Mercenary. Gunfire in the tunnel. Catwoman races along, pursued by a Mercenary. He is yanked off his feet by darkness - he screams... Batman picks off more and more Mercenaries. Screams echo... Batman follows Catwoman through the dark tunnel.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You've made a serious mistake.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Bane.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Us? You were excommunicated. From a gang of psychopaths.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Why didn't you just kill me?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Where am I?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I don't see the need for a board meeting on the energy project -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Where are you taking us?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Do it for the pleasure.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Has anyone made it?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What does he say?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Bane.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Don't.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I won't do it. Fredericks trembles. Bane cocks the weapon.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: How would he know?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: How?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Is Bane the child you spoke of? Was he born here?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: How -?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I watched you die.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You were the mercenary. Bane is your child. Your heir. INSERT CUT: the Mercenary at the side of the road. R¯'s.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm not meant to die in here. The Prisoner indicates the TV:

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You told me a child did it...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Wayne Enterprises. Lucius Fox is there, with Miranda Tate.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Miss Tate is fully aware of the situation.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It was built as a fusion reactor. The first of its kind. Bane turned the core into a bomb, then disconnected it from the reactor.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: As the device's fuel cells decay, it's becoming increasingly unstable...until the point of detonation.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: And it will go off. In twenty-three days. Captain Jones reels at this news.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I don't know, But I could reconnect it to the reactor. Stabilize it.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Take Miranda - Blake grabs Miranda, heads for the back stairs. Mercenaries jump out of the elevator, firing high.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: My body makes the jump.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: My soul's as ready to escape as my body.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm not afraid. I'm angry.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Why?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I do fear death. I fear dying in here while my city burns with no one there to save it.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: How?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Pretty generous, for a thief. Selina recognizes the voice. Turns to find Wayne - strong, but weathered. Beard, work clothes.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Not yet.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: It wouldn't suit you. I need your help.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: For this. The 'Clean Slate'.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I admit I felt a little let down. But I still think there's more to you. In fact, I think for you - this isn't a tool, it's an escape route. You want to disappear. Start fresh.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I can give you a way off. Once you've gotten me to Lucius Fox. I need you to find out where they're holding him. Then take me in.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: To save this city.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Maybe you do. But tomorrow that bomb's going off.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I'm trying. But I need Fox.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You picked a hell of a time to go on vacation, Mr. Wayne.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: How long until the core ignites?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: That bomb goes off in twelve hours.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Unless we can connect it to the reactor.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: If you can get it there. I'll find a way to plug it back in. Can you get Miranda out?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Not tonight. I'm sorry.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: What for?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: To get me back in the game. Catwoman comes down the stairs with the Thugs.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I won't forget about you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I like your girlfriend, Mr. Wayne.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Any move I make against Bane or the bomb - the triggerman sets it off.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: They can't be using radio or cell - too much interference. Infrared doesn't have the range. It could only be micro-burst long wave... Wayne opens a panel in the wall, takes out equipment: mini-mines, Batarangs, utility belt...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Could you block it?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Yes. I need the EMP cannon-guidance mount from the Bat. You remember where you parked? Wayne nods. Smiles. The Batsuit rises from the floor...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: She fly pretty well?

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Even without the autopilot...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Autopilot? That's what you're there for.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Light it up.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: This blocks the remote detonator signal to the bomb. Get it onto the truck by sunrise. They might hit the button when it starts.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: War.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: If you're working alone, wear a mask.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: The mask is not for you. It's to protect the people you care about.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I lost someone once. Since then I break into their homes when they're sleeping and implant a tracking device on the back of their neck.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: On three - one, two, three - They throw the mini-mines at the rubble of the entrance - the blasts barely move any rubble.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: That's to warn the men on the other side. Batman disappears into the shadows.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: All-out assault on Bane...but you need to get the people you care about across the bridge.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: In case we fail. Lead an exodus across the bridge. Save as many lives as you can.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You've given me an army. Now go. Blake nods. Turns to leave. Stops.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Don't thank me yet.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: The mid-town tunnel's blocked by debris, but the cannons give you enough firepower to make a path for people.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: To start it, you -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: We've got forty-five minutes to save this city -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: With your help I might.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: There's more to you than that. She stares back at him. Facade slipping a touch.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Not everything. Not yet.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No. I came back to stop you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Give me the trigger! You'd never give it to an ordinary citizen - Bane's thrashing calms as he stares at Batman through pain-soaked eyes...gasping through his broken mask for relief.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: You thought you were the only one who could learn the strength to escape? Bane looks at Batman, curiosity behind his pain.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: He was trying to kill millions of innocent people -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Your knife may have been too slow... A Mercenary steps forward -

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: I need you on the ground, me in the air, we have to force that convoy east, to the entrance to the

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Two minutes. I can fly it out over the bay...

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: No autopilot. She takes this in. He stands to face her.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: So did you.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: And you were right.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: A hero can be anyone. That was always the point.

title: Dark-Knight-Rises-The
dialogue: Please, I just need to know what I could've done to fix it.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, sir.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No, no, no! What do you mean she's not coming?! I have a backyard full of these little girls who are counting on a visit from a fairy princess!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah! Hurts! Ah! Stop it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Listen! I don't want a refund! I want a fairy princess... please! Please, I am begging you. You know what? I hope that you can sleep at night, you crusher of little girls' dreams!!!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Any minute now!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Stall them.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aaaaaahh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: It is I, Gru...zinkerbell! The most magical fairy princess of all! And I am here to wish Princess Agnes a very happy birthday!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Because my house is made of candy and sometimes I eat instead of facing my problems.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay! Time for cake!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You are welcome, little girl.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hello, Jillian.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No, no, no, get off of the limb right now. No limb.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No, Jill's, that is not happening. Seriously. I'm fine.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I'm sorry. I did not see you there.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Or there.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Kyle... Kyle!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ky--Kyle! No, do not do your business on the petunias!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: There you go. Those are Fred's. Go crazy.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Good boy.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Wha? I didn't... What... Yes?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hi! Agent Lucy Wilde of the AVL. Oh. Whoops. Sorry, you're gonna have to come with me.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, sorry, I--Freeze Ray! DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 9.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You know you really should announce your weapons after you fire them, Mr. Gru. For example--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Lipstick Taser! Oh, it works so good.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Man. Ugh. Large...person.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh...sorry!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Get...in...there...you...big...man!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ugh...ooh...what...where...ah...oh, foot's asleep...ah...pins and needles...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ehhh...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I don't. I'd do it again in a heartbeat. I am not gonna lie--I enjoyed that. Every second of it. Gave me a bit of a buzz, actually.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Sorry, sir.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, this is bogus!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I don't know who you people think you are, but--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: First of all, you've got no proof that I did that. Second, after I did do that, I put it back!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, me now...?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Um, recently an entire top secret lab disappeared from the Arctic Circle. Yeah, the entire lab. Just whoosh. Voom! Gone. Where did it go? DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 14.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I don't care.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: The lab was devoted to experiments involving PX-41, a transmutation serum. What is PX-41, you ask? Mmmm, it's pretty bad... Look.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hmm, you usually don't see that in bunnies.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha! A mall? DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 15.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: The plan is to set you up undercover at a shop in the mall, where hopefully you'll be able to--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, I see where this is going, with all the Mission Impossible stuff, but no. No! I am a father now. And a legitimate businessman. I am developing a line of delicious jams and jellies.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, attitude! That's right! So thanks, but no thanks. And here's a tip--instead of tasing people and kidnapping them, maybe you should just give them a call! Good day, Mr. Sheepsbutt!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, yeah, like that's any better!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Look, I probably shouldn't be saying this, but your work as a villain was kind of amazing, so if you ever want to get back to doing something awesome--give us a call.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, I told you guys to get to bed.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, well, she is a nutjob. And I'm not going on any date. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 17.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey Lisa, I was wondering if you--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Scared? Of what? Women?! No, that's bonkers! I just-- I have no interest in going on a date, that's all. Case closed. I'm not scared-- of women... or dates... let's go to bed.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Goodnight, Edith.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Goodnight, Margo.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Well, hold the horses. Who are you texting?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Avery... Avery? Is that a girl's name or a boy's name?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No, no, it doesn't matter... Unless it's a boy!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Uh...oooh...you...do?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, yes...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Goodnight, Agnes. Never get older.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, Tim, nice haircut!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Donnie, hang in there, baby! It's almost Friday.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: So, how's today's batch, Dr. Nefario?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: That tastes good... Love the flavor of that...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No! No! Oh, we're making great progress! Here, try some of this.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Whoa... okay, just because everybody hates it doesn't mean it's not good.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What? What's wrong?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, I'm also considering a line of jams...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Dr. Nefario! Come on, you're kidding, right?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Very well. Let us give you the proper send-off. Minions!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: The highest honor awarded. To Dr. Nefario for your years of service. The twenty-one fart gun salute!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Good morning, girls! I have an announcement to make.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ummm...Bruce Willis.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, what are you doing?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, okay...WHAT?! No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No! Stop! No one is ever getting out there! Ever!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, now for the announcement: I have accepted a new job.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, I have been recruited by a top secret agency to go undercover and save the world!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: That's right, baby! Gru's back in the game! With gadgets and weapons and cool cars...the whole deal.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes. Yes I am.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hm. "Bake My Day." Blech.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, here is the cupcake recipe I got off the internet.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: And don't go nuts with the sprinkles!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha! Yaa! Ho! Ooof! Zaaa! Ay-ay- ay-ay-ay!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Whoo. Wasn't expecting that. Or was I?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ooh... you got... You got... a little...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Here, I'll-- I'll get it.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, that's just spreading...um...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, alright. I got it. I got it!... Stop it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh! I'll let you get it.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, what you just saw there was a little something new I've been working on. It's a combination of Jujitsu, Krav Maga, Aztec warfare, and krumping.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, that's weird--why are you here?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: On assignment from Silas. I'm your new partner. Yay!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What?! No, no "yay." Ramsbottom didn't say anything about a partner.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, seems that because of your checkered past, everyone else refused to work with you. But not me. I stepped up. And I'm new, so I kind of have to do what they tell me anyway.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You know this guy?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, he's one of my minions.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. I should have known.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You're free to go. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 29.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Dave...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Earth to Dave! You can leave now.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Now, what do we got? Who's on the list? Fire `em at me.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: First suspect...Hedda Blumentoft, proprietor of Mum's the Word Floral Shop.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No. Not her.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, moving on...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Chuck Kinney, owner of "Stuff-A- Bear."

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ooh.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I don't think so.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Gru. And this is Lucy. And we are closed.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Look away!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You-- Whoa... Hooo...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: El Macho.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: But it couldn't be... DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 32.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Wha-- What? What couldn't be??

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: That guy looks exactly like a villain named El Macho. From about twenty years ago.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: He was ruthless. He was dangerous. And as the name implies, very macho.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: He had a reputation for pulling off heists using only his bare hands.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah, but sadly, like all the greats, El Macho was gone too soon. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 33.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: He died in the most macho way possible.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Riding a shark with 250 pounds of dynamite strapped to his chest into the mouth of an active volcano.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: It was glorious.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, sounds like El Macho's pretty dead...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: They never found the body. Oh no. All that was ever retrieved was a pile of singed chest hair. But... that face. It has got to be El Macho.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Then what do you say you and I break into his restaurant? Tonight.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, that's good, because I'm telling you--if anybody in this place has the PX-41 serum...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: ...it's him.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, alright, homework done, pajamas on, teeth brushed, time for bed.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I just... I have a lot of work to do.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Very important business. So...hugs, kisses... ...good night, sleep tight, don't let the bedbugs blah-blah-blah-blah- blah--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Fine, fine... Let me hear it. Quickly. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 35.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Wow! That was...something else. I really liked the way you smiled at the end. Let's try this one more time, but a teensy bit less like a zombie, okay?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Perfect! Time to go!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, what do you mean? Why not?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, you don't need one to do the show. I mean, you did the Veterans Day Pageant and you haven't been in combat.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, well, then...maybe you can just use your imagination.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, right. You can do that, can't you?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, hey, hey-- No, no, no, no! Hey, please!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Kevin, Jerry, watch the girls for me, okay? Dave, Stuart--come this way. With me! Come on!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Come on!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: We're stealth ninjas. We make no sound.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Right. Gotcha.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, El Macho, you're going down.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Wait! Wait!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What are you doing?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I'm checking for laser beam alarm triggers.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: It's a restaurant!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You never know what kind of booby traps this guy could have set. Huh? C'mon!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: There are no booby traps!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha! Booby!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh. There's a chicken. Are you lost little guy? You must be lost!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha! Some guard dog.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaiiiigh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Get it off of me! Get it off of me! Get it off of me!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I got you!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I got it! Ha!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha! DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 41.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ugh...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What is wrong with that chicken? Hey, that pollo? Es loco.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No? Okay, let's go.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You getting anything?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No. Not yet. But hey, maybe you can find something with these x-ray goggles.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Bah...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: How're they working? Tell me, tell me!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ahh! Ooof!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What's wrong? Something wrong?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, that's an image I'll never get out of my brain. Blagh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I knew it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: The serum is in here!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ooh, then let's get it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, this is going to be good! Ahh...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: A-ha! What? It's... salsa?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Awww man. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 43.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Gru, call one of your munchkins!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: We've been spotted! Come get us!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hm. Subtle.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Over here, over here! Over... here.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hold tight!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: All right, there he is. Suspect #8: Floyd Eaglesan.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh. Okay.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: See if you can get closer. Go...go.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, what do--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh no. That's not good.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh! Girls! What are you doing here?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha...funny.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, there you are. Oh, who's this?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Lucy, these are my girls, Margo, Edith and Agnes. Girls, Lucy. Lucy, girls.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh! Goodness...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh! Hey! I have an idea! Since Lucy and I have lots of work to do, why don't you girls go and explore the mall!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Here is some money. Go buy some useless mall junk! Some headbands, and--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Are you out of your gourd? No! She just works with me.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, stop! That is a song of lies. I don't even like her! Now go have fun!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha, ha, ha! Kids...right? They're...funny.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Those girls totally adore you. I bet you're a fun dad.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Huh. I am pretty fun.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: All right, I'm going in.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: If it picks up any traces of the serum the sensor in your belt buckle--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: --will make a sound like this-- MEE- MO-MEE-MO-MEE-MO!!!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay! I get it! I get it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You...know my name?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I'm getting nothing so far. I think you need to move around. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 53.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Wow, this looks interesting. What is it?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No serum.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, not so much.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, how about this impressive trinket?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Nothing.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, I don't care.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: MEE-MO-MEE-MO-MEE-MO!!! Hold on. I'm picking up something! Behind that wall! DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 54.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah! And what do we have here?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No thanks. So what's on the other side of the wall?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Gru?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Date??? Boyfriend??? What???

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, no, no, no! Do not say that they are...no no no, no!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Margo. What is going on here?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Me llama-lama-ding-dong, who cares. Let's go.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What the-- Father?!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh... look at you.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Haha. He likes me!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, we really should be going. Girls, come on.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No! You know, they're not in love. They hardly know each other!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No, no, I am--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, but there has been a new development, and I'm telling you, this is the guy. You need to arrest him immediately. And his deviously charming son. I'm pretty sure that the son is involved, too. The son also. You've got to get the son.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I think that the son is the mastermind. There's a look. There's a devilish look in his eyes and I don't like it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Evidence schmevidence! I go with my gut, and my gut tells me that this guy is El Macho! Lock him up! Lock up the son. Don't forget about the son. The kid gives me the creeps!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Uh, but, on the less... ..."crazy" side of things, uh, Gru discovered traces of the serum at Eagle Hair Club. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 59.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, and you know who made that happen? Huh? This guy. Nailed it. Amazing, right?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No. I mean, sure, but it's not him. It is... ...El Macho.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No. It is him! And I will prove it!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Gru, c'mon!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: He really thinks it's El Macho. Can you tell?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Kevin, the wi-fi's out! Kevin?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, Lance! Where the heck is Kevin?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Alright, we need to revisit the number of vacation days you guys get. I can't find anybody anymore!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Agnes! Agnes! Tell Jillian I'm not here!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, I hear you.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah. I can tell.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: We are in a restaurant, you know.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hi. Takeout for Lucy?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah. Well, thank you very much. I was--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hahaha. Hoooo. Is it hot in here? Oof. How's the food? DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 64.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What? Ah! I don't think so.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh. What? No. These locks are all mine...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I don't think so, Miss Lady.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hello... Hello, are you...?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, Gru.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hello, Lucy, how you doin'...? DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 65.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Wow, looks like your date's out for the count. It's like she's been shot with a mild moose tranquilizer.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, I'm winking `cuz that's what actually happened.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, she's just uh--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Shall we take her home?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, I think you did it. You just officially had the worst date ever.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Huh, tell me about it.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Don't worry--it can only get better from here, right? But if it doesn't, you can always borrow my dart gun. I've had to use it on one or two dates myself.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, you know, as far as dates go, I think I'm good with just the one.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, good night, partner.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: This was fun.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes. Surprisingly, it was.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, and uh, just between you and me? You look much better bald. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 67.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: See you tomorrow!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Quack! Quack! Quack!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No! It was horrible!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: High-five!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Bump it.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Mr. Ramsbottom?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What are you doing here?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Got who?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah. Alright. So...what now?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Australia...?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey there.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: So...we got him.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yay. That's great. And now you're going to Australia?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, it's not definite yet. Still figuring it out. Already been working on my accent. Wallaby. Diggeri-doo. Hugh Jackman. So...um. Pretty excited...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Great. Well...good luck.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Thanks. You too. Oh. Here. I wanted to give you this.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Your lipstick taser?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, it's just a memento. Just, you know, from the first time we met.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh. Thank you, Lucy.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well... it looks like they need you, so...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yeah, I uh, I better go. Bye, Gru.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah, thank you.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Remember when you said that I liked Lucy? Well, it turns out...you're right.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes, but...well, she's moving away. I'm never going to see her again.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, I don't--I don't think so, sweetheart.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: "Hello, Lucy. This is Gru. I know up to this point our relationship has been strictly professional, and you're leaving for Australia and all, but..." Okay, here is the question. "Would you like to--to go out on a date?"

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay, that's not helping.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: All right. Here we go. For real this time. DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 73.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I can do this.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Agh! I hate you!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ah.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Okay. Let's party. Ah? But first let's go over the rules. Because what is fun without the rules?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Agnes, easy on the churros.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Edith, try not to kill anyone.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Margo--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aghhh! Okay...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: There must be the standard six feet of space between you and boys. Especially this boy.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, nothing. Nothing is wrong. I'm just chilling with the guac...from my chip hat.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: How did you know?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: What the--oh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Huh.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oooh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aaaahhh...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aaaahhh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oooohhh.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aha! Ha ha ha--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ouch! DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 80.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Say what?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I choose Gru. I CHOOSE GRU!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Thank you, Gru stewardess!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ha ha! I knew it! You are El Macho!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Nobody believed me! Ho ho! But I knew you weren't dead! DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 82.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Dr. Nefario?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Whaaat? This-- So, this is your new job opportunity?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh! Kevin? Agh!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Together?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Uh...yeah...probably...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I mean, yes! Yes. Of course, yes, I just have a lot going on right now...I just need to get some things off my plate before we start taking over the world, that's all.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No--no, forget it! One hundred percent! I am in! I think--what is--do you hear that-- I do. That's Agnes calling me from on the surf--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Totally in!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Edith! Agnes! Come on!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Ooof!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: We need to go home now! Where's Margo?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Margo!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Come on, we're leav--hey, what's wrong?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Yes...they stink. Sorry, honey, we've got to go.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oops, sorry!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, hey! Eduardo!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, speaking of Gru...uh, have you seen him? I really need to talk to him.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, I don't know. I mean close... I wouldn't say we were close. Why, did he say we were close? Did he say that? DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 87.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No, it is not cool. Plus, I pretty much knew it was him all along, so if anyone's cool, it's me.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Well, Dr. Nefario... DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 88.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Lucy? Wha--that's impossible! She's on her way to Australia...

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Not for long.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Come on. We're getting her out of there.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, guys. Come on! Stay focused here!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Curses. Foiled again. These guys captured me.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Run!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Up that tree! Hurry, hurry!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Hey, hey! Nice work, Dr. Nefario!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Thank you, Doctor! Now let's go get the--

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You brought the girls?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: You guys take care of the rest of the minions. I'm going to find Lucy.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: It's over, El Macho. Now where is Lucy?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, hey Gru! Turns out you were right about the whole El Macho thing, huh? Yay!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: No!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Lipstick taser!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Aw...he copied me.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Don't worry about me, Gru! I'll be fine. I have survived lots worse than this. Okay, that's not entirely true. I'm actually kind of freaking out up here!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Don't worry--I will get you out of this!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: I really hate that chicken.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Is there a red one? It's usually the red one.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Gru, anytime now!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Listen, Lucy--we may not get out of this alive, so I need to ask you a question.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Uh, better make it quick!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: If I'd asked you out on a date, what would you have said?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Are you kidding me?! Yes!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: JUMP!!!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh! Lucy! Lucy! Where are you?!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Oh, Lucy!

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Gru! DESPICABLE ME 2 CINCO & KEN DRAFT 99.

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: Sorry...I guess you kind of need your arms to tread water, huh?

title: Despicable-Me-2
dialogue: They'll be back...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Excuse me, can you tell me how to get to the medical school? I'm supposed to be giving a lecture in twenty minutes and my driver's a bit lost.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I couldn't help noticing the accent. You from Jersey?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Austria? You're kidding. Well, g'day, mate. What do you say we get together later and throw a few shrimp on the barbie.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Guess I won't be going Down Under tonight...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: This is 22.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Cool your jets, Arnie. I'm on my way.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Okay, gang, single file. You know the rules: No pushing, no humping, and no sniffing heinies...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: The same reason you're not on a leash, sir because it's demeaning and it chafes like hell.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You kids stay right here...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Hey, wait a minute!

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Hello. I'll be just a minute...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Why you going to the airport? Flying somewhere?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: How'd you guess?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well, I saw your luggage, then when I noticed the airline ticket, I put two and two together. So where you heading?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Aspen.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Oh, you're gonna love it. I hear California's beautiful this time of year. Mary looks back out the window and Lloyd sneaks another glance.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Name's Christmas. Lloyd Christmas.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I'm Mary.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Uh, this isn't my real job, you know. It's only temporary.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Oh?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Yeah, you see, my friend Harry and I are saving up our money so we can open our own pet store.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's nice.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I got worms.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I beg your pardon?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's what we're gonna call it: I Got Worms. We're gonna specialize in selling worm farms you know, like ant farms. A lot of people don't realize that worms make much better pets than ants. They're quiet, affectionate, they don't bite, and they're super with the kids.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Aren't ants quiet, too?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Uh... well, sure but they aren't half as affectionate. And if you cut an ant's head off, it won't grow back.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I see.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: And best of all, worm farming is a seventy-five-thousand-dollar-a-year industry. I wouldn't mind having a piece of that pie, if you know what I mean.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What's the matter? Little tense about the flight?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Something like that.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: It's really nothing to worry about, Mary. Statistically, they say you're more likely to get killed on the way to the airport. You know, like in a head-on crash, or something.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Um, Lloyd, could please keep your eyes on the road.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Good thinking. There's a lot of bad rivers out there.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Here you go.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Keep it. It was my pleasure.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Relax, Mary. Just get trashed and pass out. You'll be there before you know it.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Thanks Lloyd. And good luck with your worms.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Drive around me, you pinhead!

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Damn!

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You can't do this! I'll lose my job!

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I got fired again.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I don't mean to be harsh, Harry, but let's face it, you are one pathetic loser. No offense.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: None taken. Were you shitcanned, too?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Of course not. I quit.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Why'd you quit?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I had a hunch Arnie was gonna fire me.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Why didn't you wait and see if your suspicions were well-founded?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Winners control their own destiny, Har.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You know, the thing that really chaps my ass is that I just spent my life savings turning my van into a poodle. The alarm alone cost me two hundred.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Big deal. That car's an old bomb anyway.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What are you talking about? It's only six years old.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's forty-two in dog years.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What's with the briefcase?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: It's a love memento.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Huh?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: The most beautiful woman alive. Her name was Mary. I drove her to the airport. Sparks flew, emotions ran high, breasts heaved. She left this case in the terminal and flew to Aspen and out of my life. End of story.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What's in it?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: DO you really expect me to go snooping around in someone else's private property?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Why not?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: It's locked.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Friend or foe?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: We don't have any friends.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Can't recognize them. Could be student loan thugs again, or the IRS, or maybe somebody pissed off about that case of Girl Scout cookies you bounced a check on.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Hey, I ordered Mystic Mint. The little swindlers gave me Peanut Butter Praline.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well, whoever they are, they look serious. One of them's even wearing plaid.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's a hostile pattern. I say we bail and get down to unemployment.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Blew it? For your information, we only missed three days in two months.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Yeah, and that was because of a blizzard

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Come on, Stan. I'm sure you can find something else for us. How about another crack at that Suicide Hotline?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Give me what's left of our dough. I'll go to the corner and buy a few necessities.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What's cheaper, Thunderbird or Night Train?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Get Robitussin it's a better buzz.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Excuse me, little old lady, do you have change for a dollar?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well could you do me a favor and guard this while I go break a dollar? My wallet's locked in this machine.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Where's the booze?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: It's gone. I got robbed by Grandma Walton. She got my wallet, too.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Come on, man, cheer up. We've been own before. I'm sure we'll land on our heads somewhere.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: It gets worse, Lloyd. My parakeet Petey he's... he's dead.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Oh man, I'm sorry, Harry. What happened?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: His head fell off.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: His head fell off?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Yeah, he was pretty old.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I don't suppose he had a warranty...?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Nah, I bought him used.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's it! I've had it with this ump! We don't have food, we don't have jobs, our pets' heads are falling off, we're surrounded by roving gangs of larcenous old

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Okay, calm down.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: No I won't calm down.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What the hell are we doing here anyway, Harry? We've got to get out of this town.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Yeah, and go where?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I'll tell you where: someplace warm, a place where the beer flows like wine, where beautiful women instinctively flock like the salmon of Capistrano. I'm talking about Aspen.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Aspen?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's right, Aspen.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I don't know, Lloyd, the French are assholes.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Let me ask you something: do you want to end up like Petey dead in some flea-ridden apartment, face- down on a Dear Abby column, with a soggy sunflower seed pressed against your beak? Or do you want to enjoy your life? Come on, Harry, don't let Petey's eath be in vain. Don't you see what he was saying? Spread your wings, man. he was saying? Spread your wings, man. Fly.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What are you talking about, Lloyd? His head fell off. Wait a second, I know what you're up to. You just wanna go to Aspen so you can find that girl who lost her briefcase and you need me to drive you there.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's bullshit. I'll drive. And what's so wrong about going someplace where we know someone who can plug us into the social pipeline?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I don't know, Lloyd. I think we should stay here, hunt for jobs, and keep saving money for the worm store. I'm getting a little sick and tired of always running from creditors.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You know what I'm sick and tired of, Harry? I'm sick and tired of having to eek my way through life. I'm sick and tired of being a nobody.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: But most of all, I'm sick and tired of having nobody.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Come on, Lloyd. Give us a kiss.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: On the other hand, maybe you're right, Harry. Maybe we should stay here and try our luck in bankruptcy court. With all those lawsuits against us, I'm sure we'll win at least one. It could be a boost to our egos.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Petey, I made a promise to you once, man... ...and I'll be damned if I can remember what it was.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well, we're finally doing it. Do you realize that in all the years we've known each other, this is the first time we've done this together.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Been run out of town?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Taken a trip.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Why'd you do that?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Take your seatbelt off.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Because we just cleared the danger zone.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Huh?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Don't you know anything, Lloyd? Ninety percent of all accidents happen within five miles of home. We've already traveled 6.3 miles.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well what about the people who live around here? What if we got into an accident with one of them?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Where'd you get those?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Bought 'em when we filled up.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Lloyd, I thought we agreed to confer on all expenditures. We're on a tight budget, remember?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: This didn't come out of our travel fund. I was able to scrape up twenty- five bucks before we left. You know, so we could live in style.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Where'd you get twenty-five extra bucks?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I sold some stuff to Billy in 4-C.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You mean the blind kid?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: That's right.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What did you sell him, Lloyd?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Just some odds and ends.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Specifically?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Oh, a few baseball cards, a sack of marbles, Petey, three comic books a second, are you telling me you sold my dead bird to a blind kid? Well who else was I gonna sell it to?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: But Lloyd, Petey didn't even have a head.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Put your mind at ease, friend. I took care of it.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: How far have we gone?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: According to this map, about an inch and a half.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Shit. We're gonna need a smaller map or we'll never get there. We don't have enough gas money.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Relax. We have more than enough.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I believe you're wrong, Lloyd.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: And I believe I'm right, Harry.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I still say wrong, Lloyd.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: How much you wanna bet?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I don't bet.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What do you mean you don't bet?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I mean I don't gamble, you know that. Never have and never will.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Oh, bull. I'll bet you our next meal that I can get you gambling before the day's out.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: There's no way, Lloyd. You can't do it.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I'll give you three-to-one odds. That's three feedbags if you win, against only one if you lose.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You're wasting your money, Lloyd. I already told you, I don't gamble.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Okay, five-to-one I can get you gambling before the day's out.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Sorry, pal, no way.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Make it ten-to-one. Harry sticks out his hand.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You got yourself a bet, sucker!

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What's the soup du jour?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Sounds tasty. I'll have a bowl.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Actually, this chocolate milk isn't mixed very well. Could you please bring me a spoon?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Uh-oh...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What's the matter?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: You spilled the salt. That's bad luck. We're driving across the country and the last thing we need is bad luck. Quick, toss a handful of salt over your right shoulder.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What for?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Because that's good luck.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Or was it the left shoulder?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: It was a terrible accident, Sir. Believe me, I would never do anything to offend a man of your size. Please accept my most sincere apology.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Um... the thought had crossed my mind.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Nah, you go ahead.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Perfect. I'm out eight bucks and I still haven't eaten.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well if you'd stop picking fights with the locals... Wait a second. I think I just had an idea. Follow me...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Excuse me, gentlemen, I'd just like to apologize for that unpleasant scene a little earlier.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: What I'm trying to say is, my friend and I would like to buy you guys a round of beers, just to bury the hatchet.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Whatever you want, sir. I'll have the waitress send them over. Oh, and fellas hope to see you again down the road.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Lloyd, what are you doing? You know we can't afford to buy them drinks.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Um, Sea Bass and the fellas offered to pick up our check. They said just add this to their tab.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Well, if that guy at the table over there is Sea Bass...

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Oh, and put these on there, too.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: By the way, how far is it to Rhode Island from here?

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I just wish we could've seen Sea Bass's face when he got the bill.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I hope we never have to.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Don't worry. That fish-head is probably half-way to Providence by now.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: I hope so.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
dialogue: Hey, stop the car. I gotta take a whiz.

title: Dumb-and-Dumber
