dialogue: Is it spring-loaded? Yeah... I guess if you come from over there, and you're standing at the door to the squab shack, this little gadget probably triggers the -- Move out of the way, darling. That's right where it's going to land. Mrs. Fox runs back to Fox and tugs at his arm.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: No, it just falls straight down right here, doesn't it? I guess it's not spring- loaded. Sounds come from around the farm: the dog barks, doors open, voices yell, lights come on. Mrs. Fox turns to Fox and says

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Wow. We're going to have a cub. Honey, that's great news!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Does anybody actually read my column? Do your friends ever talk about it?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Why would they? It's a rag-sheet.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I love the way you handled that. Mrs. Fox looks at Fox sideways. She says loudly to Ash:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Dad's study is occupied by Dad. Ash goes back into his bedroom. Fox lowers his newspaper. He looks around the room. He says to Mrs. Fox:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I don't want to live in a hole anymore. It makes me feel poor. Mrs. Fox stops buttering the toast. She looks to Fox and says

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Comme-ci, comme-ga. Anyway, the views are better above ground. Mrs. Fox nods. She brings Fox a plate of toast and a cup of coffee. Fox takes her paw and says:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I'm seven non-fox-years old now. My father died at seven and a half. I don't want to live in a hole anymore, and I'm going to do something about it. Fox kisses Mrs. Fox's paw. He suddenly eats three slices of toast in a second and a half, savagely but neatly. He stands and picks up his cup of coffee.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Well, I'm off. Fox throws back the last of his coffee, kisses Mrs. Fox on the back of her neck, grabs his briefcase, tucks his newspaper under his arm, and walks to the door. He shouts

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Have a good day, my darlings! Ash comes out the bedroom again. He has now added a white cape to his ensemble and is in the middle of brushing his teeth. There is toothpaste all over his mouth. He waves briefly to Fox and goes back into his bedroom. Fox looks puzzled.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What's he wearing? Mrs. Fox shrugs. She smiles sadly and waves to Fox. Fox waves back. He starts to go out but pauses to look down at a folded up section of his newspaper.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What's in the bucket, Mr. Kylie?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Certainly. Thank you. Kylie reaches into his bucket and hands Fox a live, wriggling minnow. Fox swallows it whole. Fox stares out the window at three sprawling poultry compounds in the distance. Black smoke pours out of a farmhouse chimney on each property. A sign on a water tower in the first compound reads Boggis Farms and has a picture of a chicken on it. A sign on a silo in the second compound reads Bunce Industries and has a picture of a goose on it. A sign on a windmill in the third compound reads Bean, inc.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I used to steal birds, but now I'm a newspaper man.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Good afternoon, gentlemen. Fox shakes hands abruptly with Weasel and starts across the room. Weasel is about to ask something when Fox stops in the doorway, looks back, and says:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Oh, and Kylie -- thank you for the minnow. It was superb. Kylie smiles. Fox exits.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You're exaggerating, Badger.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Really? Tell me about them. Silence. Badger sighs. He loosens his tie and settles in.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I understand what you're saying, and your comments are valuable, but I'm going to ignore your advice. Badger leaps out of his chair and slams the office door. He points his finger at Fox and screams:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Don't cussing point at me!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: One last thing: something's probably about to happen to me at work which I can't put my finger on but have a funny feeling about. How can I protect myself legally?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Slash I quit. Here's my letter of resignation. Fox's silhouette throws an envelope onto the squirrel's desk.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Good jump, Ash! Remember to keep your tail tucked! Fox looks at Mrs. Fox's canvas. It is a picture of the pond and landscape in severe weather with black clouds and lightning bolts. It is signed Felicity Fox. Fox raises an eyebrow.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Still painting thunderstorms, I see. Fox sees a small, Samsonite suitcase on the ground next to a pair of yellow sneakers. He frowns.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Whose suitcase is that? A boy's voice shouts from the high tree branch:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kristofferson! Welcome to our little tree! I see you brought your swimming trunks! Kristofferson steps off the branch and performs a reserved but perfect jack-knife. He enters the water splashlessly. Fox leaps to his feet, applauding with his paws above his head, whistling and hollering:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Look at that! This kid's a natural! I'm speechless, Kristofferson! Kristofferson smiles modestly and shrugs. Ash stares at him stonily. Fox turns to Mrs. Fox.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Plus, he knows karate.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What are you talking about?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What's the sub-text here? Ash thinks for a minute. He looks at Kristofferson in the next room. Kristofferson is now sitting Indian-style on the floor meditating. His paws are turned upward with his thumbs touching his index fingers forming a ring. Ash says loudly to Mrs. Fox in the kitchen:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kids are crazy, aren't they? You got to try it, though. Raising a family.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What do you think of this tree, by the way? It's great, huh?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I have one last part of what I was about to say.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I'm going broke. You want to help me steal some chickens?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I used to do this professionally, and I was very successful at it. I had to get out of it for personal reasons, but I've decided to secretly quit my job slash got fired to pursue it again. I'm bringing you in as my secretary and personal assistant.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I'm going totape this formyrecords,so don't make a lot of sounds --meaning stop rocking.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I don't want people to eavesdrop on us, Kylie. Let me just tell this. Kylie stops rocking. Fox presses record on a tape recorder.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Master Plan. Phase one. Side A.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: We'll start with Boggis' Chicken House #1. His only security is a few old hunting beagles and a low stone wall. Now a word about beagles: never look a beagle directly in the eye. And if --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I picked some blueberries, butterflied them with a scalpel, and laced each one with ten milligrams of high-potency sleeping powder.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Enough to tranquilize a charging gorilla.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Beagles love blueberries.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: If we approach with the wind in our faces, we'll smell the chicken livers on Boggis' breath from at least fifty yards away.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Remember: they aren't very smart, but they're incredibly paranoid -- so always kill a chicken in one bite.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: One bite, get it? Fox waits for Kylie to respond. Kylie does not. Fox frowns.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Are you listening to me? I look into your eyes and I can't tell whether you're getting anything I'm saying. Kylie stares at Fox vacantly. He shrugs.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: A few beagles, as we discussed, but we're ready for that. Fox and Kylie cross a dirt lane and come out of a shallow ditch. Fox licks the pinky of his paw and holds it up in the air.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You feel that? The wind's in our faces.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Oh, nothing? Never mind. Fox and Kylie veer off into shorter grasses. Fox points ahead, regaining his composure:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Here comes the low stone wall. Not a problem. Fox and Kylie climb over a low stone wall and find themselves at the base of a chain-link fence eleven feet high.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: This is a chain-link fence, I guess. Did I not remember this? Maybe it's new. Let's pause.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Give me a second! I said, "Let's pause"! Pause. Fox pulls himself together. He turns to look at the plywood lightning bolt.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: That, I guess, hypothetically, could mean maybe this fence might be electric.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Watch this. Fox puts a blueberry into the end of a straw and shoots it out into the barnyard.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Beagles love blueberries! Didn't I tell you? The master plan's working again! Kylie raises his fist enthusiastically and trips over an unconscious beagle. He picks himself up quickly, and they weave among the rest of the beagles. They reach the entrance to the chicken house, open the door, and duck inside. Pause. There is an eruption of crazed squawking, screaming, and fighting from inside. The chicken house rumbles. Lights jolt on across the compound. An alarm goes off. Voices yell. The chicken house door swings open again, and Fox and Kylie emerge among a cloud of feathers. Fox carries two dead chickens, and Kylie has one live one. Fox yells:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I said one bite, cuss it!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Follow me again! Fox and Kylie run back across the barnyard, past the beagles as they begin to wake up and stagger around. Farmhands appear, loading shotguns and running into the confusion. Fox and Kylie race by, unnoticed, among them. They dart into the house through a flap in the back door. The lights are out in the kitchen. They take a moment, breathing hard in the darkness. Kylie shakes his head in disbelief.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I have no idea. Fox opens the door-flap a crack. He looks out and sees Boggis opening the front gate to let out his beagles and farmhands, barking and shooting, as they search for the intruders. Fox shouts to Kylie:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Holy cuss! They opened the gate! Follow me again! Lightning quick, Fox and Kylie burst out through the door- flap, race across the barnyard, and dart through the open gate. Up the road, Boggis screams furiously as he runs with his pack of beagles and farmhands. Fox and Kylie fly into the bushes. As they race through the underbrush Fox says

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Let's hit the five and dime on the way home! We need to make some fake price tags and wrap these chickens in wax-paper so it looks like we got them at the butcher shop! Fox and Kylie howl ecstatically.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I'm supposed to cover this book party at some animal's nest in a tobacco field down the hill, so me and Kylie are going to hop over there and give it a whirl. Don't wait up. Fox pulls his napkin out of his collar, drops it on the table, and stands up. Mrs. Fox asks cooly:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Dinner was -- -- pitch-perfect.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I spotted a couple of broken burglar bars underneath the back door to Bean's secret cider cellar.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Where'd you come from? Go back to the tree and do your homework!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: But nothing! You're going to get me in a lot of trouble! The three animals stand in silence for a minute. Fox points to his tree. Ash turns and starts back home. Fox shakes his head.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Where the cuss does that kid get off? Can you believe that? How'd he get tipped off? You think he's going to tell on us? Fox turns to Kylie. Kylie looks back at him vacantly.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Before we go any further, from now on can you give me some kind of signal once in a while just so I know any of this is getting through to you? Pause. Kylie makes a slight motion with his paw. Fox hesitates.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Was that it? OK.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You've aged badly, Rat.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Do you refer to my wife?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Shut up. Rat lunges at Fox with his switchblade. Fox dodges nimbly. He cocks an eyebrow and smiles:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: That was close, Rat. Be careful.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Woah! I didn't see you. Sitting in the dark over there. Yeah, no. Actually, there's a fire. I just got the call. They said maybe it's arson? I got to interview the marshall and see what's --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Nice job covering for me. Next time

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: All three! Fox and Kylie spin around and dart back into the hole as Boggis, Bunce, and Bean open fire wildly from the bushes. A barrage of bullets and buckshot rips into the tree-bark. Silence.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What's with the crazy outfit? Why a cape and the pants tucked into your socks? Ash does not respond. Fox sighs. Mrs. Fox finishes bandaging his tail. Fox goes over to the wall and stands with his back to the room.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I got fired slash quit the Gazette and started stealing chickens on the sly.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Why the cuss didn't I listen my lawyer? At this point we'll be lucky if we can flip this tree for half of what we've already sunk into it. Fox flips over onto his stomach.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I won't be able to sleep on my back for six weeks -- and on my stomach I feel congested. Why the cuss didn't I listen to my lawyer?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What was that?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Wake up! Everybody! They're digging us out! There is a scrunch and then a loud thump from above. Mrs. Fox looks at Fox intensely:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I've got it! There's not a moment to lose! Why didn't I think of this before?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Think of the one thing a fox does quicker than a man, quicker than any other animal in the world!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I think it's time for me to give us a pep talk and explain some things. A very long time ago --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: One of those slovenly farmers is probably wearing my tail as a necktie by now.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You scared the cuss out of us!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You don't just bang into somebody's cussing tunnel!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You're cussing right I'm cussing yelling!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Give me a minute. Fox turns and walks away. He faces the wall of the tunnel. He sits down on a rock. Everyone watches him uncertainly. They look at each other. Badger starts to say something, but Kylie cuts him off sharply:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I've got an idea.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: It could be a good one.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: It might save our lives.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: All right! Let's try it!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Go to the flint-mine. Tell Mrs. Badger, Rabbit's ex-girlfriend, et al. that help is on the way.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I sure as cuss hope so. Mrs. Fox detects a special, familiar, inspired light in her husband's eyes at this moment. She nods. She hands Ash the lantern. She straightens the neck-line of his cape, licks the mud off Ash's snout, and scrambles away down Badger's tunnel. Ash wants to cry but does not. Fox turns to the others.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Gentlemen, this time we must dig in a very special direction. Fox feels the walls with his paws. Everyone watches attentively.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I got to kind of feel out the vibe. Fox stops. He points slightly downwards and due south. He says with quiet anticipation:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Begin. Everyone starts digging, slowly but intently.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I've done it! I've done it, first time! Come up and see where you are, my darlings! Everyone scrambles up out of the tunnel.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I hit it slap in the middle! Do you get how incredible this is? The others nod. They look dazed and wild. Fox holds up his hands and whispers:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Don't lose your heads, now. Let's do this properly. First, everyone have a drink of water. Fox leads the others over to the chickens' drinking trough. They all lap up the cool water. Fox dries his mouth.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: But Clive's right --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I guess we do have those three ugly, cusshole farmers to thank for one thing: reminding us to be thankful and aware of each other. I'm going to say it again.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I've stepped on some toes and alienated a few of you over the past few days -- but is it wrong for me to suggest we might've done worse than having an incredible banquet in a beautiful flint-mine surrounded by our favorite animals? Look at each other. Here we are. Wow. Now I've already had too much to drink, and I'm feeling sentimental, but I'm going to say something, anyway, which nobody wants to admit, but I think is probably true: we beat 'em. We beat those farmers, and now we're triumphantly eating their roasted chicken, their sizzling duck, their succulent turkey, their foie gras de --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Let's pause again. A wild deluge smashes into the room flooding the flint-mine and tunnels with a blasting current that sweeps everyone and everything away chaotically.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What the cuss just happened? Something with water. That was dangerous. Is anyone hurt?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Let's do a head-count! Everybody pick a buddy! Each animal turns to his neighbor and establishes their buddy relationship. Fox looks wildly agitated as his eyes dart about, searching. He shouts:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Where'd the boys go? Ash? Kristofferson? Ash's voice cracks on the other side of the cavern:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Ash! Who's your buddy?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You lost him? Where were you?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kristofferson! Fox sprints around the cavern, splashing, digging, and ducking in and out of tunnels as the others join his frantic search. His voice sounds pained as he shouts:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kristofferson! Kristofferson! Kristofferson!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Your brother's going to kill me, if he survives his double-pneumonia. Beaver runs into the brick cavern out of a drainpipe,

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Somebody take over. I'm not in charge anymore.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You told me to change, but I can't --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Excuse us, everyone. Fox leads Mrs. Fox over to a ledge near a cement waterfall on the far side of the brick cavern. He puts his arm around her waist.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Badger's right. These farmers aren't going to quit until they catch me. I shouldn't have lied to your face. I shouldn't have resigned slash gotten fired from the Gazette. I shouldn't have pushed these farmers so far and tried to embarrass them and cuss with their heads. I enjoyed it, but I shouldn't have done it -- and now there's only one way out. Maybe if I hand myself over and let them kill me, stuff me, and hang me over their

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I don't know, but I have a possible theory. I think I have this thing where I need everybody to think I'm the greatest -- the quote-unquote fantastic Mr. Fox -- and if they aren't completely knocked- out, dazzled, and kind of intimidated by me, then I don't feel good about myself. Mrs. Fox shakes her head and turns away. Fox continues:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Foxes traditionally like to court danger, hunt prey, and outsmart predators -- and that's what I'm actually good at! I think, at the end of the day, I'm just --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I guess we always were. I promise you: if I had all this to do over again, I'd have never let you down. It was always more fun when we did it together, anyway. Mrs. Fox has tears all over her face. Fox kisses her. He whispers in her ear:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I love you, Felicity.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Did I ever tell you about the time I learned we were going to have a cub?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Right. We were at gun-point, and your

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Let me tell it, OK? I had no idea how we were going to get out of this jam, and then it hit me: what do foxes do better than any other animal?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You're stepping on my lines.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: So we dug. And the whole time I put paw over paw, scooping dirt and pebbles with your mother digging like crazy beside me, I kept wondering: who is this little boy going to be?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Or girl, right -- because at that point we didn't know. Fox grabs Ash by his shoulders and looks him in the eye.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Ash, I'm so glad he was you. Fox hugs Ash tightly, holds him for an instant, then let's go. He turns to the group.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Badger, organize a search party and try to find Kristofferson. Maybe he's alive. I'm sorry, everyone. I wish --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: All these wasted years. What were you looking for, Rat? Fox wipes the blood from Rat's chin. Rat mutters.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Here you are, Rat. A beaker of Bean's finest secret cider. Rat's slivery, scratchity, long, pink tongue laps up a taste of the black liquid. He licks his lips and says faintly:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: But, in the end -- he's just another dead rat in a garbage pail behind a Chinese restaurant. Ash puts his hand on Fox's shoulder. Fox lays Rat gently onto the sewer floor. He stands up and turns to the rest of the group. Badger claps his paws together.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Just some old back-story.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: In a way, I'm almost glad that flood interrupted us, because I don't like the toast I was giving. I'm going to start over. Fox pantomimes raising a long-stemmed glass.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: When I look down this table with the exquisite feast set before us, I see: two terrific lawyers, a skilled pediatrician, a wonderful chef, a savvy real-estate agent, an excellent tailor, a crack accountant, a gifted musician, a pretty good minnow fisherman, and possibly the best landscape painter working on the scene today. As Fox describes them, the shot cuts to: Badger and Beaver; Mrs. Badger; Rabbit; Weasel; an especially small, waifish field mouse; Mole; Kylie ; and Mrs. Fox, respectively.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Maybe a few of you might even read my column from time to time. Who knows? I tend to doubt it.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Wild animals with true natures and pure talents. Wild animals with scientific- sounding Latin names that mean something about our D.N.A. Wild animals each with his own strengths and weaknesses due to his or her species, and also -- well, I guess these things usually have a lot to

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: do with the parents, as we all know. Anyway, I think it may very well be all the beautiful differences among us that just might give us the tiniest glimmer of a chance of saving my nephew and letting me make it up to you for getting us into this crazy whatever-it-is. I don't know. It's just a thought. Thank you for listening. Cheers, everyone. Fox motions with his imaginary glass and pantomimes drinking it. A few of the others reluctantly pantomime drinking. Fox finishes his glass and pantomimes throwing it on the floor. He makes a smashing-glass sound. Kylie shouts:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Linda! Lutra Lutra! You got some dry paper? Here we go! Fox, highly energized, moves among the group, touching their shoulders and patting their backs.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Mole! Talpa Europea! What do you got?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Rabbit! Oryctolagus Cuniculus!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You bet your cuss you are! Linda?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Beaver! Castor Fiber!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Amazing! Linda?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Badger! Meles Meles!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Demolitions expert! OK! Linda!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Weasel! Mustela Nivalis!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: All right! Fox points to the various cubs and pups.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: All you little kids get organized and put together some kind of a K.P. unit or something to keep this sewer clean. It's good for morale. The field mouse shoves his way to the front of the crowd. He makes a fist with his paw.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You're a cuss of a lot bigger than you look, Rickity. Kylie tugs at Fox's sleeve. Fox turns to look at him. Kylie

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Listen, you're Kylie. You're an unbelievably nice guy. Your job is really just to... be available, I think. I don't know your Latin name. I doubt they even had opossums in ancient Rome. Kylie puts his hands in his pockets and scowls.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: It's stupendous. Where's us?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Paint an X.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Synchronize your clocks. The time is

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: -- nine forty-five A.M. Everyone checks their watches. Badger points at Fox's wrist.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Did you bring the boy?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Come on! That doesn't sound anything like him! It's amateur night in Dixie! Badger rapidly slaps two pieces of flint together. A bit chips off, and sparks fly from the break. He blows on some kindling. He takes a pinecone out of a basket.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Scared, no! I have a phobia of them!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Where'd you come from again? How'd you get in the sidecar? I feel like I'm losing my mind! Fox angrily steers toward a small mound of dirt. They jump it slightly and fly over a little ditch. Ash yelps enthusiastically as Fox drives them back onto the road.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: That's the annex over there on the right. Ash nods. Kylie does not respond.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: The white building over there on the right. Pause. Fox looks to Kylie.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kylie? Kylie turns to Fox and stares at him vacantly. Fox says

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kylie!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: When? I didn't see it! Kylie makes his slight gesture with his paw. The gardener puts three turnips into a basket and rides away on his bicycle. Fox, Kylie, and Ash scramble down the tree trunk. They come out of the bushes on their motorcycle and ride through the gates, across the yard, past the wandering turkeys. They park outside the courtyard doors to Bean Annex and jump off the motorcycle.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Kylie, you got a credit card?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: A Titanium Card? How the cuss did you qualify for this?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Give me a blueberry. Kylie looks surprised. He shrugs. He shakes his head and gestures, I don't have any. Fox frowns. He throws up his hands in the air. Kylie makes a frustrated face. Fox points at him. Kylie looks away and snorts angrily. Fox looks away and spits at the ground. Ash says quietly:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: That's not soap.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: He's rabid. With rabies. I've heard about this beagle. The beagle stands up. Fox says carefully:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Easy, boy. Fox takes a cautious step toward the beagle. He holds out the back of his paw for the beagle to sniff. He says back over his shoulder to Kylie and Ash:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I'm going to try to befriend him. I feel like there's a tenderness in his eyes. Fox takes another step. He makes a soft, kissing noise. The beagle watches him calmly.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Yes, I'm right. He's a good boy. A little lonely, maybe, but -- Fox takes another cautious step.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: -- but terribly sweet. Hello, there, boy. Is your name Spitz? That's German, isn't it?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Climb the trellis! In well under a second, Fox, Kylie, and Ash scale the trellis six stories -- Kylie's pants catching on a nail and ripping off on the way up -- and find themselves standing on the roof of Bean Annex. Kylie wears blue Fruit-of-the-Looms with a pattern of stars, moons, and planets on them. They all look down at the rabid beagle, which continues to pitch an insane fit, running in circles after its tail at the bottom of the courtyard. Fox takes in their new surroundings. He says, pleased:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: So the attic is probably in the area right up around here somewhere, I figure, huh? Kylie and Ash, panting and dripping with sweat, both stare at Fox vacantly.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Your tractors uprooted my tree. Your posse hunted my family. Your gunmen kidnapped my nephew. Your rat insulted my wife -- and you shot off my tail.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Ash, that was pure, wild animal craziness. You're an athlete. Ash swallows. He beams. He sits up straighter. Fox kick-starts the motorcycle and races across the farm. Boggis, Bunce, and Bean scramble onto the roof of a car port with an old, white Mercedes convertible under it. The snarling beagle barks and snaps below them. They watch as: Fox steers the motorcycle toward a broken apple cart at the edge of the property. He guns the motor and yells:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Holy swearing cuss!!!

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What? Fox turns around. A huge, wild, grey wolf with ice-blue eyes stands on a rock fifty feet away from them. Fox slams on the brakes. The motorcycle slides to a halt.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Where'd he come from?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Canis lupus! Fox points to himself:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Vulpes Vulpes! The wolf does not answer. Fox, Kylie, Ash, and Kristofferson watch idling from the motorcycle.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I don't think he speaks English or Latin.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: He doesn't seem to know. Silence. Fox shouts to the wolf with a strange hitch in his

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I have a phobia of wolves! The wolf does not answer. It breathes heavily with its mouth open. Its teeth are long, sharp, and yellow. Its tongue hangs out, and its eyes are wild. Fox looks back at it with the identical expression for a minute, mesmerized -- then Fox closes his mouth and his eyes soften. Fox raises his paw in the air. The wolf blinks a few times. It raises its paw in the air. It turns away and trots off into the woods. Fox says wistfully:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: What a beautiful creature. Wish him luck, boys. Fox guns the motor. Gravel spits from under the spinning tires, and they tear off down the road. The shot booms down into the ground, below the grass, through buried pebbles, layers of soil, and subterranean mineral deposits.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: My darlings? Everyone looks to Fox. He signals them to follow him.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Nobody knows.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Watch your step. Fox takes everyone through an opening and starts climbing a metal ladder. He says theatrically:

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Let's see, now. Where does this lead?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Keep a good grip, everyone.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: I think I see a little sliver of light. What's this? Is that a door?

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Shh. I'm going to crack open this trap door and see if something's on the other side. I highly doubt it, though. There's probably just more sewer. Fox clears his throat. Pause.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: You know, wouldn't it be surprising if --

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Hey, look! There's a whole, enormous, glorious, gigantic supermarket up here! Ash and Kristofferson seem dumbstruck. Fox raises an eyebrow and smiles at Mrs. Fox. She puts her arm around his shoulder.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Oh, really? Well, now's the time to buy. Kylie comes around the end of the aisle pushing a miniature shopping cart filled with jars of jelly, jam, olives, pickles, and honey, plus three loaves of bread, Band-Aids, toothpaste, and a carton of strawberry ice cream. He says

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: Because we were talking about other things.

title: Fantastic-Mr-Fox
dialogue: The white cape rather suits him, doesn't it? Actually, I had to do quite a bit of searching myself before I found a look that really flattered me. Remember those horseshoe cuff-links? Fox and Mrs. Fox crack-up laughing. Fox notices something and stops. He stares at Mrs. Fox strangely. She is glowing. She hesitates. She shrugs.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Don't make a fuss. I'm fine. I'll get up.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I have a test today. I have to take it. I want to get into a good college so I can have a fruitful life...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm okay, Mom. I feel perfectly...Oh, God!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Is that Jeanie? I can't see that far. Jeanie?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Please don't be upset with me, Jeanie. Be thankful that you're fit and have your health. Cherish it.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'll be okay. I'll just sleep. Maybe I'll have an aspirin around noon.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It's nice to know I have such loving, caring parents. You're both very special people.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: They bought it.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Incredible! One of the worst performances of my career and they never doubted it for a second. What a beautiful day!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Parents always fall for the clammy hands. It's physical evidence of illness. It's a good, non-specific symptom. Parents are generally pretty hip to the fever scams. And to make them work you have to go a hundred and one, hundred and two. You get a nervous mother and you end up in a doctor's office and that's worse than school.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Fake a stomach cramp and when you're doubled over, moaning and wailing, just lick your palms. It's a little stupid and childish but then so if high school. Right?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: This is my ninth sick day with semester. If I go for ten, I'm probably going to have to barf up a lung. So, I absolutely must make this one count.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I don't care if you're fifty five or seven, everybody needs a day off now and then. It's a beautiful day. How can I be expected to handle high school?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I do actually have a test. That wasn't bullshit.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: That I care about it was.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It's on European socialism. I mean, really. What's the point? I'm not European. I don't plan to be European. So, who gives a shit if they're socialists? They could be fascist anarchists and it still wouldn't change the fact that I don't own a car.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: WELL SHAKE IT UP, BABY, TWIST AND SHOUT...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Not that I condone fascism. Or and "isms". "Isms", in my opinion are not good. A person should not believe in an "ism". He should believe in himself. John Lennon said it on his first solo album. "I don't believe in Beatles, I just believe in me." A good point there. Afterall, he was the Walrus.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I could be the Walrus and I'd still have to bum rides off people.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm not very political? Let me put that into perspective...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: My uncle went to Canada to protest the war, right? On the Fourth of July he was down with my aunt and he got drunk and told my Dad he felt guilty he didn't fight in Viet Nam. So I said, "What's the deal, Uncle Jeff? In wartime you want to be a pacifist and in peacetime you want to be a soldier. It took you twenty years to find out you don't believe in anything?" Grounded. Just like that. Two weeks. Be careful when you deal with old hippies. They can be real touchy.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: My mother was a hippie. But she lost it. She got old. If she listens to the White Album now? She doesn't hear music, she hears memories. Nostalgia is her favorite drug. It'll probably be mine, too. I hope not.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: In eighth grade a friend of mine made a bong out of one of these. The smoke tasted like glue.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: His name is Garth Volbeck. He's a serious outsider. Not a bad guy, I like him. I'm probably his only friend. I do what I can for him. I mean, if I was him, I'd appreciate it. Do unto others, right? Anyway, his mother owns a gas station. His father's dead and his sister's rumored to be a prostitute, which is complete bullshit. She only puts out so people will hang out with her. It's sad but I don't hold it against her. Better to hold it against the guys who use her and don't care about her. My parents never allowed Garth over here. It was because of his family. Mainly his older brother. He's in jail. I could see them not wanting his brother here because he is a registered psycho. I wouldn't want him here. I once watched the guy eat a whole bowl of artificial fruit just so he could see what it was like to have his stomach pumped. But Garth isn't his brother. It isn't his fault that his brother's screwed-up. Alot of fights with the parents on that point. I always felt for Garth. I was sleeping at his house once and I was laying on the dark worrying that his brother was going to come in and hack me to death with an ax and I heard Garth crying. I asked him what was wrong and he said, "Nothing". ... Nothing was wrong. There was no specific thing he was crying about. In fact, he wasn't really even aware that he was crying. He just cried himself to sleep every night. It was a habit. The guy's so conditioned to grief that if he doesn't feel it, he can't sleep. How could you possibly dump on guy who has to deal with that kinda shit? My parents acknowledge the trudge of the situation and I'm sure that deep down, they do feel for him but still the guy's banned from our house.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Unfortunately, now my parents have a legit argument. Garth doesn't need his brother to give him a rep anymore. He's getting one on his own. He's lost. It's over for him. He's eighteen. Gone from school. Gone from life. His legacy is a gas station.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: One very serious danger is playing sick is that it's possible to believe your own act.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: That and boredom. Alot of people ditch and feel great for about an hour. Then they realize there's nothing to do. TV and food. I myself have ditched and gotten so bored I did homework. Figure that shit out.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You have to plan things out before you take the day off. Otherwise you get all nervous worrying about what to do and all you get is grief and the whole point is to take it easy, cut loose and enjoy.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You blow your day and at about three o'clock, when everybody's out of school, you're going to wish you'd gone to school so you could be out having fun.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Avoid the misery. Plan your day. Do it right.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: There's alot of pressure at work in my age group. And it's not always recognized.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Some guy whose hair is falling out and his stomach's hanging over his belt and everything he eats makes him fart, he looks at someone like me and thinks, "This kid's young and strong and has a full, rich future ahead of him, what's he got to bitch about?"

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: That's just one reason why I need a day off every now and then.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Food...shelter...no...yes...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Hello?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Very little.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Shredded.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: She's not home. Where are you?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm taking the day off. Get dressed and come over.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It's all in your head. Come on over.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I feel like complete shit, Ferris. I can't go anywhere.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm dying.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: If anybody needs a day off, it's Cameron. He has alot of things to sort out before he graduates. He can't be wound this tight and go to college. His roommate'll kill him. I've come close myself. But I like him. He's a little easier to take when you know why he's like he is. The boy cannot relax. Pardon by French but Cameron is so tight that if you stuck a lump of coal up his ass, in two weeks you'd have a diamond. And Cameron would worry that he'd owe taxes on it.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: This is really degrading.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Financing my activities this way. Very damaging to the self-image. But, hey, I'm broke. In times of crisis one must to what one must to. I'll pay it back. With interest.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Regardless of how much shit sisters make you eat, how often they rat on you, how gross they act or how wicked and insensitive they can be, you should not alientate them. Because most likely they have cash and it's usually very easy to get your hands on.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I wanted a car. I got a computer. How's that for being born under a bad sign?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: A sample of my blood was sent to Atlanta to the Center for Disease Control. I don't know, man, I'm bricking heavily. Freshman. Did you see Alien? When the guy had the creature in his stomach? It feels like that.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron, if you're not over here in fifteen minutes, you can find a new best friend. I'm serious, man. This is bullshit, making me wait around the house for you.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm sick. I feel like shit. Why can't you leave me alone?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You want to stay home and try to have the shits? Try to barf? Try to feel worse?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Be a man. Take some Pepto Bismol and get dressed. You're boring me with this stuff.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Squeeze you buns for a second. I got another call.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: H--hell-o?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm so worried about falling behind.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Dad? Can you hold on a second?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Just a little phlegm on the phone. Hold on.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron? It's my Dad.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It's completely cool. He's just checking up on me. Now, listen to me. I'm working on getting some heavy bucks out of him. So, the least you can do is hurry up and get over here. Bye.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Sorry, Dad. The moment before you called, I had a chest spasm and I blew lung fluid all over the place. It was making me ill looking at it. But gee, it's sure great of you to call. I'm sure there're alot of fathers who wouldn't take time out from their busy schedules to call a dumb, sick teenager.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Give yourself some credit, Dad. It was a mammoth gesture. It's like those savings bonds you used to give me every Christmas. It was that kind of concern.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You had to work hard for the money to buy those things, right?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You work so hard I'll bet you don't even remember where those bonds are, right?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Oh, yeah? You're pulling my leg. You're just trying to cheer me up.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Was that a class move or what? The guy gave it up faster than a drunk Catholic girl. I hope my kids don't pull this shit on me. Of course, if they didn't, they'd be dumb and abnormal and they'd probably never move out of my house and I'd have to support them until I die. I take it back. Dad? All this talking has made me kind of light-headed. I think I better lie down.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You don't have to, Dad.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You win some, you lose some.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm so disappointed in Cameron. Twenty bucks says he's sitting in his car debating about whether or not he should go out.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: We're gonna get caught. No doubt about it.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm not doing it.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: He'll keep calling until I come over.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Actually, what'll happen is I'll get caught. Ferris'll escape.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron'll go on like that for a good thirty minutes. The guy is a shellfish when it comes to making a decision. The reason he doesn't fell good is, he worries about everything. He's the only guy I know who's deeply concerned that when he grows up there'll be a critical shortage of strategic metals.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron's also the only guy I know who knows what strategic metals are. Pardon moi.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: MAYBE I'M JUST LIKE MY MOTHER, SHE'S NEVER SATISFIED...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Dead grandmother.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Mr. Rooney? I'm sorry to disturb you at work but I was wondering if it would be possible for my sister to bring home any assignments from my classes that I may need.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You oughta be sorry for Christ's sake! A family member dies and you insult me. What's the matter with you, anyway?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: This isn't over yet, buster. You just make sure my daughter's out in front of the school in ten minutes. Do you read me?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Call me sir, goddamn it!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: That's better.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I'm scared shitless, Ferris! What is Rooney guesses my voice!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Impossible. You're doing great.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I don't have all day to bark at you so I'll make this short and sweet.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Great!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I want my daughter out in front of the school in ten minutes. By herself. I don's want anyone around...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: What'd I do?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Out in front my herself? It's too suspicious! He'll think something's up, moron. Cover it.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You do it!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Talk!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I changed my mind, fella. You be out in front with her! I wanna have a few words with you!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Why'd you hit me?!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Where's your brain?!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Why'd you hit me?!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Where's your brain?!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Why'd you hit me?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Where's your brain?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I asked you first.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: How can we pick up Sloane if Rooney's going to be there with her?!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I said for her to be there alone and you freaked!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: My, God, you're so stupid! I didn't hit you, I lightly slapped you.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You hit me. Look, don't ask me to participate in your crap if you don't like the way I do it!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I was home, sick. You get me out of bed, being me over here, make me jeopardize my future, make me do a phoney phone call on a dean of students, a man who could squeeze my nuts into oblivion and then you deliberately hurt my feelings.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I didn't deliberately hurt your feelings.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Oh, really?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Yeah, really.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Hey, Ferris? Have a nice life.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Stick it up your ass, Ferris.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to jam you. It was uncalled for.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You're serious?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Dead serious.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Thanks.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: You did screw up through, right? Not that is was necessarily all you fault. Right?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Why?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: To fix this situation, I'm going to have to ask you for a small favor.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: 1958 Ferrari 250 GTS California. Less than a hundred were made. It has a market value of $265,000. My father spent three years restoring it. It is joy, it is his love, it is his passion.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It is his fault he didn't lock the garage.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Ferris, my father loves this car more than life itself. We can't take is out.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: A man with priorities so far out of whack doesn't deserve such a fine automobile.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: He never drives it, Ferris. He just rubs it with a diaper.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: We can't pick up Sloane in your car, Cameron. Rooney'd never believe Mr. Peterson drives that piece of shit.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It's not a piece of shit.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It's a piece of shit. Don't worry about it. I don't even have a piece of shit. I have to envy yours. Look, I'm sorry but there's nothing else we can do.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: He knows the mileage, Ferris. He has it tatooed on his wrist.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: He doesn't trust you?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: No.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Alright, look, this is real simple. He puts his arm around Cameron.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Whatever miles we put on it, we'll take off.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: How?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: We'll drive home backwards.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Forget it. I'm putting my foot down, Ferris. You'll have to think of something else...

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Are you crazy?! Put the top back up!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: This is perfect top-down weather.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: What about Rooney?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Cameron, the more obvious we are, the less likely we are to get caught.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: That makes no sense whatsoever.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: The adult mind is a suspicious machine. Stay down, man.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Howcome it's my Dad's car and I'm taking all the risk and I have to ride back here?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I don't have an explanation.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Huh?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Oh. Um. Yeah. Very. She was a terrific lady. Very hip. Very old. Yeah.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Hurry along now!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: I guess that's my Dad. Thanks. See ya.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: This is so great! I can't believe it! Right in front of Rooney!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Hi, Cameron. You comfortable?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Hi. No.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: What a fabulous car!

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Enjoy it quick. It' s going home.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: It was risky, it was bold but it was totally necessary.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: What're we gonna do?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: The question isn't "what are we gonna do", the question is "what aren't we going to do."

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Don't tell me we're not going to take the car home. Please.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: If you had access to a car like this would you take it back right away? Would you give up feeling like a ton just to ease your best friend's tension?

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Either would I.

title: Ferris-Buellers-Day-Off
dialogue: Hello, Mrs. Froeling. How are you?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Hello. My name's Forrest Gump.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: You want a chocolate?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I could eat about a million and a half of these. My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get."

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Those must be comfortable shoes. I'll bet you could walk all day in shoes like that and not feel a thing. I wish I had shoes like that.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Momma always says there's an awful lot you could tell about a person by their shoes. Where they're going. Where they've been.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I've worn lots of shoes. I bet if I think about it real hard I could remember my first pair of shoes.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Momma said they'd take my anywhere.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: She said they was my magic shoes.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Now, when I was a baby, Momma named me after the great Civil War hero, General Nathan Bedford Forrest...

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: She said we was related to him in some way. And, what he did was, he started up this club called the Ku Klux Klan. They'd all dress up in their robes and their bedsheets and act like a bunch of ghosts or spooks or something. They'd even put bedsheets on their horses and ride around. And anyway, that's how I got my name. Forrest Gump.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Momma said that the Forrest part was to remind me that sometimes we all do things that, well, just don't make no sense.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Momma always had a way of explaining things so I could understand them.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: We lived about a quarter mile of Route 17, about a half mile from the town of Greenbow, Alabama. That's in the county of Greenbow. Our house had been in Momma's family since her grandpa's grandpa's grandpa had come across the ocean about a thousand years ago. Something like that.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Since it was just me and Momma and we had all these empty rooms, Momma decided to let those rooms out. Mostly to people passing through. Like from, oh, Mobile, Montgomery, place like that. That's how me and Mommy got money. Mommy was a real smart lady.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: She wanted me to have the finest education, so she took me to the Greenbow County Central School. I met the principal and all.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Momma, what's vacation mean?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Where Daddy went?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Anyway, I guess you could say me and Momma was on our own.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: But we didn't mind. Our house was never empty. There was always folks comin' and goin'.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Sometimes we had so many people stayin' with us that every room was filled with travelers. You know, folks livin' out of their suitcases, and hat cases, and sample cases.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: One time a young man was staying with us, and he had him a guitar case.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I liked that guitar.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: It sounded good.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I started moving around to the music, swinging my hips. This one night me and Momma...

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: ...was out shoppin', and we walked right by Benson's Furniture and Appliance store, and guess what.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Some years later, that handsome young man who they called "The King," well, he sung too many songs, had himself a heart attack or something.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Must be hard being a king. You know, it's funny how you remember some things, but some things you can't.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I sure will, Momma.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I remember the bus ride on the first day of school very well.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Momma said not to be taking rides from strangers.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I'm Forrest Gump.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Well, now we ain't strangers anymore.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: You know, it's funny what a young man recollects. 'Cause I don't remember being born.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I, I... don't recall what I got for my first Christmas and I don't know when I went on my first outdoor picnic. But, I do remember the first time I heard the sweetiest voice...

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: ...in the wide world.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I had never seen anything so beautiful in my life. She was like an angel.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Well, are you gonna sit down, or aren't ya?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: What's wrong with your legs?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Um, nothing at all, thank you. My legs are just fine and dandy.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I just sat next to her on that bus and had conversation all the way to school.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Then why do you have those shoes on?

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: My momma said my back's crooked like a question mark. These are going to make me as straight as an arrow. They're my magic shoes.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: And next to Momma, no one ever talked to me or asked me questions.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Are you stupid or something.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: Mommy says stupid is as stupid does.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I'm Jenny.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: I'm Forrest Gump. Forrest Gump.

title: Forrest-Gump
dialogue: From that day on, we was always together. Jenny and me was like peas and carrots.

title: Forrest-Gump

dialogue: What are you doing?

dialogue: ...I'm going to see my sister.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You're going to kill yourself.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I wouldn't put my foot there.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You're distracting me.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Or there. How do you know Elsa even wants to see you?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'm just blocking you out cause I gotta concentrate here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You know, most people who disappear into the mountains want to be alone.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Nobody wants to be alone. Except maybe you--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'm not alone.... I have friends, remember?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You mean the love experts?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Yes, the love experts!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Please tell me I'm almost there.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Does the air seem a bit thin to you up here?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hang on.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, Sven? Not sure if this is going to solve the problem, but I found a staircase that leads exactly where you want it to go.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ha ha. Thank goodness. Catch!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Thanks! That was like a crazy trust exercise.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Whoa.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Now that's ice. I might cry. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Go ahead. I won't judge.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: All right, take it easy. I gotcha.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You stay right here, buddy.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Flawless.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Knock.... Just knock.... Why isn't she knocking...? Do you think she knows how to knock?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ha. It opened. That's a first.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You should probably wait out here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Last time I introduced her to a guy, she froze everything.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: But, it's a palace made of ice. Ice is my life. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Bye, Sven.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You too, Olaf.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Me?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Just give us a minute.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: One...two...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Elsa? It's me...Anna?!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Elsa, you look different.... It's a good different.... And this place is amazing. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Thank you, I never knew what I was capable of.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I'm so sorry about what happened. If I'd known--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, it's okay. You don't have to apologize.... But you should probably go, please.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: But I just got here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...You belong in Arendelle.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: So do you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, I belong here. Alone. Where I can be who I am without hurting anybody.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Actually, about that--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wait. What is that?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hi, I'm Olaf and I like warm hugs.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Olaf?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You built me. You remember that?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: And you're alive?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Um...I think so?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: He's just like the one we built as kids.... We were so close. We can be like that again.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, we can't.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Goodbye, Anna.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Elsa, wait--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'm just trying to protect you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You don't have to protect me. I'm not afraid. Please don't shut me out again. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: PLEASE DON'T SLAM THE DOOR. YOU DON'T HAVE TO KEEP YOUR DISTANCE ANYMORE.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna,

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Yeah, but--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I know!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: JUST STAY AWAY AND YOU'LL BE SAFE FROM ME.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ACTUALLY, WE'RE NOT.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU'RE NOT? FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I GET THE FEELING YOU DON'T KNOW?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WHAT DO I NOT KNOW?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ARENDELLE'S IN DEEP DEEP DEEP DEEP SNOW.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You kind of set off an eternal winter...everywhere.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Everywhere?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: It's okay, you can just unfreeze it.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, I can't. I don't know how.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Sure you can. I know you can.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: CUZ FOR THE FIRST TIME IN FOREVER,

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: YOU DON'T HAVE TO BE AFRAID.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WE CAN WORK THIS OUT TOGETHER. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I CAN'T CONTROL THE CURSE!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WE'LL REVERSE THE STORM YOU'VE MADE.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ANNA, PLEASE, YOU'LL ONLY MAKE IT WORSE!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: DON'T PANIC.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: THERE'S SO MUCH FEAR!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WE'LL MAKE THE SUN SHINE BRIGHT.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: YOU'RE NOT SAFE HERE!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WE CAN FACE THIS THING TOGETHER...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: NO!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WE CAN CHANGE THIS WINTER WEATHER, AND EVERYTHING WILL BE...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I CAN'T!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna. Are you okay? FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'm okay.... I'm fine.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Who's this? Wait, it doesn't matter. You have to go.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, I know we can figure this out together--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: How? What power do you have to stop this winter? To stop me?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna, I think we should go.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No. I'm not leaving without you, Elsa.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Yes, you are.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Stop. Put us down!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You are a lot stronger than I think you realize.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Heads up!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Olaf!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Watch out for my butt!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: It is not nice to throw people!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Uh-oh. Now you made him mad!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I'll distract him. You guys go.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, no, not you guys. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: This just got a whole lot harder.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: This way!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ho-ho-ho!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I got him!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Whoa, stop!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: It's a hundred foot drop.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: It's two hundred.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ow.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What's that for?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'm digging a snow anchor. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay. What if we fall?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: There's twenty feet of fresh powder down there; it'll be like landing on a pillow.... Hopefully.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay, Anna. On three.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay. You tell me when...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: One...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I'm ready to go....

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Two...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I was BORN ready! Yes!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Calm down.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: TREE!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Whoa! That happened.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ah. Ah. Man, am I out of shape. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: There we go. Hey, Anna! Sven! Where'd ya guys go? We totally lost Marshmallow back there!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey. We were just talking about you. All good things, all good things.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: NO!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: This is not making much of a difference!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: WHOA!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Olaf!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hang in there, guys!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wait, what?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Aargghh!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff! FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ugh. We won't.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, you were right. Just like a pillow.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I can't feel my legs! I can't feel my legs!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Those are my legs.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ooh. Hey, do me a favor, grab my butt.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Oh, that feels better.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, Sven! FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: He found us. Who's my cute little reindeer?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Don't talk to him like that.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Whoa!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You okay?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Thank you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Um.... How's your head?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ah! Ooh!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I mean, It's fine. Ah...I'm good. Ha. I've got a thick skull.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I don't have a skull.... Or bones.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Now what?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Now what? Now what?! Oh! What am I gonna do? She threw me out. I can't go back to Arendelle with the weather like this. And then there's your ice business--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, hey, don't worry about my ice business... Worry about your hair?!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What? I just fell off a cliff. You should see your hair.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, yours is turning white.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: White? It's what?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: It's because she struck you; isn't it?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Does it look bad?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You hesitated.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, I didn't. Anna, you need help. Now, come on. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay! Where are we going?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: To see my friends.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: The love experts?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Love experts?!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Yes. And don't worry; they'll be able to fix this.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: How do you know?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Because I've seen them do it before.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I like to consider myself a love expert.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Get it together. Control it. Don't feel. Don't feel. Don't FEEL!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Look, Sven. The sky's awake.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Are you cold?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...A little.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wait. Come here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Oooh.... That's nice.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: So, about my friends...well, I say friends, they're more like family.... Anyway, when I was a kid, it was just me and Sven...until they took me in.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: They did?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Yeah. I don't want to scare you, they can be a little bit inappropriate...and loud...very loud...they're also stubborn at times, and a little overbearing. And heavy. Really, really heavy. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: But they're fine.. You'll get it. They mean well.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff, they sound wonderful.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay then....

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Meet my family.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, guys!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...They're rocks.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: He's crazy. I'll distract them while you run. Hi, Sven's family! It's nice to meet you! Anna, because I love you, I insist you run. I understand you're love experts! Why aren't you running?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay. Um...I'm gonna go--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff's home.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wait? Kristoff?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ah! No. I'm gonna keep my clothes on, thank you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Great to see you all. Where's grandpa?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Trolls? They're trolls.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What's going on?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I've learned to just roll with it.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wait. Oh. Um. No.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You've got the wrong idea. That's not why I brought her here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Right. We're not. I'm not--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Can we just stop talking about this?! We've got a real, actual problem here.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, I don't.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Enough! She's engaged to someone else. Okay?!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wait, what?!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: She's as cold as ice.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Grand Pabbie!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What...? No.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: So remove it, Grand Pabbie.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: An act of true love?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna, we've got to get you back to Hans.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Hans. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Help us out, Sven.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Come on, Olaf!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'm coming! Let's go kiss Hans! Who is this Hans?!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No. Please.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Stay away!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No....What have I done?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Why did you bring me here?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: But I'm a danger to Arendelle. Get Anna.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Don't you see...I can't.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You have to tell them to let me go.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Just hang in there. Come on, buddy, faster!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I'll meet you guys at the castle! FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Stay out of sight, Olaf!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I will!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hello!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I've got you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Are you g-gonna be okay?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Don't worry about me.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Get her warm and find Prince Hans, immediately.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Make sure she's safe!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hans, you have to kiss me.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Now. Here we go.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Elsa struck me with her powers.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I was wrong.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: She froze my heart and only an act of true love can save me.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...You said you did.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What are you talking about?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hans?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hans. No, stop. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Please.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...You're no match for Elsa.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You won't get away with this.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Please, somebody help.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What is it, buddy?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, watch it. What's wrong with you?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I don't understand you when you talk like that. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ah! Stop it! Put me down!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, Sven! We're not going back!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: She's with her true love.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Help.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna. Oh no.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Olaf? Olaf. Get away from there.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Whoa! So this is heat.... I love it.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Ooh! But don't touch it!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: So, where's Hans? What happened to your kiss?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I was wrong about him. It wasn't true love.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Huh. But we ran all the way here?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Please Olaf, you can't stay here; you'll melt.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I am not leaving here until we find some other act of true love to save you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Do you happen to have any ideas?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I don't even know what love is.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: That's okay, I do....

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Love is...putting someone else's needs before yours, like, you know, how Kristoff brought you back here to Hans and left you forever.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Kristoff loves me?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wow, you really don't know anything about love, do you?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Olaf, you're melting.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Some people are worth melting for.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Just maybe not right this second.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Don't worry, I've got it!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: We're going to get through-- Oh, wait. Hang on. I'm getting something.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: It's Kristoff and Sven! They're coming back this way.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...They-they are? FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wow, he's really moving fast. Huh.... I guess I was wrong. I guess Kristoff doesn't love you enough to leave you behind.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Help me up, Olaf. Please.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No, no, no, no, no. You need to stay by the fire and keep warm.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I need to get to Kristoff.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Why...? Oh, oh, oh, I know why.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: There's your act of true love, right there, riding across the fjords like a valiant, pungent reindeer king! Come on!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Look out!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: We're trapped.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Slide, Anna.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: We made it!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Come on, buddy, faster.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Keep going, Anna!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Come on! Come on!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Sven? Sven!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Good boy.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna...? Anna!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...Just take care of my sister.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What? No.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Kristoff.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna.
