title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Elsa.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Oh, Anna...no...no, please no.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Anna?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Wha-? Anna?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Oh, Elsa.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...You sacrificed yourself for me?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I love you.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: An act of true love will thaw a frozen heart.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Love...will thaw... Love.... Of course.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Elsa?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Love.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I knew you could do it.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hands down, this is the best day of my life...and quite possibly the last.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Oh, Olaf. Hang on, little guy. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Hey, my own personal flurry.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Uh. Uh. Uh.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: The only frozen heart around here is yours.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Come on. Come on. Come on. Come on!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Pole.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Oops. Sorry.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Okay. Okay. Here we are. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I owe you a sled.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Are you serious?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Yes. And it's the latest model.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: No. I can't accept this...

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: You have to. No returns. No exchanges. Queen's orders. She's named you the official Arendelle Ice Master and Deliverer.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What? That's not a thing.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Sure it is. And it even has a cup holder.... Do you like it?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Like it?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I love it.... I could kiss you!

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: ...I could. I mean I'd like to. I'd... may I? We me....I mean, may we? Wait, what?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: We may. FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Are you ready?

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: I like the open gates.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: We are never closing them again.

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: What? Oh, Elsa, they're beautiful, but you know I don't ska--

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: Look out. Reindeer coming through! FROZEN - J. Lee

title: Frozen-(Disney)
dialogue: That's it. Glide and pivot and glide and pivot.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Egon, could you hold off on the weather balloon bit for a minute?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: It's Your night to take out the trash.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Thanks, Slimer. I really needed that!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Hey, even a half-baked false alarm sounds better than doing Egon's chores. Let's roll!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Why? Lately even when he's with us, he's not with us.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Good. Then he can hire a maid to do his share of the chores.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Ray! It's six feet tall!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Thank you, Sir. We'll put out a missing chicken report right away.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: This one's easy, guys. Old Zeke's been watchin' too many horror movies and eating too much greasy popcorn.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Get serious, Ray.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Look, if this is a werechicken egg,

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: ...how come there's no PKE reading?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: I'll take it. C'mon, Slimer.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Werechickens.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Yo, balloon man, we've got some real work for you: How about analyzing this?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: I don't wanna hear about it, Egon. We've had a long night in a not-too-fragrant barnyard, so I'm taking a shower and hitting the sheets.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Slimer! How 'bout some privacy??

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Monster?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Egon? Well, Slimer, I don't see anything here that looks like a monster.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Holy cow!!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: What'd you do to Egon, you bird-brain!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Hey!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: What's wrong with you guys? That thing ate Egon!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: You're kidding! Come to think of it, there was a certain resemblance.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Ray, what's this have to do with Egon being a chicken?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Sit down, Egon, we have some good news and some bad news.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Take it easy, Egon. You're gonna be fine. Hurry it up, guys!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Come on, Ray!!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: He's changing again!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: What happened?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Well, we hafta do something!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Let's stop that thing before it makes drumsticks out of anyone else! Un, no offense, Egon.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: All quiet on the chicken front. How about down there?

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: It's how big? Okay, Ray, I admit you were right about these Werechickens,...

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: ...but I definitely don't buy them growing to the size of buildings.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Ray, you were right! The chicken's here, and he's a walking high-rise!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: It's heading down 34th toward the Empire State Building.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Take over, Slimer!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: So how're we gonna, put that big bird on ice, guys'

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Egon, can we freeze that big chicken with your weather balloons

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Piece of cake.

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Lemme guess -- more chickenbane soup!

title: Ghostbusters
dialogue: Tell me, how do I get out of this chicken outfit?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Showtime, a-holes! It'll be here any minute!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Which will be its loss.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Is that a rifle?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You don't know what a rifle is?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I thought your thing was a sword.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We've been hired to stop an interdimensional beast from feeding on those batteries' energy, and I'm going to stop it with a sword?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Don't look at me like I'm stupid. You're the one being all inconsistent.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Drax, why aren't you wearing one of Rocket's aero-rigs?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Hurts?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: If I finish this, we can listen to tunes while we work.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Blame Quill! He's the one who loves music so much!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I agree with Drax. It's hardly important right now.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh, sure, okayyyy, Quill.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No, I really agree with him.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Sure, I know.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Damn. I'm using my left eye?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: They were not looking at you funny.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well. That's intense.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Groot, look - !

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Get out of the way, Groot! You're going to get hurt!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Hi.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Spit it out! Spit it out!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Disgusting.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Huh?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Drax, no! That doesn't make -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What is he doing?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He said the skin is too thick to be pierced from the outside, so he --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That doesn't make sense!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I tried to tell -- !

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Its skin is the same thickness from the inside as from the out!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I REALIZE THAT.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Gamora, there's a cut on its neck - Rocket, get it to look up.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Hey, you giant Sea Monkey, up here!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Anulax batteries.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's nothing like what I just said. But they're worth thousands of units a piece. Which is why the Sovereign hired us to protect them.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Just be careful what you say around these folks. They're easily offended and the cost of transgression is death.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's the kind of thing you might want to keep to yourself.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'll hold my tongue, as long as they deliver what was promised.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I guess I prefer making people the old-fashioned way.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah, I mean, if it's for research that could be pretty --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Pretty repulsive. I'm not into that kind of casual -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh, please. Your people promised something in trade for our services. Bring it and we shall gladly be on our way.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Family reunion. Yaaaay.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: She's worth no more to me than the bounty due for her on Xandar.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Thank you, High Priestess Ayesha.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: My mother is from earth.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's... not from Missouri, that's all I know.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You know, they told me you people were conceited douchebags. But that isn't true at all.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh, shit, I'm using my wrong eye again, aren't I? I'm sorry. That was meant to be behind your back.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You're telling me. You wanna buy some batteries?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Let's get baldy back to Xandar and retrieve that bounty!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You all right?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That stuff about my father. Who does she think she is?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I know you're sensitive about that.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not sensitive about it. I just don't know who he is.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Sorry if it looked like I was flirting with her. I wasn't.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I don't care if you were.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I think you do care. That's why I'm apologizing.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Uh huh.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, that is pretty hot, but--

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: All right, okay, fascinating, don't need to hear it. I get your point, I'm a dancer and Gamora is not.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No. It's not ripe yet. And I hate you.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: A what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: `Guardians of the Galaxy.'

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Why would we be `the Gardens of the Galaxy'?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah, it would be.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I wasn't the one who thought of it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No. You'll live out your days in a prison on Xandar, wishing you could.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We got an armed Sovereign fleet, approaching from the rear.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Why would they do that?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dude.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What were you thinking?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dude, it was really easy to steal.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's your defense?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Come on. You saw how that high- priestess talked down to us! I'm teaching her a lesson!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh! I didn't realize your motivation was altruism. A shame the Sovereign have mistaken your intentions and are trying to kill us.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Exactly.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I WAS BEING SARCASTIC!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh no! You tricked me! You're supposed to use a sarcastic voice! Now I look foolish!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: SHUT UP, DRAX! You knew! You should have told us!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Are you kidding me?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You never listen to anything!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: None of you listens! Can we please just put the bickering on hold until after we survive the massive space battle?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Whoa. Somebody woke up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Do not try to bro down with me right now, dude. I will fricking punch you in your fricking face.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Real nice! Resorting to violence.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: More incoming!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: GOOD! I WANT TO KILL SOME GUYS!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You're not killing anyone. Those ships are all remotely piloted.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's the closest habitable planet?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's called Berhert.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: How many jumps?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Only one. But the access point is 47 clicks away. And it's through that Quantum Asteroid Field over there.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Lucky for us -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I am.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What are you doing?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I've been flying this rig since I was ten years old.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I was cybernetically engineered to pilot a spacecraft!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You were cybernetically engineered to be a douchebag.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Stop it!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Quill, later on tonight you're gonna lay down in your bed and there's gonna be something squishy in your pillowcase and you're gonna be, like, `what's this?' and it's gonna be because I put a turd in there.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You put your turd in my bed, I shave you.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh it won't be my turd, it will be Drax's.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We're about to die, and this is what we're discussing?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Groot, he's right, you have to start aiming inside the box.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Stop it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, that's what you get when Quill flies.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Ow!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: There's still a Sovereign craft behind us!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Our weapons are down!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Twenty clicks to the jump.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Where's he going?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Fifteen clicks.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Ten clicks.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Five clicks!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Son-of-a-! They went around the field!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What is that?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Doesn't matter! That's the jump point! GO! GO!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's a guy.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh my God.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Groot, put on your seat belt!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Prepare for a really bad -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Either one of you could have gotten us through that field, if you had flown with what's between your ears instead of what's between your legs!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: If what's between my legs had a hand on it, I guarantee I could have landed this ship.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's not funny, Peter. We almost died. Because of your arrogance.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: More like because he stoled Anulax batteries!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No, they're not!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You know why I did it, Star-Munch?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Do you?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not going to answer to `Star- Munch.'

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I DID IT BECAUSE I WANTED TO.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dick.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What are we even talking about this for? We just had a little man save us by blowing up fifty ships!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Like this.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: A little one-inch man saved us?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, if he got closer I'm sure he'd be much larger.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's how eyes work, you stupid raccoon.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Don't call me a raccoon!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, I meant to say `trash panda.'

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Is that better?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's worse.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: YOU SON-OF-A-!!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not a fool, Nebula.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You'll attack me the moment I let you go.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You'd think an evil supervillain would learn how to properly lie.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Who the hell are you?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Because I was a skinny kid who could squeeze into places adults couldn't, making thieving easier.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We've been together all this time and you thought Yondu was my actual, blood relative?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: One's blue.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He wasn't my father. Yondu was the guy who abducted me. He'd beat the crap out of me so I'd learn how to fight and he kept me in terror threatening to eat me.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: How'd you locate us now?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Not buying it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Peter, we need to take a walk.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Give me a break! After all this time, and he just expects to be my Dad all of the sudden!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I hear you.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I mean, this could be a trap - the Kree purists, the Ravagers, now the Sovereign - they all want us dead.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I know, but -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: But what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What was that story you told me about Zardu Hasselfrau?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Who?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: The wonderful television-singer man. He had a magic boat.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: David Hasselhoff?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Right.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He had a talking car, not a magic -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Why did it talk again?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Just to be a good friend, I guess.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And as a child you carried his picture in your pocket, and you told the other children he was your father, but he was out of town --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Shooting Knight Rider or touring with his band in Germany. Why are you bringing this up now? I was drunk when I told you that.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I love that story.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I don't. It's just sad! I was so sad because I'd see the other kids off playing catch with their dads, and I wanted that, more than anything in the world.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: My point is, maybe this man is your Hasselhoff. I know it's a long shot. But I lost my father as a child. I'd give anything...

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: If he ends up being evil, we'll just kill him.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's funny?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's not a fox.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Shoot her if she does anything suspicious. Or if you feel like it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It will just be a couple days. We'll be back before Rocket's finished fixing the ship.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I have clones.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: There's no way for them to know they're here.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You're like an old woman.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Hope daddy isn't as big of a dick as you, orphan boy.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: So what's your goal here? To get everyone to hate you? `Cause it's working.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Can I ask you a personal question?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: The antennae, what are they for?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You're not supposed to say that.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Just making clear - if it's anything else - any other answer - I win?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Three pairs of pants.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What are - ?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You read minds?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah, I guess, yeah, I have sort of a general, unselfish love for everyone.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No. No, I don't.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What the hell, dude? That's a total overreaction.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You got to be kidding me.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's so incredibly uncool.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Touch me. And the only thing you're going to feel is a broken jaw.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Like what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Is that real?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's kind of like someone put a baby's head on a big, muscular body, isn't it?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Crap.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: How's it going, you blue idiot?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You give me your word you won't hurt Groot, and I'll tell you where the batteries are.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Hold on! There's got to be some sort of peaceful resolution here! Or even a violent resolution, where I'm standing over there.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Wow. You have your own planet?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's beautiful.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Single-handedly?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Whoa. It's perfect.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You've got to be kidding.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's Ronan. That's you.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You own a planet and can destroy two dozen spaceships without a suit. What are you, exactly?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: A Celestial. Like a... god?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Wow.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dude.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I don't need to hear about how my parents, you know -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's disgusting.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh my God.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: When did you meet my mother?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: If you loved her why did you leave her?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm sorry. Your name is... it's `Taserface'?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Do you... shoot tasers out of your face?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: For what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Really?... Okay, sure.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. I just keep imagining you waking up one morning, looking in the mirror, and, in all seriousness, saying `You know what would be a really kickass name? Taserface!'

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What was your second choice?! Scrotum Hat?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, dying is certainly better than having to live an entire life as a moronic shitbag who thinks `Taserface' is a cool name.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: My mother told everyone my father was from the stars.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: She had brain cancer - so everyone thought she was delusional.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Listen. I'd love to believe all of this, I really would - but you left the most wonderful woman ever, to die alone!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: So why didn't you come back?! Why'd you send Yondu, a criminal, of all people, to fetch me?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I know exactly what that's like! I had to watch her die!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What do you mean?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Whoa.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's going on?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You're not ugly. Drax.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Mantis, can you show us where we'll be staying? I'm getting eye-strain in this place.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Why are there no other beings on this planet?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And you're not a flea?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What were you about to say to Drax before I walked out?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Okay, Taserface. See you later, Taserface. Hey, Taserface, tell the other guys we said hi, Taserface!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No offense, but your employees are a bunch of jerks.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That was mostly Drax.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Slow down, drama queen. You might deserve this, but I don't. We gotta get out of here.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Went off with his old man.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah. It's a day for dumbass names.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You smiled and for a second I got a warm feeling, but then it was ruined by those disgusting-ass teeth. Ever heard of floss?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Pretty much a pro. Why didn't you deliver Quill to Ego like you promised?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh, man. What'd they do to you?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah, I was pretty sure he didn't know what you were talking about. You have to explain it more careful.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's an orloni. It's a fin, Groot.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: But leave the eye here.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's gonna wake up tomorrow and he's not gonna know where his eye is!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's a desk. We told you it was this big.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Tell me you guys have a refrigerator somewhere with a bunch of severed human toes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Okay, then let's just agree to never discuss this.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He thinks you want him to wear it as a hat.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's relieved that you don't want him to.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He hates hats.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: On anyone, not just himself.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: One minute you think someone has a weird-shaped head. The next minute, it's just because you realize part of that head is a hat. That's why you don't like hats?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No. Let's try again.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: One more thing.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You got any clones of Quill's old music on the ship?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You maniac. The whole ship is gonna blow.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Ego.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I know that.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: So I guess this could all be mine someday.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Rocket? Rocket, you there? Dammit.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What are you doing, Peter?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dance with me.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No. I'm not --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Come on. This is Sam Cooke, one of the greatest Earth singers of all time.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Drax thinks you're not a dancer.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: If you ever tell anyone about this, I'll kill you.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: When are we going to do something about this... unspoken thing between us?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What unspoken thing?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: There is no unspoken thing between us.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, that's a Catch-22. Because if you said there was, it would be spoken, and then you'd be a liar. So by saying there isn't, you're telling the truth, and admitting there is.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's not --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What we should be discussing right now is that something about this place doesn't feel right.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What are you talking about? You were the one who wanted me to come here!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That girl, Mantis. She's afraid of something.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Why are you trying to take this from me?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's my father. He's blood -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You have blood on earth. You never wanted to return there.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Again - you made me come here! And Earth?! Earth is the place my mother died in front of me.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No, it's because that's real, and this is a fantasy.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: This is real. I'm only half human, remember?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's the half I'm worried about.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh, I get it. You're jealous because I'm part god! You like me being the weak one!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Uh. You were insufferable to begin with. I haven't been able to reach Rocket. I'm going to see if I can get a signal outside.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You know, this isn't Cheers after all. It's whatever the show is where one person is willing to, you know, open themselves up to new possibilities, and the other person is just kind of a jerk who doesn't trust anyone! It's a show that doesn't exist - it would never be made, it would be so horrible! It would get zero ratings!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You're having a conversation with yourself! I don't know what Cheers is!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I finally found my family, don't you understand that!?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I thought you already had.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: So this is how it ends, then? Our whole story. Like this? You and me?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Get it through your head, Peter. There is no you and me. There never was.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dammit.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You psychopath.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Are you kidding me?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Uh, no, I just spared your life -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You just let me live!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not the one who just flew across the universe because I wanted to win!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I don't have to because you make it OBVI -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You know - ?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah, it is.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, you might not be mortal, but ME -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm immortal? That's... really?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And I can use the light to make cool things? Like how you made all this?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well, get ready for an eight hundred foot statue of Pac Man, then. With Skeletor. And Heather Locklear. I'm gonna make some weird shit.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Wow, that...

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: How?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's that?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Doesn't eternity get boring?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I see it. Eternity.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh my God.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I could tell by how you talked about him - this Ego is bad news. We're here to save Quill.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No! I don't care about those things! I want to save Quill so I can prove I'm better than him! I can lord this over him forever!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What are you laughing at me for?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You don't know anything about me, loser.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Shut up.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I said, shut up.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm serious, dude - !

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What kind of pair are we?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: All right, okay, that's - Wait. Fight a what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Who are you people?! What is this place?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: The bodies in the caverns, who are they?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's beautiful.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What did she do to me?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We need to find Peter now and get off this damn planet.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No. He's our friend.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: My friends.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yes. I don't need that.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Forever.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Temporary.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: But my mother.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You said you loved my mother.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Wh- what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You killed my mother!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Rocket?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Keep that transmitter nearby so I can find you. We're in an old piece of construction equipment Yondu once used to slice open the Bank of A'askavaria.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Ego's unhinged -

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I know. Get ready.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I got a plan.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's pretty simple.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: NO.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I told you something didn't feel right.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: `I told you so.' That's really what I need right now.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I came back, didn't I?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Because there's an unspoken thing.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: There is no unspoken thing.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Uh, `Thank you, Rocket'?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's Smurfette doing here!?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: She tried to murder me!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's not a fox.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not a raboon either!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: `Raccoon,' whatever!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: There's the center to him - his brain, his soul, whatever it is, in some sort of shell --

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: YONDU?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I guess I should be glad I was a skinny kid. Otherwise you would have delivered me to this maniac!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's what you told me, you old doofus!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You said you were gonna eat me!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Not to me!!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You people have issues.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Of course I have issues that's my fricking father!!... Thrusters are back up.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We can't. Ego wants to eradicate the universe as we know it. We have to kill him.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Rocket!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Got it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: So, we're saving the galaxy again?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I guess.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Awesome. We'll really be able to jack up our prices if we're two- time-galaxy savers.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I seriously can't believe that is where your mind goes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It was just a random thought, man! I thought we were friends!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Of course I care about the planets, and the buildings, and all of the animals on the planets.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And the people.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Meh.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He needs my genetic connection to the light to help destroy the universe. He tried to teach me how to control the power.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: A little. I made a ball.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I thought as hard as a could, that's all I could come up with.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What do you use?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Whoa.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That ore's thick. Rocket, we're gonna need to use the big laser.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Keep it still!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We drill into the center, we kill him.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Why aren't you firing the laser?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: They blew out the generator! I think I packed a small detonator.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We got these!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Is it strong enough to kill Ego?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: If it is, it will cause a chain reaction throughout his entire nervous system.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Meaning what?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: The entire planet will explode. We'll have to get out of here fast. I rigged a timer.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Go!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You need to, girl. If you don't keep Ego at bay, we all die.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: The metal is too thick! For the bomb to work we'd actually need to place it on Ego's core. And our fat butts ain't gonna fit through those tiny holes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Well...

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's a terrible idea.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Which is the only kind of idea we got left.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Unbelievable. `Rocket, do this. Rocket, do that.'

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Uh, what a day.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: All right. First you flick this switch, then this switch. That activates it. And then you push this button, which will give you five minutes to get out of there. Whatever you do don't push this button, because that will set off the bomb immediately, and we'll all be dead. Now repeat back what I just said.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Uh huh.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's right.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No! That's the button that will kill everyone! Try again.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No! That's exactly what you just said! How is that even possible?! Which button is the button you're supposed to push?! Point to it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: NO!!!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Hey, you're making him nervous!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Shut up! And give me some tape! Does anyone have any tape out there!? I want to put some tape over the death button!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I don't have any tape. Let me check.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yo, Yondu, do you have any - ow! - do you have any tape?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No one has any tape.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Not a single person has tape?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You have priceless batteries and an atomic bomb in your bag! If anyone had tape it would be you!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: That's exactly my point! I have to do everything!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dude, you're wasting time!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We're all gonna die.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We're gonna blow!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Peter?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You look like Mary Poppins.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah. He's cool.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Oh. Wow.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: How long before the bomb goes off?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: In the unlikely event Groot doesn't kill us all, about six minutes.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Someone needs to be up top when Kraglin arrives. Drax, take Mantis.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Gamora!!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We have to get up to the extraction point!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You shouldn't have killed my mom and squished my walkman.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Groot! Groot, if you can can hear me, hurry up - I'm not sure how long Quill can keep him distracted!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yondu! We're about to blow!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Not without Quill.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Not without you.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: A space suit and an aero rig. I only have one of each.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He says welcome to the frickin' Guardians of the Galaxy... only he didn't use `frickin'.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: We're gonna need to have a discussion about your language.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Where's Peter?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Rocket, where is he?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Rocket?! Rocket, look at me! Where is he?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not leaving without him.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm sorry. I can only afford to lose one friend today. Kraglin, GO!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's so wrong with that?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yondu, you can't! What are you doing? What are you doing?!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yondu. Yondu, no!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No!

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: The other day I told Gamora how I used to pretend my dad was David Hasselhoff.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He's a singer and actor from earth... a really famous guy.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And, you know, today it struck me. Yondu didn't have a talking car, but he did have a flying arrow. And he didn't have the voice of an angel, but he did have the whistle of one. And both David Hasselhoff and Yondu went on kickass adventures, and hooked up with hot women, and fought robots.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: So, the thing is, David Hasselhoff kinda did end up being my Dad after all, only he was Yondu. I had a pretty cool Dad.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And what I'm trying to say here is, that thing you're searching for your whole life, sometimes it's right there by your side all along and you don't even know it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yeah. That's the friend I was talking about.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He did call you `twig.'

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Nebula.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I was just a child. Like you. I was concerned with staying alive until the next day - every day. And I never considered what Thanos was doing to you. I am sorry.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm trying to make it right, everything I did.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: There are little girls like you were - little boys - all over the universe - who are in danger. You can stay with us, and help them.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I don't know if that's possible.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You'll always be my sister.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Wait.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Rocket grabbed the pieces and reassembled them. I think Yondu would want you to have it.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: They came.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I sent word to Yondu's old Ravager buddies and told them what he did.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's a Ravager funeral.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: He didn't chase `em away.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: No.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Even though he yelled at `em.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And was always mean.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: And he stole batteries he didn't need.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Of course not.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: It's just some unspoken thing.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Dude, seriously, you got to clean up your room. It's a complete mess.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not boring, man. You're boring. Once I got stuck on a planet where everyone was just lines and dots. I had to use geometry to get out of prison. Is that boring?

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: You know what's boring? Not doing the dishes. What's boring is me tripping over your vines everywhere.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Drax and I switched pants in the middle of that party last weekend. For no reason other than we're awesome and very much not boring.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Once I got a venereal disease that made me float for three days... Don't tell Gamora... it's dormant, but... If that's boring then, I guess I'm boring.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: I'm not boring.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: What's boring is when you roll your eyes like that at me and make an exasperated sound like I'm an old, boring, stupid idiot.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Now I know how Yondu felt.

title: Guardians-of-the-Galaxy-Vol-2
dialogue: Yondu.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He's in his late 20's, tall, rugged -- and currently a mess. His shirt is ripped open, his aviator sunglasses are bent, his lip is bloodied, and he clearly hasn't slept in days.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Tracy, it's Vick. Parked on the dirt road behind Vick is his near-totalled 1967 Cadillac Deville convertible; it's scratched, dented, filthy - - and missing its passenger side door. Slouched inside are TWO OTHER GUYS, also looking like hell.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Listen, honey...The bachelor party got a little out of control and, well...we lost Doug.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, that's not gonna happen.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude this is already the best weekend ever!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu, relax, we're still on the 10.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, did I show you pictures of my kids?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Haylee is two, and Kaitlin is already four! Can you believe it?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: The one on the left is gonna be a hottie. The other one, not so much. Stu protectively snatches the photos back, muttering:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, dude, those are my children--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, am I rubbed in? Stu glances over and sees un-rubbed-in sunscreen all over Alan's face.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, you're good.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Of course they are, Doug. Jesus, Alan's been dating Becky for 14 years. When they first met, Alan had braces and soccer hair, and Becky had a functioning hymen.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Asking Alan if he's still with Becky is like asking the sun if it still rises in the east. The guys try not to laugh; Alan scowls.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Enh, we've moved past the pressure stage...it's more like aggravated assault stage now? Like at the last wedding we went to, she threw a camera at my head, called me a closet fag, then ran out crying. The guys wince, oooo.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: But we talked, and everything's cool now.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Maybe you could wear a helmet to Doug's wedding.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Great idea, Stu. Thanks.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, great. Yeah, I'm working on bringing the next big dessert craze to Los Angeles. It's gonna be huge.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Bavarian custard. We ran the numbers, and it's gonna be bigger than fro yo. Doug and Stu nod, impressed; only Alan looks skeptical.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Isn't custard like a trillion calories--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Our plan is to open three stores in the Valley and then franchise it. Shares are selling fast, but I can probably squeeze you guys in...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Me too, man! I love pudding! Alan just shakes his head, unbelievable.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Is this gonna do better than the hip-hop label you started, Vick? Or the topless sushi bar? Or the mobile tattoo parlor--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Tattoo-To-You was an idea ahead of it's time, Alan! And don't come crying to me when there's a Custard Cabana on every street corner in America and you didn't buy in--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude! I can't believe I get to party all night, and then, tomorrow ...I get to sleep in! It's almost too much! And FYI, if anyone gets really drunk and craps themself, just let me know, I can have you cleaned up and partying again in under three minutes. No joke. I am a master of stool removal... They rocket off into the desert, LAUGHING...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Checking in. Lennon comma Victor. The man types into his computer.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hold it right there, Atashir. This is my best friend from childhood, Douglas Billings. In two days, he is to marry a woman of great beauty and strong teeth, do you understand? A woman of gigantic bosoms who will give him many, many sons... Atashir looks confused. Alan looks embarrassed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: My two other childhood friends have travelled great distances, across many deserts, to be here. This isn't a night in a hotel for us, Atashir: this is a family reunion. Perhaps you too have family situated great distances away, in a foreign country with much sand? Atashir looks like, sort of...? Vick reaches over the counter and touches his arm, simpatico.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Then I have but one question for you, friend: if they came to town, would you put them in an economy suite?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, then. I think one of us needs to get back on his little computer and find us a suitable room. Atashir frowns...but types away at his computer.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dean-o will be fine. Send up a case of Cristal, two bottles of Patron, four ahi sandwiches, and a crate of skinless mangos... Vick turns to the guys:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You guys want anything? The guys stammer, too stunned to speak.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And have Jean-Marie cook up a dozen of those duck skewers I like so well. He knows the ones.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: American Express. Atashir looks up to accept the card. After a beat, Vick turns to Alan:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, give him your AmEx.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Don't worry, we'll hit you later. Alan stammers.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, come on, I paid for gas. Stop being such a Jew. Alan stammers some more -- then angrily pulls out his card.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This is bigger than my house. Vick blows past them, totally unfazed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Get dressed, ladies. We're wheels up in ten. Stu and Doug race off to find their bedrooms, leaving Alan standing alone, just staring at the decadent suite.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I am so not getting paid back.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This is Vick.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He's in Vegas?! You're kidding me!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I said all right, dude! How many more times you want me to say all right?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So, you ready for Sunday?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Tracy's dad still hate you?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Any closer to figuring out why?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Ahhh yeah, I wasn't going to tell anyone about that-- Just then, Stu wanders in, wearing only his COLORADO STATE BOXER SHORTS. His gut is sizable.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Anyone got any nipple lube--? Jesus would you look at the size of that thing?! Stu grabs the ring from Doug.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, who made this thing? Diddy?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Actually, I-I was trying to keep it a secret, so-- Just then Vick blows in, singing, effeminate:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Boy Party in the bathrooooom--! Miner's cut, 2.6 Carats, slight pink tint, street value: 26, 27K. Vick studies it in the light. Alan just rubs his temples.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, it's for Becky! Alan's finally going to propose!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well gosh-golly, Alan Mervish, good for you! Where'd you get the ring?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, it's a family heirloom. My grandmother smuggled it through the Holocaust, actually. I was going to propose to Beck this weekend. Doug throws his arm around Alan, happy for him.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Thish is so great! I love you guys!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Check it out, Stu's already wasted. Vick starts refilling everyone's glasses.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We've only had two shots, man!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, I'm a dad! I don't have time to get plastered anymore! It blows!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Because my dad was a bad dad.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Have I showed you guys pictures of my kids yet--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, what do you take us for?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh yeah! That was hilarious! And remember when I blacked out at Homecoming and you wrote on my face with permanent marker?! That was awesome! What'd you write again?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Ahh, good times, man. Good times...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We'll be good tonight, Doug.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Seriously, man, we're your friends.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, we've totally grown up since then. Doug looks at them, highly dubious, then hoists his glass.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Damn, dude, why are you retarded? Both men are ragingly hungover. A long beat as both of them rub their faces, then:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Um, Stuey?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yo.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why do you have a mullet? Stu does, in fact, have a mullet haircut. But he's too hungover to understand.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You know, business on top, party down the back? Stu still looks confused. This is excruciating for Vick.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Your hair, dude. You have a mullet. Stu touches his hair. Then he stumbles into the bathroom. After a beat, we hear his voice:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude...I have a mullet. Then we hear ALAN'S VOICE in the bathroom, groggy:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Just give me ten more minutes, Beck...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Whoa, did you sleep in the tub? Beat, then Stu pokes his head out of the bathroom.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Check it out: Alan slept in the tub.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Get him up. I'm hungry. Stu disappears back into the bathroom. We hear the SHOWER turn on. Beat. Then we hear Alan slowly awaken:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wet. Water. Jesus, what's--?! There's a THUD as Alan falls out of tub. Beat. Then Stu and a very confused, very hungover, very wet Alan stumble out of the bathroom. Alan appears to be wearing his polo shirt from the night before. Only, as we PULL BACK, we see that his shirt is cut off at his chest -- he's naked from there down.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, dude, put away your sack. Alan looks down at his hairy nakedness, totally bewildered.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, and it might be time for some manscaping, bro. Your bush looks like Yanni. Alan looks back up again, squinting, hungover.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What did we do last night?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, why is my ass killing me...?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We might not smell very good. The guys shake their heads, yeah, no.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This might be the worst hangover anyone has ever had, ever.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can't taste anything.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Please stop talking. If I don't focus on eating I'm going to throw up all over myself. The guys nod, right. They keep eating. After a long while:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey... Are we missing something? The guys all slowly look around. Then Stu points at Alan:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes: I left my hat in the room -- thank you, Alan. They continue eating. Alan looks up again, still troubled.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No. That's not it... There's something else... Vick nods at Stu as he stuffs food in his mouth.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You gonna finish that cruller? Stu shakes his head, no. Vick takes it, packs it into his already stuffed mouth. Then Alan realizes:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Doug. Guys, where's Doug? The guys look around. Hunh.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah. He's not here.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Probably left him in the room. Vick pulls out his cell phone, starts dialing.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'll call his cell. Then a phone RINGS in Stu's pocket. He answers:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Good morning, this is Stu?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's me, meatdick.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's Vick-- Then Stu realizes. Oh.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This is Doug's phone. Vick nods, ya. He's already dialing another number.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You calling the room? Vick nods, uh-huh. He lets it ring, rubbing his temples. Then he hangs up.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No answer. Vick goes back to eating. Alan frowns.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Ummm...shouldn't we look for him? Check-out is in like ten minutes.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, and we told Tracy we'd have Doug back to LA by five. Vick just looks at both of them, his mouth full of food:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm eabing.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What an asshole. Stu, check the pool and the casino, I'll check the room and the gym. Maybe he's working out or something... Stu nods, and they slowly slide out of the booth.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And Vick, if you could keep a close eye on the buffet, that'd be really helpful. Thanks, man. Alan and Stu saunter off. Vick yells after them, mouth full:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Doug...? Doug...? Wake up, man. Alan enters the bedroom where Doug slept, and stops. It takes him a second to realize what's wrong:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That's weird...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No, no. It's cool, I'm a dad. It's totally cool...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I hate you all...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey guys. DOUG! DOUG--! Then Stu registers what just happened. He stops and turns around -- enh? -- but the gay men are gone. Before he can comment, however, he sees Vick and Alan talking to Atashir at

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You find Doug?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No, I assume you didn't either? Stu shakes his head, no. Then Atashir hangs up his phone.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Maybe he went for a jog?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude. It's 120 degrees outside.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Or shopping? The guys just look at him like: you're an idiot.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Great. So we've officially lost Doug. His wedding is in what, 22 hours?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Relax, it's Doug, he's probably crashed out on someone's couch right now. All we have to do is retrace our steps from last night, and we'll find him.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, so last night... The guys wince, trying to remember. It's painful to think.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, we started on the roof...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Right, that was like, 6ish...?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Then...I think...we had steaks at the Palm?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah. Then...we played craps at the Hard Rock...maybe?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That sounds right... Stu throws up his arms, already giving up.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, honestly? I don't even remember going to dinner.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I vaguely recall...doing body shots ....at some point? Is that...maybe?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm pretty much blank after The Hard Rock.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think we went to the Flamingo after that...? And then, I just remember a lot of blue light...and the overpowering smell of baby oil.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So that was what, 10ish?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Give or take.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Was Doug still with us? Vick rubs his temples, trying to fight through the hangover.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes. Yes. Doug was with us. I tackled him...for some reason. The guys nod, okay, okay.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay. So we only have a 13 hour window where we could've lost him. They guys frown. Shit. Stu puts his hands into his pockets, thinking... Then he feels something. A matchbook. He pulls it out. It's from The Flamingo Nightclub.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey! Look, we were at the Flamingo. A long beat of silence... Then the guys hurry to an empty BLACKJACK TABLE and start emptying their pockets of the detritus from the night before. They find matchbooks, receipts, room keys, a valet ticket...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: ATM receipt from the Rio at 10:37-- For 600 dollars?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: The valet ticket says we returned here at 4:57AM.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We drove last night? The guys wince, jesus...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Here's a receipt from Sbarro. The meal was comped for some reason--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why do we have a matchbook from The Golden Pony All Male Revue? The guys exchange a look, alarmed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Someone could've given that to us.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, totally! There's no way we went there! We're not gay! Hahaha! They frown, then stare at all the clues lined up on the blackjack table.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think we should call Tracy.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Absolutely not.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What if Doug called her? She might know where he is. Stu shifts uncomfortably, tenderly adjusting his ass.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, I'm with Alan on this one.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Of course you're with Alan, you're both gutless cowards. But we're not calling Tracy. You never call the bride from the bachelor party. Ever. If my balls were on fire and Tracy was sitting next door with a tall glass of water, I still wouldn't call her. It's a rule.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: But shouldn't we at least tell her we're gonna be getting home late?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She has a watch, she'll figure it out.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think I'm beginning to see why you're always single.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And I think I'm beginning to see why you're always a douche--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Guys, wait. I need your help -- oh my God -- like right now. Come on.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, what is it?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can't believe we're doing this.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You don't have to look up my butt, just at it. Something is terribly, terribly wrong... Stu's jeans fall to the ground -- and everyone freezes.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Sweet mother of mercy...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Who's Roger?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I-I-I don't know?! What do you think it means?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What do I think it means? Well, Stuart, your ass is all torn up and you're wearing thong underwear declaring your love for another dude -- I don't think we need the CSI team for this one! You got reamed last night, man! Stu covers his mouth, horrified!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm sure there's a perfectly logical explanation for this...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Really?! What?! Alan tries to think of one.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, maybe there isn't.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, I'm sure Roger is a very nice, considerate young man--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God, guys: what if I'm gay?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Come on, Stu, you're nowhere near cool enough.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I do watch Dancing With The Stars with the kids!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh god, that doesn't mean you're gay.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: But sort of...it does? Stu grows increasingly frantic.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And once, I caught myself gazing at a topless photo of David Beckham!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So what, he's a great-looking dude--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And then I had those weird feelings for Vick that time in middle school, remember?! Everyone stops. Vick most of all.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Um, what?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, that weekend we were all camping -- I told you this.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, no you didn't.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I didn't?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think I'd remember, dude.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, I think we'd all remember.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah. I had weird feelings for you that weekend. Like really hot, really gay feelings. But then they went away. Vick is just looking at him, stunned.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait -- I was there that weekend. Did you have gay feelings for me?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Unbelievable.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?! I was a good-looking kid!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Please, you're so not his type!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait, what? Just then, a FATHER and his YOUNG SON enter the men's room and see Stu standing there, pants down, in his G string...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, Stu, one homosexual experience doesn't mean you're permanently gay, okay? A lot of guys test the waters. ...the FATHER and SON wheel right back around and exit.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: All right, we're scaring the children. Let's go. The guys head for the door. Stu quickly pulls up his pants.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait -- so have either of you tested the waters?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No! We're not gay!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How am I going to tell my wife?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Quickly, and from a great distance. Alan's hand accidentally hits a brass railing and CLINKS...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, what kind of father am I? Alan's hand CLINKS against the railing again, and this time it registers. Alan looks down -- and stops cold.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You think Erin will try to take the kids--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh...my...God.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What now? Alan holds up the source of his CLINKING: on his ring finger is a huge, tacky, silver WEDDING RING with a unicorn on it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Cool ring. Also, my Dad is gonna have a field day with this. Vick, however, recognizes the implications of the ring, and starts back towards Alan.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God... Oh my God...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What's the big--? Oh! OH! OH!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Maybe it's not a wedding ring?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: "To My Noble Husband, Alan." The guys eyes bulge, oh shit!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This is worse than my underwear! Vick takes the ring and reads the rest of the inscription:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: "Now & Forever Wedding Chapel." They guys exchange a look.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, at least it's a lead. Beat. Then Alan turns and THROWS UP all over the slot machine. Nearby OCTOGENARIAN SLOT PLAYERS look over, disgusted -- but continue playing their nickels.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So, we go to the wedding chapel, we find out what we did with Doug, we recover him, and we're back in LA before sundown. Easy as Stu's ass. No one laughs. Tense SILENCE as they wait for the car.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Check it out, some idiot threw his bed out the window last night. Stu points over at a huge stone GRIFFIN in front of the hotel with an ENTIRE BED impaled upon its ear.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That was us, dude.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Really?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, there's no bed in Doug's room.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, Stu, I really do.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Guys, relax. Everything's gonna be cool... Just then the Valet drives up in

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You okay, Vick?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm not emotionally prepared to talk about it just yet, Stuart, but thank you. Vick dons his sunglasses and heads for his destroyed car...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Seriously: what am I gonna tell Becky? For 14 years she's been begging me to get married...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, now you did. Just not to her. Alan glowers at the city going by... Then he sits up--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait, is that homeless guy wearing Doug's shirt? The guys turn to see a HOMELESS GUY weaving down the sidewalk in Doug's DISTINCTIVE ORANGE SHIRT from the night before. Once they pass, the guys exchange a look.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Naaah.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, that was a different shirt. Alan doesn't look so sure. They drive in silence. Then:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Left turn. Stu, sitting shotgun, braces against the empty doorframe so as not to fall out of the car as they turn left...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What if they don't remember us--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How are you, you dumb bastards?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Does the pope wear a funny hat?! Let's do this thing! Steve CACKLES and guides them over to a table; Alan scowls.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And where is Chastity today? They all sit on white plastic chairs.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: W-Who's...Chastity?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Uh, it was such a lovely ceremony, wasn't it?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hand to God, I've never seen two people more in love!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Sadly, I believe you... The guys look at the photos of Alan's wedding from the night before. They're typical wedding shots, only the guys are all wearing MEDIEVAL COSTUMES, swords, bows, tights, even armor. They look incredibly happy -- and incredibly drunk. The next photo is of Alan and his BUSTY BLONDE BRIDE. She's having a blast in a white medieval gown and tiara.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hello, Chastity... Alan just closes his eyes, oh God.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I am never...ever...drinking again.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, she is stacked.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu, please, show some class. That's Alan's wife you're talking about.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Sorry. She looks really nice. But Alan is too busy gaping at the next photo, of him and Chastity atop a UNICORN in the chapel.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We got a unicorn?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, yeah, you got the entire Double Camelot Package. Alan just rubs his temples, oh no.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: A-And how much did that cost?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: 7 thousand dollars. Alan closes his eyes. Stu and Vick exchange a look, no way!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, you didn't want to get it, either, but Vick insisted. Beat. Then Alan pounces across the table at Vick!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm gonna kill you!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You can't put a pricetag on love, Alan! OW! You just can't!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's good to be seen, Carla. It's good to be seen.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No way! Awesome!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: A hundred DVDs of the ceremony... She lays out the stacks of DVDs. Vick nods at Alan:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: For you and Chastity to watch on your anniversary... Alan just clenches his jaw, I fucking hate you.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And it looks like real velvet, Alan, so no machine wash, okay?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I want a shield!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Me too! Hey, can Stu and I get a shield?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't suppose you have any sort of return policy, do you?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Um...if you know another couple who looks exactly like you guys, and who want two dozen commuter mugs, a wall hanging, and a shield...sure. Alan scowls. Then his cellphone RINGS. He angrily answers it without looking at the Caller ID.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What. We hear someone YELLING AT HIM. Alan's eyes bulge.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, hey Becky! Hi! He steps away to take the call. Vick explains to Carla:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That's his girlfriend of 14 years. I'm sure this'll only take a minute...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No! I-I have no idea--! Then Vick calls over from the white plastic table, pissed:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Nothing! Baby, nothing, the GUYS

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know, baby! I know--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes. I will. I promise.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes, no, I love you too! Becky hangs up, rolling her eyes, unbelievable. STAY WITH ALAN as he closes his cellphone. Exhales.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, how's Becky doing, man?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, did she ask about us?! Off of Alan's hate-filled glare, we

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look on the bright side, Alan. Vick found a great clue.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Turns out Doug was in all the wedding photos, which means -- if the time stamp was right -- we had him in our possession until 11 pm.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That's another hour of last night that we can account for. Isn't that great?
