title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Amazing.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, Steve, you don't happen to know where we were heading when we left here last night, do you?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, the Double Camelot Package comes with a five course wedding feast, so I assume you went there.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Great -- where was the feast?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Sbarro, over in the Fremont mall.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I paid 7 grand for Sbarro?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Your negativity is like a little black cloud over our car, Alan. You've got to let go of this.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Let go of what, exactly, Vick?! The fact that I married a complete stranger last night? Or that my girlfriend's about to leave me? Or that I'm broke? Which one?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You're broke? I thought you were

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know you think it's like terminally uncool to be in a committed relationship, Vick, but I actually love Becky, okay?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Alan. Honey. Have you considered, even for a second, that maybe the things we do when we're drunk are what we secretly want to do?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, no, you're absolutely right, Vick, I've always secretly wanted to marry a bottle blonde with big fake melon tits named Chastity!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I ain't mad atcha, dude...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Or, after 14 years, maybe you don't have the balls to leave Becky, and this is your way of getting her to leave you.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I was going to propose to her this weekend, you jackass!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: All the more reason to freak out. Alan opens his mouth to respond, but nothing comes out. Vick nods, chew on that, and continues slowly reversing the car.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I love you, Alan Mervish, I do, but you've always had a major pole up your ass. Maybe last night was your inner cool person trying to get out-

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I swear to God, Vick, if you say one more word to me, I will destroy you.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Guys, come on, let's not use our angry words--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What the--?! They look up to see two MASSIVE SAMOAN MEN in loud Hawaiian shirts, KALOLO FANALUA and KIKIOLANI, 30's, standing on either side of the car. And they look pissed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Who are these guys?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu, please. I think there's been some sort of mistake, Mister...?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Those so aren't their real names.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Vick, don't be a dick--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Alan? Relax. These men aren't going to hurt us. They're from Hawaii.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, okay! Cool it with the bat! Jesus, why is everyone trying to kill my car...? Vick undoes his seatbelt and reaches for his door handle. Kikiolani lowers his bat -- and Vick throws the door open, right into his nuts! The huge Samoan staggers back, OWWW, and Vick slams his door shut and

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why'd you do that?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Maybe they just wanted to talk!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I honestly don't know how you two are still alive.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Do you think we stole something from them last night?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my god I am such a bad dad!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm calling the police. This is getting way out of control--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No! No cops!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: "No cops?!" Who are you, Fitty Cent?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, Vick, what's going on?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Nothing! I just think we should focus on finding Doug and not get distracted by every little thing!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Every little thing?! We were just assaulted by the Yakuza!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh please, those guys are from Guam. Get a grip.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: They knew your name, Vick! Which means they probably know who Stu and I are, too!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: If anything ever happened to my family, Vick...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Fine. Let's just go back to the hotel -- Doug is probably back from wherever he spent the night, we'll get him, we'll straighten out whatever we did to those angry Samoans, then we'll get the hell back to LA, okay? Left turn. Vick angrily takes a harder-than-necessary left turn. Alan hangs on tight, almost flying out of the car.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Doug? Doug? Alan quickly checks the room phone.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No messages.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Come on, let's toss the place. Alan starts wading through the crap in the living room, while Vick and Stu head off to check the bedrooms...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, check it out, Vick! I invested 30 grand in your custard store last night! Vick calls from the other bedroom.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Smart move, man. Stu opens the closet door -- and freezes.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, you wanna come in here a sec?! Vick enters a moment later to find Stu staring into the closet. Vick follows his gaze and sees a SEXY WOMAN snoring away on the closet floor, her blonde hair obscuring her face.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Whoa.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You think she's what those Guamian dudes wanted?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No. I think she's Alan's wife. Stu covers his mouth, oh shit! Vick produces the wallet- sized photos from Alan's wedding, compares them, and nods.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Alan? Wanna step in here, buddy? A second later Alan enters, what's up?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Alan, Chastity. Chastity, Alan. Alan looks down, sees Chastity SNORING on the closet floor, her body all contorted, and freezes. Oh my God.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What...what am I supposed to do?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wake her up, man!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why me?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Because she's your spouse, dude! Scowling, Alan slowly crouches down. Then, a little scared, he nudges her. Nothing. He nudges her harder.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Pinch her tit. It always works. Alan shakes her a bit harder and -- BRRAPPPP -- the girl lets out a massive burp and awakens, COUGHING. Alan jumps back up, terrified. The woman, CHASTITY, looks around, disoriented.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She seems really cool.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, I really like her, man.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So, um, did you take Alan's name?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, are you Chastity Mervish now--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Listen to me. Just...did we, or did we not, have sex last night? Alan braces, please say no, please say no... Vick braces, please say yes, please say yes...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What a responsible, upstanding young Jew. They don't make `em like that anymore, am I right? Chastity smiles, sweet, as she straps on her 6 inch heels.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait-- we didn't use a condom?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Can someone...please open a window?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: They don't open.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, not so much.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, I think your wife's mad at you.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You don't happen to remember what time we met you last night, do you?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's the All-American love story, isn't it? What happened next?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And was Doug with us then?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Interesting... Do you have any idea where we went after the wedding?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Work friends?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You work here? Behind him, Vick SLAPS FIVE with Stu, psyched.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, I don't know how to tell you this, but--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: The Holocaust, man. Alan just stares into space. Vick takes him by the shoulder.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, we can get your grandmother's ring back. We just gotta go about it in the right way.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I have besmirched my people.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Don't be so hard on yourself, dude-- Just then Chastity runs back over with two BLONDE STRIPPERS.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Please...don't. Just then a SPOTLIGHT finds Chastity and Alan, and the SLEAZY PONYTAILED DJ up in the booth comes over the P.A. system:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Twenties?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, I don't know how to say this, but my friends and I were very drunk last night. We would never come to a place like this-- He glances over at Vick and Stu -- but they're gone.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Guys?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You are the best bridesmaids ever.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude: I might not be gay. Then Alan hurries in with Chastity; he looks pissed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What the hell are you doing?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Two-for-ones, man.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We don't have time for this! We gotta find Doug!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What do you think we're doing?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We're getting into the mindset of last night, to see if it sparks any memories. Now: is this exactly how you were dancing for me last night, Starr? She nods. Vick nods, pensive, scientific.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, still no memories. Keep going -- and put your back into it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You are so goddamn selfish, Vick. You really are. Stu, let's go.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No. Stu, sit and enjoy your dance. Stu looks between them, torn.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude: Doug is missing! We have less than 18 hours til his wedding! We do not have time for this!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm trying to save your life here, Alan Mervish.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Vick--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm not kidding, man! Life is one long series of emergencies, and if you don't learn to stop and have a little fun along the way, you're gonna grow into a joyless old prick like your dad. I'm sorry to bring Moshe Mervish into it, but it had to be said. Now yes, we have 18 hours to find Doug -- which means we can afford to spend ten minutes celebrating the special talents of these gifted young body-artists. So sit down, have a jager shot, and smell the goddamn roses for once in your miserable life. Chastity, honey? When you're ready? Chastity pushes Alan onto the red leather banquette and starts dancing for him. He tries to squirm away:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No, look-- I am like totally against this, morally and politically. Plus Becky specifically asked me not to--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think I know why he married her.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Because if he hadn't, I would've. They continue watching on in silence.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Is it weird that we're sitting this close watching?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Not for me. More watching in silence.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I really shouldn't be here. I have daughters. Then both of their heads angle the same way.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Not that can do that.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How can she do that without dislocating her hip?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Because she's been touched by God. They continue staring, amazed. Just then, the door is kicked open and KIKIOLANI and KALOLO FANALUA burst into the Champagne Room, peering through the darkness, looking for our guys. Vick and Stu see them immediately.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Shit. They both hop up. Alan remains sitting, however, hypnotized by Chastity. Vick grabs him.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Alan, come on, man, we gotta go!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Whoa, whoa, I'm smelling the roses-- Vick literally yanks Alan up from the banquette.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Come on, man! We got company! Finally, the Guamians spot the guys and lumber for them!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Chastity, honey, is there a back way out of here?! Thinking fast, Chastity grabs her clothes and darts over to a darkened, unlabeled FIRE DOOR.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Did she just do that in heels?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm really starting to like this girl. The guys all follow suit, sprinting down the runway and leaping over the patrons! Then the Guamians blow through the curtain, panting, very upset. They lumber down the stage -- and the patrons at the end of the runway clear the hell out of the way.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Did you see them trample those tiny Japanese businessmen?! I think they killed like four of them! Everyone laughs. Vick puts his arm around Alan.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Come on, Alan: tell me that wasn't just a little fun...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That was...a little fun. Vick smiles -- just as a LAS VEGAS POLICE CAR hops the curb, lights flashing, and cuts them off! Two mustachioed COPS get out and hurry for them, pointing, intense.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No idea.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Ditto. Officer Bladen SLAMS the table with his fist.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Whatever we did, we're so sorry!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Honestly, man, I will confess to anything you want!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu: stop talking. Alan: sit up straight. Officer Merriweather, I've told you twelve times now: we have no memory of last night. Now either charge us with a crime, or let us go. Merriweather scowls and nods at Bladen, who steps over to a TELEVISION and turns it on. Merriweather, meanwhile, pulls out a photograph of a slick ASIAN MAN in a red suit, slides it onto the table.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Nothing?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Who is he?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my god--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Did we kill someone last night--?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We have no idea who this man is.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, that's right. ON THE TELEVISION, grainy surveillance camera footage of a birthday party starts playing. In the video, JIMMY LANG sits in an upscale restaurant, in front of a BIRTHDAY CAKE, as a table full of hip ASIAN GUYS serenade him with "Happy Birthday To You." When the guys sitting next to Jimmy lean forward to help him blow out the candles on his cake, however, we see that it's Vick, ALAN, STU, DOUG, and some BLACK GUY, all very drunk!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I love you, Jimmy Lang! Merriweather FREEZES FRAME on Vick kissing the top of Jimmy Lang's shaved head. In the interrogation room, Vick, Stu and Alan sit, frozen. Silence.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We're in a lot of trouble, aren't we.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Officers, I swear, we have no memory of that ever occurring--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh no, sir, please don't!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We have a very important wedding--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know Jimmy Lang. Everyone stops, looks at Vick.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You do?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jimmy and I tried to raise capital for Girl-nasium, a 24 hour fitness center and day spa for tween-age girls, but it never got off the ground. It was an entirely legitimate enterprise -- I had no idea he was a criminal. We must've bumped into him last night, and he must've invited us to join his birthday celebration. No crime in that, is there, Officers? Merriweather gets in Vick's face, intense.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu might. Stu shakes his head, unbelievable.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Now: are you gonna charge us with something, or are we free to go? The cops look at each other, scowling. Beat.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, thank you, Officers!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It was really nice meeting you--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Did you have to be such a dick?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We got out, didn't we?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, four hours later! If we'd just cooperated with them--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: If we'd cooperated with them, we'd be in jail right now, Alan. They reach the curb, and Stu starts trying to hail a cab. Desperation is setting in.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What are we gonna do now? We've got zero leads on where Doug is!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why hasn't he called? It's 8:30. The guys shake their heads, I don't know.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Do you think he's okay--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu, don't. Doug is fine.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I mean, we were hanging out with mobsters last night, man! They kill people for looking at `em weird--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu: Doug is fine.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Or what if we like drove Doug out to the desert and left him, just as like a funny prank--?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu! Enough!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What did you just say?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I said I knew I shouldn't have come this weekend, Vick!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Is that right?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, that's right. I only came because Doug insisted. Vick steps towards Alan, heated.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why do think you're so much better than us, dude?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't -- I just think I'm better than you, Vick! And trust me, it's not that hard! You haven't changed one bit since high school! Jesus, you're 28 years old and you still talk back to cops?! Really?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You're out of your depth, Alan--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And you're still the one getting us in trouble! Only then it was hiding your weed in our locker, and now you've got us partying with wanted felons! It's not cute anymore, man! We're too old for this! Vick scowls; this is actually hitting home...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And all your stupid get-rich-quick schemes?! Girl-nasium?! Custard?! In Los Angeles?! Are you joking?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, let's all take a breath--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: When's the last time you had a real job, man?! When's the last time you had a girlfriend?! Hell, when's the last time you picked up the check?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What's so great about any of those things?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Those "things," Vick, are what grown men do! Vick swallows, furious.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, we're all tired and hungry--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: None of us ever liked you, Alan! We only hung out with you because Doug made us! Alan recoils, whoa, stung. This is clearly news to him.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stu...? Is that true? Stu gestures, uncomfortable, enh, who's to say? Alan nods, I see, his face reddening.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why would anyone like you, dude? Have you ever thought about that? You're uptight, you're judgemental, you're cheap, and yet somehow you think you're sweeter than everyone else! Well look around, man: no one wants to be you! I'd rather be Stu than you!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait, what--? Too late: Alan charges Vick and TACKLES him onto the lawn! They roll on the ground, trying to punch each other, but it ends up being a mess of half-chops, pulled hair, and hands in each other's faces...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I've...always...hated you...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You punch like...your sister... Stu runs over and jumps in, trying to break them apart.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, no! Time out! We all need a time out--! THUNK! Stu is accidentally kicked in the face and goes down. Alan and Vick continue rolling on the lawn, trying to beat the crap out of each other. They could be kids again. Then, just when it starts getting way too intense,

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Good call on happy hour, Chastity. These tacos kick ass.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey -- how'd you start Vick's car?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That's funny, because Alan's daddy taught him tax law. Chastity smiles, a little confused. Alan is quick to retort:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And Vick's daddy taught him how to get really drunk at his kid's soccer games and then piss himself.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's a disease, dude--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Guys, come on! For Doug?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: "Number blocked."

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What if it's Doug?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What if it's Tracy?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Good evening, this is Stu!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's Tracy! Vick glares at Alan. Alan looks away, shit.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why is she calling me?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Because she knows you're the most easily tricked.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We have tell her we lost Doug.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No we don't! Tell her nothing, Stu! Stu turns back to the phone, rattled.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey, Trace! W-What's going on?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wow, that sounds amazing!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Ummmm........Hang on. She wants to know where Doug is!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm working on it! Buy us some time!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No, just tell her the truth! Honesty is always the best policy!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What are you, retarded?! Honesty is never the best policy! Especially not with brides!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Um, what'd you say?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, um, hang on. She still wants to know!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay: tell her Alan got really drunk last night and fell down, and the doctor said not to move him for a few hours, but that we'll be back in time for the wedding.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why do I have to be the one that fell over drunk?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's a fictitious canard, Alan, get over yourself! Stu: tell her!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Listen, Tracy, Alan fell on a

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Fell over drunk.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: H-He was drunk. And the doctor -- a different doctor, not the one he fell on -- he said we couldn't move him until the wedding--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: For a few hours! We'll be home before the wedding!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: But we're going to have the wedding at your home-- Tracy just looks really confused. Exasperated, Vick rips the phone away from Stu.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Tracy?! Vick! How are ya, hon?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Nothing! Stu is a moron. Listen, Alan hurt his back last night, so we're gonna be laid up here for a bit, but I promise we'll have Doug home in time for the wedding, okay?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes, luckily he had a steel rod surgically implanted up his ass at birth, so the doctors anticipate a complete and swift recovery. Alan flips him the bird.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What? No! No, you can't actually, Doug...Doug is out.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Where is he? He's aaaat...the pharmacy. Yeah, picking up Alan's medications. Listen, Trace, I'm losing you, but we'll see you tomorrow, okay? Bye, sweetie--! Vick hangs up and nods confidently.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She bought it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Perfect. We just told Tracy we'd have Doug home in 13 hours, and we still have no idea where he is... They pass a DOORMAN on their way out, who's standing with a stamp and a UV light reader.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Maybe we should go back to the hotel and--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God, guys! Look! Stu holds his hand under the UV light -- it's covered in STAMPS from all the clubs they've been to the night before! Stu yanks up his sleeve to reveal his ENTIRE FOREARM GLOWS, completely covered with stamps! The guys hurry back and slide their forearms under the UV light, too: they all have the same stamps! Their eyes alight:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's like a map of last night! The guys look at each other, hope returning to their faces!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Where do you want to start?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: At the top! We hit every club we went to til someone remembers what we did with Doug!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Nice clue, Stuey! I can't believe we're actually gonna pull this off! Stu grins over at the car next to them. Then he stops.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey: is that guy wearing Doug's hat?! The guys look over to see that the DRIVER of the next car over is, in fact, wearing the DISTINCTIVE FEDORA-STYLE HAT Doug was wearing last night. The guy turns off the Strip.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Naaah, couldn't be.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Lots of people have hats like that. Stu nods, yeah, I guess...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: All right, this is the last place we went, "Chaps." Vick rolls to a stop in front of...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You sure we came here...? Then they look up at the marquee. It reads "CHAPS: HOME OF

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: The Golden Pony. That's us.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Maybe I'll just wait in the car-- But Vick is already shoving Stu out of the car.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You think we would've remembered this...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, I don't think we came here...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Then why is your underwear nailed to the wall? The guys turn to see numerous pairs of MEN'S UNDERWEAR nailed to the wall nearby. A sign above it reads "CHAPS WALL OF FAME." We recognize Stu's COLORADO STATE BOXERS.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Those could be anybody's. Thousands of people go to Colorado State--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God, are they autographed?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I am so gay... Just then, a BUFF WAITER in assless chaps blows by, smiling.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: R-Roger?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stay very close to me. She smiles and dances through the crowd.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh. G-Good, thanks...?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We're going to love you either way, Stu... Stu nods, focussed, nervous, like before a big game.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Some of my best friends are gay.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Is that true?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Not...not really? I live in Connecticut, man, we don't even have black people yet. Stu nods, right. Then, after steeling himself, he enters...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Excuse me, friend, can you tell me where Roger is?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He's cute...I guess...? Stu shrugs, yeah, I guess...? As they draw close, Roger sees them, and smiles.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my god.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Listen, man, we don't really remember what happened last night, can you fill us in?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Did we...you know...do anything?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Was I...the boy or the girl?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait-- what?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You insisted?! Why'd you insist?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't know! I don't know why I insisted!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm really not sure we can be friends anymore... Finally, Chastity starts LAUGHING.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Not cool, Roger. Not cool.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So what did happen last night?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Really? Doug did?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: The guy from the Jimmy Lang surveillance video. The guys nod, right.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No! That's cool, I don't need to see it--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We must see that video.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm a Dad, I-I don't get to the gym as much as I'd like...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Annnnd that would explain the searing ass pain.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And what time was all this?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And our Doug was with us?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait, so we left with Doug at 4:45, we got back to the hotel at 5:00, and Doug was gone by 5:30 when Chastity met back up with us?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That doesn't make any sense.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Did we lose him along the way?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He was passed out, how far could he have gone--? Just then, Vick's cellphone rings. The caller ID reads "MANDALAY BAY." He answers:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hello?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Atashir, many greetings to you.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?! Are you sure it's him?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh thank you, Atashir! You are a man of great honor! A thousand blessings upon your ancestors! Vick SLAMS his phone shut, overjoyed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Doug is in the room! A maid just found him! He's passed out, but he's okay!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: They're sure it's him?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Atashir swears it is! The guys all laugh, a massive weight lifted.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh thank God he's okay...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: After all this?! He's in the room?! They keep laughing and hug each other, heartfelt. Vick even hugs Roger.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't even care! Hug me, you big shiny homosexual!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That was cool of Roger to give you all the tapes of your performance.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know, if I actually was gay, I'd totally date Roger first. What a gentle soul. They get into Vick's clunker.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How we doing on time?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We'll be in LA by dawn. I told you bitches this would all work out... They drive off into the night, grins all around.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This has officially been the craziest weekend of my life. Thanks for all your help. You were awesome.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm sorry about all this, Chastity.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Beg pardon?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, well, I'm sorry, Jennifer.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Where you from?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh yeah?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You fly out every week?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Kid?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: They always have kids.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No kids. Same girlfriend for 14 years. Becky. Alan shows her a photo of Becky on his cellphone.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We like you way better.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Becky is great.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Becky collects teapots.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, she's a total canwego.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You know, she's the girl at the party who's always like "Can we go? Can we go?" Chastity laughs. Alan does too, shaking his head.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She has low blood sugar.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She has low fun sugar.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, guys! This is the girl I'm going to marry! If, you know...she forgives me for cheating on her...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Wait: you're going to tell her?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Of course I'm going to tell her! I could never keep something like that from her.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, she still hasn't forgiven me for scratching her Queensryche CD in sixth grade -- she's neeeeever gonna forgive you for marrying a stripper in Vegas.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, then that's just the price I'm going to have to pay. Alan looks off, stoic. Chastity pats his hand, proud.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She's gonna cut your dick off, dude.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Keep `er close, Paco. We'll be right back.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Doug! Wake up, man!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Uh-oh. The door SLAMS behind them, and they whip around to see KIKIOLANI standing in front of the door, blocking their exit. He has an identical CAST on his right arm.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Not good. Just then, a toilet FLUSHES and an immensely large man in a red suit exits the bathroom, drying his hands. We recognize him from his police photo as crime boss JIMMY LANG, 50's.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Where is Doug?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Listen, Mr. Lang, whatever we did last night, we are incredibly sorry-

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What's going on, Vick? Vick stammers, trying to find the words...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, Vick...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How could you do this to us, man? We're your best friends... Vick looks away, ashamed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: They were gonna hurt me, man...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can get it! I can! I just--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You have Doug?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes! Yes. Jimmy nods and heads for the door. The Samoans follow him.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: M-M-Mr. Lang?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: H-How much does Vick owe?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: 200 thousand dollars?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How the hell could you blow that kind of money?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Was it for the custard store?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, Stu, wake up! There is no custard store! Vick was just trying to rip us off to pay back Jimmy Lang!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Is that true, Vick? Vick just stares out at the city, not denying it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Were any of your deals...real?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, I manage an Applebee's, that money meant something to me... Vick spins around, furious:

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Do you really think I wanted my life to turn out like this, Stu?! Do you really think I don't know that I'm a massive loser?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, you guys got out of high school and you just knew what to do, you went to college and got good jobs and found cool wives and made beautiful children -- what do I have to show for the last decade of my life?! Nothing! Vick swats a lamp off a nearby end-table -- it SMASHES against the wall! The guys freeze. Tense silence. Vick grows emotional.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, I'm almost 30, and the only thing I really have...the only thing I really have is you guys.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Come on, Vick--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No, man, it's true! I put on a good show, but my life is so goddamn hollow and vapid and lonely, it scares me, man. I-I don't know how much longer I can keep this scam going. And now I've gone and ruined the one good thing I had... Tears threaten in his eyes. He wipes at them, angry.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Just...please don't give up on me, okay? I-I don't know what I'd do without you guys. I really don't... Alan and Stu exchange a look. They've never seen brash, cocky Vick this vulnerable before. Stu can't help but give in.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Come on, man, we've been bro's since third grade, it's gonna take a lot more than money to ruin our friendship. Vick looks down, deeply touched...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What I don't understand is why you didn't just ask me for the money. I would've given you every last cent I had, man...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I love you, man.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Love you too, bro. Love you too. They hug tight. For a while.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Also, I banged your sister sophomore year. Vick pulls away.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Sorry. Just seemed like a good time to tell you. Vick stammers at Stu, speechless.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She had just broken up with that guy from Central, we were playing "I Never" at Tim Donahee's pool, one thing lead to another--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No! No. That's...that's plenty. Vick desperately tries to clear the image from his mind. Alan just frowns at his watch, stressed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, I'm glad we're all sharing, but we've got three hours to come up with 200 grand, or else... The guys nod, frowning, back on point.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'd offer to take a loan out, but it's 3 o'clock in the morning, I'm pretty sure my bank is closed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think I can get a 20 grand cash advance on my credit card...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So that just leaves 180 grand... The guys frown at each other.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Time check!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: 12 minutes.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Chip check!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Faster! Come on chip check!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Dude, how many Red Bulls have you had?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I stopped counting at six! I can hear my heart beating in my head! Alan finishes counting the chips -- and frowns.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Just over 100 grand. The guys wince, damn.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: There's only one thing left to do. They all exchange a knowing look...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You sure we don't want red?! What if the ball lands on red--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Shut up, Stu.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can't watch! My heart's gonna explode! Can your heart even explode?! Because I think my heart is gonna explode! I can't watch! The ball lands. Dead silence.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's red, isn't it?! I knew it! Tell me it's not red!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's not red... Stu turns, ecstatic--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's green. The ball has stopped on green, DOUBLE ZERO. Stu clutches his chest, like he's having a seizure. Vick inhales, grim. Alan slowly drops to his knees. Chastity closes her eyes. Their HUGE PILE OF CHIPS is raked off the table...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No...It might get a little dangerous. I wouldn't want... He trails off. Chastity nods.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Thanks for all your help. Awkward silence. The cold desert wind blows.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, probably not... Alan looks genuinely sad.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We gotta go, man. Alan nods, yeah, and gets in the car...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yep, just driving out to the middle of desert to meet some mobsters, what could possibly go wrong...? The guys all frown.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So what's our plan?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I think we should tell Mr. Lang that we couldn't get the money, but that, if he's amenable, we could create a payment calendar--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We're gonna give Jimmy a dummy bag of money, grab Doug, and make a run for it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yes, good! What an airtight plan--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jimmy Lang doesn't do payment calendars, Alan! Trust me: this is our only shot of getting Doug back! Left turn! Vick skids onto Highway 12 -- a barely labelled dirt road. Things are quickly going from bad to worse...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This all the cash we got? The guys frown at their empty wallets, yeah. We are

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This is the dumbest plan ever.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Alan I need you positive please.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Here they come. They all look up to see a WHITE YUKON approaching on the far horizon, kicking up a trail of dust. The guys tense up.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Stuart?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: There's an emergency bottle of tequila in my glove box. Get it out please. Stu opens the glovebox, pulls out a bottle of Patron. He opens it, takes a swig, then passes it to Vick, who takes a pull and passes it to Alan, who also drinks. They all watch the white Yukon draw ever closer.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can't believe this is how we're going to die... The Yukon pulls up about ten yards away. No one moves. The Yukon's doors open... The Cadillac's doors open... TIGHT ON the Jimmy Lang's RED BOOT as it hits the road...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Let's see Doug! Jimmy Lang nods to Kalolo, who opens the back door of the Yukon and pulls out a GUY with his hands tied behind his back and a plastic RALPH'S BAG over his head; he struggles a bit. The guys look a bit alarmed.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jesus, what'd they do to him?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Pull off the Ralph's bag! Jimmy yanks the bag off of the guy's head to reveal

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Who the hell is that?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God: it's the other Doug! Roger's friend, the cake designer!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, you got the wrong Doug, man!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, man, our Doug is white!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't know what to tell you, bro, this isn't the Doug we requested!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my God Oh my God Oh my God...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Christ that hurts!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm being shot at! I'm being shot at!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my god, is he okay?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Who cares! Go go! Alan floors the car while Stu and Vick SPRINT and DIVE in! The caddy peels the hell out of there, kicking up rocks and dust! The Guamians FIRE after them!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can't believe you just saved my life!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I can't believe you just drove my car into Jimmy Lang! Alan drives, his eyes as big as saucers.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He's gonna be really upset!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, I was just thinking that!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Now can we call Tracy?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah. It's probably time.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Who wants to make the call? Beat. Then Vick reaches for his nose, odd man out. Stu and Alan immediately reach for their noses, too. It's close.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That was you!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What?! No! I beat you by a mile!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Vick, who won?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, I'll be damned... Vick grabs the bottle of Patron, takes a long swig. Beat.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I still can't believe Stu banged my sister. Vick hands the bottle to Alan, gets out, and makes for the pay phone...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: In the desert, on the pay phone, looking through his busted aviators into the rising sun.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Tracy, it's Vick.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Listen, honey...The bachelor party got a little out of control and, well...we lost Doug.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, that's not gonna happen...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, I'm really sorry, Trace. This is all my fault--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What the--?! Alan gets on the phone with Tracy, his heart racing.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Tracy, it's Alan! Hey, Vick is just joking around! We've got Doug right here! Vick looks like: what?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know, Vick is such a prick! We'll see you at the wedding! Bye! Alan hangs up and races back to the car. Vick follows.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: What are you doing?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I know where Doug is!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Remember when we saw Doug's bed impaled on the griffin thing?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, we threw it out the window.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No: the windows don't open, remember?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: So how did--?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't get it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And that's why we've been seeing Doug's clothes all over Vegas! He was trying to signal someone!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I don't believe it...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I-I still don't get it--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And it totally jives with the timeline, right?! We brought Doug back to the hotel at 5:00, he was passed out...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: It's so obvious!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Not...to me...so much?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: How'd you figure it out?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: The Patron, man! It reminded me of our first drink of the night!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Honestly, dude, you're a genius.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He's on the roof! Stu looks confused, the roof?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: After Doug passed out, we must've taken him up there in his bed as a prank, so he'd wake up on the roof or whatever? Then we forgot him.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: And all day he's been throwing his crap off the roof, trying to signal someone to get him down!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You think he's still up there?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Only one way to find out...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh my god, I'm so glad you're okay!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, no, that's cool!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah, you have every right to be upset! We validate your anger!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Why'd you do it, sweet Atashir?! Why did you betray us?!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Fair enough! See you next time, you beautiful Judas! They blow out of the hotel...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: No flights to LA with empty seats!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, we can't drive! It's 350 miles to LA and the wedding starts at 10, which is in--

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: --three hours! Beat. Then Vick, Stu and Alan exchange a look...a smile slowly creeps across their faces.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Look, Doug, I think I speak for everyone in the car when I say I'm really sorry about locking you on the roof of the hotel.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You gotta admit, it's a pretty funny prank... I mean, up until the part when we forgot all about you. Doug just stares out at the desert in stony silence.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: He's still not talking to us.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Totally understandable, man. Whenever you're ready...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Sorry, Mapquest took us a crazy route. We ready to do this thing? The bridesmaids sit up, stunned.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She looks beautiful, man.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: That's cool. I get it.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We did it, fellahs. We pulled it off.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I never had a doubt. They LAUGH. Alan smiles, more relaxed than we've ever seen him. They sip champagne and watch Doug and Tracy enjoy their first dance on the dance floor.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: You think Doug's ever going to talk to us again?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Give him time.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Yeah. Like a decade or two-- Then Stu sees someone approaching over Alan's shoulder.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Uh-oh. The guys all look over to see

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Hey Beck--!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I-I'm so sorry, I can explain-- Then there's a WOMAN'S VOICE behind them.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: This just got complicated...

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Jennifer? Chastity smiles that he called her by her real name.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: She's my wife. Becky's jaw drops. Chastity smiles slightly. Stu and Vick grin, oh shit!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We don't make each other happy anymore, Beck. And we can keep not making each other happy for another 14 years -- hell, maybe even another 50 years -- but let's not. Let's find people who make our hearts race. Let's be excited and fun and alive again... Alan looks at Becky, sincere, honest. Beat.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I'm sorry, Beck. I really am. Can I buy you a free drink? Chastity smiles, takes his arm, and they walk off together towards the bar.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Let's start with dinner, and see where it goes...?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Oh, I missed you guys so much!

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Okay, okay, I'll go with you. Just...don't ruin the wedding. Then JIMMY LANG enters the bathroom on RED CRUTCHES.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Um, what...?

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: I will pay you back, you know.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Damn straight you will! They all LAUGH.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: Well, Alan married a stripper, Stu went gay, and I learned a very important life lesson from an obese hoodlum.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We'll tell you the whole story when you get back from your honeymoon.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: We really are sorry, man. Doug nods, I know. Vick raises his cocktail.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: To Doug and Tracy.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: To Doug and Tracy.

title: Hangover-The
dialogue: To Doug and Tracy.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This, is Berk. It's twelve days North of hopeless, and a few degrees South of freezing to death. It's located solidly on the meridian of misery. The camera drifts over rolling hills to reveal a small village nestled on an outcropping of sea mounts.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: My village. In a word, sturdy. And it's been here for seven generations, but every single building is new. The camera drifts closer, circling.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: We have fishing, hunting, and a charming view of the sunsets. The only problems are the pests. You see, most places have mice or mosquitos. We have... Sheep graze peacefully on a hillside. Suddenly one is snatched.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ...dragons.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Most people would leave. Not us. We're Vikings. We have stubbornness issues. Vikings sound the alarm. Viking men and women pour out into the streets, axes in hand. ON HICCUP darting through alleys, staying under eaves, making his way through the battle.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: My name's Hiccup. Great name, I know. But it's not the worst. Parents believe a hideous name will frighten off gnomes and trolls. Like our charming Viking demeanor wouldn't do that. Dragons sweep back and forth, dodging axes and blasting the Vikings who throw them. A burly warrior gets tossed in an explosion, knocking Hiccup to the ground.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Meet the neighbors. Hoark the Haggard...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... Burnthair the Broad...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... Phlegma the Fierce...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: . Ack. He passes a silent ox of a viking, picking his ear.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yep, just Ack. Enter STOICK, the biggest Viking of all. He yanks Hiccup from the path of a strafing dragon and holds aloft to the crowd.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup!? What is he doing out again?!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yes I do. An EXPLOSION forces Vikings to DUCK. Stoick stands firm, brushing flaming debris off of his shoulder.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: What have we got?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Any Night Furies?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Who me? Nah, come on! I'm way too muscular for their taste. They wouldn't know what to do with all this. Hiccup strikes a bodybuilder pose.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: The meathead with attitude and interchangeable hands is Gobber. I've been his apprentice ever since I was little. Well...littler.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: We move to the lower defenses. We'll counter-attack with the catapults.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: See? Old village. Lots and lots of new houses.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh and that's Fishlegs, Snotlout. The twins Ruffnut and Tuffnut. And...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Their job is so much cooler. Hiccup tries to join them as they pass, but he's hooked by Gobber and hoisted back inside.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Please, two minutes. I'll kill a dragon. My life will get infinitely better. I might even get a date.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay fine, but... He rushes to the back corner of the stall and presents a bizarre, wheel barrow-like contraption.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... this will throw it for me. Hiccup OPENS the hinged lid of the device. An arm springs up, equipped with twin bows. They prematurely launch a bola, narrowly missing Gobber... and taking out a Viking at the counter.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Mild calibration issue.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You, sir, are playing a dangerous game. Keeping this much, raw...Vikingness contained.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: One day I'll get out there. Because killing a dragon is everything around here.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: A Nadder head is sure to get me at least noticed. The Nadders clamber onto the building, tearing the roof and walls apart. Sheep pour out and SCATTER. Elsewhere, hippo-like Gronckles pick drying racks clean of fish and fly off like loaded pelicans.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Gronckles are tough. Taking down one of those would definitely get me a girlfriend. A stealthy, snake-like dragon head peeks over a rooftop, breathing gas into a chimney.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: A Zippelback? Exotic, exciting. Two heads, twice the status. A second head pokes through the door and lights it. KABLAM! The two heads fly through the explosion, their necks zipping together to reveal a single body. It flies past Stoick as he climbs to the top of a CATAPULT

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And then there's the Monstrous Nightmare. Only the best Vikings go after those. They have this nasty habit of setting themselves on fire. It emerges from the flames, climbing the catapult with a leering, toothy grin.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Reload! I'll take care of this. Stoick takes on the Nightmare, face to hammer. Suddenly, a LOUD BALLISTIC MOANING streaks overhead. The catapult crew ducks.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: But the ultimate prize is the dragon no one has ever seen. We call it the--

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This thing never steals food, never shows itself, and... The sound recedes, leaving the crippled catapult in flames.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ...never misses.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I know. Be right back!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Mind yourselves! The devils still have some juice in them.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh I hit it! Yes, I hit it! Did anybody see that? Hiccup's victory is short-lived. A Monstrous Nightmare appears, slithering up over the lip of the cliff.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Except for you. ON STOICK, holding down the netted Nadders. He hears a familiar HOLLER and looks up to see... HICCUP running through the PLAZA, SCREAMING, with the NIGHTMARE fast on his heels. Alarmed, Stoick abandons the Nadders and runs off.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: (to his men, re: the

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You're all out. He smashes the Nightmare repeatedly in the face, driving it away. It takes to the air and disappears. Winded, Stoick turns to Hiccup.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh, and there's one more thing you need to know...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Sorry, dad.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: It's not like the last few times, Dad. I mean I really actually hit it. You guys were busy and I had a very clear shot. It went down, just off Raven Point. Let's get a search party out there, before it--

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: --STOP! Just....stop. He releases Hiccup. Everyone goes silent, staring expectantly.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Every time you step outside, disaster follows. Can you not see that I have bigger problems? Winter's almost here and I have an entire village to feed! Hiccup looks around. All eyes are upon him.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Between you and me, the village could do with a little less feeding, don't ya think? A few rotund Vikings stir self-consciously.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This isn't a joke, Hiccup!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I can't stop myself. I see a dragon and I have to just... kill it, you know? It's who I am, Dad.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You are many things, Hiccup. But a dragon killer is not one of them. Sting. Hiccup looks around to see many nods of agreement.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Get back to the house.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Thank you, thank you. I was trying, so... Hiccup avoids Astrid's glare and heads up toward a large house, standing prominently on the hill above the others.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I really did hit one.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: He never listens.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And when he does, it's always with this... disappointed scowl. Like someone skimped on the meat in his sandwich.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Thank you, for summing that up. They reach the doorway.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I just want to be one of you guys. Gobber eyes him sympathetically. Hiccup turns and goes through the front door. And straight out the back door. He hurries off into the woods, determined.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Either we finish them or they'll finish us! It's the only way we'll be rid of them! If we find the nest and destroy it, the dragons will leave. They'll find another home.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Alright. Those who stay will look after Hiccup. Hands jut into the air, volunteers galore. Enthusiastic murmurs of prep and packing fill the room.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, I need you to stay and train some new recruits.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: What am I going to do with him Gobber?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, I'm serious.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: He'd be killed before you let the first dragon out of its cage.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I do know that, actually.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, actually I do.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Listen! You know what he's like. From the time he could crawl he's been...different. He doesn't listen.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Has the attention span of a sparrow. I take him fishing and he goes hunting for... for trolls.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: When I was a boy...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: My father told me to bang my head against a rock and I did it. I thought it was crazy, but I didn't question him. And you know what happened?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: That rock split in two. It taught me what a Viking could do, Gobber. He could crush mountains, level forests, tame seas! Even as a boy, I knew what I was, what I had to become.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uggh, the gods hate me. Some people lose their knife or their mug. No, not me. I manage to lose an entire dragon. Hiccup WHACKS a low-hanging branch. It SNAPS back at him, hitting him in the face. He looks up to see a snapped tree trunk. His eyes follow it to a long trench of up-turned earth. He follows it to a downed, black dragon, its body and tail tangled in a bola. It appears dead. Hiccup approaches, beaming.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I have brought down this mighty beast! It suddenly shifts.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Whoa! Hiccup springs back, terrified. He turns his blade on it. Rattled, Hiccup creeps along the length of the weak, wounded dragon, dagger poised to strike. As he reaches the head, Hiccup finds the Night Fury staring coldly at him. Hiccup tries to look away, but he's drawn back to its unnerving, unflinching stare. With the dragon safety tangled in the ropes, Hiccup jabs with his dagger, puffing himself up with false bravado.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm going to kill you, Dragon. I'm gonna cut out your heart and take it to my father. I'm a Viking.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I did this. He turns to leave. Pauses. And glances back at the dragon, chest heaving. Hiccup GRUMBLES. He checks over his shoulder to ensure that no one is watching... then hurries back to cut the ropes. The Night Fury's eye shoots open. With the dragon watching his every move, Hiccup hurriedly saws through the bola ropes. As the last rope falls free, the Night Fury suddenly POUNCES! In a blur, the dragon is upon him, pinning Hiccup down, grazing his neck. Looking like it's about to kill him. Hiccup is paralyzed. The dragon's breath ruffles his hair. Hiccup opens his eyes to find the Night Fury's wolf-like stare boring into him. The exchange is intense, profound. The dragon draws a deep breath, as though it's about to torch him, then lets out an ear-piercing scream instead. It turns and takes flight, flapping violently through the canopy of trees. It bashes against a nearby mountain side, recovers, and drops out of view some distance away. Winded, Hiccup struggles to his feet, staggers a few steps, collapses to his knees, and faints.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I, uh... I have to talk to you, Dad.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I need to speak with you too, son. Hiccup and Stoick STRAIGHTEN at the same moment.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You go first.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, you go first.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Alright. You get your wish. Dragon training. You start in the morning.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: --You'll need this. Stoick hands Hiccup his axe. Hiccup avoids taking it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I don't want to fight dragons.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Come on. Yes, you do.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Rephrase. Dad I can't kill dragons.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: But you will kill dragons.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, I'm really very extra sure that I won't.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: It's time Hiccup.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Can you not hear me?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This is serious son! Stoick forces the axe into Hiccup's hands. Its weight drags him down. He looks up to see Stoick under-lit with firelight.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: When you carry this axe... you carry all of us with you. Which means you walk like us. You talk like us. You think like us. No more of...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You just gestured to all of me.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Deal?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This conversation is feeling very one-sided.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Good. Train hard. I'll be back. Probably.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And I'll be here. Maybe. Stoick heads out the door, leaving Hiccup holding the axe.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah, no kidding, right? Pain. Love it. The recruits turn to see Hiccup behind them. Groans all around.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: A doctor?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Well this was stupid. SUDDENLY, the NIGHT FURY blasts past him. Hiccup recoils, watching the massive beast struggle to climb the walls. It flaps violently, then peels away to a rough landing. The dragon is trapped. Hiccup grins, excited to see it again, and slips closer. He watches as the dragon, exhausted and frustrated, leaps into the air, beating its wings furiously. Again and again, it rolls uncontrolled and CRASHES heavily. As if remembering to snap a photo, Hiccup pulls a leather- bound book and flips past drawings of weapons to a blank page. He sketches the dragon quickly, desperate to record the image. The Fury claws at the steep rock walls, trying climb out of the cove. It SLIPS and falls hard, crushing several saplings. The Fury rolls back to his feet and slowly crawls to the water's edge. He spots fish in the shallow water and snaps at them... but comes up empty. He lowers his head, looking weakened.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: So I guess we'll share--

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: All mine then. Wow, so okay. I'll

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Tomorrow.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Dragon classifications. Strike class. Fear class. Mystery class. Hiccup turns the page.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Thunderdrum. This reclusive dragon inhabits sea caves and dark tide pools.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: When startled, the Thunderdrum produces a concussive sound that can kill a man at close range. Extremely dangerous. Kill on sight. Hiccup's eyes drift to a lurid illustration of decapitated Vikings. Another page, another dragon.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Timberjack. This gigantic creature has razor sharp wings that can slice through full grown trees...extremely dangerous. Kill on sight. The illustrations seem to take on a life of their own, shifting and squirming in the candlelight.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Scauldron. Sprays scalding water at its victim. Extremely dangerous. The storm outside rages against the shuttered windows. Hiccup is startled, but presses on.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Changewing. Even newly hatched dragons can spray acid. Kill on sight. He begins flipping through the pages. A blur of dragons...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Gronckle. Zippleback. The Skrill. Bone Knapper. Whispering Death. Burns its victims. Buries its victims. Chokes its victims. Turns its victims inside-out. Extremely dangerous. Extremely dangerous. Kill on sight. Kill on sight. Kill on sight... Hiccup finally lands upon the page he's been looking for.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Night Fury. It's BLANK -- no image, save for a few, sparse details.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Speed unknown. Size unknown. The unholy offspring of lightning and death itself.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Never engage this dragon. Your only chance, hide and pray it does not find you. Hiccup pulls his sketchbook out of his vest and opens it to his drawing of Toothless. He lays it over the book's blank page and considers it. CLOSE ON the drawing of Toothless...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I can almost smell them. They're close. Steady. Stoick raises his gaze to... AN EPIC FOG BANK, towering from sky to sea like a bruised, daunting curtain, beyond which nothing is visible. The three ships drift alongside it, skirting its solid edge, looking for an opening. ON DECK the crewmen mill nervously, all too aware of what Stoick is considering.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Take us in. The helmsman steers Stoick's ship into the fog. The men draw their weapons, prepping for the worst.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You know, I just happened to notice the book had nothing on Night Furies. Is there another book? Or a sequel? Maybe a little Night Fury pamphlet? KABLAM! A blast takes the axe head off of Hiccup's hilt, leaving a smoking hole behind him. Hiccup YELPS and RUNS.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hey, so how would one sneak up on a Night Fury?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I know, I know, but hypothetically...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: They probably take the daytime off. You know, like a cat. Has anyone ever seen one napping?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Just... let me... why don't you... The Nadder spins around and races back toward them like a Raptor. Astrid untangles herself and tries to pull her axe from Hiccup's shield... which is attached to his limp, gangly arm. She PLANTS her foot on his torso and YANKS the axe free, still burrowed into the shield.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Huh. Toothless. I could've sworn you had... A set of razor sharp teeth emerge from its gums to grab the fish. Toothless snatches and gnashes it up, swallowing it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... teeth. The teeth retract again. Toothless presses closer with an expectant look. Hiccup retreats nervously.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh, no. No, I don't have any more. The Fury backs Hiccup against a rock, placing himself the same position as before. The dragon closes in over him, staring blankly. A tense moment passes... then Toothless regurgitates a chunk of fish onto Hiccup's lap. They exchange stares. Hiccup realizes what Toothless wants him to do. Hiccup crouches slowly and squeamishly picks it up. The dragon waits expectantly. Hiccup gags and gnaws off a bite of the slimy fish. He forces a smile. Toothless mimics him. Amazed, Hiccup sits up and tries to touch him. Toothless HISSES and flaps off to a crash on the other side of the cove. He BLASTS the mossy ground to a red-hot temperature... and curls up on it like a giant dog. He turns to find Hiccup seated beside him. Toothless tolerates his persistent presence... until Hiccup tries to touch his damaged tail. Toothless SNAPS at him. Hiccup takes the hint and leaves.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hey Toothless. I brought breakfast. I hope you're hungry. Hiccup drops the basket and kicks it over. Fish spill out.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay, that's disgusting. Toothless approaches, settling in to devour the feast.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh..we've got some salmon... Toothless swallows it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... some nice Icelandic cod... Swallows those too.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... and a whole smoked eel. Toothless nabs it, chews a few times, then spits it out. He shakes his head violently, snorts and scrubs his massive tongue on the sand. Hiccup takes note.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, no, no! It's okay. Yeah, I don't like eel much either. Toothless focuses on the remainder. With the dragon distracted, Hiccup unwraps his prosthetic fin and opens it like a fan.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay. That's it. That's it, just stick with good stuff. And don't you mind me. I'll just be back...here. Minding my own business. Hiccup cautiously approaches the injured tail, but every time he gets near it, Toothless sweeps it away like a cat.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: It's okay. Hiccup drops a knee on top of the tail. Toothless' head juts up, slows its chewing to a halt.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay...okay.. The dragon tenses, slowly spreading his wings. Hiccup straps the prosthetic fin in place. He cinches the straps.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Woah! No! No! No! Hiccup struggles to hold on to the tail. As the ground speeds away, Toothless immediately TIPS into a uncontrolled bank and dive. Hiccup sees the folded fin rattling uselessly in opposition to its flared counterpart. Flap as he may, Toothless can't correct his trajectory.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: It's working! Toothless arcs just short of the water and climbs... high into the air.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yes! Yes, I did it. He glances back at Hiccup, busily holding the tail open while trying to hold on. They're going to crash. Whoomp! Hiccup is suddenly thrown from the tail in the intense force of a turn.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Look out! A Zippleback head emerges out of the smoke. Fishlegs hurls his water at it, completely dousing the head. It leers and opens its mouth, spewing gas into the area.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh, come on!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: BACK! BACK! BACK! Now don't you make me tell you again! The Zippleback retreats through its door and into its cave, hissing.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yes, that's right. Back into your cage. Hiccup slyly OPENS his vest, revealing the spotted smoked EEL from earlier. He TOSSES it inside the door, then SLAMS it shut.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Now think about what you've done. Hiccup turns to the teens and Gobber. They stare, slack-jawed

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay! So are we done? Because I've got some things I need to... Hiccup jogs out of the ring, past the speechless group.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yep...see you tomorrow. Astrid SNEERS. Something's going on.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hey!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah! Whoa!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I left my axe back in the ring. He turns and hurries back.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You guys go on ahead and I'll catch up with you. Astrid watches, suspicious.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh, great.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Astrid. Hey! Hi Astrid. Hi Astrid. Hi Astrid.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Not even close.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I hope you had a little more success than me.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: He's... gone?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay there bud, we're gonna take this nice and slow. Hiccup checks a leather cheat sheet, clipped onto his harness. Inscribed upon it are several tail positions and their pedal position equivalents.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Here we go. Here we go...position three, no four. He presses the pedal, causing the tail to flare. They roll off into an arcing bank, gloriously lit by the late afternoon sun. Hiccup tucks tight against his neck, thrilled that his new harness and vest are holding. The foot controls make the tail appendage quick and responsive. He watches Toothless' every fluctuation, trying to match it with the prosthetic. Hiccup sizes up a target -- a towering arch of stone, rising from the sea.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Alright, it's go time. It's go time. They dive toward it, lining up to pass through the arch.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Come on. Come on buddy. Come on buddy! They zip through the arch. A perfect maneuver.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah! Yes, it worked! The triumph is short-lived. They smack into one of several sea stacks as Hiccup tries to keep up with the turns.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Sorry. They hurtle into another rock pillar. Toothless grumbles.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: My fault. Toothless swats him with his 'ear' plate.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah, yeah, I'm on it. (referring to the cheat

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah! Go baby! Yes! Oh, this is amazing! The wind in my... He spots the leather guide tearing free in the turbulence.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh gods! Oh no! Without Hiccup, the tail loses control. Hiccup and Toothless spiral downward. Toothless FIGHTS to get back under Hiccup.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Alright, okay. You just gotta kinda angle yourself. No, no...come back down towards me. Come back down-- Hiccup extends his arms and legs, giving himself as much surface area as he can. He angles back towards Toothless as the tumbling dragon WHACKS Hiccup with his wing. After a few more misses, Hiccup finally GRABS HOLD of the harness and manages to lock in -- just in time to pull Toothless out of his dive... barely shy of the tree tops. They careen past the wooded cliff and directly into a treacherous slalom course of jutting sea stacks. Hiccup pulls the cheat sheet from his teeth and attempts to check positions. It flaps violently in the turbulence, making it impossible. With no time to think, Hiccup throws it away and steers Toothless' tail on instinct... with perfect intuition. Together, they manage a tight, hair-rasing series of split- second turns, making it to the open water, unscathed. Hiccup takes a breath and glances back at the death-defying obstacle course, now safely behind them. He beams, relieved. He sits back and throws his arms up in victory.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Ah, come on.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh..no thanks. (gesturing to his fish on

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Not so fireproof on the inside, are you? Hiccup throws the hapless Terror his freshly cooked fish.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Here you go. The appreciative little dragon gulps down the meal and approaches Hiccup cautiously. He curls up next to him. Hiccup is amazed.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Dad! You're back! He skirts the bench, blocking Stoick's view of Toothless, the prosthetic fin, and other drawings.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Gobber's not here, so... He strikes an awkwardly casual pose, trying to cover up as much as possible.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I know. I came looking for you.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I...have?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Just how long did you think you could hide it from me?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Nothing happens on this island without me hearing about it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: So.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh gods. Dad I'm so sorry. I was going to tell you. I just didn't know how to-- Stoick starts laughing. Big, booming. Hiccup stares, baffled.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You're not...upset?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: What?! I was hoping for this!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh...you were?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And believe me, it only gets better! Just wait til you spill a Nadder's guts for the first time. Hiccup's elated expression sinks.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And mount your first Gronckle head on a spear. What a feeling! Stoick laughs and smacks Hiccup on the shoulder, sending him into the wall.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You really had me going there, son. All those years of the worst Viking Berk has ever seen! Odin, it was rough. I almost gave up on you! Hiccup gets back up, grimacing in the irony of it all.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And all the while, you were holding out on me! Thor almighty! Stoick grabs a stool and sits. His massive frame nearly fills the tiny room.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh, I... brought you something. He presents a horned helmet.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: To keep you safe in the ring.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Your mother would've wanted you to have it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Matching set. Keeps her close, y'know? Hiccup eyes the mismatched helmets, grimacing.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Wear it proudly. You deserve it. You've held up your end of the deal. Stoick beams with pride. Hiccup squirms. He forces a YAWN.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I should really get to bed.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Well..uh..good night. Stoick leaves the room awkwardly, leaving Hiccup looking more burdened than ever.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Please, by all means. She darts off, CLOSING FAST on the dragon. The crowd above cheers her on.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Wait! Wait!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
