dialogue: So, later. Gobber snags Hiccup as he attempts to leave.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm kinda late for--

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay quiet down. The elder has decided. Thrilled, Gobber stands behind Hiccup and Astrid. He points to Astrid as the crowd waits in silent anticipation. Gothi shakes her head 'no.' The crowd 'Oooohs.' Gobber then points to Hiccup. The elder nods an affirmative 'yes.' The crowd erupts in cheers. Astrid turns a seething, deadly glare on Hiccup.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Ha, ha! That's my boy! Hiccup is hoisted onto the recruits' shoulders and carried out to the cheering spectators...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... leaving. We're leaving. Let's pack up. Looks like you and me are taking a little vacation, forever. Toothless is nowhere in sight. Hiccup sets down his basket and opens it up, his head clouded with troubles.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh..man... SHINK! Hiccup looks up to the sound of... ASTRID, sitting on the rock right in front of him, sharpening her axe.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh...training? She grabs him by his odd-looking harness.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I know this looks really bad, but you see...this is, uh... They hear a RUSTLE coming from the other side of the cove. Astrid DROPS Hiccup to the ground and sets off to investigate.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: AAAAUUGGGHHH! Why would you do that?!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No. It's okay! It's okay... Toothless pulls up short and lands hard, SPRAYING Astrid with sand.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: We're dead. Satisfied with Astrid's departure, Toothless turns away.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You have to give me a chance to explain.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Then I won't speak. Just let me show you. Hiccup extends a hand.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Please, Astrid. She eyes him and the dragon, then the ground far, far below. After a moment, she swats Hiccup's outstretched hand away and reluctantly climbs over the pedal, lines, and harness. She settles behind Hiccup, avoiding as much contact as possible.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Toothless? Down. Gently. Toothless leers mischievously. He spreads his wings slowly. With a WHOP, they fill with the updraft. Toothless releases the tree, tucks in his legs, and HOVERS in place.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: See? Nothing to be afraid of. Toothless suddenly LAUNCHES straight upward. Astrid SCREAMS. The acceleration is tremendous. Every downbeat bucks the saddle, heaving them into the sky, doubling their speed like a rocket. Astrid is thrown backward. She SCREAMS and hugs Hiccup for dear life, squeezing the breath out of him.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Toothless! What is wrong with you?! Bad dragon! He's not usually like this. Oh no...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Toothless, what are you doing?! We need her to like us! Toothless rockets skyward and begins tumbling head over tail.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And now the spinning. Thank you for nothing you useless reptile. Astrid clamps her hand over her eyes.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Don't remind me. A strange, unearthly din approaches. Toothless' ear plates suddenly stand on end. Panicked, he abruptly dives, dipping into cloud cover.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Toothless! What's happening? What is it? Toothless BARKS at him. 'Quiet!' Suddenly, out of the dense cloud, a Monstrous Nightmare emerges.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Get down! Hiccup and Astrid duck. The Nightmare calls out. A Zippleback appears to the other side of Toothless, boxing him in.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I don't know.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: What my dad wouldn't give to find this. Toothless peels away from the procession, landing on a small shadowy shelf to keep a low-profile. Hiccup and Astrid peek around, taking in the busy hive of sorts. They watch as the food continues to be dropped into the pit.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: It's satisfying to know that all of our food has been dumped down a hole.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Alright buddy, we gotta get out of here. Now! Toothless takes flight, barely evading the monster's snapping jaws. The behemoth dragon lunges for them, snatching a Zippleback out of the air instead. Toothless disappears into the winged exodus as thousands of dragons flee the caldera in fear.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, no! Not yet. They'll... kill Toothless.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Astrid, we have to think this through carefully. Astrid eyes him, incredulous.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yes. Astrid's taken aback.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Just give me until tomorrow. I'll figure something out.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: What are you looking at?

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Well, I can show my face in public again.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... or more proud than I am. Today, my boy becomes a Viking. TODAY, HE

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: It's not the dragon I'm worried about.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Put an end to this. She eyes him, dubious.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I have to try.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm ready. The door bolt is raised. The crowd grows quiet... Beat. BOOM! The doors blast open with a stream of sticky fire. Followed by a Monstrous Nightmare, coated in flames. It tears out of its cave like an irate bull -- as the crowd roars and jeers. It climbs the walls and chain enclosure like a bat, hissing at the provoking crowd and blasting fire.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: What is he doing? The dragon presses closer, snorting. Hiccup extends his open hand. It snarls.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm not one of them. GASPS and MURMURS race through the crowd. ON STOICK, as all eyes turn to him. He's welling with upset. Hiccup avoids Stoick's glare and remains focused on the Nightmare, holding his hand out. It paces around him, calming down.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Stop the fight.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No. I need you all to see this. The crowd gets restless.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: They're not what we think they are. We don't have to kill them.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Out of my way!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This way! Astrid makes it through, but the Nightmare BLASTS the doorway, cutting Hiccup off. It pounces on him and prepares to finish him off. Suddenly, a terrible roar pierces the din.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Go! GO!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Dad! No! He won't hurt you! The other Vikings surround and attack Toothless. He tosses them aside like rag dolls, his eyes focused on Stoick.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, don't! You're only making it worse! Stoick raises his hammer as he charges for Toothless. Toothless ducks and pounces on him. They tumble end over end.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Toothless! STOP! He pins Stoick and inhales. The familiar hiss of gas builds. Everyone braces...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Put it with the others! His burning glare turn to Hiccup.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I should have known. I should have seen the signs.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Dad.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: We had a deal! Stoick pauses to say something, but stops short. He SNORTS and resumes pacing, repeating the cycle.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: So everything in the ring. A trick? A lie? He stomps toward Hiccup. Stops short and points, fighting back words.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I screwed up. I should have told you before now. Take this out on me, be mad at me, but please... just don't hurt Toothless.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: The dragon? That's what you're worried about? Not the people you almost killed?!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: He was just protecting me! He's not dangerous.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: They've killed HUNDREDS OF US!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: And we've killed THOUSANDS OF THEM! They defend themselves, that's all! They raid us because they have to! If they don't bring enough food back, they'll be eaten themselves.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: --Their island? He stomps back... pointing an accusing finger.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: So you've been to the nest.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Did I say nest? Hiccup goes silent -- he said too much.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: How did you find it?!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No... I didn't. Toothless did. Only a dragon can find the island. Stoick GLARES. A moment passes, then an idea takes form on his face. His eyes flare. Hiccup watches, realizing. Stoick stomps toward the doorway.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh no. No, Dad. No. Hiccup chases after him, panicked.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Dad. It's not what you think. You don't know what you're up against. It's like nothing you've ever seen. He grabs Stoick by the arm, tugging with all his might. He has no effect whatsoever.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Dad. Please. I promise you that you can't win this one. Nothing.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No. Dad. No. For once in your life,

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You've thrown your lot in with them. You're not a Viking.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Set sail! We head for Helheim's Gate. He then notices HICCUP watching from his familiar cliff-side perch beyond the village. Their eyes meet, full of hurt and regret. Hiccup slowly shakes his head in warning. Stoick breaks the stare and turns to Toothless, fuming.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Lead us home, Devil.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Thank you for summing that up.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Why couldn't I have killed that dragon when I found him in the woods. It would have been better for everyone.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I don't know. I couldn't.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh for the love of -- I was a coward! I was weak. I wouldn't kill a dragon.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Probably something stupid.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Then something crazy. Astrid smiles.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Sound your positions. Stay within earshot. Shouts pour in from all directions.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Find the nest and take it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Shhh. Stoick notices that Toothless' ear plates are at the alert, quietly reacting to inaudible sounds. Stoick crosses to the stern of the ship and grabs the tiller, moving the helmsman out of the way.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Step aside. Stoick pulls the ship into a turn, covertly following Toothless' head movements.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I didn't...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Stay low and ready your weapons. Stoick's ship suddenly JERKS to a halt as the keel burrows into shallow black sand. Stoick hops overboard, landing on a sprawling beach. The BUZZING suddenly STOPS. Above him, a craggy volcano towers into the gloom.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: We're here. Behind him, several dragon-headed bows pierce the fog.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Relax. It's okay... it's okay.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You're going to need something to help you hold on. The teens eye each other apprehensively, and look up to reveal... ALL THE DRAGONS standing in the ring, facing the teens expectantly.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: When we crack this mountain open, all hell is going to break loose.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No matter how this ends, it ends today. He walks toward the base of the volcano wall, back by several hundred warriors. He raises his arm and drops it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: In a chaotic flurry, the dragons suddenly rush out like bats from a cave. The take to the air, bypassing the axe-swinging Vikings and fleeing the island in a mass exodus. The battle-ready Vikings drop their weapons, confused.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This isn't over. Form your ranks! Hold together! The men SCRAMBLE to organize themselves.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Get clear!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No! NO! The Red Death BLASTS the ships like a mile-long flamethrower. The sails are torched. Vikings dive overboard and masts come down. Gobber Joins Stoick.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Lead the men to the far side of the island.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Gobber, go with the men.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, me! The Red Death remains focused on Stoick - this is it. It rears back and inhales. Gas begins to amass, when... KABLAM! A BLAST explodes against the back of The Red Death's head. It turns distracted, as... ... a Nadder punches through the flames, banking across the sky. Followed by a Monstrous Nightmare, a Zippleback, and a Gronckle. They roll in unison, revealing the recruits riding on their backs. Hiccup leads, with Astrid clinging to his waist. GOBBER AND STOICK, watch slack-jawed, in awe.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Ruff, Tuff, watch your backs! Move Fishlegs! The monster shakes off the blast and snaps in their wake. Hiccup directs his squadron out of harm's way. They climb out of reach and circle each other.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Up, let's move it! The dragons climb past the Red Death.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Fishlegs, break it down.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay. Lout, Legs, hang in its blind spot. Make some noise, keep it confused. Ruff, Tuff, find out if it has a shot limit. Make it mad.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: There! He steers the Nadder over the deck and hands Astrid the reins. He lines up his jump... and hops off, guarding his face from the flames. He lands on the burning deck.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay, hold on. Hold on. He gets to work on the chains.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Working at the chains. He can't budge them. Fire licks at his clothes. He looks up to see...

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You got it, bud. Hiccup climbs onto Toothless and buckles himself in. Stoick grabs his arm.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup. I'm sorry...for everything.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Yeah...me too.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: You don't have to go up there.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: We're Vikings. It's an occupational hazard. They exchange smiles.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm proud to call you my son. Hiccup beams, taken aback.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Thanks dad. Stoick lets go of Hiccup's arm. Hiccup spurs Toothless on, charged with his father's belief in him. They rocket into the sky as Stoick watches.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Did you get her? Toothless grunts.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Do you think that did it? Suddenly, the enraged behemoth RISES into frame... flapping its wings furiously. A daunting sight.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Well, he can fly. Hiccup and Toothless DIVE into the tangled sea stacks - they weave through the rock like rabbits through a briar. The Red Death SNAPS at them, but cannot reach them. Hiccup and Toothless PULL AHEAD. The Red Death SMASHES through the canopy of rock and pulls in behind Toothless. He BURSTS THROUGH fifty-foot formations like they were saplings.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay Toothless, time to disappear. Toothless PULLS into a steep climb, heading toward the clouds.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Come on bud! The Red Death follows, closing in fast.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Here it comes! BLAST! They narrowly dodge a column of flame and smoke. They reach the low-hanging clouds and pierce them. The monster follows, immediately losing them in the hampered visibility. It roars irritably. From out of nowhere, Toothless DIVES at the huge dragon, BLASTING and PUNCTURING a hole in its wing. Toothless and Hiccup are gone again before the dragon can get a shot at them.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Watch out! The random blast CLIPS Toothless' tail. It's heavily damaged.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay, time's up. Let's see if this works. He pulls Toothless into a turn. They fly directly into the Red Death's face, taunting it.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Come on! Is that the best you can do!? Toothless utters an insult too, and they jackknife into a steep dive. The Red Death pursues. Toothless PUMPS his wings, racing faster than he's ever gone before. Hiccup and Toothless stay just ahead of the Red Death -- no longer trying to evade it. Hiccup glances back to check the tail - it's disintegrating.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Stay with me buddy. We're good. Just a little bit longer. The Red Death closes the gap. Hiccup tucks in and holds Toothless steady -- allowing the monster to set its sights on them. It narrows its eyes.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hold, Toothless. The Red Death OPENS his mouth. The familiar gas HISS emanates from his throat -- ignition is coming.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No. No. Hiccup and Toothless can't maneuver - they're dead in the air. The giant club tail CLIPS Toothless, TEARING Hiccup from the harness and sending him tumbling against the backdrop of the fast-approaching fireball. Toothless STRUGGLES with all his might to reach the unconscious Hiccup. But the fireball swallows them both.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup? Hiccup!? Stoick appears, searching desperately. Everything is scorched. Even the ground is smoking from the terrible heat.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup!? Son!? Through the ash, Stoick the motionless silhouette of Toothless.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Oh son...I did this... Astrid pushes through the crowd, her eyes welling up. Followed by Gobber. They flank Stoick as he kneels, slumped over. Behind them, a ring of Vikings form, keeping a respectful distance. As the dust and smoke clear, a ring of wild dragons can also be seen, gathering just behind and between the Vikings. Toothless stirs and groggily rolls his head toward Stoick. Their eyes meet.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm so sorry... Toothless unfolds his wings, revealing Hiccup, unconscious, clutched safely against his chest. Stoick's eyes widen.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Hiccup. He scoops Hiccup into his arms. Listens to his heart. Bursts into relieved laughter.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: He's alive!

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay, okay! I'm happy to see you too, bud. Now just-- Toothless steps on his groin, causing Hiccup to sit BOLT UPRIGHT with a YELP. He looks around, confounded. He's in his bed, moved beside the fire pit on the main floor of his house.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I'm in my house. You're in my house. Toothless TEARS around the room, knocking things over, far too big for the space.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Uh...does my dad know you're in here?! Toothless pauses at the foot of the bed, tongue wagging. He eyes the rafters... and LEAPS UP onto them, brimming with 'happy dog' energy.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Okay...okay... ... but STUMBLES with the first step. Toothless catches Hiccup's fall with his head... and slowly lifts him up, stabilizing him.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Thanks bud. Hiccup leans on him like a crutch. They take a few steps together. Their missing parts form a poetic silhouette as they make their way toward the door. Hiccup pries it open , revealing a MONSTROUS NIGHTMARE flapping outside the door. Hiccup YELPS and slams the door closed. He turns to Toothless, alarmed.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Toothless? Stay here, bud. Hiccup pauses... and cracks the door open again. He peeks outside, his eyes widening. He allows to door to swing open, revealing... ... the Monstrous Nightmare, carrying Snotlout on its back.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: I knew it. I'm dead. Stoick laughs.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: No, but you gave it your best shot. He puts his arm around Hiccup, steadying him. He gestures to the transformed village.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: So? What do you think? Hiccup just shrugs, amazed. Below, the plaza, villagers take notice.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: (bittersweet, coming to

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: ... could get used to it. Gobber presents Hiccup with a rebuilt saddle, rigging, and tail.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: This... is Berk.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: Any food that grows here is tough and tasteless. The people that grow here are even more so. Hiccup and Astrid race their dragons through the village -- under eaves, over rooftops, down cliff-sides, and between ship masts. It's a high energy, romantic dance of sorts.

title: How-to-Train-Your-Dragon
dialogue: The only upsides are the pets. While other places have...ponies or parrots, we have... Their fellow recruits join them as they take to the open sky, rocketing far above the village. The Northern sky swirls with blazing, multicolored dragons. Hiccup and Toothless break from the pack, spinning into the blinding sun.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Shhhl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's the Cross of Coronadol Cortes gave it to him in 15201

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That Cross is an important artifact. It belongs in a museum.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Run back and find the others. Tell Mister Havelock that there are men looting in the caves.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Have him bring the sheriff.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's only a snake.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Did you hear what I said?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I don't know... I'll think of something.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Mister Havelock! Anybody Everybody's lost but me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Hyahl Hyah!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh... Oh...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Holy smokes!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ohhh!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It belongs to Coronado.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This should be in a museum.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Magic?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Out!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's important!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Then waitcount to twenty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No, Dad. You listen to me

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: One, two, three, four...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: In Greek.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: One... two... three... four...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: May he who illuminated this... illuminate me...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Just the man I want to see! Now, there were five or six of them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... they came after... me...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, yes, sir. It's right here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Too small for two of us.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That belongs in a museum

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... the search for fact. Not truth. If it's truth you're interested in, Doctor Tyree's Philosophy class is right down the hall.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: So forget any ideas you've got about lost cities, exotic travel, and digging up the world. Eve do not follow maps to buried treasure and "X" never, ever, marks the spot.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Seventy percent of all archaeology is done in the library. Research. Reading.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: We cannot afford to take mythology at face value.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Next week: "Egyptology." Starting with the excavation of Naukratis by Blinders Petrie in 1885. I will be in my office if anybody's got any problems for the next hour and a half.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Marcus! I did it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You know how long I've been looking for that?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: All my life!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: We can discuss my honorarium over dinner and champagne tonight.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Your treat.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Shush! Shush! Shushl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Okay. Irene, put everyone's name on a list, in the order they arrived, and I'll see each and every one of them in turn.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "Venice, Italy."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I know who you are Mr. Donovan. Your contributions to the museum over the years have been extremely generous. Some of the pieces in your collection here are very impressive.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, it's sandstone. Christian symbol. Early Latin text. Mid- Twelfth Century, I should think.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Where did this come from?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "... who drinks the water I shall give him, says the Lord, will have a spring inside him welling up for eternal life. Let them bring me to your holy mountain in the place where you dwell.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon, to the Temple where the cup that"

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "Where the cup that holds the blood of Jesus Christ resides forever. "

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Arthur Legend. I've heard this bedtime story before.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: An old man's dream.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Grail lore is his hobby. He's a teacher of Medieval Literature. The one the students hope they don't get.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What good is it? This Grail Tablet speaks of deserts and mountains and canyons. Pretty vague. Where do you start looking? Maybe if the Tablet were intact, you'd have something to go on. But the entire top portion is missing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I've heard this one as well. Two of these brothers walked out of the desert one hundred and fifty years after having found the Grail and began the long journey back to France. But only one of them made it. And before dying of extreme old age, he supposedly imparted his tale to ato a Franciscan friar, I think.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's usually when the ground falls out from underneath your feet.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yes?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You've got the wrong Jones, Mister Donovan. Why don't you try my father?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad? He's an academic A bookworm. He's not a field mans

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad? Dad?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I don't know. But whatever it is, he's in over his head!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Mail! That's it, Marcus!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Venice, Italy!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's Dad's Grail Diary. Every clue he ever followed. Every discovery he made. A complete record of his search for the Holy Grail. This is his whole life. Why would he have sent this to me?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Do you believe, Marcus?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Do you believe the Grail actually exists?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Call Donovan, Marcus. Tell him I'll take that ticket to Venice now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ah, Venice...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I don't know. Maybe he'll know us.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Doctor Jones?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yes?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I knew it was you

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: you have your father's eyes.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And my mother's ears. But the rest belongs to you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Looks like the best parts have already been spoken for.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Marcus Brody?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Doctor Elsa Schneider.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The last time I saw your father we were in the library. He was very close to tracking down the Knight's Tomb. I've never seen him so excited. He was as giddy as a schoolboy.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Who? Attila the Professor? He was never giddy, even when he was a schoolboy!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Frauleinwill you permit me?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I usually don't.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I usually don't either.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: In that case, I permit you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It would make me very happy.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But I'm already sadby tomorrow it will have faded.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Tomorrow I'll steal you another.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yes. I have something to show you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I left your father working in the library. He sent me to the map section to fetch an ancient plan of the city. When I got back to his tablehe'd gonewith all his papersexcept for that scrap which I found near his chair.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Roman numerals.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Here is the library.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That doesn't look much like a library.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: In this case it's the literal truth. We're on holy ground. These columns over here...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... were brought back as spoils of war after the sacking of Byzantium during the Crusades.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Now please excuse me. The library's closing in a few moments. I'll arrange for us to stay a little longer.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: MarcusI've seen this window before.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Right here. In Dad's Diary. You see?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad was onto something here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My dad sent me this Diary for a reason. Until we find out why, I suggest we keep it to ourselves.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Find something?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My God, I must be blind

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad wasn't looking for a book about the Knight's Tomb... he was looking for the Tomb itself

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't you get it? The Tomb is somewhere in the library! You said yourself it used to be a church! Look.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Three.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Three!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Seven.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Seven... Ten.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And ten. Now where's the ten? Look around for the ten.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Three, seven and ten.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ten. "X" marks the spot.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Bingo.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You don't disappoint, Doctor Jones. You're a great deal like your father.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Except he's lost, and I'm not.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Lower me down.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Look after this for me, will you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come on.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Pagan symbols. Fourth or Fifth Century.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Right. Six hundred years before the Crusades.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Christians would have dug their own passages and burial chambers centuries later.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's right. If there's a Knight of the First Crusade entombed down here, that's where we'll find him.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What's this one?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Ark of the Covenant.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Are you sure?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Pretty sure.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Watch out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Petroleum. I could sink a well down here and retire.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Give me the lighter.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh, rats...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come onl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Look. . .

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It must be one of these...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Look at the artistry of these carvings and the scrollwork.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's this one.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This is itl we found it! Look the engraving on the Shield. It's the same as on the Grail Tablets The Shield is the Second Marker!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What's that?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's a rubbing Dad made of the Grail Tablet.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Just like your fathergiddy as a schoolboy.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Wouldn't it be wonderful if he were here now to see this?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: He never would have made it past the rats! He hates rats! He's scared to death of them!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Get back! Back against the wall.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Quick! Under it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Air pocket!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't wander off.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I think I've found a way out. Deep breath.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ah, Venicel

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Are you crazy?! You don't go between them!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Go between them? Are you crazy?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I said go around!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You said go between them!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I said don't go between them!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Why are you trying to kill us?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My father was looking for the Holy Grail. Did you kill him too?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Where is he? Talkor you're dead. Damn it, tell me! Tell me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Then we'll die.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This is your last chance.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: All right! Where's my father

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Who are you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And why were you trying to kill me?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I didn't come for the Cup of Christ. I came to find my father.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: How's the head?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Knights of the First Crusade laid siege to the city of Alexandretta for over a year. The entire city was destroyed.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The present city of Iskenderun is built on its ruins. Marcus you remember what the Grail Tablet said. "Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon." But where exactly?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Alexandretta. Now we know.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Marcus, get hold of Sallah. Tell him to meet you in Iskenderun.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm going after Dad.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My room!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Mine, too.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What were they looking for?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Grail Diary.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Uh-huh.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You had it? You didn't trust me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I didn't know you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: At least I let you tag along.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh, yes. Give them a flower and they'll follow you anywhere.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Knock it off. You're not mad.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No. You like the way I do things.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's lucky I don't do things the same way. You'd still be standing at the Venice pier.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Look, what do you think is going on here? Since I've met you, I've nearly been incinerated, drowned, shot at, and chopped into fish bait. We're caught in the middle of something sinister here. My guess is Dad found out more than he was looking for. And until I'm sure, I'm going to continue to do things the way I think they should be done.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: How dare you kiss me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Leave me alone. I don't like fast women.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And I hate arrogant men.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ahh, Venice.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What do you know about this place?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I know the Brunwalds are famous art collectors.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What are you going to do?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't know. Think of something.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And not before time! Did you intend to leave us standing on the doorstep all day? We're drenched!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Now look! I've gone and caught a sniffle.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't take that tone with me, my good man. Now buttle off and tell Baron Brunwald that Lord Clarence MacDonald and his lovely assistant are here to view the tapestries.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dear me, the man is dense. This is a castle, isn't it? There are tapestries?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: How dare he?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Nazis. I hate these guys.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This one. I think he's in here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: How do you know?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Because it's wired.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Indy? Indy?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't worry... this is kid's play. I'll be right back.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yes, sirl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It is you Junior!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't call me that, please.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But what are you doing here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I came to get you! What do you think?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Late Fourteenth Century, Ming Dynasty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh, it breaks the heart.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And the head. You hit me, Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'll never forgive myself

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't worryI'm fine.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Thank God!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... it's fake. See, you can tell by the cross section.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No! Dad, get your stuff. We've got to get out of here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, I am sorry about your head, though. But I thought you were one of them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, they come in through the doors.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Good point.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But better safe than sorry.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Humpfso I was wrong this time. But by God, I wasn't wrong when I mailed you my Diary. You obviously got it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I got it and I used it. We found the entrance to the catacombs.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Through the library?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Right.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I knew it. And the tomb of Sir Richard?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Found it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: He was actually there? You saw him?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, what was left of him.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And his shield... the inscription on Sir Richard's shield...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Alexandretta.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Alexandretta... of course... on the pilgrim trail from the Eastern Empire. Oh, Junior...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... you did it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No, Dad. You did. Forty years.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: If only I could have been with you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: There were rats, Dad.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Rats?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yeah. big ones. What do the Nazis want with you Dad?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: They want my diary.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yeah?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I knew I had to get that book as far away from me as I possibly could.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yeah. . .

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You doltl Do you think that my son would be that stupid that he would bring my Diary all the way back here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You didn't, did you? You didn't bring it, did you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, uh...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You did!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Look, can we discuss this later?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I should have mailed it to the Marx Brothers.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Will you take it easy....!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Take it easy?! Why do you think I sent it home in the first place? So it wouldn't fall into their hands!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I came here to save you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh yeah? And who's gonna come to save you, Junior??

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I told you--

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: --don't call me Junior!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Look what you did!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I can't believe what you just....

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa? Elsa?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But she's one of them!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Indy, please!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: She's a Nazi!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Trust me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Indy, no!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh yeah? Go ahead!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No! Don't Shoot!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't worry. He won't.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Indy, please! Do what he says!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And don't listen to her!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Wait! Waitl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm sorry.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No, don't be.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But you should have listened to your father.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: She ransacked her own room and I fell for it. How did you know she was a Nazi?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Umh?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: How did you she was a Nazi?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: She talks in her sleep.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I didn't trust her. Why did you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Donovan

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I misjudged you WalterI knew you'd sell your mother for an Etruscan vase. But I didn't know you'd sell your country and your soul to the slime of humanity.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This book contained a mapa map with no namesprecise directions from the unknown city to the secret Canyon of the Crescent Moon.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: So it did.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You're wasting your breath. He won't tell us. And he doesn't have to... it's perfectly obvious where the pages are... ... he's given them to Marcus Brody.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Marcus?! You didn't drag poor Marcus along, did you? He's not up to the challenge.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The hell you will. He's got a two-day head-start on you, which is more than he needs. Brody's got friends in every town and village from here to the Sudan. He speaks a dozen languages, knows every local custom. He'll blend in. Disappear. You'll never see him again. With any luck, he's got the Grail already.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Intolerable.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: So?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Thank you, Herr Oberst. I will meet you at Iskenderun.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No. If we fail to recover the pages from Brody, we'll need them alive.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't look at me like thatwe both wanted the Grail, I would have done anything to get it. You would have done the same.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm sorry you think so.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I can't forget... how wonderful it was.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Thank you. It was rather wonderful.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's how Austrians say goodbye.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ohh. . .

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ooooh... I like the Austrian way better.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: So did I.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Let's try and get these ropes loose. We've got to get to Marcus before the Nazis do!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You said he had two days' start. That he would blend in. Disappear!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Are you kidding?I made that up! You know Marcushe got lost once in his own museum!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Can you try and reach into my left jacket pocket?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What am I looking for?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My lucky charm.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Feels like a cigarette lighter.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Try and burn through the ropes.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Very good.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I ought to tell you something.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Don't get sentimental now Dad save it 'til we get out of here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The floor's on fire! See?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What???

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And the chair.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: All right, movel Move! Rock your Chair. Do what I do.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Head for the fireplace!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I think I can get these ropes off.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Whoopsl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Our situation has not improved.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Listen Dad... I'm almost free.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This is intolerable!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm out, Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well done, boy!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come on Dad.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dead end.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: There's got to be a... a secret door around. A passageway or something.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I find that if I just sit down and think...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... the solution presents itself.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Great. More boats.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Would you say this has been just another typical day for you? Huh?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ooofl No! It's been better than most.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come on, Dad. Come onl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What about the boat? We're not going on the boat?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ha!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Stop!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Stop! Stop!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You're going the wrong Way! We have to get to Berlin!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Brody's this way.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My Diary's in Berlin.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You don't need the Diary, Dad. Marcus has the map.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: There is more in the Diary than just the map.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: All right Dadtell me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, he who finds the Grail must face the final challenge.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What final challenge?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Three devices of such lethal cunning.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Booby traps?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh, yes. But I found the clues that will safely take us through, in the Chronicles of St. Anselm.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But what are they? Can't you remember?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I wrote them down in my Diary so that I wouldn't have to remember

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Half the German Army's on our tail and you want me to go to Berlin? Into the lion's den?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yes! The only thing that matters is the Grail.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What about Marcus?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Marcus would agree with me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Two selfless martyrs. Jesus Christl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's for blasphemy. The quest for the Grail is not archaeology. It's a race against evil. If it is captured by the Nazis, the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the earth. Do you understand me?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This is an obsession Dad. I never understood it. Never. Neither did Mom.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh yes, she did. Only too well. Unfortunately she kept her illness from me until all I could do was mourn her.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My boy, we are Pilgrims in an unholy land.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Fraulein Doctor. Where is it?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: How did you get here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Where is it? I want it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You came back for the book? Whv?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: My father didn't want it incinerated.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Is that what you think of me? I believe in the Grail, not the Swastika.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yet you stood up to be counted with the enemy of everything the Grail stands forwho gives a damn what you think?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You do.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: All I have to do is squeeze.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: All I have to do is scream.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I've got it. Let's get the hell out of here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What did you get?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I don't know. The first available flight out of Germany.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Good.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, we made it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: When we're airborne, with Germany behind us, then I'll share that sentiment.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Relax.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Fahrscheine, bitte.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Tickets please.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Fahrscheine meine Dame. Bitte.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Fahrscheine meine Herr.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Tickets please.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No ticket.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You know, sharing your adventures is an interesting experience.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's not all we shared. It's disgraceful. You're old enough to be her fa---er, her grandfather!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, I'm as human as the next man.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I was the next man.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ships that pass in the night...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Do you remember the last time we had a quiet drink? I had a milk shake.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Hmmm... What did we talk about?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: We didn't talk. We never talked.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: And do I detect a rebuke?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: A regret. It was just the two of us, Dad. It was a lonely way to grow up. For you, too. If you had been an ordinary, average father like the other guys' dads, you'd have understood that.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Actually, I was a wonderful father.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: When?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Did I ever tell you to eat up? Go to bed? Wash your ears? Do your homework? No. I respected your privacy and I taught you self- reliance.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What you taught me was that I was less important to you than people who had been dead for five hundred years in another country. And I learned it so well that we've hardly spoken for twenty years.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You left just when you were becoming interesting.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, how can you --?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Very well. I'm here now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What do you want to talk about? Hmmm?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well... I can't think of anything.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Then what are you complaining about? Look, we have work to do. When we get to Alexandretta we will face three challenges. "First, the breath of God. Only the penitent man will pass. Second, the Word of God, only in the footsteps of God will he proceed. Third, the Path of God, only in the leap from the lion's head will he prove his worth. "

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What does that mean?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I don't know. We'll find out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: They're turning around. They're taking us back to Germany.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, I thought it would take them a lot longer to figure out the radio was dead. Come on, Dad. Move!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come on, Dad. Come on!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I didn't know you could fly a plane.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Fly--yes. Land--no.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, you're gonna have to use the machine gun. Get it ready.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Eleven o'clock!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dadeleven o'clock!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What happens at eleven o'clock?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Twelveeleventen. Eleven o'clock. Fire!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, are we hit?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: More or less.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Son, I'm sorry. They got us.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Hang on, Dads We're going in!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Nice landing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Thanks.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Those people are trying to kill us!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I know, Dadl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's a new experience for me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It happens to me all the time.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This is intolerable!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: This could be close.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Faster, boy --faster!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Well, they don't come any closer than that!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, he's coming back.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I suddenly remembered Charlemagne. "Let my armies be the rocks and the trees and the birds in the sky."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: We have no time to lose. Indiana Jones and his father have escaped.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What happened to Marcus, Sallah?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Now they have the map! And in this sort of race, there's no silver medal for finishing second.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ah, I see Brody. He seems okay. They've got a tank. Six-pound gun.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What do you think you're doing?! Get down!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, we're well out of range.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Come on--come on!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No. It's him all right. He's here somewhere.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Now, who are all these people?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Who cares? As long as they're keeping Donovan busy. Dad, you stay here while Sallah and I organize some transportation.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm going after those horses.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I don't need camels.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No camels!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Marcus!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "Genius of the Restoration"

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's a rescue, old boys Come on.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It tells me that goose-stepping morons like yourself should try reading books instead of burning them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Sallah, I said no camels! That's five camels. Can't you Count?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Where's my father?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad! Dad! Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior? Junior? Junior!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad! Dadl Get it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's war.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Didn't I tell you it was a rescue, huh?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You call this archaeology?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Get out of there, Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Where's Marcus?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Hang on, Dad!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Sallah! Get Dadl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh, God. I've lost him. And I never told him anything. I just wasn't ready, Marcus. Five minutes would have been enough.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I thought I'd lost you, boy.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I thought you had too, sir.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Wellwell done! Come on!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Let's go then. why are you sitting there resting when we're so near the end? Come on let's go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I never expected to see you again.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm like a bad penny. I always turn up.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: As what? A Nazi stooge like you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Shooting me won't get you anywhere.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior. . .

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "The Breath of God... Only the penitent man will pass. Only the penitent man will pass. . . "

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "The penitent man will pass. The penitent man..."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "Only the penitent man will pass. Only the penitent man will pass."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The penitent man will pass. The penitent... the penitent. The penitent man...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The penitent man. The penitent...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The penitent man is humble before God.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Penitent. Penitent...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The penitent man is humble...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: He kneels before God. Kneel!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm through!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: No.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "The second challenge is the Word of God. Only in the footsteps of God will he proceed." The Word of God... The Word of...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "Proceed in the footsteps of the Word."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Word of God...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Name of God...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: The Name of God... Jehovahl

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: But in the Latin alphabet, "Jehovah" begins with an "I."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Oh dear!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: In Latin, "Jehovah" starts with an "I." "I"...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: "The path of flood. Only in the leap from the lion's head will he prove his worth."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Impossiblel Nobody can jump this!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's... a leap of faith. Oh, God.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: You must believe, boy. you must... believe.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Who are you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That was seven hundred years ago.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I'm not exactly...a knight. What do you mean?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Listen, I don't have time to explain, but

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Let me choose.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It would not be made out of gold.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's the cup of a carpenter.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: There's only one way to find out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad, come on. Get to your feet.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: We have got it. Come on.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa! Elsa, don't movel

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: It's ours, Indy. Yours and mine.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa, don't cross the Seal. The Knight warned us not to take the Grail from here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior! Junior!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa. Elsa don't. Elsa. Elsa. Give me your other hand, honey. I can't hold you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I can reach it. I can reach it...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa! Give me your hand. Give me your other hand!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior, give me your other hand! I can't hold on!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I can get itI can almost reach it, Dad.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Indiana. Indiana!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: ... let it go...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Dad. . .

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Please, Dad...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Elsa never really believed in the Grail. She thought she'd found a prize.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What did vou find, Dad?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Me?... Illumination.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: What did you find, Junior?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Junior?! Dad...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: That's his name. Henry Jones, Junior.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I like Indiana.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: We named the dog Indiana.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: I've got a lot of fond memories of that dog.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ready?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Ready.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Got lost in his own museum, huh?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Uh-huh.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: After you, Junior.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Last-Crusade
dialogue: Yes, sir! Haaa!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: No.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: We don't need them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: We'll leave them. Once we've got it, we'll be able to reach the plane by dusk.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: If they knew we were here, they would have killed us already.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: So this is where Forrestal cashed in.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Competitor. He was good, very good.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: No one ever had what we have... partners.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Assuming that pillar there marks the corner and...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Let's go.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Forrestal.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Now, Satipo, we don't want to be discouraged by every little thing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Let me see that.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Try not to touch the vines.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: That's what scares me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You wait here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Adios.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Too bad they don't know you like I do, Belloq.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Get it going! Get it going!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: GO!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I can't stand snakes.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I hate them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I don't know. Just because Belloq had it doesn't mean he kept it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Getting it away from those Indians would be a neat trick I hope they got him.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: That's all right, Phil. Thanks a lot.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: No. I'll see you Thursday.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Hey, if you don't like them, I can always return them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Then what's wrong?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What kind of people?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Government?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I've already served.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: We haven't spoken in ten years. I'm afraid we had a bit of a falling out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Just rumors. Somewhere in Asia, last I heard.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I understand.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Tanis. Ain't that somethin'!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Ah, Ravenwood's no Nazi.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: They're looking for the headpiece to the Staff of Ra.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Only half of it. Ravenwood had the other half.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: It all has to do with the Ark of the Covenant. The chest the Hebrews used to carry around the Ten Commandments.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: An Egyptian pharaoh stole the Ark from Jerusalem and took it back to the city of Tanis. A short time later, Tanis was consumed by the desert in a sandstorm that lasted a year. But before that, the Pharaoh had had the Ark hidden away in a secret chamber called the Well of the Souls. Which is where the Staff of Ra comes in.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Now this was rather clever. The Staff was really just a big stick - oh, I don't know, say like this - no one really knows for sure. Any way, it was capped by an elaborate headpiece with a carving of the sun at the top. What you had to do was take the Staff to a special map room in Tanis - it had the whole city laid out in miniature on the floor. When you placed the Staff in a certain spot in this room, at a certain time of day, the sun would shine through a hole here in the headpiece and then send a beam of light down here - to the map - giving you the location of the Well of the Souls...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Which is probably what the Nazis are after.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Look like? Why, it's right here...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Yes. That's what the Hebrews thought.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Who knows... lightning... fire... the power of God.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Oh yes. The Bible tells of it leveling mountains and wasting entire regions. Moses promised that when the Ark was with you, "your enemies will be scattered and your foes fell before you". An army which carries the Ark before it is invincible.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Oh, there's one other thing that Hitler undoubtably believes about the Ark... It's said that the Lost Ark will be recovered at the time of the coming of the True Messiah.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Most certainly.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
