dialogue: This isn't really a good time.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: All right. Come on in.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I'll be in a minute.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Good work, Marcus. I had a feeling this would happen. And, of course, the Museum gets the Ark when we're done.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Okay, here's the way it's gonna be. First, I'll high-tail it to Shanghai and get the piece from General Hok. Then I think I know where I can find Ravenwood. If only I can get -

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I'll worry about that when the time comes. My only hope is to find the Well of the Souls before the Nazis do.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What's the hurry?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Great. Got it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I've got to get to Nepal.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Hello, Marion.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Nice to see you, too.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Take it easy. I'm looking for your father.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What happened?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Do you find him?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Not a bad way to go. Doing what he loved.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Why not leave? Go back to the States.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Where you gonna get it?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I need one of the pieces your father collected.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I never meant to hurt you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You knew what you were doing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I guess that depends on your definition.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Look, I did what I did. I don't expect you to be happy about it. But maybe we can do each other some good.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Shut up and listen for a second. I want that piece your father had. I've got money.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Enough to get you back to the States. Where are his things?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Everything?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: That's too bad.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Seltzer.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You're a tough broad now, aren't you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I can only say I'm sorry so many times.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: A bronze piece, about this size. In the shape of the sun. Probably broken off at the bottom. Has a little hole in it, off-center. Does that sound familiar?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Do you know where it is?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Three thousand. American.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Maybe.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Okay, five thousand. That's all I can give you now. I can get you more when you land in the States.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I'm back, aren't I?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You can trust me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Why?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I trust you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I've heard that.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Bossy, aren't you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Tomorrow.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Hello.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Let's get out of here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: It's here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Forget it! I want you out of here. Now!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Let's go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I owe you plenty!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You're something!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I knew the Germans would hire you, Sallah. They couldn't have an excavation in the desert without the best digger in Egypt.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Tell me about the map room at Tanis.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Those Nazis are moving awfully fast.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Belloq. So he got away from the Indians. This is going to be more interesting that I thought.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Even Belloq won't be able to find it without that. Can you make anything of those markings? They're nothing I'm familiar with.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What is it, my friend?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Do you really need that monkey?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: And your brains.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: He'll be OK. Come on. Come on.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Run! Get out of here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Go, dammit! Go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Marion.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Too bad. I'm drinking alone.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Belloq.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I ought to kill you right now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Not a very private place for a murder.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Try the local sewer.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Now you're getting nasty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What about your boss, der Fuhrer? I thought he was waiting to take possession.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I hope your friends are patient. Dangerous work, Belloq.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Tell me, did you get away with the idol?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You know, if it's God you want to talk to, maybe I can arrange it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Yes. Yes, I'll come now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Thanks you. Marion's dead.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: And they made the calculation in the map room?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: The Well of the Souls.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Just want I need.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: How 'bout the height of the staff? Did Belloq get it off of there?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You said their top section was blank. Are you absolutely sure?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Belloq's staff is seven and a half inches short. They're digging in the wrong spot!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: My God! They aren't kidding!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What time does the sun hit the map?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: We haven't got much time. Where are the Germans digging for the Well of the Souls?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Okay. Let's go.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Sallah. Sallah!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Sallah!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I though you were dead.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: They must have switched baskets. Thank god for that! Bless those bastards. Have they hurt you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I have to leave you here for a little while. I know where the Ark is. If I take you out of here they'll start combing the place for us.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Keep your voice down.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Look, you don't know how glad I am to see you. And I don't like doing this. But the whole thing will be shot if you don't just sit here quietly. They haven't hurt you in the last twenty-four hours, they aren't going to start now. I'll be back to get you in no time.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: There!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: The Ark must be in that stone case. What's that gray stuff all over the floor -

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Why snakes? Why did it have to be snakes? Anything else.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Lots of torches. And oil. I want a landing strip down there.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Don't touch it! Never touch it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Hurry up! Why did it have to be snakes?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What the -

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Why don't you fellows come down here? I'll show you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Don't panic. There's plenty of time for that later. Wave that at anything that slithers.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Just watch the floor.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: There!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Come on!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Stay here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I'll be back in a minute. We're going through this wall.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Just keep your eyes open and get ready to run. No matter what happens to me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Come on!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I guess not. I think I'd be dead.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Absolutely.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Don't do that. It scares me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Look!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: When the Ark gets loaded, we're already going to be on that plane.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Get out! Get out!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Where is it?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You two get back to Cairo quick and get us transportation to England - a plane, a ship, anything.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I'm going to get that truck. I'll meet you at Omar's. Be ready for me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I don't know. I'm making this up as I go.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: It's lovely.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: That's what you look like.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What would you like to recapture?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Did I ever say I was sorry I burned down your tavern?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: You saved my life.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Seems things have worked out kind of even.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Maybe we should consider all past accounts closed.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What else?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: The engines have shut down.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: I'm going to find out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What's wrong?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Holy shit.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Damn!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Hold it. One move from anybody and I blow that box back to Moses.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: What about you? Talked to God yet? Where's the girl?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: That depends on how reasonable we're all willing to be. All I want is the girl. We'll keep possession of the Ark only till we've got safe transport to England. Then it's all yours.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Then the Ark and some of us are going up in a big bang. I don't think Hitler would like that a bit. Now I don't want to talk about this anymore. Show me that girl in five seconds or -

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: It's a bad habit. I'm trying to break it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Thanks. If you talk to Him, tell Him I'm on my way up.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Marion! Marion, can you hear me?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Hi.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Glad I could make it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Let's get out of here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Are you game?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Okay. Let's do it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Whatever you do, don't touch it. Let's put it on the floor.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: We'll go down that side. Shoot anyone who looks at us crosseyed.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Get down!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: That's a powerful force. Research should be done -

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Who?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: We may be able to help.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: Yeah, like what?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Raiders-of-the-Lost-Ark
dialogue: It's not the Ark... but it'll have to do.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Lao She.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wah hung how, nee nah? Wah hwey hung jing chee jah loo nee kao soo wah shu shu.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I don't like to show off.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Sure, I found him. Then last night I had a little trouble. Somebody tried to slit my throat.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Next time I'll cut off more than his finger.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: As I recall the deal was consid- erably more.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Aren't you going to introduce us?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Well -- I thought archaeologists were always funny little men searching for their mummies -- Aaahhh!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Put the gun away, sonny.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Now I suggest you pay me what you promised -- or your girlfriend here is going to be squealing a new tune.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Try again Lao -- the deal was more.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Look at this! He put a hole in my dress from Paris!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What's that?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: This Nurhachi's a very small guy.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Inside are the remains of Nur- hachi -- the first Emperor of the Manchu Dynasty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: So, what's the big deal? Let me see it --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Ow, you're hurting me, you miser- able little hood!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Let go of her, Lao. And give me the antidote.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hey, he's not a waiter...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No, Wu Han's an old friend I brought along. So, the game's not over. Put the antidote on the table, Lao.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wu Han -- listen to me -- I'm going to get you out of here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The antidote -- !

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Look out, damn it, I need that antidote!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Who cares? Where's that diamond!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Excuse me, but I believe that's my diamond!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Aw nuts!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hey,doll! Don't move!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Step on it, Short Round!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: For crying out loud, a kid's driv- ing the car?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Relax, I've been giving him lessons.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Listen, we just met for crissake! I'm not that kind of gril!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Don't get your hopes up -- where's the antidote?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You don't look very good.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Poison never agrees with me. Pull a right, Short Round, and head for the Wang Poo bridge!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Look at what you've done to me! I'm a mess! My lipstick's smeared, I broke two nails, I've got an aw- ful run in my stocking -- !

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Somehow I think you've got bigger problems.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're we going to do?! Where're we going?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The airport...No, look out, Short Round! Left, left!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You got the tickets, Short Round?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wu Han's not coming, Shorty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'll take the extra ticket. Where's this plane going anyway?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Siam.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Siam? But I'm not dressed for Siam...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Thanks, Weber.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: So, what're you supposed to be, a lion tamer?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Since I was nice enough to let you tag along, why don't you give your mouth a rest? Okay, doll?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm freezing. What do you mean, tag along? From the minute you walked into that nightclub, you haven't been able to keep your eyes off me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh yeah?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wake up! It's the drug he drank to stop the poison --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You got to be kidding! No! No, I can't!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Give me that parachute, I changed my mind --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We there yet?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: There's nobody flying the plane!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No. Do you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You got it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Short Round, what in the hell are you doing?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Are you crazy, a lift raft?! We're not sinking, we're crashing!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Get over here, damn it! Short Round, come on, grab onto me tight!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wait for me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay, Shorty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No... I'm not cut out for the kind of life you lead. Oh no...I ripped my dress. Where are we anyway?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: India...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Holy cow -- India? How do you know we're in --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What'd he say?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He told me they knew I was coming here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What do you mean -- how?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The old man saw it in a dream.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Dream -- nightmare is more like it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He said that's whey they were at river -- they were waiting for the plane to fall down.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I hope this means we're going to get some dinner.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: God, I am starving, but I can't eat this...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's more food than these people eat in a week. They're starving, too...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm sorry, I -- here, please.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We'd appreciate that. This was an unexpected detour. We'll have to go to Delhi now and find a flight west.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm a professor. I have to re- turn to the university. Can you give us a guide to take us to Delhi?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Thank you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Pankot isn't on the way to Delhi.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hasn't the Pankot palace been de- serted since the Mutiny of 1857?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I don't understand. What's hap- pened here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What evil?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Took what?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's a sacred stone in a shine that's supposed to protect a village.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Nobody brought us here. Our plane crashed. We were shot down by --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's just superstition, Shorty. Like a ghost story.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Was the stone very smooth? It was probably brought here from a sacred river.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: And it had three lines painted across it? The lines represent the three levels of the universe. I've seen stones like the one you lost.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I don't understand how losing one rock could destroy this village. Is it really powerful?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: But why would the Maharajah take this sacred stone?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He says that when the sacred stone was taken the village wells dried up first and then the river stopped.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He says their crops dies and then the animals died.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: And then they took their children.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Their children?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He says one night there was a fire in the fields. The men went to fight it. When they came back, they heard the women crying in the darkness. And the children were gone.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm sorry, I don't know how I can help you here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I have friends in Delhi and I will make sure they investigate this...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What'd he say now?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It was destined that I came here -- and the future cannot be changed...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Sankara...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Damn it , Willie, get on -- we've got to move out!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Whoa! Easy now -- nice elephant...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Nope, you got a little surprise over there, Shorty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: This is the first time anybody ever cried when I left.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Figures...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: All right, let's go. I want to get to Pankot before tomorrow night.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Pankot?! I thought we were going to Delhi! Hey, wait a minute! Can't somebody take me to Delhi?! I don't want to go to Pankot!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I think you need this more than me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Those are very big bird.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Those aren't birds -- those are giant bats.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: They must be pretty dumb to drink that awful-looking water.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I think maybe we'll camp here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hey, Willie -- I think you better get out now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Stark naked? You wish... If you're trying to seduce me, Dr. Jones, this is a very primitive approach.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Me seduce you? Honey, you're the one who took your clothes off. I just came over to remind you that you never know what else might be in the water.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Somehow I feel safer in here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Indy! Help me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Don't worry, I'm coming in! What is it?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: A snake!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: A what...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: A SNAKE!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Uh, listen -- Willie -- I got a better idea.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: First of all -- don't panic!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's got me ! Indy, help me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Don't let it pull you deeper!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's pulling me deeper!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Don't let it curl around you!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's curling around me! Damn it, stop talking and do something!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Listen, Willie. Do exactly what I tell you now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Can you move your arm?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Just one arm!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay, I want you to lift your hand -- and pet the snake.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: PET IT??!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes, stroke it right along the maxillary and precaudal verte- brae.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: THE WHAT?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Pet it on the head! Go on, pet it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh -- my -- god -- it's going to crush me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Keep stroking it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's starting to let go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's good -- you're doing fine.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's letting fo. I think it's -- I think it's going to sleep!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: See -- I got you out...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Thanks for nothing! I hate snakes!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I know the feeling...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Where'd you find your little body- guard?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I met Short Round when he tried to pick my pocket.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He'll be okay. He's a good kid.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: By the way, how'd you end up in Shanghai?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Well, when my nightclub career was run over by the Depression, some pinhead convinced me that "a girl could go places in the Orient..." So, look where I got.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What about the future?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh, that's easy -- I'm going to latch onto a good-looking, in- credibly rich prince.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'd like to find one of those myself.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh really?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yeah, but he's got to be dead and buried for a couple of thousand years. Fortune and glory...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Is that what you're hoping to find at this palace, Dr. Jones?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Maybe...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What's that?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Something that kid gave me last night. It's a piece of an old manuscript.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What does the writing say?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's Sanskrit. It tells the story of Sankara climbing Mt. Kalisa where he met the Hindu god Shiva.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's Shiva? What's he giving the Priest?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Legend says he told Sankara to go forth and combat evil. To do that he gave him five sacred stones that had magical powers.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You mean magical like the rock that was stolen from that village?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It could be.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Fortune and glory...sweet dreams, Dr. Jones.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I think you should sleep closer. I meant for safety.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'd be safer sleeping with that snake.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Did you see it?! It was one of those bats! God, what else is out there...?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Couldn't keep away, huh?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Just try and control yourself.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Still scared? Okay, Willie, you can get closer if you want...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Honey, I knew you'd be the first one to give in...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's it. Pankot Palace.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Why are we stopping here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Just a statue.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What's the guide talking about? He hasn't said a word the whole trip.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He's afraid of something.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He said he couldn't take us any farther. He has to go sell the elephants.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You mean we have to walk the rest of the way?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: -- shot at, fallen out of a plane, nearly drowned, squashed by a snake, attacked by a bat -- I smell like an elephant! I tell you I'm not going to make it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Any more complaints?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yeah, I wish you'd thought of this sooner...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It doesn't feel like there's been any permanent damage.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hello?... ...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Lost? No, we're not lost. We're on our way to Delhi. This is Miss Scott -- and Mr. Round. My name's Indiana Jones.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hard to believe, isn't it...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: How'd you like to run into him in a dark alley...that one's kind of cute...I could see myself married to a prince like that...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You should have been there...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We'd appreciate it if the Mahara- jah would let us stay tonight. We'll be on out way in the morn- ing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Is that him?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh -- good. And maybe the pres- ent Marahajah is a little younger? And thinner?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Dinner? And with a prince?! My luck is changing. But look at me -- my god, I've to to get ready!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You look like a princess.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's sort of like being in heaven.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I've always had a weakness for folk dancing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: She might get away with that act here, but she'd never make it in a real nightclub.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Listen, Mr. Lal, what do you call the Maharajah's wife?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No? Well, I guess he just hasn't met the right woman...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No. But I am interested in the occult. And this is a krtya.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's like the voodoo dolls of West Africa. The kryta represents your enemy -- and gives you complete power over him.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You think so?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're hanging on better here than you did in America.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The Prime Minister doesn't seem that naive.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I think this Maharajah is swim- ming in money. Maybe coming here wasn't such a bad idea.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Finally!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's the Maharajah -- that kid?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Maybe he likes older women.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Cheer up, you lost your prince, but dinner's on the way.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I've never been so hungry in my life...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: My god, sort of grusome, isn't it...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We are honored to be here.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Suddenly I'm not so hungry...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I had a question, Mr. Prime Mini- ster. I was examining some of the Maharajah's artifacts.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes, very fine. But not all of the pieces look old. Some were carved recently and look like images used by the Thuggees to worship the god- des Kali.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I uh -- had bugs for lunch.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I suppose stories of the Thuggees die hard.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Well, I don't know... we came here from a small village and the peas- ants there told us that the Pankot Palace was growing powerful again -- becuase of some ancient evil.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Maybe.. but how do you explain The Thuggee shrine I saw right below the palace?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Give me your hat...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm going to puke in it...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You know the villagers also claimed that this palace stole something from them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Sorry, I thought we were just talking about folklore.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Something magical. A sacred rock.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: When they lost this rock their fields and animals dies. They also said their children were taken from them.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: So you have something, you know, simple -- like soup or something?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I wanna go home...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I was dubious muself at first. Then something connected -- the village's rock and the old legend of the Sankara Stones...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The newspapers exaggerated the incident

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That was a misunderstanding.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm sorry if I've offended you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Even if they were trying to scare us away, a devout Hindu would never touch meat. Makes you wonder what these people are...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We're guests here, Shorty.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You wish is my command, your Highness.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay, Short Round, let go of it.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You don't like him do you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He was afraid of you. He knows a tough guy when he sees one.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I better see how Willie is.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I brought you something.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Not leftovers?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No -- real food.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh, it is real food...it's beautiful.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wearing your jewels to be, prin- cess?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yeah -- and nothing else. That shock you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm a scientist. I like doing research on certain "nocturnal activities" --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You mean like love rituals...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: And mating customs...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Primitive sexual practices?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're taling to an authority in that area.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're dying to come into my room, aren't you?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You want me so bad, why don't you invite me?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Too proud to admit you're crazy about me, Dr. Jones?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I think you're too used to get- ting you own way, Willie...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We'll see who gives in first -- I'll leave my door open.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Don't catch cold.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Dr. Jones -- ?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're dreaming, Willie. You want to make it real, just knock on my door.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Five minutes... fat chance.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Five minutes, Dr. Jones...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: ...want me to be her palace slave!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay, Shorty ... see you in the morning...I'm going to have a little -- word with Willie.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: He's not coming...I can't be- lieve it...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's okay, it's over -- go turn off the fan.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: This a cheap trick to get me over here?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No -- don't you see -- crawling --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What -- the bug?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Get -- the -- bug -- off!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Gee, I wouldn't want to touch an ugly critter like that!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh no -- oh no!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You know, Willie, I'll bet he's mad because they were eating his friends for dinner.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Please -- oh please, I'm going to die! Get it off!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What did I do to deserve this trip?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm packing! I'm getting out of here right now tonight!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: "Follow in the footsteps of Shiva. Do not betray his truth."

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I don't care if I have to walk to Delhi, I'm -- hey!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Lock your door and don't leave until we get back.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're right, there's something all over the floor...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: There's a chamber here. Come on --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Damn!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hey -- where are you?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes, we're in here...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Uh -- Willie?! Willie, you better get down here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Willie, come here! Hurry up, we're in trouble!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Willie, damn it! Get down here, NOW

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh hell -- I bet I get all dirty again!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: WILLIE?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm coming, what's the rush?! Ohh! What's that?! There's stuff all over the floor! I can't see a thing!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Move, Willie! Faster!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's all wet and icky! Aaahh -- things are moving!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: There's bugs! Bugs all over! Help! Help me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Willie, open the door! GET US OUT OF HERE!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: OPEN THE DOOR! LET ME IN!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: GET US OUT! Willie, shut up and listen! There's got to be a ful- crum release! Look around!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: A what?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: A fulcrum release lever!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I can't find any lever! Help me Indy!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Look around, Willie! There's got to be a liever hidden somewhere! Come on, you can do it!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: There's a hole! I found a square hole!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's it -- the release lever -- look inside!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I am -- it looks horrible!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Reach inside!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I can't, Indy! I can't!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The lever! Willie, do it! NOW!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh God, it's soft -- it's moving!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Willie!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Get is off me -- get it off!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Not that one! We had enought of that one, thank you...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What is it...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's a Thuggee ceremony. They're whorshipping Kali, the goddess of Death and Destruction.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh my God! He ripped out his -- he killed him!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No...the heart's still beating!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Let's go! Let's get out of here!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Quiet!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The village knew their rock was magic -- but they didn't know it was one of the lost Sankara Stones...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Legend says that when the stones are brought together the diamonds inside of them will glow.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Diamonds...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay -- now listen -- you wait here and keep quiet. Shorty, keep an eye on her.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Wait -- what're you doing?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm going down.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Down? Down there?! Are you crazy --!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm not leaving without those stones.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're gonna get killed chasing after your damn fortune and glory!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Maybe...someday. Not today.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh hell, where's he going?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're you -- ?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Why?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What is that?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Nobody's perfect. The way I heard it, you stole one of them from a small village.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Two are still missing.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: That's what you've got these chil- dren -- these slaves digging for?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Nobody can say you don't have a vivid imagination.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh my God, you scared me! Listen, you've got to help. We found this tunnel --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No -- you can't go! Something aw- ful's happened. They've got Short Round and I think Indy's been --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We found a tennel that leads to a temple below the palace! Please, come with me, I'll show you!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm afraid they'll kill them! We saw horrible things down there -- they had a human sacrifice and they ripped a man's heart out!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's some kind of cult! And they've got the sacred stones that Indy was searching for.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're you talking about -- I'm not a dope fiend! I saw it! I'll show you!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're we playing, hid and seek?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh, Indy, you got away! Tell them what happened, they won't believe me --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's okay. You're all right now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: They think I'm insane. Tell them I'm not, Indy. Please -- help me ...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Hey, I thought you were supposed to be a real tropper. Willie?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You've got to go to sleep now.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I want to go home...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I don't blame you... this hasn't been what you'd call a fun vaca- tion...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I've spent by life crawling around in caves and tunnels -- I shouldn't have let somebody like Willie go in there with me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: When she saw the insects she passed out cold. I carried her back to her room. She was sleeping when I re-entered the tunnel to look around.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Then she must have run out of the room and you found her.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Nothing. Just a dead end. That tunnel's been deserted for years.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Thanks, but I don't think Willie is ready to travel yet.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Indy? Did you walk to them?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: So now they believe me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes, they believe you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Then they'll send the soldiers down into the temple...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No... they won't kill me.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You know you've been nothing but trouble since I hooked up with you -- but I have to admit I'd miss you if I lost you...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You won't lose me, Willie...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No! I've found it -- you can't -- Kali knows!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: -- been too many lies -- there's no god's heaven -- just -- the horror! I've seen it -- life preying on life!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: -- rivers -- destroying mountains -- a comet in space -- exploding! Aaahh! -- the screams -- pitiful people -- their pain -- the hate -- and greed -- always greed!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: -- but I've found -- Kali's touch! Death -- no more lies -- the death I've been searching for! Quit crying! She can hear you -- Kali knows fear -- don't you under- stand -- Kali is freedom!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes, I understand.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Kali Ma protects us now and for- ever, and we must pledge our devotion by worshipping her with an offering of flesh and blood!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Indy! Help me! Indy?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Please, God, don't let them do this to me -- help me, Indy!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No! Give him to me!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Look out -- !

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Come on, quick!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're we going to do?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We're going to get them out of here -- !

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Ah, sir? Excuse me --

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: No, wait!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're we going to do?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: There's got to be another way out.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Those empty cars have got to go out of the mines.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I can't!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: We've got to get across to the empty cars. Wait here until I signal you.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Come on!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I see the problem...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What happened?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What's wrong with him?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I got one! Indy, I got one!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Indy, look out!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Get down here, Shorty! I got us a ride!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I don't appreciate being cooked like a french fry!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Come here and take the brake!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Let up on the brake!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Let her go! Our only chance is outrunning them!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What above the curves?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What're you doing?! We're going too fast!!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Get over on the other side!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: One down, one to go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Anymore ideas...?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yeah -- this time you're gonna help!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay -- one -- two -- NOW!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Okay, Shorty, hit the brakes!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Grab onto me -- I'm going to try and slow us down from underneath!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh no!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What's wrong?

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Ouch...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I'm okay -- I'm fine -- I love to flirt with death...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: What's that?...Indy?!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh... shit...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: There! Dive!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Lucky I found a short cut. Look, there's a light at the end of the tunnel...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Some short cut!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Willie -- the bridge! Climb up to the bridge!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Indy -- looks out behind you!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Let my friends go!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You want the stones, let them go and call off your guards!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Then I guess we're all going to take a big dive!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Mola Ram -- you're about to meet Kali -- in Hell!

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You're betrayed Shiva. *

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: I guess Mola Ram got what he wanted.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Not quite.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: And the diamond hidden inside...

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's a real miracle.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Yes, I've seen its power

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: The last Sankara Stone.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: And they don't even know what it really is.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Well, you didn't get your prince, and there goes your diamond.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: You didn't do so well yourself. Finding that stone could've got- ten you all the fortune and glory you were talking about.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: It's still a long way to Delhi. Who knows what might happen.

title: Indiana-Jones-and-the-Temple-of-Doom
dialogue: Oh no, I'm finding a native guide who knows the way. No more de- tours for me, thank you Dr. Jones.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And here comes the scare-baby, my kid brother, Harry Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm not scared.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm coming, Harry.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Make a chain, gang! A chain!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Potter!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: So long!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Wish I had a million dollars.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hot dog!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It's me, Mr. Gower. George Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Violet.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Two cents worth of shoelaces?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm still thinking.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Shoelaces?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You like every boy.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here you are.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Help you down!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Made up your mind yet?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll take chocolate.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: With coconuts?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't like coconuts.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You don't like coconuts! Say, brainless, don't you know where coconuts come from? Lookit here  from Tahiti  Fiji Islands, the Coral Sea!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: A new magazine! I never saw it before.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Of course you never. Only us explorers can get it. I've been nominated for membership in the National Geographic Society.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is this the ear you can't hear on? George Bailey, I'll love you till the day I die.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm going out exploring some day, you watch. And I'm going to have a couple of harems, and maybe three or four wives. Wait and see.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Gower, do you want something... Anything?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Anything I can do back here?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll get them, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir. They have the diphtheria there, haven't they, sir?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is it a charge, sir?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Gower, I think...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Got to see Pop, Uncle Billy.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It's important.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm not crying, Mr. Potter.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All I'm asking is thirty days more...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Pop!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just a minute, son. Just thirty short days. I'll dig up that five thousand somehow.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Pop!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Times are bad, Mr. Potter. A lot of these people are out of work.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I can't do that. These families have children.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Pop!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: But they're somebody's children.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, all right...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Potter, what makes you such a hardskulled character? You have no family  no children. You can't begin to spend all the money you've got.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He's not a failure! You can't say that about my father!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George, George...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You're not! You're the biggest man in town!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Run along.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Bigger'n him!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Bigger'n everybody.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Don't let him say that about you, Pop.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right, son, thanks. I'll talk to you tonight.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Capsules...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir, I...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You're hurting my sore ear.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Gower, you don't know what you're doing. You put something wrong in those capsules. I know you're unhappy. You got that telegram, and you're upset. You put something bad in those capsules. It wasn't your fault, Mr. Gower...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just look and see what you did. Look at the bottle you took the powder from. It's poison! I tell you, it's poison! I know you feel bad... and...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Don't hurt my sore ear again.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Don't hurt my ear again!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Gower, I won't ever tell anyone. I know what you're feeling. I won't ever tell a soul. Hope to die, I won't.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Nope. Nope. Nope. Nope. Now, look, Joe. Now, look, I... I want a big one.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Big - see! I don't want one for one night. I want something for a thousand and one nights, with plenty of room for labels from Italy and Baghdad, Samarkand... a great big one.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now you're talkin'. Gee whiz, I could use this as a raft in case the boat sunk. How much does this cost?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: That's my trick ear, Joe. It sounded as if you said no charge.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's my name doing on it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He did? Whatta you know about that  my old boss...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm working across on a cattle boat.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, I like cows.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Gower... Mr. Gower... thanks ever so much for the bag. It's just exactly what I wanted.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, it's wonderful.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh... Oh. Wish I had a million dollars.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hot dog!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey, Ernie!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hi, Bert.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Ernie, I'm a rich tourist today. How about driving me home in style?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Violet. Hey, you look good. That's some dress you got on there.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I've eaten.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't care. It's George's tux.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Annie, I'm in love with you. There's a moon out tonight.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Boy, oh, boy, oh, boy  my last meal at the old Bailey boarding house.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Pop, can I have the car? I'm going to take over a lot of plates and things.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, Mom  I'm chairman of the eats committee and we only need a couple of dozen.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, let him have the plates, Mother.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm going to miss you, too, Pop. What's the matter? You look tired.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I wonder what's eating that old money grubbing buzzard anyway?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Gangway! Gangway! So long, Pop.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Got a match?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Very funny. Very funny.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, Mom. You coming later? You coming later, George?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you mean, and be bored to death?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Couldn't want a better death. Lots of pretty girls, and we're going to use that new floor of yours tonight, too.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I hope it works.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, Pop, just a little.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Father, did I act like that when I graduated from high school?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: We have that all figured out. You see, Harry'll take my job at the Building and Loan, work there four years, then he'll go.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, no younger than I was.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How's that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, well, you know what I've always talked about  build things... design new buildings  plan modern cities  all that stuff I was talking about.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, I'll settle for half that in cash.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I... Annie, why don't you draw up a chair? Then you'd be more comfortable and you could hear everything that's going on.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You would, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, now, Pop, I couldn't. I couldn't face being cooped up for the rest of my life in a shabby little office.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry, Pop. I didn't mean that remark, but this business of nickels and dimes and spending all your life trying to figure out how to save three cents on a length of pipe... I'd go crazy. I want to do something big and something important.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I know, Dad. I wish I felt... But I've been hoarding pennies like a miser in order to... Most of my friends have already finished college. I just feel like if I don't get away, I'd bust.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You see what I mean, don't you, Pop?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Pop, do you want a shock? I think you're a great guy.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, did you hear that, Annie?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm going to miss old Annie. Pop, I think I'll get dressed and go over to Harry's party.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here you are.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You know my kid brother, George. I'm going to put him through college.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here comes George. Hello, hee-haw!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, oh. Sam Wainwright! How are you? When did you get here?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, this afternoon. I thought I'd give the kids a treat.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Old college graduate now, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah  old Joe College Wainwright, they call me. Well, freshman, looks like you're going to make it after all.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yep.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Harry! You're the guy I want to see. Coach has heard all about you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He has?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah. He's followed every game and his mouth's watering. He wants me to find out if you're going to come along with us.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I gotta make some dough first.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, you better make it fast. We need great ends like you  not broken down old guys like this one.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hee-haw!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hee-haw!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Mr. Partridge, how are you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Violet.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hiya, Marty. Well, it's old home week.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, yeah, yeah.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: "Momma wants you, Marty." "Momma wants you, Marty." Remember?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh... me? Oh, well, I feel funny enough already, with all these kids.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, go on.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, excuse me, Violet. Don't be long, Marty. I don't want to be a wet nurse for...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well... Well... Well...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, why don't you stop annoying people?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, hello.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello. You look at me as if you didn't know me.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I don't.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You've passed me on the street almost every day.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Uh-huh.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Uh-uh. That was a little girl named Mary Hatch. That wasn't you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oyez  oyez  oyez... The big Charleston contest. The prize? A genuine loving cup. Those not tapped by the judges will remain on the floor. Let's go!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm not very good at this.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Neither am I.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay  what can we lose?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: They're cheering us. We must be good.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hot dog! Just like an organ.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Beautiful.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And I told Harry I thought I'd be bored to death. You should have seen the commotion in that locker room. I had to knock down three people to get this stuff we're wearing here. Here, let me hold that old wet dress of yours.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Do I look as funny as you do?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I guess I'm not quite the football type. You... look wonderful. You know, if it wasn't me talking I'd say you were the prettiest girl in town.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, why don't you say it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't know. Maybe I will say it. How old are you anyway?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Eighteen.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Eighteen? Why, it was only last year you were seventeen.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Too young or too old?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, no. Just right. Your age fits you. Yes, sir, you look a little older without your clothes on.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I mean, without a dress. You look older... I mean, younger. You look just...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh-oh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Sir, my train, please.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: A pox upon me for a clumsy lout.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Your... your caboose, my lady.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You may kiss my hand.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Ummmmm...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey  hey, Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: As I was lumbering down the street...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, then, I'll throw a rock at the old Granville house.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, no, don't. I love that old house.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No. You see, you make a wish and then try and break some glass. You got to be a pretty good shot nowadays, too.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, no, George, don't. It's full of romance, that old place. I'd like to live in it.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: In that place?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Uh-huh.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I wouldn't live in it as a ghost. Now watch... right on the second floor there.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What'd you wish, George?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, not just one wish. A whole hatful, Mary. I know what I'm going to do tomorrow and the next day and the next year and the year after that. I'm shaking the dust of this crummy little town off my feet and I'm going to see the world. Italy, Greece, the Parthenon, the Colosseum. Then I'm coming back here and go to college and see what they know... and then I'm going to build things. I'm gonna build air fields. I'm gonna build skyscrapers a hundred stories high. I'm gonna build bridges a mile long...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Are you gonna throw a rock?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey, that's pretty good. What'd you wish, Mary?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Buffalo Gals, can't you come out tonight...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What'd you wish when you threw that rock?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, no.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Come on, tell me.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: If I told you it might not come true.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What is it you want, Mary? What do you want? You want the moon? Just say...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: ...the word and I'll throw a lasso around it and pull it down. Hey, that's a pretty good idea. I'll give you the moon, Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll take it. And then what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, then you could swallow it and it'd all dissolve, see? And the moonbeams'd shoot out of your fingers and your toes, and the ends of your hair. Am I talking too much?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How's that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Want me to kiss her, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey, hey, hold on. Hey, mister, come on back out here, and I'll show you some kissing that'll put hair back on your head. What are you...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mary...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, I give up. Where are you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Over here in the hydrangea bushes.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here you are. Catch.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Wait a minute. What am I doing? This is a very interesting situation.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Please give me my robe.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hmm... A man doesn't get in a situation like this every day.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'd like to have my robe.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Not in Bedford Falls, anyway.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Ouch!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Gesundheit. This requires a little thought here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George Bailey! Give me my robe!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I've heard about things like this, but I've never...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Shame on you. I'm going to tell your mother on you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, my mother's way up the corner there.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll call the police.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: They're way downtown. They'd be on my side, too.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm going to scream!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Maybe I could sell tickets. Let's see. No, the point is, in order to get this robe... I've got it! I'll make a deal with you, Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mary... Mary, I'm sorry. I've got to go.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Come on, George, let's hurry.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Did you get a doctor?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I have a taxi waiting downstairs.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Thanks.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Thank you very much.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I handled that, Mr. Potter. You have all the papers there. His salary, insurance. I can personally vouch for his character.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just a minute  just a minute. Now, hold on, Mr. Potter. You're right when you say my father was no business man. I know that. Why he ever started this cheap, penny-ante Building and Loan, I'll never know. But neither you nor anybody else can say anything against his character, because his whole life was... Why, in the twenty- five years since he and Uncle Billy started this thing, he never once thought of himself. Isn't that right, Uncle Billy? He didn't save enough money to send Harry to school, let alone me. But he did help a few people get out of your slums, Mr. Potter. And what's wrong with that? Why... Here, you're all businessmen here. Doesn't it make them better citizens? Doesn't it make them better customers? You... you said... What'd you say just a minute ago?... They had to wait and save their money before they even ought to think of a decent home. Wait! Wait for what? Until their children grow up and leave them? Until they're so old and broken- down that they... Do you know how long it takes a working man to save five thousand dollars?
