Just remember this, Mr. Potter, that this rabble you're talking about... they do most of the working and paying and living and dying in this community. Well, is it too much to have them work and pay and live and die in a couple of decent rooms and a bath? Anyway, my father didn't think so. People were human beings to him, but to you, a warped, frustrated old man, they're cattle. Well, in my book he died a much richer man than you'll ever be!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I know very well what you're talking about. You're talking about something you can't get your fingers on, and it's galling you. That's what you're talking about, I know. Well, I've said too much. I... You're the Board here. You do what you want with this thing. Just one thing more, though. This town needs this measly one-horse institution if only to have some place where people can come without crawling to Potter. Come on, Uncle Billy!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, I'll be right down.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I wonder what's going on in there?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, no! But, Uncle Billy...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Dr. Campbell, now let's get this thing straight. I'm leaving. I'm leaving right now. I'm going to school. This is my last chance. Uncle Billy here, he's your man.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, there are plenty of jobs around for somebody that likes to travel. Look at this. There... Venezuela oil fields  wanted, man with construction experience. Here's the Yukon, right here  wanted, man with engineering experience.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Thar she blows. You know what the three most exciting sounds in the world are?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, no, no, no! Anchor chains, plane motors, and train whistles.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: There's the professor now! Old professor, Phi Beta Kappa Bailey! All American!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, if it isn't old George Geographic Explorer Bailey! What? No husky dogs? No sled? Uncle Billy, you haven't changed a bit.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, am I glad to see you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Say, where's Mother?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: She's home cooking the fatted calf. Come on, let's go.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, wait. Wait... Wait a minute.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Ruth Dakin.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I wired you I had a surprise. Here she is. Meet the wife.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, how do you do. Congratulations. Congratulations. What am I doing?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Harry, why didn't you tell somebody? What's a pretty girl like you doing marrying this two-headed brother of mine?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George... about that job. Ruth spoke out of turn. I never said I'd take it. You've been holding the bag here for four years, and... well, I won't let you down, George. I would like to... Oh, wait a minute. I forgot the bags. I'll be right back.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Ruth, this... what about this job?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is it a good job?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And you did, too?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: The middle one.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Right down here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now you just turn this way and go right straight down.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Mom.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: She's swell.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Keep him out of Bedford Falls, anyway.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Uh-huh.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hmmmm...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hmmmm...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hmmm...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hmmm...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Sure  Sam Wainwright.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes. Sam's crazy about Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, how do you know? Did she discuss it with you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well then, how do you know?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And all's fair in love and war?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mother, you know, I can see right through you  right back to your back collar button... trying to get rid of me, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, here's your hat, what's your hurry? All right, Mother, old Building and Loan pal, I think I'll go out and find a girl and do a little passionate necking.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now, if you'll just point me in the right direction... This direction? Good night, Mrs. Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Vi.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Nothing.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I'll probably end up down at the library.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes... what are you doing tonight?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Are you game, Vi? Let's make a night of it.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Let's go out in the fields and take off our shoes and walk through the grass.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Then we can go up to the falls. It's beautiful up there in the moonlight, and there's a green pool up there, and we can swim in it. Then we can climb Mt. Bedford, and smell the pines, and watch the sunrise against the peaks, and... we'll stay up there the whole night, and everybody'll be talking and there'll be a terrific scandal...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Shhh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, just forget about the whole thing.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What are you doing, picketing?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Mary. I just happened to be passing by.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, so I noticed. Have you made up your mind?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How's that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Have you made up your mind?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: About what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: About coming in. Your mother just phoned and said you were on your way over to pay me a visit.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: My mother just called you? Well, how did she know?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Didn't you tell her?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I didn't tell anybody. I just went for a walk and happened to be passing by...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you... went for a walk, that's all.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll be downstairs, mother.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, are you coming in or aren't you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I'll come in for a minute, but I didn't tell anybody I was coming over here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: When did you get back?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Tuesday.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Where'd you get that dress?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Do you like it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It's all right. I thought you'd go back to New York like Sam and Ingie, and the rest of them.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I worked there for a couple of vacations, but I don't know... I guess I was homesick.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Homesick? For Bedford Falls?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, and my family and... oh, everything. Would you like to sit down?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right, for a minute. I still can't understand it though. You know I didn't tell anybody I was coming here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Would you rather leave?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, I don't want to be rude.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, then, sit down.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Some joke, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I see it still smells like pine needles in here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Thank you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: "And dance by the light..."

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's the matter? Oh, yeah... yeah...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It was nice about your brother Harry, and Ruth, wasn't it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh... yeah, yeah. That's all right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Don't you like her?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, of course I like her. She's a peach.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, it's just marriage in general you're not enthusiastic about, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, marriage is all right for Harry, and Marty, and Sam and you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It's George Bailey, Mother.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't know. What do you want?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Me? Not a thing. I just came in to get warm.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He's making violent love to me, Mother.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: But your mother needn't... you know I didn't come here to... to... to...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What did you come here for?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't know. You tell me. You're supposed to be the one that has all the answers. You tell me.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, why don't you go home?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: That's where I'm going. I don't know why I came here in the first place! Good night!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Good night!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll get it.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I forgot my hat.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hee-haw! Hello, Sam, how are you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, well, that's awfully sweet of you, Sam. There's an old friend of yours here. George Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You mean old moss-back George?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, old moss-back George.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Wait a minute. I'll call him. George!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He does so. He asked for him. Geo... George, Sam wants to speak to you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Sam.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, George Baileyoffski! Hey, a fine pal you are. What're you trying to do? Steal my girl?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you mean? Nobody's trying to steal your girl. Here... here's Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here. You take it. You tell him.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mother's on the extension.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: We can both hear. Come here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: We're listening, Sam.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Huh? Yeah-yeah-yeah... soybeans. Yeah.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Rochester? Well, why Rochester?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I don't know... why not right here? You remember that old tool and machinery works? You tell your father he can get that for a song. And all the labor he wants, too. Half the town was thrown out of work when they closed down.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Money? Yeah... well, a little.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He says it's the chance of a lifetime.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now you listen to me! I don't want any plastics! I don't want any ground floors, and I don't want to get married  ever  to anyone! You understand that? I want to do what I want to do. And you're... and you're...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, Mary... Mary...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George... George... George...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mary...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey, look! Somebody's driving this cab.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, look at this. Champagne!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Good old Bert.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Where are we going? Look at this. There's the kitty, Ernie. Here, come on, count it, Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I feel like a bootlegger's wife. Look!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You know what we're going to do? We're going to shoot the works. A whole week in New York. A whole week in Bermuda. The highest hotels  the oldest champagne  the richest caviar  the hottest music, and the prettiest wife!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Then what, honey?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: After that, who cares?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: That does it  come here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George, let's not stop. Let's go!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just a minute, dear. Oh-oh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Please, let's not stop, George.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll be back in a minute, Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, everybody. Mrs. Thompson, how are you? Charlie? What's the matter here, can't you get in?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What is this, Uncle Billy? A holiday?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Come on in, everybody. That's right, just come in.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now look, why don't you all sit down. There are a lot of seats over there. Just make yourselves at home.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Why didn't you call me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right now, what happened? How did it start?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: When?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All of it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Holy mackerel!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: The whole town's gone crazy.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Police? What for?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He just took over the bank.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, you never miss a trick, do you, Potter? Well, you're going to miss this one.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah... ...you can take this one off now.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now, just remember that this thing isn't as black as it appears.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I have some news for you, folks. I've just talked to old man Potter, and he's guaranteed cash payments at the bank. The bank's going to reopen next week.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, no, Charlie. I didn't even ask him. We don't need Potter over here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, but you... you... you're thinking of this place all wrong. As if I had the money back in a safe. The money's not here. Your money's in Joe's house... ...right next to yours. And in the Kennedy house, and Mrs. Macklin's house, and a hundred others. Why, you're lending them the money to build, and then, they're going to pay it back to you as best they can. Now what are you going to do? Foreclose on them?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, Tom. All right. Here you are. You sign this. You'll get your money in sixty days.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, now that's what you agreed to when you bought your shares.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now, Tom, you have to stick to your original agreement. Now give us sixty days on this.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Tom! Tom! Randall! Now wait... now listen... now listen to me. I beg of you not to do this thing. If Potter gets hold of this Building and Loan there'll never be another decent house built in this town. He's already got charge of the bank. He's got the bus line. He's got the department stores. And now he's after us. Why? Well, it's very simple. Because we're cutting in on his business, that's why. And because he wants to keep you living in his slums and paying the kind of rent he decides.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Joe, you lived in one of his houses, didn't you? Well, have you forgotten? Have you forgotten what he charged you for that broken-down shack? Here, Ed. You know, you remember last year when things weren't going so well, and you couldn't make your payments. You didn't lose your house, did you? Do you think Potter would have let you keep it? Can't you understand what's happening here? Don't you see what's happening? Potter isn't selling. Potter's buying! And why? Because we're panicky and he's not. That's why. He's picking up some bargains. Now, we can get through this thing all right. We've got to stick together, though. We've got to have faith in each other.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How much do you need?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey! I got two thousand dollars! Here's two thousand dollars. This'll tide us over until the bank reopen. All right, Tom, how much do you need?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, Tom, just enough to tide you over till the bank reopens.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: There you are.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Your account's still here. That's a loan.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay. All right, Ed?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, now, Ed... what'll it take till the bank reopens? What do you need?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Twenty dollars. Now you're talking. Fine. Thanks, Ed. All right, now, Mrs. Thompson. How much do you want?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Never mind about that. How much do you want?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Twenty dollars.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You don't have to sign anything. I know you'll pay it back when you can. That's okay. All right, Mrs. Davis.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Seven... Bless your heart, Of course you can have it. You got fifty cents? Seven...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Six... five... four... three... two... one... Bingo!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: We made it! Look... ... look, we're still in business! We've still got two bucks left!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, let's have some of that. Get some glasses, Cousin Tilly. We're a couple of financial wizards.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Get a tray for these great big important simoleons.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: A toast! A toast to Papa Dollar and to Mama Dollar, and if you want the old Building and Loan to stay in business, you better have a family real quick.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I wish they were too. Okay, let's put them in the safe and see what happens.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh-oh... wedding! Holy mackerel, I'm married! Where's Mary? Mary... Poor Mary. Look, I've got a train to catch. Well, the train's gone. I wonder if Ernie's still here with his taxicab?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Look, will you get my wife on the phone? She's probably over at her mother's.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't want Mrs. Bailey. I want my wife. Mrs. Bailey! Oh, that's my wife! Here, I'll take it in here. Mary? Hello. Listen, dear, I'm sorry... What? Come home? What home? Three-twenty Sycamore? Well, what... whose home is that? The Waldorf Hotel, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Welcome home, Mr. Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I'll be... Mary, Mary, where did you...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, Mary...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Remember the night we broke the windows in this old house? This is what I wished for.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Darling, you're wonderful.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Come on... Bring the baby. I'll bring the kids in the car.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right, kids  here  get in here. Now get right up on the seat there. Get the... get the goat!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All in...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. and Mrs. Martini, welcome home. The Martinis cross themselves.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: That old George... he's always making a speech. Hee-haw!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Sam Wainwright!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, who cares. Bread! That this house may never know hunger.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Salt! That life may always have flavor.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And wine! That joy and prosperity may reign forever. Enter the Martini castle!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: We just stopped in town to take a look at the new factory, and then we're going to drive on down to Florida.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Why don't you have your friends join us?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Why, sure. Hey, why don't you kids drive down with us, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I'm afraid I couldn't get away, Sam.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Still got the nose to the old grindstone, eh? Jane, I offered to let George in on the ground floor in plastics, and he turned me down cold.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, now, don't rub it in.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm not rubbing it in. Well, I guess we better run along.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Awfully glad to have met you, Mary.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Nice meeting you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Goodbye.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Goodbye, George.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: So long, George. See you in the funny papers.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Goodbye, Sam.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Have fun.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Thanks for dropping around.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: To Florida! Hee-haw!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hee-haw.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Thank you, sir. Quite a cigar, Mr. Potter.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I... I suppose I'll find out sooner or later, but just what exactly did you want to see me about?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes. Well, most people say you stole all the rest.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Forty-five!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now what's your point, Mr. Potter?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hire me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Twenty thou... twenty thousand dollars a year?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Would I? You're not talking to somebody else around here, are you? You know, this is me, you remember me? George Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, what about the Building and Loan?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, Mr. Potter, I... I... I know I ought to jump at the chance, but I... I just... I wonder if it would be possible for you to give me twenty- four hours to think it over?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'd like to do that.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay, Mr. Potter.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No... no... no... no, now wait a minute, here! I don't have to talk to anybody! I know right now, and the answer is no! NO! Doggone it! You sit around here and you spin your little webs and you think the whole world revolves around you and your money. Well, it doesn't, Mr. Potter! In the... in the whole vast configuration of things, I'd say you were nothing but a scurvy little spider. You...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: ...And that goes for you too!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And it goes for you too!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Buffalo Gals, won't you come out tonight, won't you come out tonight, won't you come out tonight.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hi.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hi.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mary Hatch, why in the world did you ever marry a guy like me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: To keep from being an old maid.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You could have married Sam Wainwright or anybody else in town.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I didn't want to marry anybody else in town. I want my baby to look like you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You didn't even have a honeymoon. I promised you... ...Your what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: My baby.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You mean... Mary, you on the nest?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George Bailey lassos stork.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Lassos the stork! You mean you... What is it, a boy or a girl?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hold on... hold on... hold on now. Don't you know there's a war on?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hi, Ernie, look at that.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you mean  it's gonna snow again? Look at the headlines.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Commander Harry Bailey. Mr. Gower, look at this  the second page. Now look, this is for you. This is for you, this is for you. See you again.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Extra! Extra! Read all about it!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Harry! What do you know about that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you mean it's okay? For a hero? Harry! Oh, you old seven kinds of a son of a gun. Congratulations! How's Mother standing it?... She did? What do you know... Mother had lunch with the President's wife!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What did they have to eat? Harry, you should see what they're cooking up in the town for you... Oh, are they? The Navy's going to fly Mother home this afternoon.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What? Uncle Billy? Has Uncle Billy come in yet?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He's not here right now, Harry.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: But look...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: ...now tell me about it.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What man?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh... Talk to Eustace a minute, will you. I'll be right back.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Good morning, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Carter, Merry Christmas.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: We're all excited around here. My brother just got the Congressional Medal of Honor. The President just decorated him.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Good year? Well, between you and me, Mr. Carter, we're broke.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well... ...now, come right in here, Mr. Carter.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, no. He wants to talk to Uncle Billy. You just hold on.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't blame you at all, Mr. Carter, Just step right in here. We'll fix you up.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just make yourself at home, Mr. Carter. I'll get those books for you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, hello, Vi.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Why, of course you can. Come on in the office here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Uncle Billy, talk to Harry. He's on the telephone.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here you are.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It takes a lot of character to leave your home town and start all over again. He pulls some money from his pocket, and offers it to her.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Here, now, you're broke, aren't you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you want to do, hock your furs, and that hat? Want to walk to New York? You know, they charge for meals and rent up there just the same as they do in Bedford Falls.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It's a loan. That's my business. Building and Loan. Besides, you'll get a job. Good luck to you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Say hello to New York for me.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now, let's hear from you...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's the matter? Merry Christmas, Vi.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, Mr. Carter, I'm sorry. I'll be right with you. Uncle Billy in?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Unc... What's going on? The bank examiner's here, and I...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, yeah. He wants the accounts payable...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's the matter with you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Eustace...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Come here a minute.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Did you see Uncle Billy with any cash last night?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now look, did you buy anything?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right. All right. Now we'll go over every step you took since you left the house.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: And did you put the envelope in your pocket?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Maybe  maybe! I don't want any maybe. Uncle Billy, we've got to find that money!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Listen to me. Do you have any secret hiding place here in the house? Someplace you could have put it? Someplace to hide the money?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Listen to me! Listen to me! Think! Think!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Where's that money, you stupid, silly old fool? Where's the money? Do you realize what this means? It means bankruptcy and scandal, and prison!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: That's what it means! One of us is going to jail! Well, it's not going to be me!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello darling.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How do you like it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Did you bring the wreath?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What? What wreath?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: The Merry Christmas wreath for the window.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No. I left it at the office.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is it snowing?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, just started.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Where's your coat and hat?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Left them at the office.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's the matter?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Nothing's the matter. Everything's all right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Go on, Pete, you're a big boy. You can put the star up. Way up at the top. That's it. Fill in that little bare spot right there. That's it. Isn't it wonderful about Harry? We're famous, George. I'll bet I had fifty calls today about the parade, the banquet. Your mother's so excited, she...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Must she keep playing that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Better hurry and shave. The families will be here soon.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Families! I don't want the families over here!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Come on out in the kitchen with me while I finish dinner.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Have a hectic day?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, yeah, another big red letter day for the Baileys.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, what's the matter with our car? Isn't it good enough for you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Excuse you for what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right, darling, you're excused. Now go upstairs and see what little Zuzu wants.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Zuzu! What's the matter with Zuzu?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, she's got a cold. She's in bed. Caught it coming home from school. They gave her a flower for a prize and she didn't want to crush it so she didn't button up her coat.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What is it, a sore throat or what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just a cold. The doctor says it's nothing serious.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: The doctor? Was the doctor here?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, I called him right away. He says it's nothing to worry about.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is she running a temperature? What is it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Just a teensie one  ninety-nine, six. She'll be all right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Gosh, it's this old house. I don't know why we don't all have pneumonia. This drafty old barn! Might as well be living in a refrigerator. Why did we have to live here in the first place and stay around this measly, crummy old town?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George, what's wrong?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Wrong? Everything's wrong! You call this a happy family? Why did we have to have all these kids?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't know. Ask your mother.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Where're you going?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Going up to see Zuzu.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: F-R-A-N-K-I-N...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, what happened to you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Wait now. Where do you think you're going?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: All right, all right. Here, give Daddy the flower. I'll give it a drink.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, all right. Now, I'll paste this together.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: There it is, good as new.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Now, will you do something for me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Will you try to get some sleep?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I know  I know, but you just go to sleep, and then you can dream about it, and it'll be a whole garden.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Uh-huh.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll get it. Hello. Yes, this is Mrs. Bailey.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, thank you, Mrs. Welch. I'm sure she'll be all right. The doctor says that she ought to be out of bed in time to have her Christmas dinner.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is that Zuzu's teacher?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Let me speak to her.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello. Hello, Mrs. Welch? This is George Bailey. I'm Zuzu's father. Say, what kind of a teacher are you anyway? What do you mean sending her home like that, halfnaked? Do you realize she'll probably end up with pneumonia on account of you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Is this the sort of thing we pay taxes for  to have teachers like you? Silly, stupid, careless people who send our kids home without any clothes on? You know, maybe my kids aren't the best-dressed kids; maybe they don't have any decent clothes...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, that stupid...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hello, Mrs. Welch. I want to apologize... hello... hello... She's hung up.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'll hang her up!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Wait a minute. Hello? Who is this? Oh, Mr. Welch? Okay, that's fine, Mr. Welch. Gives me a chance to tell you what I really think of your wife.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Will you get out and let me handle this? Hello? Hello? What? Oh, you will, huh? Okay, Mr. Welch, any time you think you're man enough... Hello? Any...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How should I know? What do you think I am, a dictionary?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Tommy, stop that! Stop it!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Janie, haven't you learned that silly tune yet? You've played it over and over again. Now stop it! Stop it!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm sorry, Mary, Janie. I'm sorry. I didn't mean... you go on and practice. Pete, I owe you an apology, too. I'm sorry. What do you want to know?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's the matter with everybody? Janie, go on. I told you to practice. Now, go on, play!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: George, why must you torture the children? Why don't you...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mary...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Bedford, two-four-seven, please.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, Janie, pray very hard.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You too, Tommy. Hello, Uncle Billy?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm in trouble, Mr. Potter. I need help. Through some sort of an accident my company's short in their accounts. The bank examiner's up there today. I've got to raise eight thousand dollars immediately.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: The reporters?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Please help me, Mr. Potter. Help me, won't you please? Can't you see what it means to my family? I'll pay you any sort of a bonus on the loan... any interest. If you still want the Building and Loan, why I...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, sir. There's nothing wrong with the books. I've just misplaced eight thousand dollars. I can't find it anywhere.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yes, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, sir. I didn't want the publicity. Harry's homecoming tomorrow...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, sir. No, sir. I haven't.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I can't get hold of him. He's in Europe.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: They don't have that kind of money, Mr. Potter. You know that. You're the only one in town that can help me.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, sir.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I have some life insurance, a fifteen thousand dollar policy.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Five hundred dollars.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: God... God... Dear Father in Heaven, I'm not a praying man, but if you're up there and you can hear me, show me the way. I'm at the end of my rope. Show me the way, God.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Who was that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh  Welch. That's what I get for praying.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Where's my insurance policy? Oh, here...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm all right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I'm all right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You what? To save me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Go through with what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Very funny.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, I got a bust in the jaw in answer to a prayer a little bit ago.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: How do you know my name?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What are you, a mind reader or something?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, who are you, then?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Odbody... A-S-2. What's that A-S-2?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, brother. I wonder what Martini put in those drinks?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Hey, what's with you? What did you say just a minute ago? Why'd you want to save me?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I wouldn't be a bit surprised.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah... just things like that. Now how'd you know that?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, you look about like the kind of an angel I'd get. Sort of a fallen angel, aren't you? What happened to your wings?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I don't know whether I like it very much being seen around with an angel without any wings.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Sure, sure. How?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Only one way you can help me. You don't happen to have eight thousand bucks on you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, that's right, I keep forgetting. Comes in pretty handy down here, bub.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I found it out a little late. I'm worth more dead than alive.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Yeah, if it hadn't been for me, everybody'd be a lot better off. My wife, and my kids and my friends. Look, little fellow, go off and haunt somebody else, will you?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Aw, shut up, will you.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I don't know. I guess you're right. I suppose it would have been better if I'd never been born at all.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: I said I wish I'd never been born.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What did you say?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Say something else in that ear.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, that's the doggonedest thing... I haven't heard anything out of that ear since I was a kid. Must have been that jump in the cold water.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you know about that... What's happened?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: It's stopped snowing out, hasn't it? What's happened here? Come on, soon as these clothes of ours are dry...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you know about that? Stove's hotter than I thought. Now, come on, get your clothes on, and we'll stroll up to my car and get...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. I'll stroll. You fly.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You haven't got your wings. Yeah, that's right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, this is where I left my car and it isn't here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, I had a car, and it was right here. I guess somebody moved it.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, say... Hey... where's my car?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: My car, my car. I'm the fellow that owns the car that ran into your tree.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What do you mean, what tree? This tree. Here, I ran into it. Cut a big gash in the side of it here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Pottersville? Why, you mean Bedford Falls.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, I don't know. Either I'm off my nut, or he is... ...or you are!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, maybe I left the car up at Martini's. Well, come on, Gabriel.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Clarence! Clarence!

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: That's all right. Go on in. Martini's a good friend of mine.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: There's a place to sit down. Sit down.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, hello, Nick. Hey, where's Martini?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No, no, Martini. Your boss. Where is he?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Okay  all right. Double bourbon, quick, huh?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Nick  Nick, just give him the same as mine. He's okay.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: What's the matter with him. I never saw Nick act like that before.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, yeah. Hey, little fellow  you worry me. You got someplace to sleep?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: You don't huh? Well, you got any money?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: No wonder you jumped in the river.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Oh, that's right.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Made what?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Look, I think maybe you better not mention getting your wings around here.

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: A... Yeah, but... you know...

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: He never grew up. He's... How old are you, anyway, Clarence?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Look, Nick. What's wrong?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Well, Nick, that's your name, isn't it?

title: Its-a-Wonderful-Life
dialogue: Mr. Gower! Mr. Gower! This is George Bailey! Don't you know me?

dialogue: Hey you cretaceous dromaeosaur, you can't catch me. Hey, come and get me, you flat-snouted Mongolian beast. Hey!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: I'm going in. Muldoon, cover the door after I go in. Wu, guide me!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Damn, I banged my head.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: One -

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Two -

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Three!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Raptor!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Come on, Wu! Come on! Run!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: They're coming inside!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Why didn't the power go on?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Probably your grandfather's quarters. Let's go.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Actually, stay here.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: No, keep an eye on things round here for me. I'll be back with the others.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: I'll radio the ship as soon as I find somebody. You're in charge now. Don't move from here ... unless you have to, ok?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Be right back.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Why don't you just nail that bastard?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: How long?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: There's a raptor on the roof of this building. Open that gate and you're a dead man.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Ellie, I'm go glad -

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Shut up and listen. We have about fifteen minutes here. The computer has to be rebooted. That'll turn on the electric fences. Besides the r aptor stuck in here with us, there are four more ...

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Talk, Ellie, just keep talking.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Timmy, you know anything about computers?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Ok good, you're elected.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Okay, we've reached the computer room. Who can te ll Timmy how to reboot?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Ah, Alan, nobody here knows how to boot the computer. Please hurry, we've only got a couple minutes left.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Tim, you got to book the system. They reset the power and there are no phones. We gotta turn on the fences and we gotta stop that ship.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: If we can get help very soon.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Ellie, we're working as fast as we can here.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Ok, we're all right here for now.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Don't mention it. It was Timmy.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: But there's still one more raptor. So be careful.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Queen Anne, do you read me? Queen Anne?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Report your position!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Try this for identification, Captain Farrell. You are in possession of stolen biological materials. If you don't turn that boat around and return to Isla Nublar immediately with your contraband cargo, you will be found in violation of Section 509 of the Uniform Maritime Act, you will be subject to revocation of license, penalties in excess of fifty thousand dollars, and five years in jail. Do you copy?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Do you copy, Captain Farrell?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Who the hell knows?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Well it gives us ten more hours. Let's see if we can raise the Costa Rican Coast Guard on that thing.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: And then there were none.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: We have to leave now.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: You interrupted natural law. There are regulations, rules that nature follows that make her knowable.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Barriers? Like the seasons? The earth spinning, orbiting the sun? The entire solar system in interlocking motion. Our own beings in biological step with it all. Mr. Hammond, you've disrupted the pattern and look what it's done!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Don't count on it. Now get in.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: You created mutant forms that you further mutated to create amus ement attractions. You made biological puppets with heartbeats and an early death sentence.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: You created a park to generate a profit- making merchandising operation.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: You park is doomed. Now come with me.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: Come back, Mr. Hammond! It's over!

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: They're so beautiful. They're condemned, aren't they? Even those embryo fragments had the same viral contamination.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: I have a theory.

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: You have a theory?

title: Jurassic-Park
dialogue: So the very process itself was flawed.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Whu?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh, nothing!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Monkey! Mantis! Crane! Viper! Tigress! Rowrrrr...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Coming!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Sorry, Dad.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, nothing. Just had a crazy dream.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Huh?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What was I... eh, I was dreaming about uh... heh...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Noodles.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh, yeah. What else would I be dreaming about?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Careful, that soup is... sharp!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh...a sign of what?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Dad Dad Dad, it was just a dream.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But Dad, didn't you ever, I dunno, want to do something else? Something besides noodles?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: So why didn't you?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I know. Is here.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Well done, students... if you were trying to disappoint me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Tigress, you need more ferocity. Monkey, greater speed.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Crane - height. Viper - subtlety. Mantis--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master Oogway? You summoned me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Is something wrong?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: So... nothing's wrong?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You were saying?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: That is impossible. He is in prison.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Zeng!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Fly to Chogun Prison and tell them to double the guards, double their weapons. Double everything! Tai Lung does not leave that prison!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: We have to do something. We can't just let him march on the valley, and take his revenge! He'll, he'll--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The Dragon Scroll...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But who? Who is worthy to be trusted with the secret to limitless power? To become...the Dragon Warrior?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oop...sorry.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Sorry. Suck it up.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oop! Sorry! A thousand pardons.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?! Master Oogway's choosing the Dragon Warrior! Today!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Everyone! Everyone! Go! Get to the Jade Palace!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: One of the Five is gonna get the Dragon Scroll!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: We've been waiting a thousand years for this! Just take the bowl!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: This is the greatest day in Kung Fu history! Don't worry about it, just go!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: To the...Jade Palace?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Selling noodles? But Dad, you know, I was kinda thinking maybe I...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I was kinda thinking maybe I...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: ...Could also sell the bean buns. They are about to go bad.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah, ha ha, glad I had it.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Come on! Come on, ya-- Almost there...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What? No! Oh No!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No. I'll bring me back a souvenir.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: It is an historic day, isn't it, Master Oogway?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes, Master Oogway.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh no! No no no! Wait! I'm coming!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey! Open the door!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Let me in!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Citizens of the Valley of Peace! It is my great honor to present to you... Tigress! Viper! Crane! Monkey! Mantis! The Furious Five!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The Furious Five!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Warriors prepare!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Peeky-hole!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ready for battle!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah! Woo! The Thousand Tongues of Fire!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey, get out of the way!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And finally...Master Tigress!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And believe me citizens, you have not seen anything yet!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I KNOW!!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master Tigress! Face Iron Ox and his Blades of Death!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Citizens of the Valley of Peace! Master Oogway will now choose... the Dragon Warrior!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Huh? Oh no! Wait!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What does it look like I'm doing? Stop! Stop! I'm going to see the Dragon Warrior!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I lied. I don't dream about noodles, Dad!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I love kung fuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuu-

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh oh...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What's going on? Where...uh? What are you pointing--?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh. Okay. Sorry. I just wanted to see who the Dragon Warrior was.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Who--?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Me?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What???

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Stop! Wait! Who told you to--?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master Oogway, wait! That flabby panda can't possibly be the answer to... our problem. You were about to point at Tigress. That thing fell in front of her. That was just an accident!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No. If the panda has not quit by morning, then I will have failed you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wait a second! Hello? Uh...I think there's been a slight mistake. Everyone seems to think that I'm, uh...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Whoa. The Sacred Hall of Warriors. No way! Would you look at this place!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master Flying Rhino's Armor! With authentic battle damage!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The Sword of Heroes! Said to be so sharp you can cut yourself just by looking-- OW!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The Invisible Trident of Destiny!?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I've only seen paintings of that painting...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Nooo! Ohhhh!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The legendary Urn of Whispering Warriors! Said to contain the souls of the entire Tenshu army. Hellooo?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Have you finished sight-seeing?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Sorry. I should've come to see you first.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: My patience is wearing thin.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh. Well, I mean, it's not like you were going anywhere.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Would you turn around?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Sure.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey, how's it going?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Now how do you get five thousand-- Master Shifu!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Someone...broke that. But I'm gonna fix it. Do you have some glue?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow! Ooh. Splinter.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: So you're the legendary Dragon Warrior. Hmmm?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh...I guess so?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wrong! You are not the Dragon Warrior. You will never be the Dragon Warrior until you have learned the secret of the Dragon Scroll.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Whoa. So how does this work? You have a ladder or trampoline or...?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You think it's that easy? That I am just going to hand you the secret to limitless power?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No, I...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: One must first master the highest level of kung fu. And that is clearly impossible if that one is someone like you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Someone like me?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes. Look at you...this fat butt.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Flabby arms...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Those are sensitive in the flabby parts.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And this ridiculous belly.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: --and utter disregard for personal hygiene.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Now wait a minute. That's a little uncalled-for.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Don't stand that close...I can smell your breath.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Listen...Oogway said that I was the-

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The Wuxi Finger Hold?! Not the Wuxi Finger Hold!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, you know this hold?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: DevelopedbyMasterWuxiInTheThirdDyna sty-- YES.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, then you must know what happens when I flex my pinky.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No no no!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You know the hardest part of this? The hardest part is cleaning up afterwards...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay! Okay! Take it easy...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Now listen closely, panda. Oogway may have picked you, but when I'm through with you, I promise you, you're going to wish he hadn't. Are we clear?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah, we're clear. We're clear. We are so clear.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Good. I can't wait to get started.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Let's begin.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wait wait wait...What? Now?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes...now. Unless you think the great Oogway was wrong, and you are not the Dragon Warrior.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, okay. Well-- I don't know if I can do all of those moves.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Well, if we don't try, we'll never know will we?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh, yeah. It's just, maybe we can find something more suited to my level.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And what level is that?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Well, ya know...I'm not a master, but uh, let's just start at zero, level zero.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: There is no such thing as level zero.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey! Maybe I can start with that.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: That? We use that for training children. And for propping the door open when it's hot. But if you insist...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Whoa. The Furious Five. You're so much bigger than your action figures -- except for you, Mantis. You're about the same.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Go ahead, panda. Show us what you can do.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Um, are they gonna watch? Or should I just wait until they get back to work or something...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hit it.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ok. I mean, I just ate. So I'm still digesting... So my kung fu might not be as good as later on.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Just hit it.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Alright. Whatcha got? You got nothing cause I got it right here. You picking on my friends? Get ready to feel the thunder. I'm comin' at him with the crazy feet. Whatcha gonna do about my crazy feet? I'm a blur. I'm a blur. You never seen bear style, you only seen praying Mantis! OR... I could come at you Monkey style. OR... I'm comin' at ya snikity-snake.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Would you hit it!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Alright...alright.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Why don't you try again? A little harder...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: How's tha--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow, that hurts.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: This'll be easier than I thought.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Feeling a little nauseous.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow, those are hard! Ooh! I think I...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oooohoohoo...my tenders.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: How did I do?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: There is now a level zero.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Great.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh hey...hi. You're up.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I was just uh... Some day huh? That kung fu stuff is hard work, right? Your biceps sore?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah yeah yeah, of course.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: It's just...I'm such a big fan.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You guys were totally amazing at the Battle of Weeping River. Outnumbered a thousand to one, but you didn't stop, and then you just... HI-YAH!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ooo, sorry about that.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I know. I know. You're right. I just - my whole life I've dreamed of-

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, okay. Right right. Yeah, you want to get to sleep.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I'm keepin' you up. We got big things tomorrow. Alright. You're awesome. Last thing I'm gonna say. Okay. Bye bye.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What was that?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay. Alright. Goodnight. Sleep well.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Seemed a little bit awkward.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master Tigress! Didn't mean to wake you. Just uh...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh, yeah, yeah. Of course. This is your room.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Big fan...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Is that what this is? I am so sorry. I thought it was just a regular peach tree.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Upset? I'm not upset. What makes you think I'm upset?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I probably sucked more today than anyone in the history of kung fu, in the history of China, in the history of sucking.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And the Five... man, you should have seen them, they totally hate me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: How's Shifu ever going to turn me into the Dragon Warrior? I mean, I'm not like The Five. I've got no claws, no wings, no venom. Even Mantis has those... ...thingies. Maybe I should just quit and go back to making noodles.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Panda! Panda, wake up!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hmm. He's quit.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: All we can do is resume our training and trust that in time, the true Dragon Warrior will be revealed.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What are you doing here?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey! Huh... Good morning, Master! I thought I'd warm up a little.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You're stuck.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Stuck?! Whaa? Pfft... stuck... Yeah, I'm stuck.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Help him.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Maybe on three. One. Two-

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Threeeee. Thank you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No really, I appreci--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You actually thought you could learn to do a full split in one night? It takes years to develop one's flexibility and years longer to apply it in combat.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Put that down! The only souvenirs we collect here are bloody knuckles and broken bones.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah, excellent!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Let's get started.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I was born ready--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Eaghhh...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: That was awesome! Let's go again.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I've been taking it easy on you, panda, but no more! Your next opponent... will be me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Alright! Let's go!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Step forth.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The true path to victory is to find your opponent's weakness and make him suffer for it.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, yeah!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: To take his strength and use it against him.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: --until he finally falls, or quits.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But a real warrior never quits. Don't worry, Master, I will never quit!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Aaaoo...whoohoo...EEEee...hee- hee... I thought you said acupuncture would make me feel better.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Fat?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Sure you were.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow! Don't... Stop it, stop-- Yow! I know Master Shifu's trying to inspire me and all, but if I didn't know any better, I'd say he was trying to get rid of me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Before what?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Guys, guys. I know about Tai Lung.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: He was a student, the first ever to master the thousand...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: ...scrolls of... kung fu... and... then he turned bad... and now he's in jail.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Doieeeee...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Inner peace. Inner peace. Inner peace.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Would whoever is making that flapping sound, quiet down!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Inner...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, Zeng. Excellent. I could use some good news right now.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master! Master!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I have-- it's-- it's very bad news.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master, your vision...your vision was right. Tai Lung has broken out of prison. He's on his way!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The panda? Master, that panda is not the Dragon Warrior.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: He wasn't even meant to be here -- it was an accident!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes, I know. You've said that already. Twice.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Thrice.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Illusion?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But there are things we can control.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I can control when the fruit will fall.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And I can control--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: --where to plant the seed. That is no illusion, Master.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But a peach cannot defeat Tai Lung!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But how? How? I need your help, Master.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I... I will try.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What... what are you..?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master, you can't leave me!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: ...So I'm like, fine, you may be a wolf, you may be the scariest bandit in Haijin Province...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: ...but you're a lousy tipper.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I mean, I didn't actually say that, but I thought it... in my mind.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: If he... could read my mind, he'd have been like, "What?" Order up!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hope you like it.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No, c'mon.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You should try my dad's secret ingredient soup. He actually knows the secret ingredient.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I guess my body doesn't know it's the Dragon Warrior yet. I'm gonna need a lot more than dew. And, uh, universe juice.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You will never be the Dragon Warrior, unless you lose five hundred pounds and brush your teeth!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What is that noise you're making? Laughter? I never heard of it!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Work hard, Panda. And maybe, someday... you will have ears like mine.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ears. It's not working for you? I thought they were pretty good.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Of course it's Shifu. What do you think I'm doing?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ooh! Master Shifu!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You think this is funny? Tai Lung has escaped from prison and you're acting like children!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: He is coming for the Dragon Scroll, and you are the only one who can stop him.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And here I am saying you got no sense of humor. I'm gonna stop Tai...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What? You're serious? And I have to-- uh, Master Oogway will stop him! He did it before, he'll do it again.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oogway cannot, not anymore.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Our only hope is the Dragon Warrior.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes, the panda!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No! It is not your destiny to defeat Tai Lung. It is his.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Where'd he go?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You cannot leave! A real warrior never quits!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Watch me!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Come on! How am I supposed to beat Tai Lung? I can't even beat you to the stairs.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You will beat him because you are the Dragon Warrior!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Ow! You don't believe that! You never believed that! From the first moment I got here, you've been trying to get rid of me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes. I was. But now I ask you to trust in your master as I have come to trust in mine.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You're not my master. And I'm not the Dragon Warrior.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Then why didn't you quit? You knew I was trying to get rid of you, and yet you stayed.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah, I stayed. I stayed because every time you threw a brick at my head or said I smelled, it hurt. But it could never hurt more than it did every day of my life just being me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I stayed because I thought if anyone could change me, could make me... not me, it was you. The greatest kung fu teacher in all of China.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But I can change you! I can turn you into the Dragon Warrior! And I will!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: C'mon, Tai Lung is on his way here right now. And even if it takes him a hundred years to get here, how are you gonna change this... ...into the Dragon Warrior? How? How? How?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I don't know!!! I don't know.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: That's what I thought.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What? I eat when I'm upset, okay?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, no need to explain. I just thought you might be Monkey -- he hides his almond cookies on the top shelf.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Don't tell Monkey.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Look at you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah, I know. I disgust you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No no, I mean... how did you get up there?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I don't know. I guess I-- I don't know. I was getting a cookie...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: And yet you are ten feet off the ground and have done a perfect split.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No, this... this is just an accident.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: There are no accidents. Come with me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I know you're trying to be all mystical and kung fu-y, but could you at least tell me where we're going?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You dragged me all the way out here for a bath?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Panda, we do not wash our pits in The Pool of Sacred Tears.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The pool of...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: This is where Oogway unravelled the mysteries of harmony and focus. This is the birthplace of Kung Fu.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Do you want to learn Kung Fu?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Then I am your master!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Don't cry.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: When you focus on Kung Fu, when you concentrate...you stink.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But perhaps that is my fault. I cannot train you the way I have trained the Five. I now see that the way to get through to you is with this!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh great, `cause I'm hungry.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Good. When you have been trained, you may eat. Let us begin.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: After you, panda.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Just like that? No situps? No ten mile hike?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I vowed to train you... and you have been trained. You are free to eat.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Enjoy.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I said you are free to eat. Have a dumpling.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You are free to eat!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Am I?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Are you?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I'm not hungry... master.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You have done well, Panda.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Done well? Done well?! I've done awesome!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: The mark of a true hero is humility!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But yes...you have done awesome.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Huh? Guys? Guys!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: They're dead? No, they're breathing! They're asleep?! No, their eyes are open.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: He has gotten stronger.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Who? Tai Lung? Stronger?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: He could have killed you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: So you could come back here and strike fear into our hearts. But it won't work!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Uh, it might, I mean, a little. I'm pretty scared.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You can defeat him, panda.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Are you kidding? If they can't-- They're five masters. I'm just one me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But you will have the one thing that no one else does.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You really believe I'm ready?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You are, Po.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Behold. The Dragon Scroll... It is yours.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wait, what happens when I read it?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No one knows, but legend says you will be able to hear a butterfly's wing-beat.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Whoa! Really? That's cool.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yes. And see light in the deepest cave. You will feel the universe in motion around you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wow! Can I punch through walls? Can I do a quadruple back flip? Will I have invisibility--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Focus. Focus.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Huh? Oh, yeah... yeah.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Read it, Po, and fulfill your destiny. Read it and become... the Dragon Warrior!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Whooaa!!!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: It's impossible to open.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Come on baby. Come on now...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Thank you. I probably loosened it up for you though... Okay, here goes.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: It's blank!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Here! Look!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No! I am forbidden to look upon--

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Blank? I don't...I don't understand.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay. So like, Oogway was just a crazy old turtle after all?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No. Oogway was wiser than us all.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, come on! Face it. He picked me by accident. Of course I'm not the Dragon Warrior. Who am I kidding?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No, evacuate the Valley. You must protect the villagers from Tai Lung's rage.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I will fight him.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: What?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I can hold him off long enough for everyone to escape.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: But Shifu, he'll kill you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Then I will finally have paid for my mistake.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Listen to me, all of you. It is time for you to continue your journey without me. I am very proud to have been your master.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey, Dad.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Good to be back.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I don't know, Dad. Honestly, sometimes I can't believe I'm actually your son.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Okay.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Huh?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wait wait...it's just plain old noodle soup? You don't add some kind of special sauce or something?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: There is no secret ingredient...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: This is no longer your home. And I am no longer your master.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: This battle is between you and me.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: That is how it must be.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Obeying your master is not weakness!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You were not meant to be the Dragon Warrior! That was not my fault!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: It was never my decision to make!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I would rather die.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I have always been proud of you. From the first moment, I've been proud of you. And it was my pride that blinded me. I loved you too much to see what you were becoming. What I was turning you into. I'm... sorry.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Dragon Warrior has taken scroll halfway across China by now. You will never see that scroll, Tai Lung. Never. Never...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Stairs...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Buddy, I am the Dragon Warrior. Huhhh...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Don't tempt me. Haha. No. I'm gonna use this. You want it? Come and get it.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Lightning!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: It's okay. I didn't get it the first time either.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: There is no secret ingredient. It's just you.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: AAAAGGGHH!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Stop! Stop it! I'm gonna pee! Don't! Don't!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I'm not a big, fat panda. I'm the big, fat panda.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh, you know this hold?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Nope. I figured it out.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Skadoosh!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Thanks, Dad.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Hey, guys.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master? Master Shifu!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Master! Shifu! Shifu! Are you okay?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Po! You're alive! Or we're both dead.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No, Master, I didn't die. I defeated Tai Lung!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: You did?!

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Wow. It is as Oogway foretold -- You are the Dragon Warrior. You have brought peace to this Valley. And to me. Thank you. Thank you, Po. Thank you...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: No! Master! No No No! Don't die, Shifu. Please...

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: I'm not dying, you idiot-- ah, Dragon Warrior. I'm simply at peace. Finally.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Oh. So, um, I should...stop talking?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: If you can.

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Want to get something to eat?

title: Kung-Fu-Panda
dialogue: Yeah.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Yes. It means I'm free.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I stole a loaf of bread My sister's child was close to death And we were starving.

title: Les-Miserables
