dialogue: I know the meaning of those nineteen years A slave of the law!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: My name is Jean Valjean!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Freedom at last - How strange the taste! Never forget the years - the waste, Nor forgive them for what they've done. They are the guilty - Everyone! The day begins

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Monsieur can I help? A day's work?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Jailer. Would you let me stay here for tonight?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Pontarlier.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: No. The destination is compulsory. That is where the Law sends me. I have no home.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You let me sleep here next to you? How do you know I'm not a murderer?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: What have I done? Sweet Jesus, what have I done? Become a thief in the night Become a dog on the run! And have I fallen so far And is the hour so late That nothing remains but the cry of my hate? The cries in the dark that nobody hears Here where I stand at the turning of the years.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I am reaching, but I fall And the night is closing in... As I stare into the void - To the whirlpool of my sin.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I'll escape now from that world - From the world of Jean Valjean. Jean Valjean is nothing now!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Another story must begin!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: What is this fighting all about? Will someone tear these two apart? This is a factory, not a circus.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Now come on, ladies, settle down. I run a business of repute.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Deal with this, Foreman. Be as patient as you can.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Welcome, sir Come guard our laws I'm sure we're here In common cause.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: The dignity of toil To stay alive.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Your face is not a face I would forget.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Get back! It may fall!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Say what you must. Don't leave it there.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Let me help you up.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: No more cart driving for you!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: A moment of your time, Javert. I do believe this woman's tale.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You've done your duty. Let her be. She needs a doctor, not a jail.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Where will she end - This child without a friend?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I've seen your face before. Show me some way to help you. How have you come to grief In such a place as this?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Is it true what I've done -

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: - to an innocent soul?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Had I only known then!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: In His name my task has just begun. I will her to the hospital.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Where is she?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I will see it done! I will send for her immediately!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I don't understand. What is this crime, Javert?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You say this man denies it all, And gives no sign of understanding or repentance? You say this man is going to trial, And that he's sure to be returned to serve his sentence?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You have only done your duty It's a minor sin at most. All of us have been mistaken You'll return, sir, to your post.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: It's your duty to obey!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: They think that man is me - Without a second glance. This stranger they have found - This man could be my chance!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I am the master of hundreds of workers - They all look to me. Can I abandon them? How would they live If I am not free?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Can I conceal myself for ever more? Pretend I'm not the man I was before? And must my name until I die Be no more than an alibi?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: My soul belongs to God, I know, I made that bargain long ago. He gave me hope when hope was gone! He gave me strength to journey on! Who am I? Who am I? I'm Jean Valjean!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: And so, your honour, you see it's true That man bears no more guilt than you! Who am I? 24601!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: If you don't believe me ask Inspector Javert. He knows where to find me.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Is her daughter with her?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: `Money not enough. Send more. Thenardier.' What sort of man is this?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Dear Fantine, Cosette will be here soon! Dear Fantine, she will be by your side

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Be at peace! Be at peace ever more.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: - shall live in my protection.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Your child will want for nothing.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: And none shall ever harm Cosette as long as I am living.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Then I will keep you warm.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Take shelter from the storm.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Before you say another word, Javert, Before you chain me up like a slave again, Listen to me! There is something I must do. This woman leaves behind a suffering child. There is none but me who can intercede - In mercy's name, three days are all I need, Then I'll return, I pledge my word! Then I'll return...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Believe of me what you will There is a duty that I'm sworn to do. You know nothing of my life - All I did was steal some bread. You know nothing of the world - You would sooner see me dead. But not before I see this justice done!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I am warning you, Javert, I'm a stronger man by far! There is power in me yet! My race is not yet run!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: And this I swear to you tonight -

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Your child will live within my care -

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: And I will raise her to the light.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Hush now, do not be afraid of me. Don't cry. Show me where you live.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Cosette?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I found her wandering in the wood This little child, I found her trembling in the shadows. And I am here to help Cosette, And I will settle any debt you may think proper. I will pay what I must pay To take Cosette away.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Cosette shall live in my protection.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I will not forget my vow.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Cosette shall have a father now.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Your feelings do you credit, sir. And I will ease the parting blow. Let us not talk of bargains and bones and greed.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Now may I say we are agreed?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: No more! Here's your price! Fifteen hundred for your sacrifice. Come, Cosette, say goodbye. Let's seek out some friendlier sky. Thank you both for Cosette - It won't take you too long to forget.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Where I go, you will be.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Yes, Cosette! This is true! I'll be father and mother to you!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Suddenly I see Suddenly it starts When two anxious hearts Beat as one. Yesterday I was alone Today you walk beside me Something still unclear Something not yet here Has begun. Suddenly the world Seems a different place Somehow full of grace

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Who are you?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Monsieur Fauchelevent!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Now you can do the same for me. We need a place of sanctuary. This child and I, we need to disappear.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: We'll give thanks for what is granted What the sisters may ordain Here we pray for new beginnings - Here our lives can start again.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: What is this? Are you mad? No, Monsieur, you don't know what you say!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Dear Cosette, You're such a lonely child. How pensive, how sad you seem to me. Believe me, were it within my power I'd fill each passing hour. How quiet it must be, I can see, With only me for company.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: No more words - No more words. It's a time that is dead. There are words That are better unheard, Better unsaid.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You will learn. Truth is given by God To us all in our time, In our turn.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Cosette! Cosette!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: My God, Cosette! I heard a cry in the dark. I heard the shout of angry voices in the street.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: This is a warning to us all! These are the shadows of the past!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Must be Javert. He's found my cover at last. I've got to get Cosette away Before he returns.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: We must get away from shadows That will never let us be. Tonight we leave Cosette!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Rue de L'Homme Armee.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: And then a ship across the sea.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Hurry, Cosette! Prepare to leave, And say no more. Tonight we'll away!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Hurry, Cosette! It's time to close another door And live another day!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: One day more! Another day, another destiny. This never-ending road to Calvary. These men who seem to know my crime Will surely come a second time - One day more!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: One day more!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: One day more!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: One day more!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Tomorrow we'll be far away.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I'll take it.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: `Dearest Cosette, you have entered my soul And soon you will be gone. Can it be only a day since we met And the world was reborn? If I should fall in the battle to come Let this be my goodbye. Now that I know you love me as well It is harder to die. I pray that God will bring me home To be with you. Pray for your Marius. He prays for you.'

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: They haven't got a chance, these boys They almost certainly will die She'll be alone And she will need me all the more And we will go on as before When he is gone I dare not think like this I must find this boy

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Don't shoot!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I come here as a volunteer.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: That's why they let me through.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: There's much that I can do.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Give me no thanks, M'sieur. There's something you can do.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Give me the spy Javert! Let me take care of him.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: We meet again...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You talk too much. Your life is safe in my hands.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Get out of here.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Clear out of here!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: You are wrong, and always have been wrong. I'm a man no worse than any man. You are free, and there are no conditions - No bargains or petitions. There's nothing that I blame you for. You've done your duty, nothing more. No doubt our paths will cross again.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Go!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: God on high Hear my prayer

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Let me go! He's no more than a boy. I am old. I have nothing to fear.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: How do I get out of here?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: It's you, Javert! I knew you wouldn't wait too long. The faithful servant at his post once more. This man's done no wrong. And he needs his family's care.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Another hour yet And then I'm yours And all our debts are paid.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Come, time is running short - Look down, Javert! He's standing in his grave!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Then I die.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: She was never mine to keep She is youthful, she is free...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Not another word, my son. There's something now that must be done...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: There lived a man whose name was Jean Valjean. He stole some bread to save his sister's son For nineteen winters served his time In sweat he washed away his crime.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Years ago, He broke parole and lived a life apart... How could he tell Cosette and break her heart? It's for Cosette this must be faced: If he is caught, she is disgraced... The time has come to journey on, And from this day he must be gone! Who am I? Who am I?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Make her believe I have gone on a journey A long way away. Tell her my heart was too full for farewells - It is better this way. Promise me, Monsieur, Cosette will never know...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: ...What I have spoken, why I must go.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Alone I wait in the shadows I count the hours till I can sleep. I dreamed a dream Cosette stood by It made her weep To know I die... Alone at the end of the day Upon this wedding night I pray Take these children, my Lord, to thy embrace And show them grace... God on high Hear my prayer Take me now To thy care Where you are Let me be Take me now Take me there Bring me home Bring me home!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I am ready, Fantine...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: At the end of my days...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: She's the best of my life...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Cosette?

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Cosette, my child! Am I forgiven now? Thank God, thank God, I've lived to see this day!

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Now you are here Again beside me Now I can die in peace For now my life is blessed...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Yes, Cosette, forbid me now to die! I'll obey I will try...

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: On this page I write my last confession. Read it well When I at last am sleeping. It's the story Of one who turned from hating A man who only learned to love When you were in his keeping.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: I'm ready now, Fantine.

title: Les-Miserables
dialogue: Forgive me all my trespasses And take me to your glory!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You're late.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: A Wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's wonderful to see you, Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You didn't think I'd miss your Uncle Bilbo's birthday?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What news of the outside world? Tell me everything!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What, everything? Far too eager and curious for a Hobbit. Most unnatural...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Well, what can I tell you? Life in the wide world goes on much as if it has past age. Full of its own comings and goings, scarcely even aware of the existence of Hobbits...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: ...for which I am very thankful.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Ah, the long expected party. So, how is the old rascal? I hear it's going to be a Party of Special Magnificence.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You know Bilbo...he's got he whole place in an uproar.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Oh, well...that should please him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Half the Shire's been invited...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Good gracious, me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's up to something.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Oh, really?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Alright then..keep your secrets. Before you came along we Bagginses were very well thought of.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Indeed?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Never had any adventures or did anything unexpected.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: If you're referring to the incident with the Dragon...I was barely involved...all I did was give your Uncle a little nudge out the door.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Whatever you did...you've been officially labelled as a Disturber of the Peace.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Oh, really?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf... I'm glad you're back. Frodo leaps expertly from the cart. Gandalf smiles.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: So am I, dear boy...so am I

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: And what about very old friends?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo Baggins!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's good to see you. One hundred and eleven years old, who would believe it!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You haven't aged a day! Gandalf and Bilbo laugh together and enter Bag End.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Just tea, thank you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, not at all. Go ahead. A sudden loud knock on the front door.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: So, you mean to go through with your plan, then?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo suspects something.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You will tell him, won't you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's very fond of you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Go on, Sam, ask Rosie for a dance.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I think I'll just have myself another ale.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Oh, no you don't. Go on.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo! Watch out for the dragon!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Meridoc Brandybuck and Peregrin Took...I might have known!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Speech!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I suppose you think that was terribly clever?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There are many magic rings in the world, Bilbo Baggins, and none of them should be used lightly.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You will keep an eye on Frodo, won't you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What about this ring of yours? Is that staying too?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I think you should leave the Ring behind, Bilbo. Is that so hard?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There's no need to get angry.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Precious? It's been called that before, but not by you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I think you've had that ring quite long enough.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo Baggins do not take me for some conjurer of cheap tricks! Bilbo cowers from Gandalf, disarmed by his power...a frightened Hobbit. Gandalf's expression softens.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I am not trying to rob you. I am trying to help you. Sobbing, Bilbo runs to Gandalf and hugs him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: All you long years we've been friends...trust me as you once did. Let it go!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The ring is still in your pocket.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I'm sure you will, my dear friend.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Goodbye Bilbo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Until our next meeting.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Riddles in the dark.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo! Bilbo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: My precious...precious..

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's gone, hasn't he? Frodo steps into the living room.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He talked for so long about leaving...I didn't think he'd really do it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: ...my own.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo's ring.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's gone to stay with the Elves. He's left you Bag End...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: ...along with all his possessions.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The ring is yours now. But it somewhere out of sight. Gandalf rises hurriedly and starts to gather his things.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Where are you going?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I have some things I must see to.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What things?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Questions. Questions that need answering.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You've only just arrived! I don't understand...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Neither do I. Keep it secret, keep it safe.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The year 3434 of the Second Age...here follows the account of Isildur, High King of Gondor, and the finding of the ring of power.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It has come to me...the ring of power!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It shall be an heirloom of my Kingdom...all those who follow in my bloodline shall be bound to its fate, for I will risk no hurt to the

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: ring...it is precious to me, though I buy it with great pain...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The marking upon the band begin to fade...the writing which at first was as clear as red flame, has all but disappeared...a secret now that only fire can tell...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Is it secret? Is it safe?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What are you doing?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Hold out your hand, Frodo...it is quite cool.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What can you see? Can you see anything?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Nothing...there's nothing. Wait...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: ...these are markings.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's some form of Elvish...I can't read it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There are few who can...the language is that of Mordor, which I will not utter here.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: GANDALF

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: This is the one ring forged by the dark lord, Sauron, in the fires of Mt Doom...taken by Isildur from the hand of Sauron himself.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo found it...in Gollom's cave.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: For sixty years the ring lay quiet in Bilbo's keeping, prolonging his life, delaying old age...but no longer, Frodo. Evil is stirring in Mordor. The ring has awoken. It has heard its master's call.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: AT THAT MOMENT: A FLEETING, LOW WHISPER of BLACK SPEECH

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: But he was destroyed...Sauron was destroyed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, Frodo. The spirit of Sauron has endured. His life force is bound to the ring and the ring survived. Sauron has returned. His Orcs have multiplied...his fortress of Barad- dur is rebuilt in the land of Mordor. Sauron needs only this ring to cover all the lands in the second darkness. He is seeking it, seeking it, all his thought is bent on it. For the ring yearns, above all else, to return to the hand of its master: they are one, the ring and the dark lord. Frodo, he must never find out. SUDDENLY Frodo scoops up the Ring.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Alright!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We put it away, we keep it hidden! We never speak of it again. No one know it's here, do they? Gandalf shifts uncomfortably.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Do they, Gandalf?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There is one other who knew that Bilbo had the Ring. I looked everywhere for the creature Gollum, but the enemy found him first.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I don't know how long they tortured him...but amidst the endless screams and inane babble, they discerned two words.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Shire! Baggins! That will lead them here!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Take it! Take it!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, Frodo...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You must take it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You cannot offer me this ring.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I'm giving it to you!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Don't tempt me, Frodo. I dare not take it, not even to keep it safe.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Understand, Frodo...I would use this Ring from a desire to do good...but through me, it would wield a power too great and terrible to imagine.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: But it cannot stay in the Shire!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, no it can't.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What must I do?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You must leave, and leave quickly. Get out of the Shire.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Where? Where shall I go?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Make for the village of Bree.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bree? What about you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I will, be waiting for you at the Inn of the Prancing Pony. Frodo packs his food into his knapsack.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: And the ring will be safe there?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I don't know, Frodo. I don't have any answers. I must see the Head of my Order. He is both wise and powerful. Trust me, Frodo. He'll know what to go.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You'll have to leave the name of Baggins behind you...for that name is not safe outside the Shire. GANDALF helps FRODO into his coat.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Travel only by day and stay off the road.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I can cut across country easily enough.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: My dear Frodo, Hobbits really are amazing creatures. You can learn all that there is to know about their ways in a month, and yet, after a hundred years, they can still surprise you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Get down!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Confound it all! Samwise Gamgee, have you been eavesdropping?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I ain't been dropping no eaves, sir! Honest. I was just cutting the grass under the window there, if you follow me...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's a little late for trimming the hedges, don't you think?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I heard raised voices...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What did you hear? Speak!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Nothing important...that is, I heard a good deal about a ring...and a Dark Lord. And something about the end of the world, but...Please, Mr. Gandalf, sir, don't hurt me! Don't turn me into anything unnatural!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Perhaps not. I've thought of a better use for you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Come along, Samwise...keep up...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Be careful, both of you. The Enemy has many spies in his service, many ways of hearing...birds, beasts...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Is it safe?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Never put it on, for then the agents of the Dark Lord will be drawn to its power...Always remember, Frodo, the ring is trying to get back to its master...it wants to be found. Gandalf wheels his horse and gallops away.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: This is it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: This is what?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: If I take one more step it'll be the farthest away from home I've ever been.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Come on, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Remember what Bilbo used to say...it's a dangerous business...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Saruman!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Beyond any doubt.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: All these long years it was in the Shire, under my very nose.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We still have time...time enough to counter Sauron...if we act quickly.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The eye of Sauron.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You know this? How?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: A palantir is a dangerous tool, Saruman.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: They are not all accounted for, the lost seeing-stones...we do not know who else may be watching. Gandalf throws the cloth back over the Palantir.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The nine!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: They have reached the Shire? Saruman shrugs...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Tell me, friend, when did Saruman the wise abandon reason for madness?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo. Mr. Frodo! Frodo turns, surprised as Sam comes running towards him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I thought I lost you. Frodo looks at Sam suspiciously. Sam glances down, embarrassed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What are you talking about?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's just something Gandalf said...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What did he say?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He said..."Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee." And I don't mean to.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Sam...we're still in the Shire...what could possibly happen?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What's the meaning of this!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You've been into Farmer Maggot's crop!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Trust a Brandybuck and a Took.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: A shortcut to what?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I think we should get off the road.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Get off the road!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Anything?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Nothing.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Get down!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I have to leave the Shire...Sam and I must get to Bree.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: How far to the nearest crossing?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Come on.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We're headed for the prancing pony.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We wish to stay at the inn...our business is our own. To Frodo's relief, the Gatekeeper unlocks the gate.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Excuse me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Underhill...my name's Underbill.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We're friends of Gandalf the Grey...can you tell him we've arrived? BUTTERBUR frowns...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What do we do now?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Sam, he'll be here. He'll come.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You've had a whole half already. Merry watches Pippin go.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: That fellow's done nothing but stare at you since we've arrived.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Excuse me, that man in the corner, who is he?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Strider.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Pippin!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What do you want?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I carry nothing.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Who are you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Yes.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Let him go or I'll have you, Longshanks!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Where are they?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Where are you taking us?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We have no choice but to trust him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Did you hear that, Bill? Rivendell! We're going to see the Elves!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What are you doing?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We saved some for you, Mr. Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Put it out, you fools! Put it out! Frodo desperately kicks dirt on the fire!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Go! !

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Back, you devils!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Help him, Strider!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Do something.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We are six days from Rivendell. Frodo groans.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He'll never make it! Close on: Frodo...head lolling about, barely conscious.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf...Gandalf?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Athelas?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Kingsfoil. Aye. It's a weed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: She's an elf.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What are you doing! Those Wraiths are still out there!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Where am I?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You are in the House of Elrond, and it is ten o'clock in the morning on October the twenty-fourth, if you want to know.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Yes, I'm here and you're lucky to be here, too. A few more hours and you would have been beyond our aid. You have some strength in you, my dear Hobbit.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What happened, Gandalf? Why didn't you meet us?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I'm sorry Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I was delayed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There is only one Lord of the Ring. Only one who can bend it to his will...and he does not share power.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf! What is it? Gandalf returns his attention to Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Nothing, Frodo...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo! Frodo! Bless you, you're awake!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Sam has hardly left your side.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We were worried about you--weren't we, Mr. Gandalf?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: By the skills of Lord Elrond, you're beginning to mend. ELROND, LORD OF THE HIGH ELVES, steps up to Frodo's

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bilbo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: "There and back again: A Hobbit's tale" by Bilbo Baggins.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: This is wonderful.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I miss the Shire...I spent all my childhood pretending I was off somewhere else...off with you, on one of your adventures... But my own adventure, turned out to be quite different...I'm not like you, Bilbo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, what have I forgotten? Pull back to reveal Frodo, hands in his pocket, watching Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Packed already?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No harm in being prepared. Frodo strolls to the edge of the Balcony.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I thought you wanted to see the Elves, Sam?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I do...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: More than anything.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I did. It's just...we did what Gandalf wanted, didn't we? We got the Ring this far, to Rivendell...and I thought... seeing as how you're on the mend, we'd be off soon. Off home.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You're right, Sam. Frodo looks at Sam...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: ...we did what we set out to do. Frodo opens his hand, the Ring sits in his Palm.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The ring will be safe in Rivendell. I am ready to go home.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: That wound will never fully heal. He will carry it the rest of his life.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It is a burden he should never have to had to bear. We can ask no more of Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: His treachery runs deeper than you know. By foul craft, Saruman has crossed Orc with Goblin Men...he is breeding an army in the caverns of Isengard. An army that can move in Sunlight and cover great distance at speed. Saruman is coming for the Ring.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It is in Men that we must place our hope.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There is one who could unite them, one who could re claim the thrown of Gondor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Havo dad, Legolas...Sit down, Legolas..

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Aragorn is right...we cannot use it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Do you not understand? While we bicker among ourselves, Sauron's power grows! No one will escape it. You will all be destroyed, your homes burnt and your families put to the sword!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I will take it...I will take it...I will take the Ring to Mordor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Though...I do not know the way. Gandalf rises to his feet.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I will help you bear this burden, Frodo Baggins, as long as it is yours to bear.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: If, by my life or death, I can protect you, I will. ...you have my sword. Aragorn steps forward...followed by Legolas and Gimli.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Here!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo's not gong anywhere without me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's so light!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We must hold to his course west of the misty Mountains for forty days. If our luck holds, the Gap of Rohan will still be open to us. From there, our road turns east, to Mordor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Should not be too hard...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, Gimli. I would not take the road through Moria unless I had no other choice.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What is that?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Hide!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Spies of Saruman. The passage South is being watched.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We must take the pass of Caradhras!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Boromir?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Boromir...give the ring to Frodo. ARAGORN'S HAND moves to his sword hilt.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's Saruman.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's trying to bring down the mountain. Gandalf! We must turn back!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Losto Caradhras, sedho, hodo, nuitho I ruith. Sleep Caradhras, be still, lie still, hold your wrath.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The Gap of Rohan takes us too close to Isengard.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Let the ringbearer decide.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We will go through the mines. Gandalf slowly nods.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: So be it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Itidin...it mirrors only starlight and moonlight.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It reads, "The door of Durin, Lord of Moria. Speak, friend, and enter."

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's quite simple. If you are a friend, speak the password and the doors will open.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Annon edhellen, edro hi ammen!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mines are no place for a Pony, even one so brave as Bill.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Bye, Bill.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Go on, Bill, go on..don't worry, Sam...he knows his way home. Aragorn slaps Bill on the rump...Bill goes trotting off. CLOSE ON: Sam watching Bill disappear into the darkness.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Goodbye, Bill.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Do not disturb the water.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's a riddle...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Speak, friend, and enter. What's the Elvish for friend?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Oh...mellon.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Into the mines!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We now have but one choice...we must face the long dark of Moria. Be on your guard...there are older and fouler things than the Orcs in the deep places of the world.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Quietly, now. It's a four day journey to the other side. Let us hope that our presence will go unnoticed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I have no memory of this place.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There's something down there.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's Gollum.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gollum!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's been following us for three days.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He escaped the dungeons of Barad- dur?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Escaped...or was set loose. And now the Ring has drawn him here...he will never be rid of his need for it. He hates and loves the ring, as he hates and loves himself. Smeagol's life is a sad story. Gandalf catches Frodo's look of surprise.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Yes...Smeagol he was once called...Before the ring came to him, before it drove him mad.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It's a pity Bilbo didn't kill him when he had the chance.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Pity? It was pity that stayed Bilbo's hand. Many that live deserve death, and some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them, Frodo? Frodo frowns.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgment...even the very wise cannot see all ends. My heart tells me that Gollum has some part to play yet, for good or ill, before this is over. The pity of Bilbo may rule the fate of many.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I wish the ring had never come to me...I wish none of this had happened.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: So do all who live to see such times, but that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us. There is a note of finality in Gandalf's voice.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There are other forces at work in this world, Frodo, besides the will of evil. Bilbo was meant to find the ring. In which case, you also were meant to have it...and that is an encouraging thought, Ah! That it's that way! Gandalf points at the right hand tunnel...the Fellowship scramble to their feet.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, but the air doesn't smell so foul down there. If in doubt, Meriadoc, always follow your nose! Ye s...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Behold! The great realm and Dwarf city of Dwarrowdelf! Frodo gasps at the brief sight of a vast roof, far above

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Well, there's an eye opener and no mistake!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gimli!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: "Here lies Balin, son of Fudin, Lord of Moria." He is dead, then. It's as I had feared.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: "They have taken the Bridge and the second hall: we have barred the gates...but cannot hold them for long...the ground shakes...drums in the deep...we cannot get out. A shadow moves in the dark. Will no- one save us? They are coming."

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Fool of a Took! Throw yourself in next time and rid us of your stupidity!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Get back! Stay close to Gandalf.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I think I'm getting the hang of this.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Aragorn! Aragorn!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: He's alive!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I'm alright. I'm not hurt.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You should be dead. That spear would've skewered a wild boar!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I think there's more to this hobbit than meets the eye.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: To the bridge of Khazad-dum!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: This way!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: A Balrog..a demon of the ancient world! This foe is beyond any of you! Run! Quickly!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Lead them on, Aragorn. The bridge is near.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Do as I say; swords are no more use here.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Over the bridge! Fly!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You cannot pass!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Udun.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Go back to the shadow! The BALROG slashes at Gandalf with its Sword of

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You shall not pass!! The Balrog places one foot onto the bridge. Aragorn and Boromir race forward, swords drawn.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Fly, you fools!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Legolas, get them up!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: By nightfall these hills will be swarming with Orcs! We must reach the woods of Lothlorien. Come, Boromir, Legolas, Gimli, get them up. On your feet, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Boromir glances towards Frodo, then back at Aragorn. Frodo is walking away, as if in a daze.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo? Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Haldir of Lorien, we come here for your help. We need your protection.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Take some rest..these borders are well protected.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I have seen the white city..long ago.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: What will I see?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: If you ask it of me, I will give you the One Ring.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I cannot do this alone...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Then I know what I must do. It's just...I'm afraid to do it. Galadriel kneels down to Frodo's height, staring at him intently.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The Argonath...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Long have I desired to look upon the kings of old...my kin.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We cross the lake at nightfall, hide the boats and continue on foot..we approach Mordor from the North.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: That is our Road...I suggest you take some rest and recover your strength, Master Dwarf.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No. Orcs patrol the Eastern shore. We must wait for cover of darkness.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I know what you would say, and it would seem like wisdom but for the warning of my heart.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: There is no other way.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No. . .

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You are not yourself.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: It has taken Boromir. ARAGORN moves towards Frodo...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Where is the ring?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Stay away!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo...I swore to protect you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Can you protect me from yourself?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Would you destroy it?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I would have gone with you to the end... into the very fires of Mordor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I know...Look after the others, especially Sam...he will not understand.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Go, Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Run! Run!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Boromir!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I let Frodo go.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: The ring is beyond our reach now.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, Boromir. You fought bravely. You have kept your honor. Aragorn tries to bind Boromir's wound.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I do not know what strength is in my blood, but I swear to you... I will not let the White City fall, nor your people fail...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Be at peace, son of Gondor. Aragorn bends and Kisses Boromir's forehead.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Legolas and Gimli appear behind him...Aragorn stands.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: They will look for his coming from the white tower...but he will not return.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mr. Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I wish the ring had never come to me..I wish none of this had happened...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: So do all who lie to see such times...but that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Not alone, Frodo. Mr. Frodo! Frodo, in the boat, paddling steadfastly away from the

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: No, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Go back,Sam. I'm going to Mordor alone.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Of course you are...and I'm coming with you!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: You can't swim.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Sam!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I made a promise, Mr. Frodo...a promise. "Don't you leave him, Samwise Gamgee." And I don't mean to...I don't mean to.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Oh, Sam!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Come on then..

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Frodo's fate is no longer in our hands.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Not if we hold true to each other. We will not abandon Merry and Pippin to torment and death, not while we have strength left.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Leave all that can be spared behind... CLOSE ON: ARAGORN..a steely light in his eye.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We travel light. Let's hunt some Orc.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Mordor! I hope the others find a safer road.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Strider'll look after them.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I don't suppose we'll ever see them again.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: We may yet, Mr. Frodo. We may.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: Sam?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Fellowship-of-the-Ring-The
dialogue: I'm glad you're with me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Haven't you had any sleep, Mr Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No . . . no it isn't. It isn't midday yet. The days are growing darker.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Not before Mr Frodo's had something to eat.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Here.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: What about you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I'm not hungry - leastways, not for lembas bread.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Alright. We don't have that much left.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: For what?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: The journey home.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Hobbits!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: And there Saruman must remain, under your guard, Treebeard.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No. He has no power any more.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Peregrin Took! I'll take that, my lad!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No news of Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No word ... nothing.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: We till have time.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Do we know that?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: What does your heart tell you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: That Frodo is alive. Yes - yes, he is alive.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: , . You treacherous little toad!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No, Sam! Leave him alone!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I heard it from his own mouth he means to murder us!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You miserable little maggot! I'll stove your head in!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Sm. . .

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Call me a liar! You're a liar!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Sam! If you scare him off, we're lost.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I don't care! I can't do it, Mr Frodo. I won' t wait around for him to kill us !

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I'm not sending him away.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You don't see it, do you? He's a villain!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: We can't do this by ourselves, Sam. Not without a guide. I need you on my side.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I'm on your side, Mr Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I know, Sam, I know. You must trust me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Fool of a Took!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Minas Tirith??? Is that what you saw?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: And what did you tell him? Speak!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: What did you tell him about Frodo and the Ring?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: There was no lie in Pippin's eyes; a fool, but an honest fool he remains. He told Sauron nothing of Frodo and the Ring.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I will go.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: They must be warned.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: They will be. You must come to Minas Tirith by another ra ... od Follow the river, look to the black ships. Understand this . . . things are now in motion that cannot be undone.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Of all the inquisitive Hobbits, Peregrin, Took, you are the worst. Hurry, hurry!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Three days ride as the Nazgul flies and you'd better hope we don't have one of those on our tail.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Run Shadowfax, show us the meaning of haste.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: We have just passed into the realm of Condor!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Minas Tirith . . . City of the Kings.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Yes, the white tree of Gondor. The tree of the King.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Hail, Denethor, Son of Ecthelion, Lord and Steward of Gondor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Pippin!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Get up! My Lord, there will be a time to grieve for Boromir, but it is not now. War is coming ... the Enemy is on your doorstep. As Steward, you are charged with the defence of this city. Where are Condor's armies?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Authority is not given to you to deny the return of the King - Steward!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Come.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You're in the service of the Steward now - you're going to have to do as you're told, Peregrin Took . . . Guard of the Citadel!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: It's the deep breath before the plunge.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: There never was much hope.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: This will be the end of Gondor as we know it. Here the hammerstroke will fall hardest.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: The Witchking of Angmar . . . , . You've met him before . . .

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No, Mr Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: They're calling me!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: We come to it at last ... the great battle of our time.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: The board is set, the pieces are moving.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Peregrin Took, my lad, there is a task to be done. Another opportunity for one of the Shire-folk to prove their great worth!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Amon Din ... come on . . .

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Hope is kindled.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: The beacons of Minas Tirith! The beacons are lit! Condor calls for aid!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You ride with us?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Foreseen and done nothing!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Where? When?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: . . . And then the Pass of Cirith Ungol.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Faramir . . . Tell me everything.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Mr Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: What are you up to? Sneaking off, are we?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Alright, alright - you just startled me is all. What were you doing?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Fine, have it your own way.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: It's always dark here -

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: What? That's all we have left!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: He took it! He must have!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You're a lying wretch! What did you do with it?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: He doesn't eat it . . . he can't have taken it.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: That's a filthy lie!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Sam! Stop it!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I'll kill him! I'll kill him!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No, Sam!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Alight, I'm sorry, I didn't mean for it to go so far, I was so angry . . . Here, let's rest up a bit.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I ' m alright.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No, no, you're not alright! You're exhausted! It's that Gollum; it's this place; it's that thing around your neck. I could help a bit . . . I could carry it for a while - share the load.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Get away!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: I don't want to keep it . . . I just want to help!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Shut up, you! Go away. Get out of here.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: No, Sam . . . it's you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: But . . . he's a liar . . . he's poisoned you against me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You can't help me anymore.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: You don't mean that.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Go home.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Faramir! Your father's will has turned to madness! Do not throw away your life so rashly!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Your father loves you, Faramir! And will remember it before the end.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Six thousand will not be enough to break the lines of Mordor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: My Lord, Elrond.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: She stayed?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: It will not be our end, but his.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: There are none.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Murderers, traitors - you would call upon them to fight? They believe in nothing. They answer to no-one.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-Return-of-the-King
dialogue: Sauron will not have forgotten the sword of Elendil . . .

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You cannot pass!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the Flame of Anor!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Argh! Go back to the shadow. The Dark Fire will not avail you, Flame of Udûn! [Camera zooms in through the mountain and focuses on Gandalf and the Balrog on the bridge of Khazad-dûm. The Balrog strikes down on Gandalf with its flaming sword. Gandalf parries the blow with Glamdring, shattering the Balrogs sword.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Argh!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Fly, you fools!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Noooooooooooooooo!!!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Calls after Gandalf as he falls into the abyss] Gaaandaaaaalf!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What is it, Mr. Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Nothing. Just a dream. [Lies back down.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mordor. The one place in Middle-earth we dont want to see any closer, and the one place were trying to get to. Its just where we cant get. Lets face it, Mr. Frodo, were lost. I dont think Gandalf meant for us to come this way.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: He didnt mean for a lot of things to happen, Sam... but they did.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr. Frodo? Its the Ring, isnt it?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Its getting heavier. [Clutches the Ring by his chest and sits down, still panting. He then fumbles for his water bottle and takes a sip.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What food have we got left?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Well, let me see. [He takes out a package of lembas bread from his pack] Oh yes, lovely  Lembas bread. And look! [He digs deeper into his pack] More lembas bread.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I don't usually hold with foreign food, but this Elvish stuff, its not bad.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [smiles] Nothing ever dampens your spirits, does it Sam?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Those rain clouds might.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Looks around] This looks strangely familiar.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Exasperated] Its because weve been here before! Were going in circles.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Ah! What's that 'orrid stink? I'll warrant there's a nasty bog nearby. Can you smell it?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Yes. I can smell it. [Drops to a whisper] Were not alone.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [menacingly] This is Sting. Youve seen it before, havent you... Gollum! Release him or Ill cut your throat!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Quiet you!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Its hopeless! Every Orc in Mordors going to hear this racket! Lets just tie him up and leave him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Its no more than you deserve!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Maybe he does deserve to die, but now that I see him, I do pity him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Theres no promise you can make that I can trust.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: The Ring is treacherous. It will hold you to your word.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I dont believe you! [Gollum backs away, frightened, and climbs onto a boulder] Get down! I said, down!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Sam!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hes trying to trick us! We let him go hell throttle us in our sleep!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You know the way to Mordor?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Youve been there before?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You will lead us to the Black Gate.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Their pace has quickened. [He looks up.] They must have caught our scent. Hurry! [He runs off.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Not idly do the leaves of Lórien fall.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Less than a day ahead of us. Come! [Runs off again]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Rohan. Home of the horse-lords. There is something strange at work here. Some evil gives speed to these creatures, sets its will against us.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Legolas, what do your Elf eyes see?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Saruman.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Riders of Rohan, what news from the Mark?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I am Aragorn, son of Arathorn. This is Gimli, son of Glóin and Legolas of the Woodland realm. We are friends of Rohan and of Théoden, your king.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: We are not spies. We track a party of Uruk-hai westward across the plain. Theyve taken two of our friends captive.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: They would be small  only children to your eyes.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Kicks a helmet and yells] AAARRGGHH!!! [He falls to his knees.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: A hobbit lay here, and the other. [Flashback: Pippin yells as he looks up at a pair of thrashing hooves bearing down on him. He rolls over, avoiding the hooves.] They crawled.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Their hands were bound. [Flashback: Merry rubs his bonds furiously against the sharp edge of a weapon.] Their bonds were cut. [Aragorn holds up a broken length of thick rope.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: They ran over here. They were followed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: The tracks lead away from the battle... [They break into a run and then stop] into Fangorn Forest.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Whoa, its a bog! Hes led us into a swamp!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: There are dead things! Dead faces in the water!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Ohh!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Looks at Gollum in perplexed gratitude and disbelief.] Gollum...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Runs to Frodos side.] Mr. Frodo! Are you alright?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What did you say?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Moves over and crouches in front of Gollum] Who are you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf told me you were one of the River Folk.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: He said your life was a sad story.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You were not so very different from a hobbit once, were you... Sméagol?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: That was your name once, wasnt it? A long time ago.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Black Riders!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Argh!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Argh!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Cmon Frodo! C'mon!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I thought they were dead!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr. Frodo! Its alright. Im here.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: These are strange tracks.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Whispers] Gimli!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Gestures] Lower your axe.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Man cenich?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Do not let him speak. He will put a spell on us.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: We must be quick.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Where are they?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Who are you? Show yourself!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: It cannot be. You fell.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Through fire and water. [Flashback: Gandalf is battling the Balrog atop Dúrins Tower.] From the lowest dungeon to the highest peak, I fought with the Balrog of Morgoth.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Until at last, I threw down my enemy and smote his ruin upon the mountainside.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Darkness took me. And I strayed out of thought and time. [Camera zooms in Gandalfs eye and enters an amorphous realm of stars and galaxies, ending in a blinding white light] Stars wheeled overhead and everyday was as long as a life-age of the earth. But it was not the end. I felt life in me again.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
