dialogue: I've been sent back until my task is done.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf? Yes... That's what they used to call me. Gandalf the Grey. That was my name. [He smiles]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [With a twinkle in his eye] I am Gandalf the White. [Aragorn grins] And I come back to you now at the turn of the tide.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: One stage of your journey is over, another begins. War has come to Rohan. We must ride to Edoras with all speed.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Shadowfax. [Gimli bows in the background.] He's the lord of all horses and he's been my friend through many dangers.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Oh save us. My ol' Gaffer'd have a thing or two to say if he could see us now.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I did.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Thats it then. We cannot get past that.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Look! The gate, it's opening! I can see a way down.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Sam, no!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Argh!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I do not ask you to come with me, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I know, Mr Frodo. I doubt even these Elvish cloaks will hide us in there.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Now!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Why havent you spoken of this before?!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hes up to something.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Are you saying theres another way into Mordor?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hes led us this far, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr. Frodo, no.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hes been true to his word.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Whispers] No!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Lead the way, Sméagol.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Edoras and the Golden Hall of Meduseld. There dwells Théoden, King of Rohan, whose mind is overthrown. Sarumans hold over King Théoden is now very strong.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Be careful what you say. Do not look for welcome here.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [sees Háma] Ah.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hmm? [Glances at his staff.] Oh. You would not part an old man from his walking stick? [Looks at Háma innocently.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: The courtesy of your hall is somewhat lessened of late, Théoden King.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Be silent! Keep your forked tongue behind you teeth. I have not passed through fire and death to bandy crooked words with a witless worm! [Raises his staff against Gríma.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Théoden, son of Thengel, too long have you sat in the shadows.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hearken to me! I release you from the spell. [Gestures with his hand]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Points his staff towards Théoden.] I will draw you, Saruman, as poison is drawn from a wound.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Wait.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You did not kill me, you will not kill him!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Be gone!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Breathe the free air again, my friend.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Your fingers would remember their old strength better... if they grasped your sword.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: No, my lord! No, my lord. Let him go. Enough blood has been spilled on his account.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Théodreds death was not of your making.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: He was strong in life. His spirit will find its way to the halls of your fathers. Westu hál. Ferðu, Théodred, Ferðu.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: This is but a taste of the terror that Saruman will unleash. All the more potent for he is driven now by fear of Sauron. Ride out and meet him head on. Draw him away from your women and children. [Leans forward and puts a hand on Théodens chair. Théoden looks at his hand warily.] You must fight.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You have two thousand good men riding north as we speak. Éomer is loyal to you. His men will return and fight for their king.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Open war is upon you. Whether you would risk it or not.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Then what is the kings decision?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hes only doing what he thinks is best for his people. Helms Deep has saved them in the past.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: There is no way out of that ravine. Théoden is walking into a trap. He thinks hes leading them to safety. What they will get is a massacre. Théoden has a strong will but I fear for him. I fear for the survival of Rohan. He will need you before the end, Aragorn. The people of Rohan will need you. The defences HAVE to hold.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: They will hold.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Turns to Shadowfax and strokes him] The Grey Pilgrim... thats what they used to call me. Three hundred lives of men Ive walked this earth and now I have no time. With luck, my search will not be in vain. Look to my coming at first light on the fifth day. At dawn, look to the East.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Opens the stall gates] Go.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You have some skill with a blade.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What do you fear, my lady?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You are a daughter of kings, a shieldmaiden of Rohan. [He sheaths his knife.] I do not think that would be your fate.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hey Stinker! Dont go getting too far ahead!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Why do you do that?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Call him names; run him down all the time.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Because because that's what he is, Mr. Frodo. There's naught left in 'im but lies and deceit. It's the Ring he wants. It's all he cares about.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Glaring at Sam] You have no idea what it did to him. What its still doing to him. [He walks past Sam and stops.] I want to help him, Sam...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Why?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Because I have to believe he can come back.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You cant save him, Mr. Frodo.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Snapping at Sam]What do you know about it? Nothing!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [With remorse] I'm sorry, Sam. I don't know why I said that.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Looks back at Frodo with tears in his eyes.] I do. It's the Ring. You can't take your eyes off it. I've seen you. You're not eating. You barely sleep. It's taken a hold of you, Mr Frodo. You have to fight it!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Grows angry again] I know what I have to do Sam. The Ring was entrusted to me! It's my task! Mine! My own! [He walks away]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Cant you hear yourself? Dont you know who you sound like?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Youll make him sick, you will, behaving like that! [Holding up the two rabbits] Theres only one way to eat a brace of coneys.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Whats to ruin? Theres hardly any meat on em.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What we need is a few good taters.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: PO-TAY-TOES! Boil em. Mash em. Stick em in a stew. Lovely big golden chips with a nice piece of fried fish....

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Even you couldnt say no to that. [He takes a sip of the stew]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Youre hopeless.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr. Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Who are they?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Ready to do what?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Weve got to get moving. Come on, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Suddenly grabs Frodos arm] Mr Frodo! Look! Its an Oliphaunt!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: No one at home will believe this...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Looking around] Sméagol?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Weve lingered here too long. Come on, Sam!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Ah!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Gestures and whispers] Its the beards....

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I am asleep. This is a dream.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Min lû pennich nin i aur hen telitha.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Walks over to Arwen] Dolen i vâd o nin.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Arwen

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: But never more than a memory.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: She stays because she still has hope.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Idhren emmen menna gui ethwel. Hae o auth a nîr a naeth.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I am mortal; you are Elfkind. It was a dream, Arwen, nothing more.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: This belongs to you.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: She is sailing to the Undying Lands, with all that is left of her kin.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Running back to Théoden] Wargs! We are under attack!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Get them out of here!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Mumbles] Brego [He grabs hold of Bregos mane, pulls himself onto the horse and rides slowly to Helms Deep.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Spies?! Now wait just a minute!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: We are hobbits of the Shire. Frodo Baggins is my name and this is Samwise Gamgee.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: His gardener.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [The merest hesitation.] There was no other.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: We set out from Rivendell with seven companions. One we lost in Mória. Two were my kin. A Dwarf there was also, and an Elf. And two men, Aragorn, son of Arathorn, and Boromir of Gondor.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Yes... for my part.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Shocked] Dead? How? When?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Wait! [Faramir stops] This creature is bound to me. And I to him. He is our guide. Please, let me go down to him.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Sméagol. [Gollum turns round at Frodos voice.] Master is here. Come, Sméagol. Trust master. Come!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Sméagol, you must trust master. Follow me, come on. Come. Come, Sméagol. Nice Sméagol. Thats it. Come on.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Dont hurt him! Sméagol dont struggle! Sméagol listen to me!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: We have to get out of here. You go. Go, now! You can do it. Use the Ring, Mr. Frodo. Just this once. Put it on. Disappear.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I cant. You were right, Sam. You tried to tell me, but Im sorry. The Rings taking me Sam. If I put it on, hell find me. Hell see.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr. Frodo...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: No!! [He runs away from Faramir]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Stop it! Leave him alone! Dont you understand? Hes got to destroy it. Thats where were going. Into Mordor. To the mountain of fire.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Please. Its such a burden. Will you not help him?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Patting Brego on the neck] Mae carnen, Brego, mellon nîn.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gimli, where is the king?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hannon le.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: All Isengard is emptied

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Ten thousand strong at least.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: It is an army bred for a single purpose: to destroy the world of men. They will be here by nightfall.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: They do not come to destroy Rohans crops or villages. They come to destroy its people. Down to the last child.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Send out riders, my lord. You must call for aid.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gondor will answer.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Farmer, farriers, stable boys. These are no soldiers.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Si beriathar hýn. Amar nâ ned Edoras.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Then I shall die as one them! [He pauses and then walks away. Legolas makes as if to go after him.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Give me your sword. What is your name?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: This is a good sword, Haleth, son of Háma.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: There is always hope.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Ú-moe edhored, Legolas.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [He bows] Mae govannen, Haldir. [He grabs Haldir in a huge embrace. Initially stunned, Haldir hugs him back lightly.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: You are most welcome!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: A Eruchîn, ú-dano i faelas a hyn an uben tanatha le faelas!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Dartho!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Tangado halad!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Leithio i philinn!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Fire!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Pendraid!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Swords! Swords!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Na fennas! [Directs the Elf archers to aim at the Uruk-hai column.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Togo hon dad, Legolas! [Legolas shoots the Uruk-hai in the shoulder but the latter keeps going] Dago hon! Dago hon!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gimli! [He yells to the Elves behind him] Hado i philinn!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Herio!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Na Barad! Na Baraad! Haldir, na Barad!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Sees Haldir falling] HALDIR!! [He runs up the steps to Haldirs side and catches him and he collapses. Haldir's head rolls back, his eyes empty and unseeing. Aragorn bows his head in grief. Then with a cry, he jumps onto a ladder and swings down to the ground, killing as he goes.]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Runs up and stabs away at the Uruk-hai through the broken gate] How long do you need?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gimli!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Its a long way.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Not a word.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hurry! Inside! Get them inside!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [With tears in his eyes] The Ring will not save Gondor. It has only the power to destroy. Please, let me go.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Faramir, you must let me go!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr Frodo!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Its calling to him, Sam. His eye is almost on me.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Hold on, Mr. Frodo You'll be alright...

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Do you want to know what happened to Boromir? You want to know why your brother died? He tried to take the Ring from Frodo! After swearing an oath to protect him, he tried to kill him! The Ring drove your brother mad!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Mr Frodo?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [In a faraway voice] Theyre here. Theyve come.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Carrying a table with Legolas to shore up the door of the hall] You said this fortress would never fall while your men defend it! They still defend it! They have died defending it!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Is there no other way for the women and children to get out of the caves? [There is no answer.] Is there no other way?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Send word for the women and children to make for the mountain pass. And barricade the entrance.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Pause] Ride out with me. Ride out and meet them.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: For Rohan. For your people.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Look to my coming at first light on the fifth day. At dawn, look to the east.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Gandalf.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Théoden king stands alone.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What are you doing? Where are you going?!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Aaarrgghh!!!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [With tears running down his face] Its me. Its your Sam. Dont you know your Sam?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Slowly and with despair] I cant do this, Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Getting up slowly] I know. Its all wrong. By rights we shouldnt even be here. But we are. [He stands and leans against a wall, looking out into the distance.] Its like in the great stories, Mr. Frodo. The ones that really mattered. Full of darkness and danger they were. And sometimes you didnt want to know the end. Because how could the end be happy? [Images of the riders winning the battle against the Uruk-hai at Helms Deep] How could the world go back to the way it was when so much bad had happened?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: But in the end, its only a passing thing, this shadow. [The women and children welcome the men as they return. Éowyn runs up to Aragorn and embraces him, crying tears of relief.] Even darkness must pass. A new day will come. [Isengard is flooded. Merry and Pippin looks on from their perch on Treebeard. On the balcony, Saruman stumbles back into his chamber] And when the sun shines it will shine out the clearer. Those were the stories that stayed with you. That meant something, even if you were too small to understand why. But I think, Mr. Frodo, I do understand. I know now. Folk in those stories had lots of chances of turning back only they didnt. They kept going because they were holding on to something.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What are we holding on to, Sam?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Theres some good in this world, Mr. Frodo. And its worth fighting for.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Saurons wrath will be terrible, his retribution swift. The battle for Helms Deep is over. The battle for Middle-earth is about to begin. All our hopes now lie with two little hobbits. Somewhere in the wilderness.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I wonder if well ever be put into songs or tales.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: What?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: I wonder if people will ever say, lets hear about Frodo and the Ring. And theyll say yes, thats one of my favorite stories. Frodo was really courageous, wasnt he, dad. Yes, my boy, the most famousest of hobbits. And thats saying alot.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Huh, you left out one of the chief characters  Samwise the Brave. I want to hear more about Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Frodo wouldnt have got far without Sam.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Now Mr. Frodo, you shouldnt make fun. I was being serious.

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [smiling] So was I. [He turns to walk on]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: [Dreamily] Samwise the Brave. [He gives his backpack a heave and follows Frodo]

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Sméagol!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Were not gonna wait for you. Come on!

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Wheres he gone? Hey Gollum, where are you?

title: Lord-of-the-Rings-The-Two-Towers
dialogue: Sméagol?

dialogue: Hello?

dialogue: Hello, Neo. This is Morpheus.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I had hoped for this conversation to take place under less adverse conditions, but you can never count on hope, can you, Neo?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I've been watching you, Neo, and I want to meet you. I don't know if you're ready to see what I want to show you, but unfortunately, we have run out of time. They're coming for you, Neo. And I'm not sure what they're going to do.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Who's coming for me?

dialogue: Stand up and see for yourself.

dialogue: Right now?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Yes. Now.

dialogue: Do it slowly. Slowly. The elevator.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Yes.

dialogue: What the fuck do they want with me?!

dialogue: I'm not sure. But, if you don't want to find out, you better get out of there.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: How?!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I can guide you out, but you have to do exactly what I say.

title: Matrix-The

dialogue: Go! Now!

title: Matrix-The

title: Matrix-The

dialogue: How do you know all this?

title: Matrix-The

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: No way, no way, this is crazy.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Don't be controlled by your fear, Neo. There are only two ways out of this building. One is that scaffold. The other is in their custody. You take a chance either way. I leave it to you.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is insane! Why is this happening to me? What did I do? I'm nobody. I didn't do anything. Fuck! Fuck! Fuck!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I'm going to die.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is insane. I can't do this! Forget it!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I didn't do anything!

dialogue: Yeah. Wow. That sounds like a real good deal. But I think I have a better one. How about I give you the finger --

dialogue: And you can cram that file up your Secret Service sphincter.

dialogue: You ain't seen nothing yet.

dialogue: You can't scare me with this gestapo crap. I know my rights. I want my phone call.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The agents --

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: They got to you first, but they've underestimated how important you are. If they knew what I know, you would probably be dead.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I don't know what you are thinking right now but I want you to understand that I will not give up on you until you give up on me.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Do you still want to meet?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: ... Yes.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Take the Howard line south.

dialogue: What are you doing?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What are you doing?

dialogue: Jesus! God!

dialogue: Do what?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Oh, shit --

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: At last.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Welcome, Neo. As you no doubt have guessed, I am Morpheus.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It's an honor.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Please. Come. Sit.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Thank you, Trinity.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I imagine, right now, you must be feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling down the rabbit hole?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You could say that.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I can see it in your eyes. You have the look of a man who accepts what he sees because he is expecting to wake up.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Ironically, this is not far from the truth. But I'm getting ahead of myself. Can you tell me, Neo, why are you here?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You're Morpheus, you're a legend. Most hackers would die to meet you.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Yes. Thank you. But I think we both know there's more to it than that. Do you believe in fate, Neo?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: No.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Why not?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Because I don't like the idea that I'm not in control of my life.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I know exactly what you mean.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Let me tell you why you are here. You are here because you have the gift.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What gift?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I've watched you, Neo. You do not use a computer like a tool. You use it like it was part of yourself. What you can do inside a computer is not normal. I know. I've seen it. What you do is magic.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It's not magic.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: But it is, Neo. It is. How else would you describe what has been happening to you?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: We are trained in this world to accept only what is rational and logical. Have you ever wondered why?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: As children, we do not separate the possible from the impossible which is why the younger a mind is the easier it is to free while a mind like yours can be very difficult.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Free from what?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: From the Matrix.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Do you want to know what it is, Neo?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It's that feeling you have had all your life. That feeling that something was wrong with the world. You don't know what it is but it's there, like a splinter in your mind, driving you mad, driving you to me. But what is it?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The Matrix is everywhere, it's all around us, here even in this room. You can see it out your window, or on your television. You feel it when you go to work, or go to church or pay your taxes. It is the world that has been pulled over your eyes to blind you from the truth.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What truth?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: That you are a slave, Neo. That you, like everyone else, was born into bondage... ... kept inside a prison that you cannot smell, taste, or touch. A prison for your mind.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is. You have to see it for yourself.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: How?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Hold out your hands.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is your last chance. After this, there is no going back.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You take the blue pill and the story ends. You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You take the red pill and you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Remember that all I am offering is the truth. Nothing more.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Follow me.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Haven't I always told you, Cypher, not to let fear control your life. Apoc, are we on-line?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Apoc? You wrote the Four Horsemen Virus.

dialogue: Neo, time is always against us. Will you take a seat there?

dialogue: I imagine you know sonething about virtual reality.

dialogue: A little.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Tell me about it.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Essentially, it's a hardware system that uses an apparatus; headgear, gloves and whatever to make you feel that you are in a computer program.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: If the virtual reality apparatus, as you called it, was wired to all of your senses and controlled them completely, would you be able to tell the difference between the virtual world and the real world?

dialogue: You might not, no.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: No, you wouldn't.

dialogue: Rest, Neo. The answers are coming.

dialogue: More important than what is when?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: When?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You believe the year is 1997 when in fact it is much closer to 2197. I can't say for certain what year it is because we honestly do not know.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: That's not possible.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I promised you the truth, Neo, and the truth is that the world you were living in was a lie.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: How?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I'll show you.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is my ship, the Nebuchadnezzar. It's a hovercraft. Small like a submarine. It's dark. It's cramped and cold. But it's home.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is the main deck. You know most of my crew.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The ones you don't know. That's Mouse and Switch. The two big guys are Tank and Dozer.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: And this, this is the Core. This is where we broadcast our pirate signal and hack into the Matrix.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Help him, Trinity.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Do you remember when I asked you about an apparatus that could turn a virtual reality into reality?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It's right here.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: And it's accessed here.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This will feel a little weird.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is the Construct.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It is our loading program. We can load anything from clothes, to weapons, to training simulations. Anything we need.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Sit down.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Right now, we're inside a computer program?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Wild, isn't it?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This isn't real?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What is real? How do you define real? If you're talking about your senses, what you feel, taste, smell, or see, then all you're talking about are electrical signals interpreted by your brain.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: This is the Chicago you know. Chicago as it was at the end of the twentieth century. This Chicago exists only as part of a neural-interactive simulation that we call the Matrix.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You have been living inside Baulliaurd's vision, inside the map, not the territory. This is Chicago as it exists today.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: 'The desert of the real.'

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: We are, right now, miles below the earth's surface. The only place humans can survive outside the Matrix is underground.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What happened?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It started early in the twenty- first century, with the birth of artificial intelligence, a singular consciousness that spawned an entire race of machines.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: At first all they wanted was to be treated as equals, entitled to the same human inalienable rights. Whatever they were given, it was not enough.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: We don't know who struck first. Us or them. But sometime at the end of the twenty-first century the battle was joined.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The war raged for generations and turned the face of our planet from green and blue to black and red.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It scorched and burned the sky. Without the sun, the machines sought out a new energy source to survive.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: They discovered a new form of fusion. All that was required to initiate the reaction was a small electric charge. Throughout human history we have been dependent on machines to survive. Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The human body generates more bio- electricity than a 120-volt battery and over 25,000 B.T.U.'s of body heat.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: We are, as an energy source, easily renewable and completely recyclable, the dead liquified and fed intravenously to the living.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: All they needed to control this new battery was something to occupy our mind.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: And so they built a prison out of our past, wired it to our brains and turned us into slaves.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: No! I don't believe it! It's not possible!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I didn't say that it would be easy, Neo. I just said that it would be the truth.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Stop! Let me out! I want out!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Get this thing out of me!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Don't touch me! Get away from me!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I can't go back, can I?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: No. But if you could, would you really want to?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I feel that I owe you an apology. There is a rule that we do not free a mind once it reaches a certain age. It is dangerous. They have trouble letting go.. Their mind turns against them. I've seen it happen. I broke the rule because I had to.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: When the Matrix was first built there was a man born inside that had the ability to change what he wanted, to remake the Matrix as he saw fit. It was this man that freed the first of us and taught us the secret of the war; control the Matrix and you control the future.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: When he died, the Oracle at the temple of Zion prophesied his return and envisioned an end to the war and freedom for our people. That is why there are those of us that have spent our entire lives searching the Matrix, looking for him.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I did what I did, because I believe we have been brought here for a reason, Neo. You are here to serve a purpose, just as I am here to serve mine.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I told you I don't believe in fate.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: But I do, Neo. I do.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Get some rest. You're going to need it.

dialogue: For what?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Your training.

dialogue: No.

dialogue: You don't have...

dialogue: No way.

dialogue: Hell yes!

dialogue: How is he?

dialogue: This is incredible. I know Kung Fu.

dialogue: Show me.

dialogue: This is a sparring program, similar to the programmed reality of the Matrix. Consider this your first lesson.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Attack me.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Good. Adaption. Improvisation. But your weakness isn't your technique.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: How did I beat you?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You -- You're too fast.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Do you think my being faster, stronger has anything to do with my muscles in this place?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Do you believe that's air you are breathing now?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: If you can free your mind, the body will follow.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Again.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You are angry with me.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I, uh... maybe.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It's all right. It's natural.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I feel better.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Good, good. Anger is a gift, Neo, but it's a heavy one.

dialogue: Tank, load the jump program.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You have to learn to let go of that anger. You must let go of everything.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You must empty yourself to free your mind.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Shit.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Okie dokie.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Yeah. Free my mind. Right. No problem.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Everyone falls the first time.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: If you never know failure, how can you know success?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I thought it wasn't real.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: If you are killed in the Matrix, you die here?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The body cannot live without the mind.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Sorry.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What are you doing?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Is that... ?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Jeez, I was wondering about that.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Why I was bald here but not in the Matrix.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Residual self image.

dialogue: Life systems monitor, glucose levels.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Main power supply to the core.

dialogue: Mainframe self-destruct. Uses all remaining power to generate an... E.M.P?

dialogue: How's he doing?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Good. I want everyone alerted to 12-hour stand-by. We're going in. Neo, it's time for you to know why you're here.

dialogue: What's he talking about?

dialogue: See who?

dialogue: We're in.

dialogue: Mouse and Cable hold the exit. Let's go.

dialogue: Did you have to do this?

dialogue: What did she tell you?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Any of them true?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: We should be back in an hour.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Do you now understand what it means when we say, if you're not one of us, you're one of them?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The agents. They're sentient programs. They can commandeer any software hardwired to the mainframe.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Anyone that is still in a power plant. That is why we try to be invisible in the Matrix.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: The best hacking is always traceless.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You're looking well, Mojo.

dialogue: What -- what happened?

dialogue: This is the temple. It is a part of Zion's mainframe. It's hidden inside the Matrix so that we can access it.

dialogue: Okay, you're on your own. Go with them.

dialogue: There is no spoon. Right.

dialogue: Hello?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Hello?

dialogue: You're the Oracle?

dialogue: Yeah.

dialogue: What vase?

dialogue: Shit, I'm sorry.

dialogue: How did you know...?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Who?

dialogue: I think so.

dialogue: I don't know.

dialogue: What's the good news?

dialogue: Is that it, then?

dialogue: You don't have to tell me anything, Neo, because I already know what she said.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: You do?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: I brought you so that you could hear it for yourself. I knew it would help.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: No one will ever ask you because it is a gift from her. It is for you and you alone.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Whoa. Deja vu.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Nothing. Just had a little deja vu.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: A black cat went past us and then I saw another that looked just like it.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: It might have been. I'm not sure.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: What is it?

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Come on!

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: Give me your phone.

title: Matrix-The
dialogue: We have no choice.

title: Matrix-The

dialogue: You can go to your grave not knowing.

dialogue: Here -- it will go well with your black heart !

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I will not walk into the ocean. You'll have to throw me in!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You went back for that? We need to head for the reef!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: That's the second time I've had to watch that man sail away with my ship.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Not all that big, is it?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Has it changed since the last time you were here?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: The trees are taller.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I hope you have no intention of using that.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Not yet. Ask me again in a few weeks.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Captain Sparrow! We have to get off this island -- immediately!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: What is that? Is there a boat under there?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: What? What's wrong? How will this help us get off the island?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: It won't. It won't, and so we won't.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: But ... you did it before! Last time -

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Last time, I was here a grand total of three days. Last time, the rumrunners who used this island as a cache came by, and I bartered passage off.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: But from the looks of this, they've long been'out of business, and so that won't be happening again. We probably have your friend Norrington to thank for that.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: So that's it? That's the secret grand adventure of the infamous

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Welcome to the Caribbean, love.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You should look at our contretemps this way: we've got shade trees, thank the Lord. We've got some food on the trees, thank the Lord again. And we've got rum, praise the Lord. We can stay alive a month, maybe more. Keep a weather eye open for passing ships, and our chances are fair.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: A month? Will doesn't have a month! We've got to do something to help him!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You're right. Here's luck to you, Will Turner.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Don't be thinking I'm happy about this, Elizabeth. But I see no use in wailing and gnashing my teeth over that which I can do nothing about.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Not when you can drink instead, at least.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: And you will call me Miss Swann.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Drink up me hearties, yo ho...

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: What? What was that? Something funny, Miss Swann? share. Please,

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Nothing ... it's nothing. Just ... I'm reminded of a song I learned as a child. A song about pirates.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I know a lot of songs about pirates, but none I'd teach a child. Let's hear it.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Oh, no ... it's silly. Back in England we didn't know a thing about pirates, really. They seemed so romantic and daring -

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: That was before I met one, of course.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Well, perhaps ... with a bit more to drink, I might ...

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: More to drink!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Well?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: We pillage, we plunder, we rifle, we loot, Drink up me hearties, yo ho.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: We kidnap and ravage and we don't give a hoot, Drink up me hearties, yo ho -

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I LOVE this song! Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me! We're beggars and blighters,

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: When I get the Black Pearl back, I'm going to teach it to the whole crew, and we'll sing it all the time!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You'll be positively the most fearsome pirates to sail the Spanish Main.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Not just the Spanish Main. The whole ocean. .. the whole world. Wherever we want to go, we go. That's what a ship is, you know. Not just a keel and a hull and a deck and sails. That's what a ship need_ ... but what a ship is -- what the Black Pearl really-is ... is freedom.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Jack, it must be so terrible for you, to be trapped here on this island, all over again.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Ah, well... the company is better than last time. And the scenery has definitely improved.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: We've got a few bottles left ... and we've yet to tap the kegs.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: To freedom.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: To the Black Pearl.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: What are you doing? You've burned our food, the shade -- the rum!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Yes, the rum is gone.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: One, because it is a vile drink that turns even the most respectable men into scoundrels. Two -

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: That signal is over a thousand feet high, which means it can be seen for two hundred leagues in every direction. The entire Royal Navy is out to sea looking for me -- do you think there is even a chance they could mass it?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You -- you burned up the island, for a one-time chance at being spotted?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Exactly.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Just you wait, Captain. In an hour, maybe two, keep a 'weather eye open' and you'll be seeing white sails on that horizon!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: He can locate Isla de Muerta -- but I doubt he'll be willing to help us from the brig.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: We had time to get to know each other.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: No. The pirates have taken Will -

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Commodore, please!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Commodore, I beg you -- please do this ... for me. As a wedding gift.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Not as a condition -- a request.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Congratulations, sir.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: What?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: And now I know... where yours does, as well.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Then I can wear men's clothing.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Well, I am not going to stay hidden in a some cabin, 80 I suppose it's going to be heaving bosoms and bare ankles for the remainder of the voyage!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You didn't tell Commodore Norrington everything.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Nor did you, I noticed.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: He might delay the rescue ... and that would be too late.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Exactly.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: These men will be facing an enemy that seemingly cannot be killed.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I have a plan. If it succeeds, then any battle will be decidedly brief ... and one-sided.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: What's your plan?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Funny, I was thinking along those lines. How about you let me go in alone, and while you're setting up an ambush, I'll trick the pirates out to you.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: They left me stranded. Twice. What have you got to lose?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I knew you'd listen to reason!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: That chart I drew up'11 get you past the reefs. If you're steersman's good enough, that is.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I'll slip in, talk them into to come out, and you'll be free to blow holy high heaven the whole lot of them.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Do you have any idea where you're going?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Don't talk. These caves magnify sound. Just follow me.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: It's the right way.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You don't want to be doing that.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: All right then.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Because, right about now, the H.M.S. Dauntless is lying in wait in the harbor.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: - - and its guns and crew will cut you and your men to pieces the moment you step outside these caves.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You've no hope of surviving Norrington's attack ... that is, if you're mortal.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Simple. Don't kill the boy yet. Wait for a more opportune moment.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Like after you've killed... Every... Last ... One ... of Norrington's men.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: The situation has changed.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Aye. See, after you're done with the Royal Navy, you'll have a bit of a problem: the H.M.S. Dauntless. There you'll be, with two lovely ships on your hands, and what to do? Of course you'll decide you deserve the bigger one, and who's to argue? The Dauntless a first-rate ship-of-line, and with it, you can rule the seas.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: I sail for you as part of your fleet, I give you fifteen percent of my plunder, and you get to introduce yourself at tea parties and brothels as 'Commodore Barbossa.' Do we have an accord?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Now, you can take care of the Dauntless, right?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: There's ... another exit?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Oh, please -- do I really seem that clever?

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Use it well.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Remarkable how often those two traits coincide.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Well, isn't that interesting.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: They're so pretty, I just couldn't resist stealing one. It's a curse, I guess.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Or you could surrender.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: The worst. On the other hand, maybe I'm a man who can't pass up a chance for revenge against the black-hearted bastard who stole my ship and left me to die in the middle of the ocean -- twice! -- and who knows how to get what he wants. Now that's a great pirate.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: You're all right!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Yes, I am wearing trousers. And as for how we got off the island -- ah, that's a grand adventure, but now is not the time to talk about it.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: There. And don't you dare tell me that wasn't a proper kiss!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: It doesn't!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Tough luck. I was rooting for you.

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: AnaMaria, trim the mainsail!

title: Pirates-of-the-Caribbean
dialogue: Mr. Gibbs, organize a cleaning detail - you and Cotton. I want every inch of the Pearl spic-and-span and ship-shape!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I agree with Fezzik.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: That Vizzini, he can fuss.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Probably he means no harm.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Oh, you've a great gift for rhyme.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: FEZZIK, are there rocks ahead?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Making sure nobody's following us.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You're sure nobody's following us?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: No reason. It's only, I just happened to look behind us, and something is there.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I think he's getting closer.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Look! He's right on top of us. I wonder if he is using the same wind we are using.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: He's climbing the rope. And he's gaining on us.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You keep using that word -- I do not think it means what you think it means. My God! He's climbing.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I want to duel him left-handed.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Well, it's the only way I can be satisfied. If I use my right -- tch -- over too quickly.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Hello there.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Slow going?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Sorry.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I do not suppose you could speed things up?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I could do that. In fact, I've got some rope up here. But I do not think that you will accept my help, since I am only waiting around to kill you.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: But I promise I will not kill you until you reach the top.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I hate waiting. I could give you my word as a Spaniard.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You don't know any way you'll trust me?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I swear on the soul of my father, Domingo Montoya, you will reach the top alive.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: We'll wait until you're ready.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I do not mean to pry, but you don't by any chance happen to have six fingers on your right hand?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: My father was slaughtered by a sixfingered man. He was a great swordmaker, my father. And when the six-fingered man appeared and requested a special sword, my father took the job. He slaved a year before he was done.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: The six-fingered man returned and demanded it, but at one-tenth his promised price. My father refused. Without a word, the six-fingered man slashed him through the heart. I loved my father, so, naturally, challenged his murderer to a duel ... I failed ... --------------------------------------------------------------------------- 29.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: the six-fingered man did leave me alive with the six-fingered sword, but he gave me these.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I was eleven years old. When I was strong enough, I dedicated my life to the study of fencing. So the next time we meet, I will not fail. I will go up to the sixfingered man and say, "Hello, my name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die."

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: More pursuit than study lately. You see, I cannot find him. It's been twenty years now. I am starting to lose confidence. I just work for Vizzini to pay the bills. There's not a lot of money in revenge.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You are ready, then?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You seem a decent fellow. I hate to kill you.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Begin!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Naturally, you must expect me to attack with Capo Ferro.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Unless the enemy has studied his Agrippa-

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- which I have.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You are wonderful!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I admit it -- you are better than I am.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Because I know something you don't know.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I am not left-handed.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I ought to be after twenty years.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Tell me.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Who are you?!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I must know.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Okay.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Kill me quickly.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I am waiting for you, Vizzini. You told me to go back to the beginning. So I have. This is where I am, and this is where I'll stay. I will not be moved.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I do not budge. Keep your "Ho there."

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- So did Vizzini -- when a job went wrong, you went back to the beginning. And this is where we got the job. So it's the beginning, and I'm staying till Vizzini comes.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: It's you.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Perhaps not. I feel fine.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: That's enough. That's enough! Where is this Rugen so I may kill him?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: How many could you handle?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: That leaves twenty for me. At my best, I could never defeat that many. I need Vizzini to plan. I have no gift for strategy. --------------------------------------------------------------------------- 82.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: No -- not Vizzini -- I need the Man in Black --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- look, he bested you with strength, your greatness. He bested me with steel. He must have outthought Vizzini, and a man who can do that can plan my castle's onslaught any day. Let's go --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: To find the Man in Black, obviously.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Don't bother me with trifles; after twenty years, at last, my father's soul will be at peace.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: There will be blood tonight!!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: His true love is marrying another tonight, so who else has cause for Ultimate Suffering? Excuse me --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- pardon me, it's important --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- Fezzik, please --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Thank you.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Where is the Man in Black?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You get there from this grove, yes?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Fezzik, jog his memory.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Father, I have failed you for twenty years. Now our misery can end. Somewhere ... somewhere close by is a man who can help us. I cannot find him alone. I need you. I need you to guide my sword. Please.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Guide my sword.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: It just is not fair.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Well, we Montoyas have never taken defeat easily. Come along, Fezzik. Bring the body.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Have you any money?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Are you the Miracle Max who worked for the King all those years?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: He's already dead.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Sir. Sir.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: We're really in a terrible rush.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Sixty-five.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: This is noble, sir. His wife is crippled. His children are on the brink of starvation.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I need him to help avenge my father, murdered these twenty years.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: He's dead. He can't talk.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: What's that?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: True love. You heard him. You could not ask for a more noble cause than that.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- But this is Buttercup's true love -- If you heal him, he will stop Humperdinck's wedding.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Humiliations galore!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: That's a miracle pill?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Thank you for everything.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: What's the difference? We've got him. Help me here. We'll have to force feed him.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: We can't wait -- the wedding's in half an hour and we must strike in the hustle and the bustle beforehand.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Tilt his head back. Open his mouth.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Your guess is as good as mine --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: We had Miracle Max make a pill to bring you back.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Buttercup is marrying Humperdinck in a little less than half an hour, so all we have to do is get in, break up the wedding, steal the Princess, make our escape after I kill Count Rugen.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: There is but one working castle gate.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: And it is guarded by sixty men.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Your brains, Fezzik's strength, my steel.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Where did we put that wheelbarrow the Albino had?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: There we cannot help you.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Where did you get that?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Why? You can't even lift one.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I'll say -- how do I find the Count? -- Once I do, how do I find you again? -- Once I find you again, how do we escape? --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Right, right, sorry.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: What?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Now?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Now?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Fezzik, tear his arms off.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Fezzik, I need you --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: He's getting away from me, Fezzik. Please. FEZZIK!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Thank you --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: ... Sorry, Father ... I tried ... I tried...

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father; prepare to die.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, prepare to die.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: HELLO! MY NAME IS INIGO MONTOYA. YOU KILLED MY FATHER. PREPARE TO

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- offer me money --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- power too -- promise me that --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: -- offer me everything I ask for --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: I WANT MY FATHER BACK, YOU SON- OFA-BITCH!

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Where's Fezzik?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: No.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Help him.

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Because he has no strength --

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: Shall I dispatch him for you?

title: Princess-Bride-The
dialogue: You know, it's very strange -- I have been in the revenge business so long, now that it's over, I don't know what to do with the rest of my life.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Yes, well, actually, that would be a giant. Now, ogres, oh they're much worse. They'll make a suit from your freshly peeled skin.

title: Shrek
dialogue: They'll shave your liver. Squeeze the jelly from your eyes! Actually, it's quite good on toast.

title: Shrek
dialogue: This is the part where you run away. And stay out! "Wanted. Fairy tale creatures."

title: Shrek
dialogue: Please, don't turn me in. I'll never be stubborn again. I can change. Please! Give me another chance!

title: Shrek
dialogue: Oh!

title: Shrek
dialogue: Hey! I can fly!

title: Shrek
dialogue: Ha, ha! That's right, fool! Now I'm a flying, talking donkey. You might have seen a housefly, maybe even a superfly but I bet you ain't never seen a donkey fly. Ha, ha! Uh-oh.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Aye?

title: Shrek
dialogue: Oh, really? You and what army?

title: Shrek
dialogue: Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!

title: Shrek
dialogue: Are you talkin' to... me? Whoa!

title: Shrek
dialogue: Yes. I was talkin' to you. Can I tell you that you that you was great back here? Those guards! They thought they was all of that. Then you showed up, and bam! They was trippin' over themselves like babes in the woods. That really made me feel good to see that.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Oh, that's great. Really.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Man, it's good to be free.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?

title: Shrek
dialogue: But, uh, I don't have any friends. And I'm not goin' out there by myself. Hey, wait a minute! I got a great idea! I'll stick with you. You're mean, green, fightin' machine. Together we'll scare the spit out of anybody that crosses us.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Oh, wow! That was really scary. If you don't mind me sayin', if that don't work, your breath certainly will get the job done, 'cause you definitely need some Tic Tacs or something, 'cause you breath stinks! You almost burned the hair outta my nose, just like the time... ...then I ate some rotten berries. I had strong gases leaking out of my butt that day.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Why are you following me?

title: Shrek
dialogue: I'll tell you why. 'Cause I'm all alone, There's no one here beside me, My problems have all gone, There's no one to deride me, But you gotta have faith...

title: Shrek
dialogue: Stop singing! It's no wonder you don't have any friends.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Wow. Only a true friend would be that cruelly honest.

title: Shrek
dialogue: Listen, little donkey. Take a look at me. What am I?

title: Shrek
dialogue: Uh ...really tall?

title: Shrek
dialogue: No! I'm an ogre! You know. "Grab your torch and pitchforks." Doesn't that bother you?

dialogue: Cordé...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Less than an hour ago, an assassination attempt was made against my life. One of my bodyguards and six others were ruthlessly and senselessly murdered. I was the target but, more importantly, I believe this security measure before you, was the target. I have led the opposition to build an army... but there is someone in this body who will stop at nothing to assure it's passage...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I warn you, if you vote to create this army, war will follow. I have experienced the misery of war first-hand; I do not wish to do it again.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Wake up, Senators... you must wake up! If you offer the separatists violence, they can only show us violence in return! Many will lose their lives. All will lose their freedom. This decision could very well destroy the very foundation of our great Republic. I pray you do not let fear push you into a disastrous decision. Vote down this security measure, which is nothing less than a declaration of war! Does anyone here want that? I cannot believe they do.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Thank you, Master Yoda. Do you have any idea who was behind the attack?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I don't wish to disagree but I think that Count Dooku was behind it.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I don't know, but everything in my being tells me he was behind it...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Chancellor, if I may comment, I do not believe the...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Chancellor, please! I don't want any more guards!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: This is not necessary, Chancellor.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It's Good to see you, too, Jar Jar.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Hi, Jar Jar.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It's a great pleasure to see you again, M'Lady.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It has been far too long Master Kenobi. I'm so glad our paths have crossed again... but I must warn you that I think your presence here is unnecessary.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I'm sure the Jedi Council have their reasons.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Annie?? My goodness you've grown.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: So have you... grown more beautiful, I mean... and much shorter... for a Senator, I mean.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Oh Annie, you'll always be that little boy I knew on Tatooine.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Our presence will be invisible, M'Lady.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I don't need more security, I need answers. I want to know who is trying to kill me.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: We're here to protect you Senator, not to start an investigation.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: We will find out who is trying to kill you Padmé, I promise you.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: We are not going to exceed our mandate, my young Padawan learner.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I meant in the interest of protecting her, Master, of course.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: We are not going through this exercise again, Anakin. You will pay attention to my lead.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Why?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What??!!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Why else do you think we were assigned to her, if not to find the killer? Protection is a job for local security... not Jedi. It's overkill, Master. Investigation is implied in our mandate.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: We will do as the Council has instructed, and you will learn your place, young one.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Perhaps with merely your presence, the mysteries surrounding this threat will be revealed. Now if you will excuse me I will retire.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: She didn't even recognise me, Jar Jar. I thought about her every day since we parted... and she's forgotten me completely.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Anakin, you're focusing on the Negative again. Be mindful of your thoughts. She was glad to see us. Now lets check the security here.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Yes, my master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Captain Typho has more than enough men downstairs. No assassin will try that way. Any activity up here?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Quiet as a tomb. I don't like just waiting here for something to happen to her.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What's going on?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: She covered that camera. I don't think she liked me watching her.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What is she thinking?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: She programmed Artoo to warn us if there's an intruder.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It's not an intruder I'm worried about. There are many other ways to kill a Senator.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I know, but we also want to catch this assassin. Don't we, Master?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: You're using her as bait??

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It was her idea... No harm will come to her. I can sense everything going on in that room. Trust me.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It's too risky... and your senses aren't that attuned, young apprentice.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: And yours are?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Possibly.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: You look tired.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I don't sleep well, anymore.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Because of your mother?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I don't know why I keep dreaming About her now. I haven't seen her since I was little.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Dreams pass in time.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I'd rather dream of Padmé. Just Being around her again is... intoxicating.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Mind your thoughts, Anakin, they betray you. You've made a commitment to the Jedi order... a commitment not easily broken... and don't forget she's a politician. They're not to be trusted.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: She's not like the others in the Senate, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It's been my experience that Senators are only focused on pleasing those who fund their campaigns... and they are more than willing to forget the niceties of democracy to get those funds.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Not another lecture, Master. Not on the economics of politics.... It's too early in the morning... and besides, you're generalising. The Chancellor doesn't appear to be corrupt.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Palpatine's a politician, I've observed that he is very clever at following the passions and prejudices of the Senators.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I think he is a good man. My instincts are very positive about...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I sense it, too.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Stay here!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I have a bad feeling about this.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: That was wacky! I almost lost you in the traffic.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What took you so long?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Oh, you know, Master, I couldn't find a speeder I really liked, with an open cockpit... and with the right speed capabilities... and then you know I had to get a really gonzo color...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: If you'd spend as much time working on your saber skills as you do on your wit, young Padawan, you would rival Master Yoda as a swordsman.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I thought I already did.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Only in your mind, my very young apprentice. Careful!! Hey, easy!!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Sorry, I forgot you don't like flying, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I don't mind flying... but what you're doing is suicide!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Master, you know I've been flying since before I could walk. I'm very good at this.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Just slow down!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Wait! Don't go in there!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: You know I don't like it when you do that!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Sorry, Master. Don't worry, this guy's gonna kill himself any minute now!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What are you doing? He's gonna blast me!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Right - this isn't working.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: That was too close!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Clear that!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What??

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Clear the flag! We're losing power! Hurry!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Whooooaaa! Don't do that! I don't like it when you do that!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: So sorry, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It's dangerous near those power couplings! Slow down! Don't go through there!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Yiiii, what are you doing?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Sorry, Master!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Oh, that was good...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: That was crazy!!!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Ahh, damn.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Stop!!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: No, we can make it.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I'm crazy... I'm crazy... I'm crazy.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: But it worked... we made it.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It didn't work... we've stalled! And you almost got us killed!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I think we're still alive.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: It was stupid!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I could have made it...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: But you didn't!!! And now we've lost him.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: No we didnt...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Where are you going?! He went down there, the other way.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: This is a shortcut... I think.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: What do you mean, You think? What kind of shortcut?! He went completely the other way! Youve lost him!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Master, if we keep this chase going, that creeps gonna end up deep fried. Personally, Id very much like to find out who in the hell he is and who hes working for...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Oh, so thats why were going in the wrong direction.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Well, you lost him.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Im deeply sorry, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Excuse me for a moment.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Anakin!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: She went into that club, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Patience.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Here. Next time try not to lose it.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Sorry, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: A Jedi's saber is his most precious possession.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Yes, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: He must keep it with him at all times.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I know, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: This weapon is your life!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I've heard this lesson before...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: But, you haven't learned anything, Anakin.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I try, Master.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Why do I think you are going to be the death of me?!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Don't say that Master... You're the closest thing I have to a father... I love you. I don't want to cause you pain.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Then why don't you listen to me?!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I will. I'll do better, I promise.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Do you see him him?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: I think he's a she...

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Then be extra careful... Check it out.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Where are you going, Master?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: To get a drink.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: You don't want to sell me death- sticks.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: You want to go home and rethink your life.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Easy... Official business. Go back to your drinks.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Do you know who it was you were trying to kill?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Who hired you?

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: Tell us!

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
dialogue: This wound's going to need treatment.

title: Star-Wars-Attack-of-the-Clones
